review_content: I love this hotel!The location of the hotel is great--located right in the city next to St. Elmo's, which is very convenient. It's also walking distance from several other restaurants. In addition, the rooms are spotless and beautiful. They have a nice modern touch but are very warm and comfortable at the same time. Lastly, their staff is wonderful--they are extremely nice and make you feel welcome, which is something I look for when staying at a hotel. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at the Le Meridien,I will preface this by saying that downtown Indy is an odd hotel market. While Indy is a rather large downtown, it really isn't at the same time. It's a secondary hotel market, so ones expectations might not be met when comparing it to other the other Le Meridiens in major markets.Pro's:+ Location- You are smack down in the middle of downtown and steps from Circle City Mall and many restaurants. Depending on the weather, you about a 15 minute walk or short Uber ride to Mass Ave+ Decor- Updated Modern decor. Very clean and functioning.+ Bed - Comfortable+Shower head - nice and tall + Outlets - Plentiful and modernized to include USB cables+ Wifi- It works and the signal strength is good+ Staff- Front of the house staff is very friendly and helpfulCon's: - Valet- Depending upon the time you arrive/depart and scheduled events downtown, this can take some time and a bit of a line- bed - the king beds are a bit on the shorter side, especially if you are on the taller side- Elevators - this is an older hotel. They are smaller and can only fit 1-2 people, especially with luggage. It can fell a bit claustrophobic.- Rooms - this is an older hotel, so the walls are a bit thin and room sizes varyTips: If you don't wish to valet, there are many parking lots associated with Circle City Mall that are close, if not right across from the hotel. Just remember, there are no in/out privileges when using these lots.This was my first stay at the newly branded and newly renovated Le Meridien Hotel in Indianapolis. It was a fine experience and the staff was fantastic, but I feel the need to provide some advice as a seasoned traveler. While the staff was warm and accommodating, there aren't enough of them. We pulled up to the front of the hotel and waited about ten minutes before the one bellman was able to accommodate our luggage, which I unloaded and was sitting on the sidewalk in front of the hotel. It appeared very unprofessional. The hotel itself is designed beautifully and the firm that completed the decor should be applauded. Modern and tasteful, the Le Meridien Indianapolis interior eschews minimalism for a warm contemporary aesthetic. The small elevators, reminiscent of boutique hotels in Europe, brought us to our small, but well appointed room. It too was designed well, with enough room for everything so we did not have to live out of our suitcases. The hotel has rooms of different sizes, with lots of different names, so try to get one of their larger rooms. The bathroom was a nice size and comfortable, but sliding doors on bathrooms do not shut out light or sound, diminishing any sense of privacy. I realize it is a space issue, but still.............The bed must be new, but at least my side was rather concave. In addition, the AC is turned off at night, and even though we were only on the 6th floor, it was hot and stuffy and I did not sleep well. Noise carries and I heard every door on our floor close. Afternoon naps were impossible. Also, it would be great to have a coffee machine in the room.The restaurant and bar at the hotel, Spoke and Steele, is wonderfully trendy with innovative food and a hopping scene at the bar. It was great fun. With a fantastic staff, great design, and a fab location, the Meridien Indianapolis has a great foundation and can emerge with five star status with just a few tweaks. I will happily stay here again on my return to Indianapolis, an underrated travel destination.Awesome hotel! From the moment we walked in, the front desk clerk Jarrod greeted us with a smile and was very friendly and accommodating. We'd had a long, delayed flight and he made sure to get us a room even though it was still a few hours till check in time. The staff at this hotel goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome. The room was spacious and clean. The bed, pillows and comforter were the most comfortable I have ever slept on! Perfect for sleeping in! Walls are thin so if you are a light sleeper ask for a room away from the elevators.Because of it's great location, gorgeous, modern decor, and friendly staff, I'm happy to dole out 4 stars for Le Meriden Indy. That being said, I think there's some room for improvement overall.Decor: Is really lovely. Super modern but warm and inviting at the same time. Lots of whites and grays. Comfort factor: My bed was super comfy, the room spotless, and the bathroom was spacious and inviting. The rooms themselves lean on the smaller side, but when I travel for work it's typically just me, so I don't require a ton of room. In Room Dining: Major fail here. The food was actually decent, but the prices were already high and tack on a 23% service charge *and* $5 delivery and your lunch is exorbitant. Staff: Everyone I encountered was friendly but I didn't experience the overwhelming helpfulness & accommodation that I've read it other reviews. WiFi: Free and stable, just like it should be! Location: Great and walkable to plenty of downtown points of interest.Indy hotels are a big of an enigma to me, mostly because the cost can get extremely high if there's even a chance of a convention downtown. So, while Le Meridien is a nice hotel, I'm still up for exploring other options when I travel to town.I loved Le Meridien during my stay in Indianapolis! The staff made my experience the best due to their superior customer service. Merriam provided the best recommendations on locations to visit and places to eat with warmest smile. The hotel's location was phenomenal as it is close to Georgia St. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next visit!This hotel seems brand new from all the interiors and upgrades. My room was upgraded to a suite and I have not seen anything more modern than this hotel.Parking - you can park overnight or long term in the parking garage across the road for $22 a night.There are multiple places to eat around so no worry there. This place went out of their way for service by getting me razors from nearby CVS as they had run out of emergency stock.This hotel is located in a great location within walking distance to all of downtown Indianapolis. The remodel took this historic hotel to a modern feel with absolutely none of the old charm left. It is now ultra-modern if that is your thing, you will enjoy staying here. If you stayed here prior to the remodel and loved the historic feel, you will hate it.I have stayed in Le Meridien hotel brands and as always the service is impeccable.Summary: Fantastic hotel in the heart of Indianapolis. This is one of the nicer hotels in the area. I'd even stay here over the Westin because everything seems new. Very clean property. Very quiet rooms. Pros: Very clean. You can tell the rooms are new. The decor is awesome. If you can get an upgrade to an executive room, the bathroom will be HUGE. Comfortable beds and pillows. EASY access to the city. Restaurant downstairs is nice. Lots of lobby space on 2 different floors for meeting with clients/coworkers.Cons: Small property means rooms fill up fast. You can't rely on good rates at this hotel because they can fluctuate within the same week from $130 - $400+ a night. That means I only stay here occasionally and I'd love to stay here more. The parking is also limited, you can park under circle center for $23-$25 a night, which is much less than valet. The fitness facility could also be larger, limited space for weights means you have to wait your turn.My favorite hotel in Indianapolis! I love this small boutique hotel for several reasons. Location, location, location, it's in walking distance to Lucas Stadium, mall(connected by a skywalk), convention center, movie theatre, etc.. The rooms are modern, clean, and quiet. The restaurant, Spoke & Steele has a very hip and trendy vibe, great food and drinks. The staff is very attentive, friendly. You won't be disappointed!My stay at Le Meridian was amongst the best I have ever had. The remodel was wonderfully done. We had a two king bed room, which was an unexpected surprise. Everything was clean, spacious, and pristine. The wait staff, desk clerks, and curb staff were all wonderful. Any request I made of them was exceeded, and with a smile.The bar staff was a little less attentive but that was easily overlooked when the rest of the stay was taken into account.Hoping to be lucky enough with the 2016 GenCon housing lottery system to stay here again in the future.Super attentive staff, great location, comfy bed, good room service, Illy coffee. Hotel is very small only about 10 rooms per floor. The rooms are pretty small too - like the luggage valet cart doesn't fit in closet and the king bed takes most of the room. The business traveller desk is tiny and your feet dangle as they use a bar stool style chair. The hotel is connected to a mall that has walkways to other hotels. Location is awesome, walkable to lots of restaurants and shops. All and all a decent place to rest your head on business travel. Thumbs up!Wish I could give this hotel a great review but we had to check out just 30 min after arriving. The Hotel is small, nicely done and well located but upon arriving in our room, we were hit with strong, noxious chlorine bleach fumes. The 2 staff members on duty were really pleasant but they seemed to be young and experienced. After telling them about this issue, they offered us 2 other rooms but they both had similar fumes. We checked out because I have very mild asthma and was feeling quite sick. I had a full on asthma attack the next evening which my Dr. believes is related to this experience. No one from the hotel checked the room after we reported this and after calling to speak to the manager the next day, I was transferred to his administrative assistants voice mail. We checked into the Alexander which is always a great experience.I want to say 3.5 stars, but I'll round up. Hotel has a small entrance on Illinois street. Drive too fast and you'll miss it. Highly recommend that you park in the circle center garage across the street, as it is under $25 a night to park there, unless you're willing to pay $40 for valet. Upon entry, you'll notice it is an upscale hotel, and also a tiny one. Hallway is tiny, only two tiny elevators...you get it. Check in was easy, and I found out there is no club lounge, unlike other SPG properties like Sheraton around the corner. It has a fitness center, a restaurant, and direct mall access. Coffee is complimentary, and the green choice sign is a thin sheet of paper under the Sony alarm clock. Modern decor throughout inside the room. They're obsessed with maps and coordinates here. Beautiful wood on the cabinets, and awesome Samsung smart TV on the wall. Soft towels and tissue paper in the bathroom. USB wall outlets. Overall cosmetically beautiful property, just missing the amenities I would normally get from the Westin and Sheraton.Walk-around: youtube.com/watch?v=haYw...Beautiful place and great location. The rooms are very nice and modern. Large bathroom with big mirrors. Bar in the lobby as well.Disappointing. While I had never heard of this hotel chain, I assumed that as it took over the Canterbury Hotel, it would compete as one of the best in the downtown area. Not so....While the Canterbury was stuffy, I had stayed in their remodeled rooms and they were awesome. Le Meridien came in and dropped the hotel by 2 stars with cheap redesigns of lobby and room. Would not recommend. Poor service in restaurant and poor quality of room service.Rooms had an excellent design. I should have taken photos for home design ideas. Staff were helpful and always there when needed. Didn't try the bath products. Quality of the hairdryer could be upgraded. Food and beverage were excellent. Had a lunch, breakfast and snack there (all-day meeting).Wow! Very impressed by this little gem in the heart of downtown Indianapolis. We stopped here on our way north just for the evening. Tim at the front desk greeted us and checked us in quickly. We had a corner room on the 7th floor with a king bed. So so clean, modern finishes and couldn't be more inviting. TV mounted on the wall, plenty of lighting options, we could've stayed in the room all evening. The next morning I worked in the lobby a bit. Amazing space down there. Just the right amount of people, but not too distracting. Love love love this place, I will be back!Hail to Le Meridian! We went to see Casablanca at the Indianapolis Symphony and decided to eat dinner at Spoke & Steel. I made the reservation and thought I would check rates for Le Meridian for the night. The rates were very reasonable and the rooms are very nice. However,what stands out the most is the staff. I truly have nothing but exceptional things to say for ALL of them - from the valet to the front desk. Just a note, Tim, who checked us in and checked us out was so great. It's easy to walk into a hotel as nice and expertly decorated as Le Meridian and feel a pretentious air but Tim made us feel right at home.Complimentary coffee in the lobby when we checked out - what a nice treat!!Stayed at this hotel for a weekend while my buddy was proposing to his girlfriend at the omni hotel. When I left I was thinking about how perfect the hotel was and there's a lot of reasons to back that up. 1. I needed a car wash and didn't know where to go because my phone was dead and I couldn't use the gps, soooo the staff at the front desk printed directions for me. Nice. 2. This hotel is pet friendly, and I have a large english bulldog. 3. Every time I entered the building there was someone there to open the doors for me. 4. I needed to go to the grocery store in a hurry, one of the guys in the front called a cab that he knew by name for me and sent me to the nearest grocery store. 5. Everyone there was very friendly. They all had smiles on their faces and made the best of the day. I remember one person trying to make me laugh. (It worked).6. The rooms were neat, clean and organized. All of these things would definitely make this hotel my default when I'm in Indianapolis. But as my girlfriend pointed out, when she flipped her pillow to the other side overnight she noticed a cloudy black stain on the other side. She checked my pillow in the morning and it was the same. We had a friend staying a couple of rooms down the hall and the same was for their pillows. All I'm saying is every thing about this place is perfect except for those pillows.
review_content_20: Friendly staff! Very modern style. The bar does barrel aged cocktails. Didn't get a chance to try any but will on next visit. We parked in the mall lot for $22 for 24 hours. The mall connects to hotel. Everything you could want to do is in walking distance. We walked to slippery noodle and heard 2 great blues bands! Had take out sushi from place across the street. It was gross. The bed was very comfortable for husband who likes a firm mattress and myself who likes a soft fluffy one. That was some kind of magic!What great service from the front desk staff on in.Great location great bar.I love Hotel Tonight.The highlight was the person who checked me in was amazing - great job ZenobiaThis is a four star hotel?Is that why I called for room service three times to no avail so I had to come downstairs and order take out?Or is it because I called valet and got no answer when I wanted to take out my car?Or is it because they mis charged our acct and no one is available to talk to us about it?Are hotels a part of the hospitality industry?I have had better service at a holiday inn.My wife and I will check into the Alexander next time.On a recent weekend getaway, I booked a room at Le Meridien. The price was extremely reasonable for a last minute reservation and it's great location downtown Indy. I booked a deluxe room after being told it would include a better view of the city. Once in the room, the view included the top of a parking garage with a small glimpse of a church steeple. I expected the room to be a little more spacious but the bathroom was amazing and somewhat made up for the small feel.From the beginning to the end of our stay, the guys at the curb were the highlight to the stay. They were very friendly and attentive...especially Keith. I appreciated being walked to the curb under an umbrella while getting into our cab for dinner (unfortunately it was raining). We were also disappointed when we chose to order morning coffee via room service instead of making the coffee in the room. When it was delivered, it came on a tray with the coffee being in a stainless pot, creamer provided in stainless creamer pitchers but the provided cups were paper. I understand if the intention was to provide us a way to take our coffee to-go but if we invested the time & money into room service, it would have been nice to have actual coffee cups. While it seems like a trival complaint, we felt that with the hotel setting a "high-end" tone, it was a missed service opportunity/presentation.Should I have the need to stay in downtown Indy again, I would stay here again but would not seek it out as a destination stay.Couldn't have been better, beautiful renovation, super comfortable beds, great showers.  Breakfast and room service were perfectThis hotel was beautiful on the inside and extremely well located. The bellhop Chaz made it even more worth the trip to this hotel and absolutely worth coming back for sure. He was extremely friendly, a wealth of information and he made our trip over the top enjoyable with his total orientation to service. The management at the hotel are obviously totally on top of it as further demonstrated by the beautiful artwork in the rooms and the overall feel of the hotel. Thanks for the great stay.The staff has been awesome. Tonight I was dying for some chocolate and everything around the hotel was closed. After asking if they had anything made of or covered in chocolate they offered to make us a batch of chocolate chip cookies. At 11pm they went out of their way to fulfill a somewhat unreasonable request. This was typical of the service. The bar staff is also a great group. Good drinks and a upbeat attitude. Had dinner here as well and the food and service did not disappoint. On top of all of it the rooms are clean, modern, and a pleasure to come back to after a long work day.Clean bathroom, attentive and friendly staff and good climate control. Very quiet on the 10th floor and a wonderful shower. No in room coffee maker but they bring you up complimentary tea and coffee if you ask. Updated and elegant but my room was tiny, but it felt cozy. Very nice stay and close to my location if business.Great hotel! Best shower of any hotel I've stayed at in Indy. Trendy but classic decor, comfortable beds, and very quiet. A bit more expensive (+$50/night) but well worth it. I'll be staying here on my monthly trips.In town for one night. When they found out it was my wife's birthday they upgraded us to a suite. The room was fantastic. The remodel was spot on. Can't think of one thing that was not up to par. Highly recommend.Rooms are very nice and brand new.  Windows have two blackout blinds with dark curtains too.  Virtually no light comes in the room in the morning.  The bathrooms are huge and well accompanied. The employees are still working out the kinks since it just opened (this week), but all the staff was very nice and positive even if they were still a bit rusty on how things should operate at the hotel.  The specialty drinks in the bar are made with care and top shelf.  I'd definitely stay here again especially if attending an event at Lucas Oil Field.Nice hotel, great location, and superb service!  We're big fans of Starwood and Le Meridien Indy didn't disappoint!  Front desk staff was very pleasant and one employee even went as far as running to his apartment to get collar stays for my husband in a pinch.  Great experience!Room service breakfast menu portions are small and in room coffee maker was not adequate. Staff was absolutely wonderful. Room is modern and very cosy. We got the standard room and were very happy. Valet parking is a bit costly BUT it included in&out which the self parking did not include.

review_content: This review is for a cooking class I attended; I didn't stay overnight, but will definitely be keeping The Nestle Inn in mind the next time someone asks about lodging options downtown! The theme of the class was the Foods of New Orleans; the menu included crawfish etouffee, shrimp po boys, and beignets. The experience was very much like hanging out in a friend's kitchen (a friend who is a great cook mind you...), chatting with them while they cook, and pitching in as needed; in other words, very relaxed and informal! Leesa, the owner was a great host, and had the fun task of keeping up with the dishes! Chef Anna was a great instructor, and selected recipes that I really feel like are realistic for all of us to make at home! We learned a lot about cooking techniques, and came away with some new skills and great recipes! The class ends with eating of course! We were able to enjoy the creations in the dining room of the Inn; the tables were decorated for Mardi Gras which was a nice touch! All of the dishes were delicious! I can't wait to try the recipes out at home!First things first. This place is a bundle of cozy, home-away-from-home, cuteness. The bed! The pillows! The microfiber comforter! This place is well equipped to deliver a comfy-night's beauty rest. Bonus perks that made me sleep like a baby in my own bed? My room was stocked with a fan and space heater. As a picky sleeper who likes to have white noise when I sleep, the small fan was perfect. A beautiful and well cared for victorian home, complete with cast iron stained glass windows - incredibly beautiful, especially in the morning light. I was in room number one, which can be a little noisy when other guests are returning at night and a again in the morning when guests are going up and down the stairs. If you plan to sleep in I recommend opting for one of the bedrooms on the upper floor.A hidden gem on Mass Ave. Intimate, inviting, and comfortable. Took part in a cooking class during our stay. Highly recommend it. Love the self check in process.Welcome to planet cute. Where the rooms are modern rustic but cozy. Where the WiFi is stable. Where butter bars and biscotti lie for your snacking. Where dreams are made - because the beds are so comfortable. I only enjoyed The Nestle Inn for 10-12 hours, but those hours were well spent enjoying the spoils of this adorable bed and breakfast. Because I was super busy flying into Indy, working and hanging with my colleagues, I didn't get a chance to check in until almost midnight, but with an advance head's up to Leesa I was able to walk right in and plop into my bed within minutes. I didn't get a chance to redeem my breakfast voucher at Henry's, but I've been there many a time and can say it's a great place. Next time I'm in Indy and looking for a heavy dose of cute, I'd definitely stay at Nestle Inn again!This was my fourth visit to the inn. Leesa is wonderful and very welcoming. The inn is very clean, comfortable and quiet. I will be returning again next year!We had a great stay here last night! We loved the perfect location and Leesa was super welcoming. She showed us around the house, gave great recommendations for local spots, and her butter bars are awesome. Our room was comfy and clean. The only thing we'd change was the lack of water pressure in the shower.... That was a major downer. Other than that, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and recommend it!Very surprise by so many good reviews when. I've always though stone soup inn is way better. One bed and breakfast usually have food in the mourning for u not this place u have to go somewhere else to get food wow that's why I gave it a one star and no tubs in the room boring.This is my "go to place" when I need time to think, create and rest. Love the amenities, location and aesthetics.I have to thank yelp for helping me discover this lil gem! I was planning my cross country road trip and my first stop was Indianapolis. I am SO happy I booked with Nestle Inn... first reason being I was traveling cross country alone and I wanted a comfortable, safe spot my first night. This place lived up to every thing that is written about it. I chose the self check in, as I was unsure of what time I would arrive, but I winded up arriving around 5pm. As I pulled up one of the inn keepers was gardening, which I loved. Check in was smoothe and easy. My room was on the first floor (the only room on the first floor, which I loved) I was able to see my car parked right outside my room. Everything was comfy, cozy, chic', rustic, and a true homey feel. The following morning for breakfast, we got yogurt cups, and fresh fruit, baked oatmeal, and scrambled eggs....I had to leave to get on the road, so not sure if more was served...but everything was yummy and so well worth it...for my first stay at a bed and breakfast, this was quite a a delight! I would totally recommend staying here to anyone passing through Indy!I just got back from a quick overnight trip to Indianapolis, my first time there. The Nestle Inn was exactly what I wanted and for a price that was more reasonable than the downtown hotels. Located in the hear of the Mass Ave theater & arts district, it is just one short block to theaters, shopping, bars, restaurants and only a few feet to the coffee shop next door. I went with a girlfriend so we stayed in the suite which had a king bed plus a daybed in the sitting room. I've only stayed at a couple of B&Bs before, but I've tried to find them with 2 beds in a room before and it is rare...and the few times I did the prices were way too high. The Nestle in has great prices, lots of space in the suite and in the several public sitting areas. With 5 rooms (and a 6th on the way) and the owners living in the carriage house behind the Inn, it really did feel like we were coming home after an evening on Mass Ave. We barely saw anyone else during our short stay (Sunday afternoon to Monday morning) but everyone we met was very friendly. The owner, Leesa, was friendly and warm, but also quietly disappeared to give you privacy when you weren't needing her for something. We didn't get the chance to try out the weekend breakfast...what a shame. It sounded really good. That said, we liked having a $10 voucher for breakfast...or anything we wanted...at the coffee shop next door. I ate a full breakfast, but my friend wasn't hungry and grabbed a sandwich to go for lunch. As a relative novice at B&Bs (this was my 3rd one), this was my very best experience to date. I would highly recommend Nestle Inn for business travelers (free wifi everywhere, easy weekday breakfast on your schedule), group things (retreats, girls weekend, family vacations), couples or friends. If you've never stayed at a B&B and are a tad uncomfortable about the idea...the Nestle Inn will win you over!I've written a full post with pictures, more details and a video interview of Leesa on my website, Future Expat. futureexpat.com/2013/02/...I just left Nestle Inn and I miss it already!Admittedly I LOVE the idea of bed and breakfasts but in practice I've rarely found ones that I love. I guess despite the fact that I love things low key, quaint and cozy when it comes to my lodging I love a pimped out hotel. Nestle Inn, however, never once had me longing for a hot tub, crazy mood lighting, or a rooftop bar. And here's why:+ Free wifi that WORKS! I had no trouble working or surfing.+ Comfy beds. I slept like a dream both nights.+ Complimentary soft drinks and water in the common area, plus hot tea, coffee and a variety of sweet treats left out (biscotti and the amaaaazing butter bars that I know I'll be jonesing for soon).+ Spacious rooms with a good sized bathroom attached. + A wonderful proprietor. Lisa was unbelievably nice! + Lovely decor. Very cozy, very rustic, but not over the top. I've been to B&Bs where it looks like Laura Ashley had a dozen babies and they all threw up all over the room. This is tasteful, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. It's holiday time and the decor was really lovely. Lots of fresh greenery and pretty things.+ Walking distance to awesome things downtown. It was terribly cold while I was there so I didn't do that (uber was my friend) but it's a great location.+ The room comes stocked with extra blankets and mine had a small heater. If you like to get extra snuggly.A few things worth noting so you'e prepared: Check in is 4-6pm. That's the time you can meet with Leesa in person. However, if you need to make other arrangements she is more than happy to work it out. Breakfast during the week is presented via a voucher next door to Henry's a cafe with breakfast sandwiches and the like. No in-room thermostats. My room was a little drafty but with all the extra blankets and the heater I felt roasty toasty. Not a problem at all. Not sure when I'll be back to Indy but the prospect of another stay at Nestle has me very excited!What a sweet find! Located in the heart of trendy Mass Ave, this little gem provides everything of home and then some! The Nestle Inn is so unusual in that it blends antiques and modern decor to create a one-of-a-kind getaway. We enjoyed #6, the King Suite- this would be a fantastic room for a wedding couple or those celebrating an anniversary. Breakfast is right next door at Henry's- schlurp, schlurp and yum!Plan a surprise getaway- your honey will LOVE it..... Mine did!:)My wife and I stayed here July 22, 2012. Perfect for a Lyle Lovett concert at the Murat Theater.This place is gorgeous, very friendly greeting, beautiful woodwork in a nicely furnished old home. The Air conditioning was working well on a 96 degree night, the cable TV and wireless internet were flawless, the parking is easy, the neighborhood is nice. We will always recommend this place for Murat Theater events and anything else in Indianapolis.Coffee, biscotti, soft drinks, all available and complimentary.(By the way, we had an excellent meal at the Bosphorus (Turkish) Restaurant 1.7 miles south of the Nestle Inn.)My husband surprised me with a honeymoon in Chicago with a stop at The Nestle Inn in Indy on our way. Leesa greeted us with a warm welcome and recommended fun stops along Mass Ave. The rooms were incredibly clean and had wonderful details included like robes and makeup remover. We loved it and hope to be back one day! Thanks, Leesa!Leesa immediately greeted us warmly and gave us a tour of the house. She is friendly and inviting. We wanted an alternative to the chain hotels while we visited Indy for the 500 and Nestle Inn was perfect! Beautiful accommodations and one block from Mass Ave. No driving required to have a wonderful evening out in Indy. Nestle is only 6 miles from the speedway too. See you next May for the next race!!Just had a very pleasant stay. Was on the road and wanted a nice place to stop and found good reviews for the Nestle Inn. I was able to get a room and they accommodated a slightly late arrival and there were baked goods waiting to welcome us. It was in a pleasant urban neighborhood in walking distance of fun restaurants. The free breakfast was for the coffee shop next door and the $10 per person voucher gets a very nice breakfast. The room was charming but not cutesy and very clean. There was free parking in the lot next door (though we had to ask because it wasn't clear from the signs if we could park there.). The only critique besides the parking ambiguity was the fact that they didn't provide conditioner, just shampoo. I would still come back again.We had the joy of staying here during the best 4 days of the year! Well.. For gaming at least. We got the newly remodeled top room. And what a wonderful resting spot to rejuvenate between sessions. The full kitchen is a huge added bonus as well.We won a raffle and got a free overnight at Nestle Inn. It was so relaxing, not having our toddler with us, and the location is absolutely wonderful-close to all the greatness of Mass Ave & the circle. We need to book a room for 4th of July, as it gives a prime view of fireworks from the porch. Leesa was absolutely friendly & warm, and there were always little bites of deliciousness laying out for guests, along with beverages. We were treated to 2 $10 vouchers for Henry's next door the following morning, which made our send off even better. Little bits of oddity that may be handy to know: While there were soap & shampoo, there's no sample toothpaste or mouthwash. I assumed there would be and left some at home. Also, the house is old; floors creak. NBD to me, but some people may not be used to older wood floors. The owner was very accommodating with our food storage and my breastmilk storage, which is awesome. Also, there are hdmi ports on the tv, so yes, you can hook your video game consoles up to it. There was no DVD player in the room, so we ran home to check on the dog & grabbed the ps3 and a netflix we hadn't watched yet & had a grand ol' time when we settled in for the evening. Thanks for a great night, Leesa, & we hope to return soon!Spent our anniversary here - close to dining, shopping, biking on the Cultural Trail, and everything is within walking distance. Inn and room were perfect, and Sunday morning breakfast was delicious. The additional "anniversary package" of champagne and chocolates made the stay even more special.My husband and I stayed at the Nestle Inn for one night, while celebrating our wedding anniversary. It's described as an 'Urban B & B' which simply means it is located in the heart of downtown Indy's dining/shopping district. So the location is prime. It was a 2 minute walk to dinner.The B&B itself is completely charming...the home is well preserved, clean and nicely furnished. Our room was quite big, with a nice TV and very comfy bed. Everything was in perfect working condition. Sometimes I worry about old homes like that, but you could tell they keep everything updated and well maintained. The owners are just good people, and cover every last detail. You're never without a nice cup of coffee/tea/water or a little treat. And breakfast was awesome...Leesa is an amazing chef. Homemade scones, fresh fruit, waffles, iced coffee, and more. I didn't want to leave haha.We really enjoyed our stay here and would go back. Great alternative to a hotel.
review_content_20: This place is a gem and I wanna kiss its face!  The building has great historic attitude and the rooms are comfortably and tastefully furnished.  I love the refreshment bar: coffee, tea, sodas, bottled water.  Our room (3) on the second floor has big windows with a great view of the street, high ceilings, and a spacious bath.  Our stay was a weeknight, so we had complementary breakfast at the coffee shop next door, some light fare and delicious coffee while enjoying the scene from patio/sidewalk seating.  We didn't meet Rob, but Leesa proved welcoming and accommodating, helpful but not too helpful.  They also make informed restaurant recommendations.  Parking is provided.  You really can't beat this place!  We will definitely be back.This place is great! Rated #1 Bed & Breakfast in Indianapolis, and it certainly has earned it. Beautiful, large and comfortable rooms, extremely friendly hostess, an amazing breakfast, and low price. The only downside was trying to find street parking on the busy Saturday night we stayed there, but a couple times circling the block wasn't too bad. I'll definitely stay here again!My husband and I, who run two guesthouses/B&B's in Dayton, had come to Indy for a night away in October and stayed at a B&B in the old north neighborhood, but had taken a taxi to the Mass Ave. Arts and Entertainment district to got to a jazz club called the Chatterbox. We had such fun at the club, and wished we had more time to explore Mass Ave., so when we were seeking lodging for the Indy Mini, we looked for lodging in the Mass Ave. area and found Nestle Inn, and we're so glad we did.  Nights that we can pull away from our own properties are few and far between, so this was a special treat. Clean, hospitible, and inviting. Loved the fact that there was a little fan as well as a little heater for our use--it was an unseasonably cold 45 degrees that day, and after standing out in the cold (or running in the cold, in my husband's case) it was nice to have the little heater to help take the chill off--the Inn was kept warm enough, it was just the nature of our day downtown that made us cold.Though we love going to B&B's when we aren't operating our own, we aren't early risers, so anytime we don't have to be at a breakfast table by 8:30am on a Sunday/vacation day, it's a good thing. Loved the way Nestle Inn handles breakfast. They have a chalkboard with each room number on it, and you choose a breakfast time from 8 to 9:30am (I was ready to put 9:30am, but my husband wanted to be a little more moderate in our time selection, so we compromised with 9:15am ;-) The set-up of the breakfast room was great--individual tables, but close enough to be able to chat with other guests. Also liked the way breakfast was served. A dish of tropical fruit was brought to each of us at the start. Then a serving plate of almond streudel and a serving plate of stuffed french toast, with a cup of fresh strawberries on the side was brought for us to enjoy. Sure wish the weather would have been warmer so we could have enjoyed the darling little front porch, but we'll save that for next time--and we are confident there will be a next time at Nestle Inn. Steve, Barb and Ty--you've got a great thing going. Congrats on 10 years in the biz!Nicely located for business or pleasure. An interesting building with beautifully appointed rooms. The owner was very nice and helpful. A must stay!My sister and I stayed at the Nestle Inn during a quick trip to Indy for a girls weekend.  The inn is adorable, very homey feeling.  It's located right off Mass Ave, which has a lot of local shopping, restaurants and galleries.  It's also not a far walk from Circle Center if you want to do more shopping (which we did).The owners were very knowledgeable of the area and had recommendations for what do, where to eat, etc.  Breakfast is served from 7-9:30 and you just sign up for a time that works for you.  The food was amazing - Kentucky Hot Brown strata with turkey bacon, cinnamon scones, fresh fruit, coffee and juice.  All the food is homemade by the owners and is delicious!I think this would be the perfect location for a weekend getaway and plan on staying here again.

review_content: The staff is fantastic. From the gentleman who picked us up and brought our luggage to our room, the friendly dining room staff, and housekeeper who tracked me down and hand delivered the things my kid hid around the room. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom is falling apart. Like literally, the handle of the bath faucet fell off and the water ran all night. The tub had mildew and grime and was missing the drain plug. The sink faucet is set to the opposite temperature. The wifi was painfully slow. But the front desk clerk was very willing to get everything fixed asap. In conclusion, the property has seen better days, but the hard working crew is doing their very best to make your stay as pleasant as possible.My star rating would change if it was a 1 star hotel. Since they claim this is a 3 and was charged 130 a night, I will treat the review how I would expect it to be. Paint chipping, dirty carpet, old mushy beds, long hairs found in the sheets and on the desk, 1/2 a toilet paper roll, dirty and disgusting air vents, and AWFUL plumbing.The shower head was un-caulked off the wall and had the worst pressure.  The faucet handles weren't connected correctly and didn't have hot water.I would give the receptionists 3/5.  Some were nice, however some were very unprofessional looking and acting.Can you fix the HUGE potholes in your parking lot? there's about 5 of them that are 3 feet long and 1/2 ft deep.Only reason why I booked the hotel is because of convenience to the airport and not having to pay a downtown price.  You would be better off paying 60-90 dollars @ a motel 6 , red roof in, or hotel 8.Haven't stayed at a Radisson chain ever in my life. Now I know what to avoid.If half a star was an option, it would have been more accurate. Checked in at 3:00, and there were several desk clerks sitting around who saw me, but opted to ignore me anyway. Upon checking in, I was informed that since my room was non-smoking, if they smell smoke in the room, I will be charged $250. I don't smoke and I think it's subjective on weather it not "they" can smell smoke upon checking out. It's not even the message, but the delivery. It's just obvious that they don't care. I got to the room, and both the key cards were inactive. After getting new ones, I saw that the room has 2 double beds and not the king I asked for. I call the same clerk and I told her I asked for a king. She said, "Come downstairs." Went down to be told that since I booked it online, I get whatever room they have available. You couldn't have told me that over the phone? Pros: available shuttle to the airport which leaves every hour. Breakfast in the AM (didn't try it since I left at 3:00AM)Cons: Room had peeling paint, crispy blankets, sticky carpet and mold between the tiles in the bathroom.If you have other options, don't stay here!There is just not really anything nice to say about this hotel..... They obviously do not take pride in their property. We had stains on our comforters, heater was broken,  moved rooms and had stains on comforters. Next to no hot water in shower, old dirty carpet throughout hotel, ceilings were dirty, etc.... I could go on and on but this place needs to close and renovate, you really will be glad to pass this place up.... And the beds are the worst I have ever slept on in a hotel. I will suggest finding somewhere else to stay, but on a good note, the staff was nice and friendly at the bar and front desk, but the level of problems at this property is beyond their control.This place is an unmitigated disaster. I'm on the road just about every week of the year, so it takes a lot to qualify for my personal All-Time Worst list. The Radisson is truly a special-kind-of-awful worthy of this dubious distinction. Water is the Earth's most abundant resource, yet mastery of it seems to have baffled this decrepit hole. I was warned of plumbing issues upon check-in. Some work had apparently been done recently, and I was told to 'run the water for a bit' and possibly expect sediment from the faucet. While the water did run eventually after sputtering a bit, it was not until the following morning that I discovered a second issue - a complete lack of hot water. Upon complaining I was told that no other room had this problem (obviously impossible unless each one of the several hundred rooms has a dedicated self-contained hot water supply) but was invited to shower in another room. As thrilled as I was about the prospect of packing my things up and switching rooms while soaking wet with frigid water at 6 in the morning, I politely declined the gracious offer. Overall the place is tired and looks beat up. The tell tale signs abound - battered furniture, stained carpet, frayed drapes etc.The staff was just okay. The person who checked me in was friendly, but the person I spoke to the following morning about aforementioned plumbing issue was not particularly helpful. I also wasn't thrilled about getting a call at 6:20 expediting me because the 6:30 shuttle was leaving. Silly me for inferring the 6:30 shuttle left at 6:30 and not some earlier time. Maybe the driver is a mover and shaker that had other places to be.Avoid staying here at all costsAdvice to hotel manager responding to all negative reviews: Instead of spending time on Yelp responding to negative reviews, FIX THIS EYESORE and save us all the timeConvenient to the airport. But it needs some upgrades. The staff was all very friendly. The hotel is tired, needs paint and carpet. Beds were very worn and broken down mattress. The breakfast was ok but again they need some attention to details. The bread sitting next to the toaster is larger than the toaster would accommodate.Simple attention to details are important. Another example. The yogurt had spoons sitting right beside them, but the spoons were soup spoons and would not go into the yogurt container. The GM of this property is not looking at his domain.  Shows he/she doesn't care about the product.We stay at a lot of hotels soccer and this ranks as one of the worst! I called ahead of time to request a quiet area, like I do at every hotel(never with any problems). My room is right outside the elevator! The front desk lady was simply annoyed by me.Nothing starts your day then a nice shower... Not here! They must have found the worst possible shower heads ever made!Stayed here because we had an early flight the next day.  I want to start off by saying that the staff were incredible and quite frankly the only reason we didn't leave.  The room wasn't bad, only a little dated.  The reason this gets only 2 stars is the smell.  The hallway and room were permeated with a burnt-food smell that lasted the entire time we were there.  It was an awful smell that was not easy to get used to.  We will never stay here again.Updating based on Mgmt response.Management responded to my complaint.  They explained the issue and said they fixed it.  We will consider the Radisson the next time we're in Indy.  Thank you for your response.Stay here if you don't want to sleep at night because air keeps leaking and every few hours you have to fill the mattress again.Called the service desk and they said yeah these mattresses are getting old!Struggles all night and then next morning remote won't work either may be battery died!Went for a relatives wedding and the reception/brunch were wonderful. The lobby was also very attractive and there was ample parking.The rooms were dirty. The sleep number beds did not work. The vent in the shower didn't work. Despite having three people in the room for three days, each day we only had enough towels for two people. And finally, we had a very negative experience where despite numerous attempts and calls to the front desk, our room was not cleaned/serviced. The staff was less than helpful and it was terrible to feel like an inconvenience as a guest when asking for clean towels. I was also underwhelmed with the response from the GM, who gave me a half-hearted apology, blamed their Hispanic employees, and asked us to give them a second chance. No thanks.We booked two rooms . One with two double beds and another with one king sized bed. I booked this hotel quickly without reading reviews ..  I was busy , the price was satisfiable  . $69.00 for EACH rooms .  Eventually I did research this hotel.  Check -in date I was telling everyone not to expect too much , apologizing in advance. Upon arrival , everyone in the car was pleasantly surprised . The lobby , had a very "royal" feel . Upon booking the king bed wasn't promised as noted online . But the staff actually upgraded the room to suite status! In the lobby there is a visible lounge area and bar, which was strangely unappealing to me . (But the bartender was exceedingly attractive) I checked out both rooms  out of curiosity . The suite was impressive, wooden wardrobe , mini living room with a Nice flat screen and of course a huge bed . The double standard room did not have a microwave . Which actually didn't bother me . The bathrooms were also nice , granite countertops in both rooms . You could change the shower pressure . NO fan BUT the shower curtains had sheer overlay up top for airflow. I ended up eating at the bar and the portions were huge and delicious , I thought the prices for the food and alcohol was reasonable . A meal , 2 to 3 drinks 25.00 + tip . Many people complained about the noise ? I heard nothing from anyone or anything out there and I'm moderate sleeper . I WOULD DEFIANTLY stay here again !! Amazing value .I have been staying at this hotel for a year now. I get the crew rate which is the best out of all the hotels in the area. Rooms are ok and food is decent but the reason for 3 stars in the transportation service. I am not exaggerating when I say that everytime I call for the shuttle I wait at least 30 minutes. Either I "just missed it" or "they can't wait 5 minutes for you because they'll be towed away." While waiting, I will see every other hotel shuttle pass me by, some of these waiting 10+ minutes for passengers with absolutely no police intervention. Perhaps it makes sense to wait a little longer to make sure you don't leave people behind and waste time & fuel running back for that one person?! This is the only hotel I have seen that doesn't have some type of communication between desk & driver. My advice, call as soon as you get off the place and give them your number to ensure they don't leave you behind in case you're a little slow.I normally don't write reviews for hotels, but my experience here was so bad, I have to remind myself not to stay here in the future, and let others know.  It's old and run down- there's a good reason it's cheap.It was about 105 degrees outside that day, and the first room I checked into was piping warm, steaming, humid air into the very hot 80 degree room- I started sweating even more when I walked into the hotel room.  I went over to the heating/AC unit, and it was this really old, grey push button, non-functioning AC unit.  I asked to switch rooms and ended up in a room a few doors down, and it was a little better, but again, the AC unit was old (not as old as the other one) and I put the unit to 68 degrees, and it never cooled below 78.  I sweated throughout the night, and the unit was put on "auto" but the whole thing never shut off, instead it creaked, cranked, and was so loud I couldn't sleep well.Thank goodness my flight was at 7am in the morning as I left the room as quickly as I could.  Go elsewhere, it's worth it even to pay $20-$30 extra.Love this place. From the lobby to the room, it's obviously a nice hotel. Very close to the airport with a free shuttle, staff was wonderful, and they had some fruit and packaged breakfast items to go for free, even at 4:30 AM. My only regret is that this flight is so early!I travel for a living and stay in many hotels.  I've read the reviews on this hotel and agree with some of the complaints.  The rooms are slightly outdated but my room was clean and the carpet appeared to be new.  The bedding was clean and comfortable. I'd like to also add that the folks at the front desk were outstanding and very friendly.  Not the finest hotel I've stayed at but certainly not the worst.  For a short layover, probably a good choice.  Longer layovers; you need to get something downtown.  Indy is a great city and there are some very nice hotels downtown.Stayed here for 6 days on business during the beginning of May, and my observations were pretty much in sync with many reviewers here. The rooms are slightly outdated but my room was clean and the carpet appeared to be new. We were in a room that had been recently renovated. The paint job (burgundy color) was pretty sloppy, with paint drops on the air conditioner and other places.  The sleep number bed did not work properly...no display, but it was adjustable and provided good sleep. Bedding was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was very inconsistent, one day while my wife was still in the room resting on the bed, she woke up to the door being wide open. Other days the room was serviced early, but one day it was still unmade at 5pm.  The elevators are old, creaky and scary.  One did not work the entire stay, and the other was an accident waiting to happen.I'd like to also add that the folks at the front desk were outstanding and very friendly. Nicer selection of tv channels than most hotels and free internet.This is a perfect hotel to stay in for the Indianapolis airport, especially if you can get a good price. They were very friendly, had great food (breakfast), were very accommodating with late checkout, and provided a free shuttle to the airport. The bathroom included separate conditioner and a nice blow dryer. The housekeepers even gave me body wash upon request. The only negative I experienced was the noise (I could hear my neighbors), but you probably wouldn't have a problem at all if you were really tired.This weekend was by far the worst hotel experience,  ever.  Beds were so old that I had to sleep in the middle of a sleep number bed, otherwise I would have rolled onto the floor.  Party of 10 for dinner.  Waitress copped the worst attitude with a mother of a small child.   We tried to continue placing our order, to no avail.  We walked out.  Party of two from our group went back for a second try.  The service was non-existent,  and left no tip.  Waitress added her own tip onto the credit card charge.  Illegal...  the air conditioning unit rattled on and off all night.  Management needs to know what type of losers they are hiring!  Get a clue, Radisson.   Will NEVER stay at one again.This rooms at this hotel are dirty and run down. The pipe that goes from the wall to the shower head moves freely in and out of the wall. The sleep number needs are hard to use or get comfortable in. Your must hold the inflate/deflate button and once you get it set it's still uncomfortable.  The vent in the bathroom had rust and mildew inside of it.  The only saving grace was that the front counter staff was nice.  I wouldn't go back to this hotel.I should have read the reviews. It is very cold outside and there is no insulation around the heating unit. Freezing air comes thru when the heating is off. I don't like sleeping with the heat on do I have two comforters and the extra blanket on. Maintenance helped me stiff pillows all around the heating unit.   Very funky place. The people are nice but this place should be razed and rebuilt.
review_content_20: The Good:-Close to the Airport (see also "The Bad")-Friendly Staff-Free Airport ShuttleThe Bad:-Run down: Yikes. This hotel is long over due for a remodel. The rooms are stark (plain white walls, no decoration) and the furniture is worn and dated (no HD TV here, just old CRT TVs that are at least 12 years old). The elevators are old, creaky and scary and the hallways had leaky ceilings.-Uncomfortable Beds: When I walked in and saw this hotel had "Sleep Number Beds" I thought that was pretty cool. However, this hotel doesn't seem to take maintenance seriously as my bed was broken. It was broken in the "softest" position which felt like sleeping on a deflated bed. I switched rooms for the second night, and the non-Sleep Number Bed was better.-Lousy Restaurant. I had breakfast here twice and both experiences were quite unimpressive. Food was usually served luke warm and prices somewhat spendy for what you receive. The service was laughable. My colleagues never got exactly what they ordered even after things being sent back multiple times.-Expensive. $177/night (with the 17% of taxes). I have stayed at Super 8 Motels nicer than this Radisson for $89/night.-Slow Internet. Good luck trying to watch a YouTube video.-Being close to the airport is noisy. Starting around 6 AM you will hear planes take off every few minutes. Not ideal.If looking for a place to stay near IND, avoid the Radisson.Don't do it.  As many other reviewers pointed out this hotel is in serious need of a renovation.  We came in for the Indy 500 and we expected it to be busy (which it was) but the service was mediocre the food in the restaurant was terrible (pricey and down right nasty) and the condition of the hotel was poor.  Only one elevator worked the entire time we were there and the bathroom in our room looked like it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned since the Nixon administration.Been staying here because of company moving my job to the Indy area..  I have had great service and terrible service. Room is always cleaned and I've never had a dirty room.  My only problem has been with one rude room service person. Only saw them once and havnt used room service sence.Stayed here for three nights during an event that took over the place.  The rooms are in dire need of remodeling as it's a little rough around the edges.  The lobby and common areas are quite nice though.  They have a very nice bar.  Elevators could use some modernization and kept breaking down unfortunately, but they probably got more use that weekend than the past several years put together.  Two stars for the facility but an extra star for a wonderful staff who were always helpful and attentive.Well this is not the greatest hotel , but it is cheap and they have a free van ride to the hotel and then back to the airport.    The rooms are clean but, a bit on the old side.We had dinner in the hotel restaurant, food was good and the server was sweet. It was a little on the busy side. No doubt because there is nothing close by.  All in all, it is good for what it is. A quick place to stay in Indy and get back to the airport.                             They have free internet as well and that is always good!This hotel was decent.  The staff was nice.  The breakfast buffet was great and decently priced.  The hotel is definitely dated, the beds were a little hard (great pillows though) and taking a shower was like using a water hose.  The shower head was awful.  But none of this ruined our visit.  Checkout was noon, which was great!  If we were flying out of Indy, this hotel would definitely work.  But if we were staying in Indy for a few days, would probably pick another hotel.Booked a room with two sleep number beds got a room with a broken sleep number bed a bed with a mattress so worn out you can feel the springs poking through. The room is very old and worn out the AC unit barely works. What a dump!If you have a fear of jets crashing into the building do not say here. Its on the flight-path for Fed-ex and the planes are landing every 15 mins. But if your dog tired then you will not hear a thing. This place is very dated and needs to be really remodeled. The bathrooms are really small and dated too so no joy there. It was a last min decision to get into this place as it was late and we had been driving all day long. I know there are better places around we could just not find them at 2 am.Broke down in ohio and had to stay in the shadiest motel ever. Had booked a night here on hotwire, which all sales are final. My gf wouldn't shower at the bates.motel we stayed at the night before so she called the radisson to see if we could just stop in for a half an hour and take shower. We're driving cross country so we're just passing thru but jessica the front desk agent was great and let us use a room to freshen up! 5 stars because SHE was awesome!I came to Indianapolis to meet a friend who I hadn't seen in 15 years.  I had a delayed flight out of Austin due to a massive thunderstorm the night before.  I checked in after midnight and because of the long day, I stayed and rested in my room the following day until about 5:30pm.  I called for housekeeping and the guy at the desk informed me that there was no way for anyone to bring me fresh sheets or towels.I explained my situation to him and he said he would send a driver up if I were in that much need of accommodation., to which I replied wouldn't be necessary if I could just come down and get fresh sheets and towels as I would be happy to clean my own room if the hotel didn't offer any such services to its guests.  I was seriously confused by his demeanor and told him so as I left for dinner.When I returned, he stopped me at the desk to let me know that he had left fresh sheets and towels at my door (on the floor in the hallway, mind you) and that there were coupons for breakfast comps under my door.  Though he had done his best to remedy the situation, I was still a little unhappy because I feel like customer service and especially in a hotel situation, should accommodate a guest's needs within reason without fail.  Maybe I'm old fashioned or too expectant of services offered at a chain hotel such as the Radisson, but being located directly at the airport, they should be used to such requests from their traveling guests and should keep an evening housekeeper on staff.  I can't say I'll be in a hurry to book a room here again, however, it wasn't the worst experience in my life and I do appreciate the desk staff's attempt to make me happy though it was too little too late...It was my birthday weekend & my Dad chose to give me the best gift a girl could receive! OHIO STATE FOOTBALL TICKETS! Yes. That is what I said. The best gift a girl could receive. Okay--well to this girl it is the best gift. We wanted to stay at a hotel that was near the game, but not totally downtown Bloomington. The traffic would be so bad, so we thought staying in Indianapolis would be fun. And it was! This hotel was very accommodating. The front desk when I called to double check if our reservation went through from booking online [www.hotels.com] was very friendly & gave me all the information I needed. The rooms were clean a large. The double beds even came with the "Sleep by Numbers" control! My Dad had wayyy too much fun going up and down with the settings. The best part is that when we got to the hotel, checked in & while walking down the hallway the entire OSU football team came out of the conference room. Yes. I was in a total daze. I got to meet some of the players. It was truly a dream come true for me because I've been a fan since I was 10 years old. Hey if this hotel is good enough for the best college football team in the nation--then it is definitely good enough for you & me!This place is disgusting!!!! Carpet is stained, smells like mold, there, do yourself a favor and don't stay here!!!The Indy Airport area is in transition now that the (fabulous) new terminal has been opened.This hotel is right next to the OLD terminal, and is about 5 miles from the new terminal. They provide a free shuttle service (it is of course a good idea to tip the driver a buck a bag). If you don't have a car it is hard to find a place to eat outside the hotel.  (Yelp ought to add Indianapolis Airport as a searchable neighborhood...). They took us downtown to our specific destination the next morning -- a big savings of time and money.This is a hotel which can hold large meetings.  On either end of the meeting space are residential towers.  On the far side, there is the old three story tower.  Near the front desk and restaurant is the newer six story tower. The far tower is where I stayed so I can't comment on the other. It is only a two or 2.5 star at best.  It is quite old, but in decent shape overall. The bedding was in good condition with washable-cover duvets.  They have sleep number beds, but you can't adjust the sleep number.The bathroom is quite aged and probably the room's worst feature.  It is small with a small tub. The tiles have been heavily painted and the paint is starting to let go.  Still, I got the room on Priceline and I'm happy with what I got. If I had paid rack rate, I'd be more upset about it.The bar is pretty good and has some happy hour specials like sliders. I'm not able to tell you what the specials are, because they have no menu. just a sign behind the bar. I think the kitchen closes at ten.  If you're flying in from the west coast late in the day, you might be better off to eat at one of the nice places in the new terminal.I ate in the restaurant and I can tell you with authority to order the burger! It is excellently prepared and delicious on a high quality bun. I had fruit cup instead of fries, expected a cup of thawed honeydew, but instead got a beautiful cup of high quality berries and fresh sliced fruit.I had a cream of vegetable soup also and it appeared to be home made.A  nice feature of the hotel is that down by the restaurant they have a vending machine with ice cream treats and frozen entrees of decent quality  in case you get there after hours.  More hotels should offer this!  I think they do this because a lot of pilots stay here.The staff at the hotel were exceedingly friendly and took good care of us.  I will probably stay here again, as the quality of the staff gains them a star -- I can put up with a rather crummy room for service like this.I wont be staying here again.The staff was very nice but the building and its furnishings were old and worn.Im assuming the place will be torn down soon. They have stopped doing repairs and cleaning.The food was excellent tho.

review_content: We stayed here for work for a week because there was a large conference in town that drove up downtown room prices. The staff were very courteous, the rooms big and clean. I found the desk and couch useful for having meetings with coworkers and working. The downstairs area is also arranged like a lounge of sorts, with tables in small nooks around the lobby. These double as eating areas for the free breakfast (see below) and evening bar/restaurant/cafe. I didn't hang out there in the evening much, but it appeared people did. The room has a refrigerator, coffee maker, large flat screen (in my room, somewhat poor quality - local channels didn't have great reception), and a desk. I wish it had come with a microwave. I was really comfortable in it.The free breakfast includes toast, bagels, rotating pastries (danishes, muffins, donuts), fruit (usually mixed fruit and grapefruit, plus whole wrapped oranges, apples, and sometimes bananas), yogurt (plain [which I thought was of poor quality] and fruit), cottage cheese, oatmeal, cold cereal assortment, breakfast sandwiches, rotating breakfast carb (pancakes, french toast), juices and milk, coffees and teas. It all looked nice, but I thought was strangely bland and cold. Perhaps the addition of a microwave to allow people to reheat/heat would help? The 6 AM start time also seemed a bit late - even a half hour earlier would have been better for us given we often left for downtown/work around 7. Most of the hot food was not out when I was there at 6 AM. I didn't ever order anything from the 24/7 restaurant/cafe menu but it seemed like a pretty good mix (salads, soups, sandwiches, hamburgers, flatbreads, pizzas) that I assume they reheat on site (I'm not sure). Dishes, as I recall, generally cost $6-11. My coworkers noted the entrees they ate were kind of bland, but the salads were good. Note: all the food appeared quite fresh and despite the criticisms here, I thought it was quite good for hotel food in a hotel without a real restaurant. Has a free shuttle to and from the airport. The van, if not occupied, also can take you to nearby restaurants as there really isn't anything nearby that's walkable (busy highway and road).Taxis into downtown reportedly cost $24/trip. At the suggestion of one of the staff, we took uber each morning and evening and those trips cost $10-13/trip - it worked really well.Very nice room. Great staff. Comfortable bed. Lots of outlets in the room (a personal pet peeve of mine). Full sized ironing board. Be aware that the property is about a 15 minute drive from the airport. Downsides... Bathroom fan was LOUD! Temperature control was iffy. Iron was broken.The breakfast was alright fancy looking but limited selection and the food was cold!  The restaurants food is overpriced for a small bowl of microwaved Chili it was $7The rest of the hotel was great!  Very nice rooms the employees for very friendly!Great place to stay, especially if you have an early morning or late night flight! This hotel is really nice, with an up-to-date design and interior, large rooms, hot 6am breakfast and shuttle service to and from the airport.The staff was wonderfully nice and helpful, and the shuttle service that runs every few minutes is super handy for traveling. The hotel is roughly 7 miles from the airport, so the drive takes only around 10 minutes. It is also located about 7 miles from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, or the downtown area. The rooms are very comfortable, large and contemporary. There's Free WiFi, pullout sofas, coffee makers, a minifrige, and even a wet bar. The breakfast is served at 6am but if you have to leave before 6, you can get many other items like coffee, juice, muffins & other pastries or fruit. This hotel even offers a 24/7 menu and "market."The decor is attractive, modern and warm, and they have a nice outdoor pool with a 24 hour fitness center.We stayed here for the 2015 big ten championship game and unfortunately my Ohio state buckeyes were not playing in it. Our rooms were very clean and extremely spacious. The continental breakfast was exceptionally good. We noticed they had a nice bar where some people were getting a bite to eat and drink but we didn't take advantage of this due to the fact that we were downtown taking part in the festivities around Lucas oil stadium. The customer service was gracious and more than helpful. I also thought the price was right for such a nice hotel. We liked it so much that we decided to book a room a year in advance for next year's game.My husband and I stayed here for a weekend trip to Indianapolis. We chose this hotel because of our many excellent experiences with Hyatt. This hotel turned out to be mediocre at best from start to finish of our stay. Our flight into Indy was delayed an hour, putting us in at 11:30 pm. I called ahead to let the hotel know we would be checking late. When we arrived at the hotel we were very tired and eager to get to our room. The person behind the bar/check in area barely acknowledged our arrival. He said he would be right with us.  He then made drinks for a couple at the bar, answered a few phone calls then got to us. While it was only about a ten minute wait to check us in it did not set a good tone for the stay. The room had stained carpets that were dirty in corners and along the edges (I noticed because my suitcase got dustbunnies on it after only a short time in the room). The bed was clean  and comfortable (which is the most important thing to me). Our room was very noisy - freeway noise from outside at times and in the mornings loud noises from the cleaning staff. We ate the free breakfast both mornings and it also was adequate at best. Very few protein choices. Also during the  busy part of breakfast the serving area and dining tables were not kept clean. Though this hotel does not seem to be that old it does not seem to be well cared for. The staff was also OK, polite, helpful, but not really attentive. One thing I really liked  was that now you can control the TV with the Hyatt stayconnect app on your smarrphone - no more germy remotes. Overall I am satisfied with my stay, but if I were to visit Indy again would probably stay somewhere else.Small clean accommodating and awesome staff. I was exhausted when I drove in. No roomservice but I headed to the lobby bar and had a small bbq chicken pizza and wine. Both really good! Better than I've had at other bigger hotels. I like the personal care and approach the staff had. I ended up finishing my little to go pizza in the lobby, and got a cookie to go. Definitely order a cookie! The rooms are clean and spacious and really accommodating, with hassle-free free wifi (ahem every other hotel could learn something here). Next time I come through I'll be back!Hyatt Place has become my new favorite business travel hotel. This one is exactly like all of the others, which I like, because I know what I'm getting.Free breakfast is excellent, however, I'm not at all a fan of their coffee. Free wifi is decent...good enough to stream after a few minutes of buffering.This does have one of the better fitness centers of the several Hyatt Places I've stayed...it's much bigger than the usual ones. Now, it's nothing compared to a Hyatt Regency or Grand Hyatt Stay Fit, but it's nice enough.All in all, a solid hotel for frequent business travel or personal family travel.Great service, clean room, and comfy bed.  Close to the airport too, which is nice.  Not much else to say.loved our stay, breakfast buffett was fresh and with decent verity for different taste, the dinning area was a bit small but we easily found a spot. The room was clean and reasonable. Don't compare it with Hyatt hotel itself and you will feel good about it.Great room rates!!! Close enough to downtown without the downtown prices!!! Room extremely clean and guest services is a 10/10!!! I would stay here again!!!I stayed here when I came to Indy for the MotoGP. The location was perfect, only about 10-15 minutes from the track and very direct. Also fairly close to downtown via the expressway. The hotel room was very clean and comfy. There was a separate sitting area from the bed area and also a small fridge. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was pretty good. I will be looking to stay here again when I come back next year.I stay at Hyatt Place hotels frequently because I like the brand.  I found this particular location to be under par, though it did have some good points.  Our check in was fast, faster than most Hyatt Place hotels actually.  The person who checked us in, however, was disheveled -- had on a dirty shirt and it was untucked.  That seemed a bit odd.  The room size was much smaller than most Hyatt Place hotels.  I wonder if they converted another hotel to call this one a Hyatt Place -- it doesn't seem to be built as a Hyatt Place, but I could be mistaken.  One larger issue was the location of the hotel.  Although it was conveniently located off an interstate, the location seemed unsafe.  This made my wife uncomfortable and unwilling to stay here again, and I can't say that I blame her.  The breakfast was not as fresh as most similar Hyatt Place hotels either.  There were some staff at the front desk who seemed quite professional and hard working.  Unfortunately our stay here made us rethink the brand of hotels we will stay at for leisure travel, and we have decided to switch chains.Great staff. Van from airport has seat warmers to help stay warm during Indy's winter. Room is equipped with fridge and there is a microwave downstairs that's always available, along with plates and utensils. Full breakfast with a couple hot options that change depending on the day...all FREE. Not many things on the menu during the day I would go for and drinks are over priced but you can cross the street to the gas station and grab something there. Gym is nice. Good equipment. Not five stars because it is by absolutely nothing.I was there on a last minute business trip and felt bummed out that I couldn't get a hotel in downtown. Found this one. It was my first time staying there. Breakfast included in the hotel rate was really very good, with range of hot and cold items. Compared to other places that have similar options, it felt more convenient as it was relatively small and I didn't have to go to some restaurant somewhere to get the same. The hotel reservation counter flows into a small bar. The staff seemed to treat me as if I was a regular customer. The hallways seemed perfumed, well-lit and well-maintained. The room was furnished nicely. Complimentary internet is much appreciated. The bed was comfortable. Heater was not noisy. The place was quiet. I got the rest that I needed. I noticed right away upon first checking into my room that plastic seat on the toilet was quite loose. Called the front desk right away, and they sent maintenance within minutes with a replacement seat and within minutes he had done his job. After dinner outside, I returned only to have my key card not work. First they reprogrammed it and when it still didn't work, accompanied me to the door and said that she was convinced that the battery in the electronic lock in the door needed to be replaced. She apologized profusely, offered me a complimentary glass of wine while I waited in the lobby as maintenance fixed the problem. So, I had 2 issues needing maintenance on my first night at this hotel, but they were both handled very professionally. I would go there again.Hotel was fine but nothing special - lack of bathroom amenities, basic housekeeping Service - made the bed with remote in it. Coffee/breakfast was good and staff was friendly, but I wouldn't return. Heater very nosey and bathroom too dark and small with obnoxious fan!LOVED this place.  From the friendly staff to the beautifully designed rooms, this place will get my business whenever I have the opportunity in my travels.   Their self-serve breakfast area was spacious and clean, and the food was plentiful.  The lobby was large enough to accommodate a large number of patrons comfortably even when all the rooms have been sold out.  We were there over the Memorial Day weekend for the Indy 500 and we never felt "crowded".  Simply put, it really was a pleasure to stay here.My flight was delayed due to weather so I had a 16 hour wait overnight until the next flight. Airline would not pay for hotels, so I called around and Hyatt offered me a special "Distressed Passenger" rate. I confirmed over the phone and they had their shuttle driver wait for me as I made it outside with my bags. The hotel itself, is kind of in the middle of no-where but there is small gas station across the street in case you need amenities, ie. a bottle of wine. There is, however, a small bar (with Happy Hour!) in the lobby as well as free flowing free fruit and 2 computers with free WiFi (that no nobody was using except me). Breakfast is also free (continental stuff) but if you want an omlette it will cost you a little more. The staffs are pleasant and helpful. They asked me when my flight was and planned my shuttle ride back to the airport (free, of course).I stayed at the Hyatt Place overnight when in town to visit my boyfriend. Considering I'd never been to Indianapolis before, and figuring it was a relatively "happening" city (it's not, by the way), I counted on the hotel being in walking distance to...anything...at all. Instead it seemed in the middle of nowhere, plopped next to a gas station off the interstate. Parking was adequate and abundant. I also liked that the parking lot was well lit after dark.The check-in process was seamless. The Guest Service Agent was super sweet and had my room receipt and a glass of wine ready for me when I came back from getting my bags from the car. I am very familiar with Hyatt Place hotels and wasn't surprised at the large amount of room and the cozy feeling associated with this hotel. However, the only downside is the fact that the entire vanity area is nestled in the main bedroom space, so if someone is sleeping or lying in bed, you're stuck getting ready in front of whomever you're bunking with. The other bummer was the hairdryer which was old and didn't produce enough blowing power to properly dry my hair (which was a bummer since I was getting ready for a date). The next morning I headed down for breakfast and was pleased to see cottage cheese and hot breakfast sandwiches. The sandwich was "eh" at best, but I was glad for cold orange juice and yogurt.
