All-in-all, I had a nice time at this hotel, and had my boyfriend and I not broken up the next morning, I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again when in Indianapolis.I have written other reviews for other Hyatt Places. The reviews don't change. The service was good. The design is upscale with affordable prices. The free breakfast is very well done. They offer many choices and it is unbelievable that there is no charge. I can't forget that the hotel was clean and comfortable. I always walk in and say "Honey, I'm home". Hyatt Place is my home away from home.
review_content_20: I'm still unimpressed with this HP location! We checked in really late and found crickets in our room! They also didn't say what time breakfast was being served the next morning, so we missed it (thinking it was until 10am, but really it was until 9:30am).  Indianapolis is one of the cities we stop in during our frequent drive, but we might have to avoid this specific location from now on. Oh, I learned the bathroom counters are small in every room, not just the handicap rooms. Err!Hospitality here was great! We arrived to meet friendly and knowledgeable hotel staff. Then before we could get comfortable...fire alarms go off and we have to exit. No kidding. We were never notified of the cause or anything. But we were allowed back in probably under 30 minutes. Good business practice would've been to notify guests promptly of what had occurred. Nonetheless, we slept well in a cool room with fantastically soft beds. Morning was met with a warm breakfast of french toast, egg crossaints, fruits, etc. This is a highlight of the Hyatt Place chains. We used the gym for the treadmills around 10 or so, and there were no others in there, clean towels, and even headphones! Then we asked to extend our checkout time, and it was done, with no extra charge or anything. I'd stay here again because it was no fuss, easy off the highway, affordable nightly rate, and just a delightful experience.Clean, updated and comfortable. I met a friend who was staying in town and we went for dinner. The front desk clerk, Nicole, was incredibly helpful printing me directions to the nearest carwash and providing excellent customer service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to or through Indy. Short distance to a couple of burbs with shopping centers, and a short distance to downtown Indy Zoo, museums, etc. I will stay here the next time I come to Indy for vacation.Update: October 19, 2010; was disappointed when the General Manager Bill Styck called me the day before we were to show up and inform me that the three rooms I reserved back in November 2009 (11 months prior!) were being moved 14 miles away to a Best Western. I DO NOT UNDERSTAND why/how/why hotels oversell! If you have 100 rooms - you should take 100 reservations.....not 101, not 105, not more....100! THis is incredibly poor business practice and is terribly inconvenient for customers who THINK they have a reservation. For this.....I'm going to take 2 stars away!What a wonderful hotel!  We stayed at the Hyatt for only a few short hours on the night of July 23rd.  We had to get up at 5am to catch an early flight back to California and celebrate our daughter's (who was with us) 18th Birthday.  Because of bad weather my family and I got re-routed and we were delayed for 7.5 hours.  We were completely exhausted and laying on the floor of the airport was not an option.  We called up the hotel and spoke to Sara.  She immediately sent a shuttle to get us and put us back in our room.  The driver (Elaina) called ahead to have our room keys waiting and schedule a late checkout.  She even stayed late to shuttle us back to the airport later in the day.  I can't even begin to tell you how wonderful this service was.  They went out of their way for us!  You don't see that much anymore!  It meant everything to us that day!The rooms are great too.  SUPER spacious and modern.  Best part was the giant sectional couch in room and a mini fridge and bar area.  Oh, and the free breakfast far out-did any other hotel breakfast buffet I have seen.I give this hotel my personal recommendation!  You won't be disappointed!Christina O. :)

review_content: I accompanied my boss for an over night mid-week business trip and was disappointed because it has such a high Trip Advisor rating. While the public areas are tastfully decorated and spacious, the room was quite small and you could hear conversations and tv from adjoining rooms. The bathroom floor was dirty and the floor safe was difficult to reach and impossible to read the instructions. We ate twice in the resturant...$6 for coffee and poor service at breakfast, better at lunch. All in all, I expect more from Marriott.Housekeeping staff were friendly, and the bed linens and bathroom were clean, but this hotel is otherwise in such poor repair, with so much needing deeper attention/maintenance, that the overall impression is unhygienic. Gouges in the wall, dents and marks on everything, old and stained hall carpets, and a coffeemaker with glass so cloudy that I wouldn't use it.Service from desk staff was terrible. We called ahead to secure a refrigerator for our room and were told twice that there were plenty, even extra, in advance of a busy weekend. We reminded them again on check-in, receiving the same assurance.. but total inaction. We finally called down and were told that they'd been "out for hours". We had a three-night reservation, but declined to spend the night. We booked a different hotel and left.Wow, just wow! Stayed two nights, two nights WAY to long! First off no hot water the entire time we were there. I complained on six separate occasions with absolutely no results. At 8:45 pm there is w knock on the door with the person stating they are housekeeping wanting to know if we needed service. That's right they had not gotten to my room yet! My response was Um no, im getting ready to go to bed.  Truly the worst experience I've ever had in a hotel. I would've been better at the $19.99 a night Motel 6. Live and learn! The only reason they got a star is because I had to rate it something to post!The hotel looks like it used to be awesome and then they let it go. There was never anyone at the front desk counter when we needed stuff and we wound up having to wait to check in. The waterpark section was closed for repairs defeating the whole purpose of even staying here. The first room had stains on the bed. Called the next morning to see what time breakfast was; they told me it was usually 630-1030 but they havent set it up yet so i guess theyre not having it... It was 9:30a. They do still have a pool here and the whole hotel smells like it. The whole place smells like chlorine. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.Absolutely awful. Everything you could possibly imagine to be bad, was terrible. Do not waste your time or money. It was dirty, under staffed, and not up to date on anything. I would never go back, even if it were free! (Also the breakfast staff doesn't speak English and they will try to bully a gratuity charge out of you, which you do not have to pay.)The beds & the breakfast here leave something to be desired. If I were 12 years old giving this review, it would be higher, but I feel like they could do a little better pleasing the folks who are paying for the kiddos experience.  If you don't have much more to do on a cold winter weekend, it is worth a trip for the kids....if you can get a groupon or not have to pay full price.This was awful, we did not go for the water park, we only went for a late sleepover.  The room was available and the price was lower than most.  That being said, we checked in very late, wanted a shower and realized there were NO towels in our room.  We tried to call down to the front desk, but the buttons on the phone didn't work, so we had to go down to get the towels ourselves.  Then the breakfast was free, and that was too much for the poor quality of food. Remember, a deal isn't a deal if so many things are not right.  The water park was probably ok, not sure though.Stayed here earlier this month. Absolutely terrible. My family had bug issues and service issues. Housekeeping needs more help. The employees try their best, but it just not up to par as an resort experience.I honestly don't a have anything positive to say. Within the first 8 hours of checking in, we had three different rooms. The next day, room service removed ALL of the towels from our room during routine cleaning, which was not discovered until we returned to clean up for dinner after a long day. When we asked for compensation from management, we were told that we could receive our money back as long as we checked out immediately, and that we were horrible customers. I'm writing this the next morning as I await for the day-shift manager to arrive to hopefully help, but from what I hear from other guests, there's very little hope. In short, I have better luck at Red Roof Inns when it comes to consistency in housekeeping and in attention of the front desk. Hands down. I will never return, and recommend that you don't stay here unless you must.I attended a seminar here so I can't attest to what the rooms or the pool is like. Hell, I didn't even eat here! All I know is that is was a little old, still decently maintained, had a weird chlorinated charm, and it wasn't a bad spot to get a meeting room. There are loads of restaurants near round so it's quite convenient.In some many words!!  This place SUCKS!!!Don't even bother, the worst part about the water slides, the life guards are useless!!!All water park hotels seem damp and chlorine-y to me.  This place is no exception.  When it comes to hotels my biggest fear is bed bugs so I always say; "This room isn't the one with bed bugs is it?  We don't want to be on a floor with bed bugs."  This time, it payed off and the clerk said, no those rooms are on the 4th floor, you're no where near there.  Okay then....   I still checked the mattresses and we were fine.  My then three year old son loved the water park and his dad and I enjoyed it, too.  We all had a good time and slept well.  Not amazing but gets the job done.Horrible nothing works! Water park is mediocre. Not worth $15 per person. Wall paper falling off the walls! No ice I any ice machine. None of the games in the "arcade" work. Even with the free stay they offered us to composite can I really say I will come back.My family of five stayed here. When we got to our room there was only one towel in the bathroom. When we turned the air on it was so loud that it sounded like a refrigerator about to blow up. The beds were extremely hard and the television channels were all staticky. The water park is only open a couple days a week so make sure you check what days they are before you decide to stay, of course it was closed on ours. The "included" breakfast was awful even my kids did not want to eat it. My advice is if you are planning on staying in the area drive a little farther down the road...After reading all the reviews I truly tried to keep an open mind. However this place is full of disappointments. Some big but most so small that it's like a nagging itch that just can't be scratched.- Toilet in the room won't flush. You have to lift the tank lid and jiggle.- terrible reception on the TV- room and halls saturated in the smell of chlorine.- two pool tables that have the use of 11 balls between both of them.- one soda machine that won't take bills. The other always out of the most popular product.- the AC wasn't working.....wife goes to front desk to notify. The canned response was do you want a technician, a new room or a box fan. Really a box fan was one solution? This must be a constant problem.- aryan nation tats on a large group of thugs in the water park........guess the kids won't be going there.....and that's why we came.- bars not open- pool bar/restaurant not open- hot tub bubbles won't come on- as I sit here writing this watching over my kids for gang activity my boys inform me the water slides are closed. It's 6:30 Pm.- a lot of just chillin' life guards- the place just isn't very clean. That's very broad I know but that's the general impression.- we booked 5 people in our party. We were given a room with 2 full size beds. When we asked about a roll away bed we were told it's against fire code to use them. So we decided to bully our youngest into sleeping on the ground (he really volunteered) but there were no extra blankets or pillows on the room. Had to beg for some.That's all I can write about as I'm worn out. The ONLY saving grace is that they have a stellar, finely tuned Ms PAC man/Galaga arcade game and since the place is totally empty it was all mine. My advice of drive east for 1.5 hours and go to the Great Wolf Lodge. It's very nice, huge, clean and full of family fun. It has an indoor water park, rooms and activities that puts this place to shame.How do I word this delicately.....The Place Sucks!!!@The hot breakfast bar was cold. The cold breakfasy bar was warm. The fruit had a funny "not very fresh" taste to it.I had to ask for silverware, to replace the white plastic "picnic warBte" they had on the tables.. I had to ask for a coffee re fill and they brought me a COLD cup of coffee.  BTW-It was Sunday morning.Save your tme, your dignity and your Money. Go anywhere else!!!This place was probably nice once upon a time. Now it's grimy, buggy and damp. We had a low rate on Hotwire, which was probably because their waterpark is closed for repair, but even without that, this place is just disgusting. Our first room was mouldy, the second one they gave us was torn apart for renovation and we finally settled into a third room, which was passable, but the hallway reeks. They need new ownership, I think.This place was terrible from start to finish; from water park to hotel. We arrived early to use the water park, which we have done at other indoor water park resorts. We were able to get our wrist bands (this is the reason I've given the one star that I did) and head to the park. When we arrived, we were told that they were out of additional wrist bands, but went ahead and let our daughter in.We headed to the large water slides with our sons, only to discover that they couldn't use the tube slide because the air compressor was out and the tubes couldn't be re-filled. This was incredibly disappointing. The water park staff was sullen and unhelpful. Same for the snack bar. The place was pretty dirty as well, and many of the toys in the (freezing!) baby pool did not work.We went to check in to the hotel to find that others that had booked through LivingSocial (which we had also done) had been turned away because the hotel was over booked. We stood in line for over a half hour to check on the room, and were given a single room instead of the suite that we booked.This was when we decided to leave and to go to another hotel. We got a refund from LivingSocial, and alerted the hotel that we were leaving. About a month later, we received a charge for the room - that we did not stay in. We had to have a long discussion with the hotel to get that unwarranted charge refunded.I would not recommend this hotel or indoor water park.TERRIBLE! We only stayed one night and I wish we were able to get our money back. When you first walk in, it actually looks very nice. But when you walk down the halls and into your room, it's a completely different story. The bathroom was grungy and dirty. The beds only had a sheet on it so you could see the bottom mattress (very odd and tacky). Thankful it wasn't cold! The pillows were hard and lumpy. When we arrived at the hotel (around 5) to check in, they told us the water park was only open until 7pm. And they also said it wasn't going to be open Monday? That's the whole reason we chose this place! We ran to our rooms to change but it didn't matter. We didn't stay long at the waterpark. It was filthy and the kids were bored. And the lifeguards were extremely unprofessional! I wouldn't trust them with anyone's life! They were goofing off, playing on their cell phones and wearing socks and sneakers.. Seriously? What happens if my child needs you? I highly doubt you wouldn't ruin those shoes of yours.. If you go to their website, don't believe he pictures because it's nothing like that now. Very run down. It's almost like it was a nice place.. Years ago. I'm blaming terrible management. Don't waste your money or time. And breakfast wasn't good either. Seriously-just go to the holiday inn.. And I guess they are adding Tilted Kilt to their building.. Just what they need to add next to a child's waterpark.. This place needs serious help.RATING the bar and the gal (Tabitha) with 5 Stars - excellent service - but the hotel looks dirty - lots of kids running around lobby, on stairs...not hotel's fault but tells a lot about the people staying there. Was NOT impressed and would NEVER stay there.But again, the bar was nice and Tabitha was personable, friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our drink.Bar is NOT located where the outside sign says it is - you have to walk around the building, go up the stairs to find it. Appears it has been upstairs for quite a long time but management isn't about to pay for signs directing someone there.
review_content_20: If I could give this place 0 stars, I would!! Easily one of the worst experiences for the family yet. I really can't mention anything else that hasn't been already. We waited over 45 minutes in the parking lot in our car because the couldn't figure out the room situation. Halls reek of chlorine, elevators were out of order, it was dirty and worst of all THE HEAT WAS OUT. They moved my family two different times because the rooms didn't have heat, and because the doors didn't lock. Anyone could just walk in. We went for my niece's birthday party and pretty much the entire night was ruined for the kids. The heat in the water park didn't work either, and despite the pool being "heated", you could see your breath in there. Entirely too cold for me, much less our toddlers. Their lips were turning blue and they shivered the whole (maybe) hour we were in there before we decided enough was enough. I heard the same thing about the box fans in summer. Apparently they just give them away. The place was full of thugs and their out of control, rude kids. I would NEVER visit this place again, not even if someone paid me!!!The staff is pleasant enough, and they let us check in early.  We appreciated that after spending several hours in the water park - the kids were all ready for a nap.  Now for the negatives:  there are no towels in the entire hotel.  Luckily, I anticipated this and brought towels.  But how do you not have a lot of towels at a water park?  Note to the owners - call Great Wolf and ask them how they do it.  Take lots of notes. We asked the front desk staff in person for towels and we were given a couple of excuses as to why they didn't have them.  One staff member finally went and got some for us.  It wasn't until I got to my room that I realized she gave me floor mats.  So, I never got my hands on an actual towel (that I didn't bring from home) during my entire visit.  Our room was clean enough, but worn down.  At one point, a staff member just walked right into our room.  She said that she was checking for empty rooms.  I guess they don't have a computer system?  The fitness room is a joke - two treadmills and a tv shoved into a corner room.  The waterpark is ok.  It's fairly clean and the lifeguards seemed to be paying attention.  However, there's some sort of weird sediment on the bottom of the hot tub.  Gross!  The water is also incredibly cold.  The lazy river is just uncomfortable to be in, and the kids play area isn't too much better.  The pool in the hotel is pretty cold as well.  The kids in our group wanted to sit in the hot tub, as it was more comfortable.  The hotel is incredibly noisy.  You can hear everything - like our neighbor loudly announcing "I'm popping!"  I heard that through the bathroom wall.  The lobby ad pool area noise is so loud that you can hear a conversation on the balcony. My four year old is having a great time though, which is why we are here.  Next time, however, we will spend the extra and drive to Great Wolf.  It's worth it to have a much better experience.We didn't actually get to stay in our room, because when we arrived the front desk clerk informed me that the entire Indoor Water Park was closed for the whole weekend, due to a "chemical imbalance."  Sounds like they violated some hygiene codes to me.  Either way, our whole reason for booking a package through Living Social for this place was so the kids could play at the indoor water park.  The staff at the hotel explained to me that they knew about this problem probably around 10am that morning.  I was arriving at 9pm that night.  I asked why no one called or emailed me to tell me about this ahead of time.  They said they were under the impression that the day shift manager was taking care of this.  All they offered was a $40 courtesy credit -- not a discount off of our room, but $40 we could spend on in-room movies and room service.  No thanks.  Not what we had in mind at all, and now we have to go through Living Social to get our refund.  We will NEVER stay at this place.There are very few times in life where I feel negative stars are necessary. Here is one of those times. Worst mistake was buying a Living Social certificate for $269 for a two night stay.We booked our stay at this horrendous place back in July. Easy enough.  As a party of 8, half of us is drove in from Chicago, and the other half drove in from Columbus.  We were hoping to spend a weekend as a family taking the kids to the waterpark. Upon both halves driving 3.5 hours with children, we get to Caribbean Cove and attempt our check in.  This is when we were told the waterpark was closed. Closed closed closed. Not one pool was open and we were just stuck with each of us looking at each other like "I'm being punked, right?"  We weren't. We were told that we would get extra comp cards for the arcade and credit for food. There was no way kids could just stare at an empty pool and empty waterpark. We honestly couldn't believe that we couldn't even get a heads up courtesy call from the hotel. So now we are stuck in the car looking for options (our final decision took us driving 2 more hours to Ohio to go to another waterpark which will be a whole other review). We were furious about the experience so far. When we finally returned home, we placed an immediate call to Living Social who refused to refund our $269 (times 2 since my brother purchased one too). They pretty much told us we were on our own since we passed the days needed for a refund. Lesson learned. Sticking to groupon.So now we ran into Labor Day weekend. We didn't have any set plans for the kids so we decided "we are stuck with this damn $269 certificate, lets just try this out again." We called about 5 times making sure the waterpark would be open- we were assured it was. Here goes another 3.5 hour drive for all of us again. Where do I start?1. Walked in. Great looking lobby. Front desk staff was very friendly.  So far so good.2.  Elevator not working (looks like this is a continuous issue since its mentioned several times on reviews). We were told to just walk until we find another elevator. Dragging kids and bags, not what I wanted to hear but there we went. Went to next elevator, door opens, we pile in, door closes, no movement. We reopen and try again. Elevator shakes horribly but we made it to the third floor.3.  Entered room. Very spacious. Paint is peeling, doors are warping. Phone doesn't work, volume on tv doesn't work and 3 small towels that are a little larger than hand towels are in bathroom. I call the front desk for extra towels. 20 min later, nothing. Call again, they say "okay they are on their way". 30 min later - nothing. 4. All restaurants are closed except for one little room with a bar. The bartender/waitress/table cleaner/ cook / manager is all one person.  A sweet person but there is just no way in hell one person can handle all of that. We all felt just so bad for her. There wasn't really a restaurant so I guess she placed the order with room service but then she had to leave to pick up out food so she leaves the small room for a good 10 minutes or so. Comes back with our food which is beyond mediocre but edible. We order drinks but there are no kids cups and no straws. We left it at that, ate, and went home.5. The waterpark and pool. You walk in to either and your eyes can barely stay open with the smell of chlorine. It's humid, and not in a good way. 2 pools are taped off and closed off. There are no towels. The hot tub actually allowed babies and children in it. Sadly, I could keep going. Stay far far away!!!!!You know what? Reviews can be deceiving.The BF and I decided at the last minute that a nerd quickie-cation was necessary. So we made plans to check out GenCon in Indy. (For those of you who don't know, GenCon is the biggest convention of gaming--board games, card games, dice games, role playing games, etc). Of course, when people from around the country take over a city, you'll be hard-pressed to find a hotel at a decent rate near the convention. So we went through Expedia. With the we-won't-tell-you-where-you're-staying-until-you've-given-us-your-money "deal," we managed to get away with $65 for the night. Then I discovered the hotel that we'd be staying at: Caribbean Cove Hotel. SWEET. Water park. Wait. Not the plan. Games. Games are the plan. So I forced myself to not be lulled by the idea of water fun...We were leaving after work on Friday, so I called to inform the hotel that we'd be late. The woman was pretty snotty, and talked down to me like I was an idiot, but she said that it was no problem. I brushed her 'tude off.I thought that reading reviews on the way down would be a good way to pass the time. After reading reviews on Yelp, Google, and more...I got scared. Panicked even. Bed bugs? Reviews with bed bugs? Cockroaches? Yikes. I was expecting dingy rooms with dark lighting and lots of creepy crawlies. Maybe this isn't such a good idea. Our options were slim, as our arrival was going to be late. So just before going in, I decided to remove the clothes I would need from my brand new fancy (but free) Victoria's Secret travel bag, put them in a grocery bag, and proceeded to the hotel.We arrived and entered the hotel, which had a beautiful lobby, with a really great looking facade. The staff at the front desk was mostly awesome. The snotty clerk was there, and appeared to be new (train her or boot her, but she was awful). She didn't have the faintest clue what she was doing. Luckily, the other two staffers at the desk made up for her rude behavior. The guy even joked around with me. It was all good.We walked through the "Holidome," which was really nice looking, got to the room, stashed our bags, and went on a thorough search for signs of ickies. Nothing. Seemed pretty safe. The room was clean, and bright. The decor was friendly. Overall, it was a really great bargain for $65. We went to sleep shortly thereafter, but at 4 AM, I woke up in a panic, thinking to myself, "this is when bed bugs are active!" So I was up for about 2 hours freaking out internally, without the faintest hint of actual bed bugs. There were none in our room. But I thought you kids deserved a good laugh on my behalf.Let me start out by saying the only reason this hotel was even given a 1 star is because it wouldn't let me go any lower. This place is disgusting. I will say the water park was nice since it just finally opened after being shut down for a while, but the hotel is just gross. The beds are ridiculously hard and old, the rooms smell, the hallways smell, the AC doesn't work, I can go on and on. We stayed here for 1 night and that was 1 night too long. I almost got the kids up and drove him that night after the water park. We waited over 30 minutes to get towels in our room, the AC didn't work so they thought they would send someone up to look at it when it was already 11:00 at night. They finally ended up moving us and the AC at least worked better in that room, it wasn't 82 degrees like the previous room. Rude people work here is all I can say. The nicest person was the maintenance guy, and to be honest I kind of felt bad for him. You know it's bad when 3 kids tell you, maybe we should have come over to just play at the water park and stayed at the hotel across the street! Nasty nasty place, will not return again. Was here about 8 years ago and it needed some renovations then, nothing has been done to it since then, so imagine what it's like now. Oh and the damn lifeguard at the water slides we tipping people off their tubes after they came down the slides. Big douche bag for sure, who cares if the kids or adults knew how to swim. He had a lot of pissed off people at him. Bottom line, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE, go stay somewhere else!!!!This was one of the worst places I have ever stayed in the U.S. The only reason I went was because I purchased a coupon for it. We arrived, Friday and was supposed to stay until Sunday. I was so frustrated I left Saturday night. The hotel is old, with old decor. The water park is small but enough for small kids. Not much for adults. Friday night we asked for extra blankets. It took 45 minutes for us to receive those. I called the front desk twice and just went down there myself after 30 minutes. The next day we went downstairs for the complimentary breakfast. There was a line. A hostess was there but not giving any information as to how long the wait would be. I asked her and she seemed confused on what to say. When we finally got a seat after about 20 minutes (the people in front of me waited 20 minutes before I got there). Most people got the complimentary breakfast so all the server had to do was get drinks. WHY was the server slow as hell to get drinks?? I told her that I wanted the menu because I didn't want anything on the complimentary bar. It took 20 minutes she still never came back to take my order. I called the manager over to complain, he apologized and took my order. All I had was scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes and 2 pancakes. Can you believe that took 20 minutes to make!! The pancakes were horrendous, I didn't even eat them. The manager came over and apologized for the wait, he had the head cook come out and apologize. No one offered me a discount or a comp on this lousy service!In the hallway to our room some of the wallpaper was ripped open with clear mold spores on it. No lie, about 10 of them. Right out in the open! How pathetic is that! We went to the pool Saturday afternoon, they were out of towels. I asked if new towels were coming, the guy said "I think so". New towels took 1.5 hours to come.So when I went to checkout, there were 3 people ahead of me. Took exactly 30 minutes, to get to me. In that space of time one woman was loudly complaining to a supervisor about an issue, another couple came by and asked to speak to the manager and the first woman who complained came back to speak to a different supervisor.Nothing about this place is efficient or effective.Horrible. From the cold dirty pool to the filthy bathtub and no hot water for a shower. We did not have toilet paper in our room. Someone vomited in the water park pool and the life guard just looked at the water and left. Gross and I believe it violated health rules. We brought our two little granddaughters and they were so cold.  Also most arcade games were out of order. We ended up just playing on our IPad in our room. Some great weekend. I am demanding my money back.Took an hour and 45 minutes to check in. The line was out the door, and though there were 5 staff members behind the desk, only 2 were checking in patrons. No "sorry for your wait" after completing check in, either.Toilet wouldn't flush. Rooms were difficult to sleep in since the noise level carried through the walls. Waterpark was okay, though there are not nearly enough tubes for people to enjoy both the water slide and the lazy river. The water fountain was out of order, and staff refused to give my 3 year old daughter a cup of water. (This, by the way, is against health code.) When my husband pointed this out, the staff member simply said, "I can't help you."Waste of money. Never going back.The water park was fine, my son really enjoyed himself. The hotel restaurant was pretty lack luster, think an Applebee's, but more sports themed and more microwaves; beer special was pretty decent though.  But the next morning as we were getting ready to head out for the day we found two roaches crawling on the wall.I calmly showed the manager what we had found and he calmly gave me a refund for our stay.  The manager handled it the best I think he possibly could have, gave me a full refund and let us keep our wrist bands.My advice, if you really want to do a water park then just do the water park and stay somewhere else.COCKROACH alert!!!  We will be checking out of this dump tomorrow.  First, the waterpark was closed due to a mechanical failure.  The hotel a/c doesn't seem to work---soooo warm and humid in the lobby and halls.  They gave us a free pizza due to the park closing but it took them over an hour to get it to us after ordering.  My kids were starving and unhappy.  Front desk=horrible customer service.  Forgot to give me my welcome bag with vital info for our group's stay and we missed an event. And the grand finale: killed a cockroach scurrying across the bathroom floor at 1:30 a.m.We saw bugs in our bathroom - twice.  Killed them.  Pretty sure that they were roaches.  Rooms are small.  Hallways noisy.  Purchased through Priceline, so we could not get the second night refunded.  Moved to a new hotel anyways - out $100 - but better than being in a roach motel!Waterpark was so-so.  I guess good for Indy, since there are no other ones.  But coming from Wisconsin, the land of water parks, it was a disappointment.  Only one slide for inner tubes - other 2 are body slides.  Worst of all - they have 2 hot tubs and both were closed!!!  I would not recommend this hotel.I'd rather stay at a Super 8 / Motel 6 / name-your-cheap motel than this place again.  And by the way, other options are available very near this location.  My 2 friends and I were staying there for a week.  We asked for a fold out bed, it never materialized.  We were in a room for the handicap so our bathroom consisted of a big open shower.  No fridge.  The coffee machine was broken and we found some disgusting remnants in it.  It had a HDTV, but none of the channels were HD ... so why bother having a HD TV?  The air quality of the place wasn't great.  Because there is a indoor pool and a water park, the air was rather humid.  We walked around a bit and the indoor jacuzzi was broken.  A day after we arrived, the vending machine was broken.  Then we found the guest laundry ... which were only 1 washer and 1 dryer.  I can't comment on the water park.  We took a look and didn't feel like paying $10 for entry.  On one day, my friend asked for an extra blanket because I was sleeping on the couch.  It never materialized until I asked for it again later that day.  My friend called for extra towels and a few hours later, they were never delivered.  Room cleaning service was a bit erratic.  There was no consistent pattern of when they will arrive.  A friend of mine was sick and stayed in the room for a few days and he said he didn't put a Do Not Disturb sign out, but no one knocked to service the room.  The BEST thing about the hotel?  The Wifi was very stable.I wish I had read reviews before purchasing the Living Social coupon. To sum it up, completely horrible experience all around. Had I not prepaid, we would have left after one night.  Next time, we will spend a bit more and go to Great Wolf Lodge.We were seriously surprised at how nice this Holiday Inn was.  I am not a fan of H.I. but this one held up pretty well.  The rack rate was $90 to $119 but we only paid $39 plus tax so I could afford to be surprised.The hotel is huge.  Parking was difficult despite having a very large lot.  Fortunatly our room was on the first floor not far from check in.  The  beds were very comfortable but the bathroom was a bit small.  The remote control did not work well - you could channel down but not up.  The H.I. toiletries have come up a step or two in the past few years.  I even hung on to the soap that had a nice citrius fragrance.There are several restaurants, an indoor pool and waterpark at the hotel.  I'm not into kids but they really don't seem to have taken over the public areas so the Caribbean Cove thing didn't bother me.If you can snag a bargin on the Holiday Inn, it is a decent choice in this neighborhood.  There are lots of  restaurants in the area and it is just off I465.Do not stay here. This is not a three star facility. The rooms are small and the facility is old and DIRTY. It is near a busy and noisy street (Michigan Road and I-465). The walls between rooms do not act as a sound barrier.  I had to call the desk twice about noise in the halls and the room next door. The police had to ask them to quiet down. It took repeated calls to get a roll-a-way. The roll-a-way was uncomfortable and we had to buy an air mattress. The bed sheets were torn and were not changed during our stay. The ice machine was broken. The towels are like sandpaper. The bathroom was not cleaned during our stay.Booked a suite, only to find upon opening the door that it was under construction. Really?! How could you not know that. They gave my sister and I adjoining rooms that were meh. No kitchen area which is why we originally wanted the suite. The manager was nice. Gave us free waterpark wristbands and had a refrigerator brought up. Bottom line- room: overpriced and meh. Restaurant: (breakfast buffet) wayyyy overpriced for the quality of food. Runny eggs and no toast or bread of any kind. It's a breakfast buffet!!! $9.99 per person NOT including drinks.  Waterpark: brr. Cold. My four yr old was shivering. No fun at all. Hot tub could not have been over 80 degrees.  Frustrating because there isn't an alternate indoor waterpark option in the Indy area.I came here because of the Caribbean Cove Waterpark. Which was fun but not as large as I thought it would be. My room on the other hand was a disapointment.  It was so tiny for 200 bucks I think I could have had way better. It was noisy people in the hall making noise in the middle of the night. Worst room in the place in my opinion. View of parking lot, curtains didn't close. Headlights shining on me while I'm trying to sleep. If I'm in this situation again I will ask to be moved to a different room. Seriously this was shitty and a waste of 200 plus dollars.The big draw at this Holiday Inn is the Caribbean Cove Water Park that is part of it. Rooms were adequate in general, but the beds were substandard, particularly the sleeper couch the kids were using. I know not to expect much from a sleeper couch, but this was pretty bad. The "kids eat free" slogan is, as expected, a scam. They charge the adults more than enough to make up for it. The rooms appeared to be refurbished not too long ago while the water park and lobby are additions.

review_content: I came to this hotel for a three-day conference. I got here early and was able to check in at 11:00 am the day it began. The staff was welcoming, very polite, and more than willing to help any way the could. I called the front desk a few times and they answered my questions, even the difficult ones! The rooms super clean and the beds are comfy! I know it's a little pricy, but you certainly get what you pay for.Wow, had not been to Marriott East in a few years.  Had to be there this afternoon/ evening for a board training.  Great transformation!   Very nice meeting room.   Good buffet dinner ( gluten free options).   Not that I was able to use it, but the lobby bar was totally happening at 8 pm when our training let out.   Lots of energy!I attended an event in one of the conference rooms this past weekend. Finding new event spaces is always interesting. The space was OK. Service was around thought the event and worked hard to serve the guests. There was an area to dance, hang up coats, have an open bar and areas to have appetizers. There is also a great space outside of the room to have a check-in area. If you are looking for a small-to-medium room to have an organizational event or wedding reception, etc, this may be the place for you.Checked in late on a Sunday night after a 9hr drive. We were for some reason booked for a king room and the gentleman Rob at the desk spent 5min staring at the screen trying to find a room for us. He was extremely nice and engaging and the hotel was relatively empty but despite being an Elite rewards member we were put on the 2nd floor in an old room that had not been renovated.   The room itself is very dated but was overall comfortable. The bathroom is tiny, with barely any room between the toilet and the bathtub. Even the shower in the bathtub is so low that I could not even get under it despite only being 5'8.   The Beds are very comfortable and the a/c works very well. There is a good selection on TV channels. Overall the hotel does have some nice are areas including the lobby and the courtyard area. I would have liked to see the updated rooms.The Marriott East is a great conference facility and hotel. I was there to attend a work-related leadership summit. The conference facilities are top notch and the food is good, but not great. My double room was smaller than I expected, even compared to mid-range hotels I've stayed at. The bathroom was also small. It really is only just enough space for two people - four people would be crowded. I wasn't able to spend a lot of time exploring the area, but I didn't see a lot of shopping or restaurants, but there are some. You would need to drive to get to anything nearby, and downtown Indy is not that far. The property itself is good enough to recommend for a conference, meeting, or even a personal stay. But you will have to travel a bit for any substantial shopping or dining.I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend convention (Friday - Sunday).  The main complaints I have with this hotel is with the housekeeping staff and the Skylight Bistro and Wine Bar.Firstly, the housekeeping staff seems to be rushing through each of the rooms.  They neglected to clean the bathroom sink to acceptable hotel standards, leaving a lemon wedge in the sink.  Marriott asks its guests to "tip" the housekeeping staff.  If they would do their jobs correctly, the first time -- perhaps.  The Front Desk graciously comped the one night of the stay, and added 10,000 points to my account.  That was nice of them.The second complaint comes from the Skylight Bistro and Wine Bar's, mainly, for not knowing how to properly cook breakfast sausage links thoroughly.  Also the cook preparing the omelets appeared to not know how to make an omelet.  I most likely got a bad case of food poisoning from the sausage links I ate for breakfast on that Saturday morning.  The only bright spot was one of their waiters, Daniel, who waited on me and my companion for our dinners.  Daniel was very attentive to our needs.  He would do anything to make our experience one to remember.The bar is fun, recently renovated and a great area to catch up with friends. The beer selection on draft is local which was perfect to try brews unique to the region. Lunch has a limited menu but some good go-to items including their French onion soup and seasonal salads. Also try the ahi tuna entree!First time staying over night in Indianapolis & if it was not a business trip I'm not sure I  would have picked the Marriott myself but I'm glad they did. The room is actually more than what I expected and I love their outdoor space.Was here for work - and (for whatever it's worth)  I think I'd have a better opinion if I was one of those "drive in, park, stay inside & order from room service until it's time to leave" types.Dated and depressed is the best I can offer. In a shitty neighborhood. A shitty neighborhood for Indy, which is not exactly known for effective planning and zoning.I was here to attend a conference working with folks for whom concerns about basic personal safety are exceptional.  I have no earthly idea how the organizers could have knowingly selected this location. Terrible idea. Literally unfathomable.Staff tried to be helpful...but when the neighborhood amenities are what these are...not much mitigation is possible.I spent more time reassuring attendees than anything else; though since my room smelled funny, a fumigation and a dusting was needed and there were strobing lights coming in from the parking lot, my reassurances had limited efficacy.Everything was old, often smelly, and way more well-intentioned than received.Just hope I'm not expected to go back, work-wise, next year;The upgrades to this hotel are great. From the outside it just looks like your average Marriott which from my experiences can be a really good thing or a really disappointing experience.  The restaurant is nice and open in the front lobby. Nice long bar with 3 flat screen TVs to allow you to watch games or whatever your heart desires. All wait staff was extremely kind, attentive and friendly. Food was delicious (especially the Oysters on the half shell and I'm picky!) The front desk was nothing less. I was checked in promptly & given directions twice to get to my room (it was a little bit of a walk through the conference center which as a solo female could be scary).  Arrived to room, clean and simple. Plenty of plugs to get electronics juiced up. Everything you need for an overnight stay on the road.FLEA infestedStayed here a few weeks ago, and woke up the next morning covered in flea bites. Still have some unsightly scars on my stomach from those parasites. I stay at a lot of Marriotts and this is the only property that I will never be staying at again.Staff very friendly and helpful they get a 5 star, rooms clean, nothing special. The restaurant is one to stay away from, nothing special or new, high priced and nothing to back it up. Drinks were expensive and not well made. I don't mind paying $10+ for a good martini.......but it has to be good.Exceptionally clean rooms!  Very impressed with this Marriott.  Friendly staff, secure rooms and floors, great complimentary breakfast and beautiful outdoor patio.  I will definite recommend to friends traveling to Indiana.I've never stayed here but have been here for the past 5 years for a conference.  The hotel is relatively clean, although the decor in the conference area is very dated.  The staff seem on top of serving, quickly removing items from attendees tables when empty.  I enjoy the breakfast of eggs, bacon, and hash browns.  I've never liked the pasta lunch that we usually have the first day of conference.  The pasta is usually over cooked and watery and the sauces are never good.   I usually tend to load up on salad and dessert which is usually excellent.  I was concerned about the look of the water dispensers in each conference room.  They were very dirty.If I could give it no stars, I would. To start, even though each day was charged on my fiance's card housekeeping would come around and tell me that we only paid for the previous night and had to check out now. My fiance was here for work so I was the only one in the room. After I explained that all nights were paid up front the woman stormed off and said "I go check, I go check." This happened each day that we stayed here, Thurs-Sun. The same can be said about the Internet. The "high speed" Internet was included in our rate but each day when I'd call the front desk, they'd send me over to Tech Support who would the connect me back to the front desk after saying "well it must not be included in your rate then." Each day my fiance had to call the front desk and complain about what's going on.Stay downtown if you can, avoid this hotel like the plague.My girlfriend and I came here for a conference. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room that the conference was held in accommodated everyone very well. I liked that coffee was offered with pastries and fruit. The meal served at lunch was heavy on gluten. When we requested a gluten free lunch they gave you the same thing (sandwich meat, vege, and cheese) and said to just avoid the bread on the table. Ummm it was totally weird eating sandwich stuff with no bread at a conference.I spent my time at the Marriott East in the convention area for the Starbase Indy con.  The convention center was nice, but seems to be in need of a spruce up.  Updates all around, furniture, fixtures, room layout could all be renovated.  Having said that, there was plenty of space and many different room sizes to choose from.  The Con was utilizing most to all of the spaces and the hotel was supporting the event nicely.  The hotel staff was friendly and many staff members came thru the various halls asking visitors how they were and checking on needs.  If I was having a convention in the Indy area, I would seriously look into this hotel.Great service! Clean spacious rooms. Free wifi. Easy access to expressway & short ride to Colts Stadium.  Nice pool & court yard. Great little bar in lobby. Starbucks across the street!!  All around great experience.Yea... Between a 3-4 review.. First, I think this location is way better than the Marriott Indy North. The outside is a bit dated at this hotel but the insides have been redone. The bar is great. The rooms and good and this place usually seems to have a lower rate because it's not in the greatest part of Indy. When I was here there was a billiards convention. Oh man... Talk about a freak show.. That was some pretty entertaining people watching while sucking down cold brews at the bar.I'll freely admit that I didn't want to like this place.  I avoid Marriott properties as much as possible...honestly, because I can't stand the family's politics (okay, not a reason to avoid their product....but....) and everything I heard about this hotel told me it was in a part of town you only spend time in if you've lost a bet.  With that as my background "issues"....The hotel is indeed in a part of town that's lovely to avoid...lots of bad chain restaurants and hotels with that "if we thought you'd be staying all night we would've changed the sheets sometime this week" feel.  If, like me, you're spending 4 nights there for a work-related conference, be prepared to rent a car and spend as much time away from this neighborhood as possible.However, the hotel was quite lovely.  It's a bit of a rambling maze; there are old sections and new sections and meeting rooms and conference rooms and no real order to any of them, but the place was clean and well-appointed, the staff was helpful (for the third time since I've been going to Indy since mid-April, my laundry was lost by the hotel...the staff was incredibly helpful and easy-to-deal with and made the situation right), and, shockingly, they had a fitness center that didn't look like a prison weight room.In short, the hotel itself was quite nice...the neighborhood it's in ensured I did my morning run at a solid 30 seconds/mile faster than usual.
review_content_20: NopeRoom was clean, bed was comfortable.  I heard from a guest staying there that they just completed a big renovation, the lobby is very nice, there is a nice big glass fireplace, and a big bar area behind it with big screen tvs.  The breakfast was very expensive, I had a small glass of fresh orange juice and that alone was $6, for a very small glass, the rest of the breakfast was ok, nothing spectacular so $25 for myself for a regular breakfast seems like a lot to me.  The ambiance was nice, and the hotel has a nice contemporary feel.I am on the fence between a 3 and 4 here. I helped coordinate a conference here recently and have mixed feelings. Some of this may improve with the finishing of their renovations. This is going to be long. Here's the breakdown:Location: Not incredibly close to the airport, which was slightly inconvenient for out of town presenters. While it's not a long drive from downtown and areas to go out, there really isn't anywhere to go out nearby. Parking isn't really enough to host several events at once.Staff: The staff was by far the best part of the experience. Super helpful, always prompt (especially the tech staff for the conference rooms), very responsive, and very patient. Even the other staff I walked by greeted me every time they saw me.Conference Facilities: The good news is that there are bountiful conference spaces with rooms that can be divided or connected into one large room. The good news is also the bad news, because this means that your event might be competing with 1-2 other events, and the participants of the other event might be loud and always mingling outside your conference rooms and making it hard to hear. The kitchen was unfortunately quite loud and connected to the rooms we had, and was also distracting. We did notify the staff on the first day and they tried to correct it. There is also a lovely outdoor patio area where we had our reception- this was probably my favorite part.Food: The food was fine, nothing to knock my socks off, but then again, I wasn't in charge of ordering.Rooms: Nice, but oddly organized. Clearly they had one or two previous renovations where they added more rooms, resulting in a "tower" of newer rooms on one end that are not at all connected with the rest of the rooms on the other end of the building. TV channel selection was pretty bare. Other facilities: nice pool and hot tub area. Didn't make it to the gym this time.I was staying at this hotel for a convention recently. The rooms are a little over $100 each for a basic double, and the lobby area is VERY nice, so I expected it to be a classy place to stay. However, our first room was CRAWLING with insects; there were ants in the bathroom and on the carpet in the bedroom, and a centipede on the wall above the mirror. We called to the front desk and they switched us to another room--- this one had a HORRIBLE chemical smell and we had to blast the A/C the entire time to keep the air circulating. The rooms are not soundproofed very well so you hear EVERYTHING your neighbors are doing at all hours. My roommate and I were working at the convention, and both of our attempts to eat at the restaurant was a joke. The first time (dinner) they were busy but not slammed, and we were seated quickly. However, after almost 20 minutes no one came to even take our drink order despite tables around us receiving their service, so we left. The next day we tried it again for breakfast and ordered scrambled eggs, bacon and potatoes. We told the waitress that we only had an hour before we had to be at work, so she promised to go put our food in right away. Forty-five minutes later she returned and told us that a bunch of room service orders had come in and they had been bumped ahead of our order, so our food hadn't even begun to get made yet. We were infuriated--- 45 minutes to scramble eggs and fry up some bacon and they couldn't even do that for paying customers? She offered us a shot at the buffet table ($17 a person), which HAD those items on it--- she could've just gone and scooped them onto a plate for us and charged us that way! We didn't want the overpriced buffet, we just wanted a quick breakfast before work. Again, we left without paying--- the food service here is a joke. Our room's smell only got worse as the convention went on, and there was some kind of chemical or allergen used because both of us got very sick with sore throats and coughing as well as dried-out sinuses from having to run the air conditioning all night. However, the hotel was completely booked so we were unable to move to any other room. We heard multiple convention goers complaining of spiders or ants in their rooms as well, and many of the staff complained of sticky, foul-smelling carpets in their room. No idea what's up with this hotel but I am glad that I'm not a local and likely won't have to stay here again anytime soon. VERY disappointed for the price we paid.I have mixed feelings about this Marriott. I only stayed one night so I didn't get to get to see everything the hotel had to offer. However, they are undergoing major renovations so a lot of things are closed off or moved to a different area. For instance, the hotel restaurant was open but rather than a typical dining area a conference room was used.The room was very nice and the staff incredibly helpful. One interesting thing of note was the shower. Rather than a tub with a shower head there was a very large shower stall. The entire bathroom itself was very well done and looked newer than the rest of the room, so I guess it was part of the renovations.Overall not the best place I've stayed but certainly not the worst. Better than most, but nothing incredibly stellar. Maybe it will be much better once the renovations are completed.This Mariott is very nice.  I've only attended conferences here, but have done so multiple times.  I have always found the place to be clean, and the staff is absolutely excellent.  Needless to say, they work very hard.  The food has always been good, but not excellent.  However, I would never expect an excellent banquet lunch.Where do I start?  I started my first day with a new company today.  I woke up this morning feeling so sick and had to drive 9 hours to get to the Marriott.  When I arrived at this hotel I was exhausted and felt miserable!!   I travel a lot for work, and if you are like me you know how miserable it can be to be sick and away from home.  My body ached and I had that headache with every fast movement.  I was checking in and the woman (I think Amanda) realized that I didn't feel well.  She said to me, "If you need anything, orange juice or anything feel free to give us a call."  I've been traveling full time for about 8 years and have never heard anything like that before.  So...I got my room keys and made my way out to my car.  The hotel was under construction so there was no "main" entrance for me to bring in my things.  I was at my car unloading my humidifier, suitcase, etc when a random worker came to my car with a luggage cart.  He loaded all of my things and showed me to my room then unloaded it all.  I'm telling you what, it was so nice to have this treatment after the way I felt today.  Ready for the kicker!?  So this evening I was chilled.  I turned on my heat but cold air was blowing out.  I called the desk - they are sending someone right up.  When I went to take the "do not disturb" sign off the handle, there was a bag hanging from my door.  It was from the hotel.  It contained orange juice, Tylenol, NyQuil, Bayer, and snacks!!!!!  After all of this treatment, it was worth my time to say a few nice things here on Yelp about this hotel.  Thank you to this Marriott for going out of their way to make me feel comfortable.Great food in the bar...far better than you would expect.  The salad with goat cheese and the asparagus (either preparation) were fantastic.Very comfortable, clean rooms with LARGE tvs. They made me want to get a bigger TV at home.  I wish the weather had been better so I could enjoy the patio.The hotel is currently under construction 11/3/11  The room i stayed in was very nice the bed was very comfortable with a nice 42" flat screen.  They said that they charged for the wi fi but upon checkout I was not charged for it.  The staff was very friendly!  I pricelined this room for a great rateYes the restaurant sucks here but I will save that for a seperate review.The hotel itself is pretty darn awesome, the rooms are spotless and the beds OH MY THE BEDS are the most comfortable thing I have ever slept in!  I don't know what they put on those beds but I felt like I was sleeping in a cloud :).Big flat-screen TVs with limited cable are available for your entertainment.  However, there is no complimentary breakfast (what up with dat?) and internet isn't free either.  But there are free-to-use computers with internet on the first floor and you can always swipe wireless from another hotel (but SHHHHHH lol).We spent two nights at this hotel during a recent trip to Indy.  It wasn't terrible, but was far from a 'nice' hotel.  The walls were  so thin I heard and understood every conversation my neighbors had.The hotel did have a nice gym, but that was the only above average part of the stay.This is normally one of my favorite hotels, but I sure didn't feel like a Platinum Member this time around.  My room was so small I needed a shoe horn to get in.  You can't pull the desk chair out all the way because of the bed behind you. You can use the sink, toilet, and shower without ever moving from one spot. Oh, and the TV didn't work either, I had to call for service to get it going again (a cable line was unplugged).But the worst part of the room was the location. It faced the service drive to the convention center.  And apparently the best tme to set up the convention center is late at night/early morning. So the noise of fork lifts going back and forth went on til past midnight. And no need to worry about a wake-up call because the garbage truck emptying the dumpster will get you up at 2:45 am.My worst stay ever.The new JC Marriott in Indy is amazing. The staff goes above and beyond to help people and the room was always in excellent shape. Would have liked to have the ice machines on my floor, but the very upscale workout facility makes it all worthwhile.I didn't stay at this Marriott, but ate dreadful meals there.  The first meal I ordered was a cheeseburger with mushrooms.  I requested no bun, no onion strings, no condiments as I am allergic to wheat.  The first time it came with all three.  The second, without most of the onion strings, and with all of the condiments.  They had just put another piece of cheese on the burger and put it back on the grill so it still had pieces of bun and condiment under the cheese.  It was burned.  The third time, they redid the burger, put the condiments on the plate but on the side, and poured the wheat based gravy all over the burger.  The four time, the burger still had condiments on it, but everything else was on the side.  REALLY?  This was a $14 burger.......dreadful.  My other meals were not any better.  Avoid this place at all costs.  The diner, "Four Seasons," is walking distance (around the corner), and much better quality.You'll love it here!  Stayed for 3 nights while on business in Indy recently - the friendly service, beautiful room, nice fitness center and deliciious food (try the shrimp appetizer!) were fantastic.  Try it next time you need a hotel in Indy.We stayed here for two nights in May to visit family. It just wasn't good. The breakfast buffet was terribly expensive. Our room was loud and over looked the highway. The airconditioning unit kicked in every 45 minutes or so and was terribly loud. The hotel was jam packed with a traveling soccer kids. I wouldn't stay again.This is an average hotel with a friendly front desk staff and an awesome concierge level staff. Hotel was being renovated but did not seem to be an inconvenience. The pool was nice and big and so was the jacuzzi but unfortunately the jets were not working when were there. The towels for the pool are small and thin. The courtyard area in the middle of the hotel is a nice with plenty of tables and chairs to relax in.The rooms are beautiful, comfortable etc. but my family and I pretty much only saw the inside of the toilets after eating in their restaurant. After having the chicken quesadilla, all three of us were violently ill all night, to the point where we had to go to Urgent Care for shots. I realize that food poisoning can happen anywhere, but the staff at the Marriott didn't seem to care about our 8+ hours of hell enough to even recommend an Urgent Care to us.We didn't get food poisining, but we were here for a three day convention. First day at the restaurant, wait staff was extremely dis oriented, kept running back and forth, but forgot simple things like a spoon for your soup!Second day was the worst, we made it through breakfast and lunch ok, but then we made the mistake of thinking about getting dinner. They would not even seat you, an they had alot of empty tables, and YOU HAD TO WAIT TO BE SEATED. They claimed the kitchen was behind due to being overwhelmed with the crowds. We finally got seated after going to front desk and speaking to a manager, because the restaurant staff said they would get a manager and that was another 20 minutes, with no manager in sight.We got served and were out of there in 20 minutes after finally being seated after a 45 minute wait. We spoke to other people, and there are one party seated before us, and 1 hour later they were still waiting for their wat staff to take their order in 5 minutes was what she told them. YIKES, we won't be going back. Rooms were great, newly remodeled, facilities were in good shape, but no way will I eat at this place again.A fabulous place to stay! Very comfortable rooms and pleasant grounds - pool, large patio with comfortable seating.  Very friendly staff. Restaurant server Travis is especially friendly and takes pride in his work. Great job! The hotel is undergoing a large renovation, but it is still definitely. Comfortable.

hotel_name: Residence Inn Indianapolis Downtown on the Canal
review_content: The residence Inn at Canal Street is a very nice hotel with direct access to the Kanau center located short walk to circle center nice amenities wonderful place to stayWhen searching Indy hotels for a two bedroom suite, you really don't have two many choices super close to downtown. Therefore, I was happy to find that this RI had both the layout and price we were looking for!It's a standard Residence Inn with clean rooms, solid (included in the price) breakfast, and nice location. Our two bed suite had a full kitchen, two bathrooms, two bedrooms and a decent sized living room. In my 2.5 year old's eyes, though, the best part was looking out her hotel room window and seeing the ducks and the fish swim in the canal below us! Parking was easy in, easy out and all the staff I encountered were pleasant and helpful. If I find another need for a 2 bedroom in Indy, I'd surely stay here again.I agree with the other reviewers that this hotel is a boon for the area. The canal is probably the best amenity. It is always busy with "tourists" and fitness minded coeds. The local kiddos seem to enjoy the ducks and the goldfishes which surface in droves when summoned with tender vittles. Similarly, the residents from across the canal also seem to surface when summoned by the Tinder coeds as they come jogging along the path in droves.I can honestly say the management go out of their way to accommodate while often adding a personal touch that even the category 6 hotels in town completely miss the paddle boat on. The accommodations are decent and fairly spacious especially given the price. The desk and is convenient to get some work done. However, on the negative side, the queen bed is to a bit small for a couple. As usual with the Residence Inn, you get all of the common amenities (fridge, dishwasher, microwave, cooktop, although no oven, so the local pizza delivery is your best option for baked goods, which is fine for me because burnt frozen pizza is my speciality).Update: Dinging one star for very bad internet. In this day and age there is no excuse for crappy Internet.We loved this hotel!  Fantastic location on the beautiful canal in downtown Indianapolis.  The service was excellent - Conner helped me (and several other guests) tremendously when I was trying to print some information.  He did this while at the same time helping several other people who were requesting his assistance, all without missing a beat and being extremely polite.The location is convenient to everything downtown - shopping, restaurants, Lucas Oil Stadium, and Victory Field to name a few.  The rooms were very comfortable and updated, and the hotel hosts a nice social with food and drinks Monday - Wednesday, and a decent breakfast every morning.  All is all a great place to stay in downtown!!Friendly,helpful staff ( especially Connor at the front desk). Loved the amenities as we had a fridge, kitchen, etc. great view of the canal- great location! Brought bikes to ride on the canal walk. Would stay again in a heartbeat!Very helpful, they switched my room for me and even remembered to bring my cell phone charger which I had left plugged in in the old room.They serve breakfast everyday. The rooms are big and the place is nice and quiet. Even when it is full of people I can't hear anyone in the adjacent rooms.Staff was friendly, and the location is great right on the canal. We sat outside on the patio off the lobby at sunset and it was beautiful. Breakfast was also good. Only downside was this hotel only offers queen size beds in all rooms, no king size beds.Kind employees, clean rooms, perfect location right off of the canal...I mean do you need more? Our room had a kitchen, bedroom with queen bed, and a pull out bed in the living room.  The pull out wasn't the comfiest, but when are they?  The breakfast was fine.  Scrambled eggs, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, sausage, baked goods, fresh waffles, french toast...the usual.  Since the room was a bit costly, I wish parking had come along with it.  I mean it is right in the city, so parking will cost you a pretty penny.Super nice hotel. They are almost like little apartments! They have a whole kitchen including silverware, dishwasher,  and fridge. It also have a living area detached from the bedroom. This hotel is right on the canal. Many of the rooms have views. The hotel has activites. I think on certain nights they have cookouts, etc. Mostly during the week. There is a pool and pool table downstairs. Nice common patios to sit out on. I recommend this hotel for a stay in Indianapolis.This place was my home base for four days when I visited Indianapolis for business.My single queen bed room was actually a mini-suite, complete with a little kitchen and living room area. The bed was comfy, the pillows were plentiful, and I even had a view of the canal. The staff were exceptionally friendly and not at all stuffy. A solid experience through and through.I took advantage of both the fitness room and the pool area during my stay, and both were small but definitely sufficient for my needs.There was always coffee out (very appreciated) and cookies served in the afternoon. A complimentary breakfast was laid out every morning.What's lacking from this place are the fineries. The little touches. There were no mints on the pillows, no treats or minibar in the room, no room service. In the lobby there's a small "market" with refrigerated foods and basic toiletry items, but the room itself is utilitarian.My one real complaint is at least one hallway smelled quite musty. If I'd been assigned a room off that hallway, I would have requested a room change.Residence Inn Indianapolis Downtown on the Canal probably won't blow your mind, but it will cover all your needs and provide a comfortable stay at a great location.Stayed here for a work event.  Parking you have to pay for otherwise the rating would be 5 stars. A great hotel with a exceptional staff. Victoria and Jeannie are amazing, and work to accommodate  your every need.Nothing fancy but a nice place with great service and free breakfast. Overall friendliness of staff and service makes this place a 5 starWas able to stay here at a very affordable rate on New Years Eve. Conveniently located only a few minutes from the busy downtown, it was a great way to enjoy the city without having to pay the high hotel costs. Alyssa at the main desk was very friendly and welcoming. We originally booked a floor with a city view,  but were pleasantly surprised to find they upgraded us to a room with a canal view, which is great to look at out the window. They had the usually amenities, and a decent free breakfast in the morning. The room was very spacious and clean, bigger than the typical hotel room. **a big plus** maybe it was just because it was New Year's, but upon checking in Alyssa told us that they were waiving the $19 parking fee for our stay. This was a great surprise and much appreciated. We would definitely stay here if we ever visited the city again. **Stay here and park in the Mall parking garage if you visit downtown. The garage is about 4 minutes away, and takes only minutes to walk to places downtown. We only paid $2 for 3 hours during dinner rather than the expensive $15 + fees for valet or other lots.I have to agree with other folks and reviews.   Being a person who has stayed in hotels over 70% of my time the past several months - little things annoy me - rude staff, room double booked (yes this happened to me recently with another chain), lack of amenities (coffee, tea, etc..) .  The front desk was very kind and accomodating.     I have never stayed in a Residences Inn and liked the Apartment feel - coupled with have a canal view made my stay enjoyable.Service - GreatAtmosphere - Okay - they are doing soem construction but no dings here for them trying to improve their facilitiesCost - medium but worth itI will stay here again.I was just reading some of the other reviews about this property, and noted that the friendliness/helpfulness of the staff was called out. I'm glad to see that, because that was also what stood out most about this property.  Every single person at the front desk throughout our stay went out of her way to be friendly and helpful. They gave us directions and advice on places to eat. One woman went out of her way to find us milk for our 2 year old. Another gave our son, exhausted from a day of walking the canals in the hot sun, a bottle of gatorade free.  Note: as general advice to other hoteliers -- the friendly and helpful staff make an incredible difference. I will always stay here in the future when I travel to Indy, and will always recommend this place to friends and colleagues. The location is amazing -- right on the canals. The lower level opens right on the canals.  The whole time we were there, we never even needed to exit at the street level. The property itself is typical Residence Inn -- kitchenette, two-room suite, etc. The rooms are fairly small, and the furnishings not terribly exciting -- but they were all very clean and adequate for our family of four. The breakfast was excellent (better than usual extended-stay hotel-quality), and we particularly enjoyed eating our breakfast on the patio overlooking the canals. They also have free light suppers during the week, which we weren't able to partake in.All in all, an excellent place to stay in downtown Indianapolis -- and thanks to the staff and management for being so welcoming!!Front desk staff were helpful the the location was excellent.This 3 star hotel far exceeded my expectations and provided even better than the majority of 4 star hotels that I've been to.  We checked in late past midnight and the lady working the night-shift was amazing.  She was super friendly, checked us all in promptly and got all of our requests promptly.  All room service requests were answered immediately.  Free breakfast, free in-room internet, free newspaper, free snacks/dinner on many days of the week.  Amazing.  The coffee was amazing, everything!  I'm definitely remembering this brand.Five stars for an amazing helpful staff that went way beyond expectations during my recent visit.  I'll be back next time I come through Indianapolis.This was a great place to stay.  First off, it's right on the canal - we got a room on the canal level, so the water was about 10 feet from our window - nice and beautiful, seeing the ducks go by every now and then.They provide a nice continental breakfast, with eggs, sausage, cereal, belgium waffles, fruit, juice, etc.  But I also need to give kudos to the staff.  There was a problem with our room - there was an occasional leak from the room above us above the counter in the bathroom, which caused some dripping.  Because of it, the manager gave us free taxi rides to get to and from the theater on Saturday night, which I thought was a good response.  (I'm sure they would have transferred us to another room if we asked, but we didn't want to bother with moving all of our stuff).Also, the staff were great in helping us to find a place to eat.  It was new year's day, and half the places were closed and the other half were booked, but the guy at the desk spent about half an hour calling places for us so we could have a reservation at a good restaurant somewhere.  You are within walking distance of the zoo, downtown, and within a long walk of the Murat theatre, so the location is great.  Being right on the canal was great for us as we love to run, so it gave us a great place to run without having to worry about traffic lights.The staff were wonderful, the location was ideal, and the breakfast was good.  I would definitely stay here again.I stayed here 3 or 4 times while my farther in law was in IU Hospital.  This is a real nice hotel,  Our hotel rooms were always very clean. The staff are great.  Its also within walking distance to downtown which is awesome.  I look forward to going here again soon
review_content_20: I'm a long time Marriott guy. This staff was great! They even do 3 free dinners a week.This place will always have a special place in my  heart.  I essentially lived here for a year, and found the place always clean, the staff always pleasant, and generally a class act all around. I try to make a point of staying here whenever I'm in Indy.  Real close to downtown too, at a nice location with a canal in back of it.

review_content: This hotel is located north-northeast of Indianapolis, about a 25-30 minute drive to downtown.Check in was easy, friendly front desk staff and extremely helpful and efficient.Rooms are not opulent, but they are clean, as are the bathrooms.Internet available, paid or free depending upon your room rate.There is a HUGE parking lot, and parking is free, always a very nice perk.There is a decent restaurant inside the hotel too (Bistro 33) if you get hungry and don't want to venture out. My food was actually pretty spectacular the evening I chose to dine.There are many, many, many, MANY restaurant choices available to you with just about every cuisine you could imagine within a 5-10 minute drive. Also there's lots of shopping available too.The good:Location is excellent, amid a slew of shopping and places to eat. Extremely courteous staff. Nice lobby and public spaces. Plentiful parking.Comfy bed.The mediocre:The rooms are in need of a makeover. I mean badly. Look, I'm not a snob, but the 90s decor hints that this hotel has not had an upgrade in a while. But the real tell was in the room itself. Wallpaper was coming off the walls at the seams. The place had a weird funk about it. And the bathroom sink and tile was cracked, and obviously so for some time. Hey, I'm not saying the room looked like the aftermath of a stay by The Who, but a property of this caliber should be more up to date in its interiors. One more thing. The typical price gouging on WiFi. Once you ponied up for it, it works well. But $9 a day is just obscene, especially when the Hampton Inns of the world give it to you for free.
