So the more you spend for a hotel room, the more likely they're going to charge you for WiFi. Will the hotel management gurus of the world explain to this weird approach to pricing? I'd really like to know. You'd think the business travelers of the world would rise up as one and demand better treatment, rather than shrug their shoulders and expense it.Really OLD, not like a typical Marriott.  Guest rooms are right out of 1988.  I arrived and my tv wasn't working in the room.  Had to move rooms.  Old beds hurt my back which no bed has ever done before. Cracks all over the popcorn ceilings. Overall just a bad stay in a very outdated hotel.  Don't let the lobby fool you.  I love Marriott but will never stay here again.Very average experience overall during my recent stay.  My company has a negotiated rate with this hotel, typical procedure is to mention the rate at check-in, provide proof that you work for my company and you receive the negotiated rate.I mentioned the rate during check-in and was told it was not available since there were conventions and events in town.  Wait...what?  I was then told that they had rooms available for $269.00 per night, so the rate I had booked at ($179.00) was actually a very good deal since there were very few hotel rooms open in Indianapolis.Okay....but what about the negotiated rate I am supposed to get?  I spoke with the manager and he informed me that no, I would not be receiving a locally negotiated rate.  Whenever the hotel is experiencing high occupancy, they don't honor negotiated rates.  So it sounds like they charge inflated rates whenever there are events in town and that's that.  I know that sort of thing goes on all of the time, but it seems ridiculous.Once I got online, I checked Marriott's web site and it showed rooms available at the JW downtown for $237.00 per night...so I guess the $269.00 rate at the Marriott North wasn't actually a very good rate at all.The door knob on my room was broken. The door still closed properly, but you had to adjust the knob to get the door to unlock.  The towels and toiletries provided are on par with a Marriott Courtyard property, not a higher end Marriott property.My room was clean, the bed was comfortable and it was pretty much a typical one night hotel stay.  But the issue about the room rate was a bit irritating.Located near Keystone at the Crossing. Popular location for conferences. Food served at event is some of the better food I've had through hotel catering. The decor could not use a little updating. Conveniently located to shopping and entertainment venues. If you're an independent movie fan very close to Keystone Arts Cinema.Excellent staff but the facilities are very outdated.  I requested a room change because the tile in my bathroom was broken and rather gross.  Also, the exercise facility is terrible - a small room with a handful of treadmills and some free weights.  I've stayed at much nicer marriott's in the past.  But, again, excellent staff.I made reservation days ago for 2 queen beds, late check in etc. we arrive late and get our room only to walk in and find one queen bed for a family of 5. Back down to lobby and they offer a rollaway bed!?! Seriously look at the reservation! Just because you overbooked I get screwed!?!? Nice business Marriott! It will be my last visit - just stayed in Times Sq and booked a night in Chicago that I will now cancel.We stay at the Marriott @ Keystone @ the Crossing every month when we travel to Indy for business. You stay at this hotel for the incredible staff #1 and the location #2. From the hotel manager to the concierge, housekeeping crew to the hostess, manager and chef at the restaurant - they all stand out (every stay) as friendly, caring, responsive & professional. The facility itself, is tired, but the caliber of staff and level of service more than compensate. Thank you Keystone Marriott staff for always taking great care of us! PS rooms are quiet and very clean, beds are super comfortable, and the coffee, omelette bar & breakfast buffet are excellent.Great location near shopping and restaurants.  Staff is very accommodating and there are 2-4 smiles to greet you in the lobby at all times.  The lobby is staffed so that if you are entering the hotel, coming down from the rooms, or coming back from the conference rooms, someone is always there to say good morning, good afternoon, good night, or have a nice day!  So many pleasant staff members.  The food served at the many meetings I have attended has always been above and beyond what I expected.  The rooms are modern with current technology and very spacious.  The beds are super comfortable and will make you want to stay forever.Great hotel, great staff, I will be back!My husband and I, along with our two small children, stayed at this hotel over the Labor Day weekend. In town for a family wedding, we extended our stay to enjoy the long weekend. Our experience at the hotel itself was pleasant and comfortable.Unfortunately, BED BUGS came home with us. Nightmare. Our lives have been turned upside down trying to rid our stuff and home of these nasty little bugs. Kids covered in bites, furniture ruined... it is awful. We believe that we got them from this hotel. There are more than two bed bug registries that make claims of bed bugs at this hotel.The concerning thing is that after multiple conversations with staff members, managers and their claims department, Marriott argues that since there haven't been other reports of bed bugs in the hotel, we can't prove anything and they are unable to help with the replacement of our stuff or the reimbursement of our stay. Heads up... this was our experience and continues to be an issue in our home. We are frustrated.Having stayed in many a Marriott, this one is par for the course. Clean rooms, exceedingly friendly staff, and nice view.The problem is that you pay for the nice view with it being isolated from a lot of things. You do have a 10 minute walk to the mall nearby and outside of that, the other side of the hotel faces the highway which is not much to look at.The property is also a bit old - it's not the JW Marriott downtown, but you're also having to consider that you can find a good deal at this property and still be within 20 minutes of driving for most locations in Indy.This Marriott really surpassed my expectations.  The entrance with it's marble flooring was impressive, but the view of the lake in  background took it over the top.  The staff is dedicated to providing every guest with the finest personal services possible.  Everyone makes you feel at home. My room was extra large with a floor to ceiling widow with a view of the lake.  The bathroom was all marble and large as well, but what I loved the most was the bed or should I say mattress.  The  pillows were unbelievable comfortable and the mattress was the perfect feeling of soft with a hard feeling.  Actually, we did a lot of walking and bike riding and I found myself looking forward to getting a good night sleep.  I am looking into buying the mattress for my home.One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff here went above and beyond and were so helpful. I arrived here on a disaster business trip including lost luggage, botched hotel reservations at another hotel, you name it. In passing I told the front desk clerk how terrible my day had been. Later that evening, the front desk clerk called and said she knew I had a long day and offered me a complimentary glass of wine or dessert. I've never had a hotel do that!The beds were so comfortable, the bar and restaurant were great. Within a comfortable walking distance to the fashion mall. I would come back to Indy just to stay here!One of the best business hotels I've stayed at. The room is huge. They have a table you can use, they have fast internet connection and its just perfect for business travel. They provide a nice TV with almost all the channels you would usually want. This probably the biggest single bed room I've ever seen of all the Marriott's. They have a fitness center, swimming pool and a Jacuzzi. The property is at a very nice location right by the lake. The view out of the window is pretty good from the 5th floor. The service is amazing and everybody at the reception are very professional the way the handle things.My most recent visit was for a meeting, but I think I did stay here before. The property is located on a large pond, and some rooms have a nice view. I remember that my room had a view of the water, and I think I even had a small terrace. I do have good recollections of my stays and visits here. It's located in the Keystone Crossings area, near the Fashion Mall and not far from Castleton Square Mall. There is a TON of shopping and dining options nearby. This hotel is located in a hotel/office complex next to the mall, and the area is safe. Recommended.The room was very outdated--looked like it hadn't been remodeled since the early 1980s. Despite that, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. However, the HVAC was not working properly--I called maintenance and they sent someone who re-started the system, but I still could not get the temperature in the room to match the thermostat. Little tip on the in-room coffee maker: it looks like there is a part missing, but the tray for the coffee pod is actually disposable and comes in the coffee package. The hotel staff was very responsive and courteous throughout my stay, which makes this review 3 stars vs. 2 (the hotel itself only merits 2 stars for the condition for the relatively high price paid). When I checked out, I mentioned the problems I had with the heat in the room and the front desk person showed appropriate concern and said she would put some extra reward points in my account (which she did). Other notes: parking is free, internet is $9.99/day, and the proximity to shopping at Keystone Mall is great.Our rate wasn't too pricey compared to other hotels of this caliber: $129/per night, per room over Labor Day weekend.  We got a few perks which definitely made the stay a little nicer, starting with a high floor room with a balcony overlooking a large, pristine man-made lake.  The hotel's proximity to the nearby fashion mall, "Keystone at the Crossing" is a bonus.The hotel itself is attractive on the inside but won't win any style awards from architecture magazines.  Typical early 1990s style brass and granite interiors.My room (#813) was nice.  No noticeably worn furniture or wall coverings.  I could have used an additional power outlet near the desk, but I simply unplugged the coffee pot to add my laptop.  The bed linens were simple, clean and attractive.  AH, THE BED.  In a word: the best hotel bed I've ever had.  It was one of those iComfort foam beds.  Wonderful.  They even have a large brochure for purchasing the actual bed linens, pillows, bathroom accessories and mattresses.The bathroom was clean and efficient.  The designer shower head was a nice touch, as were the Aromatherapy brand toiletries and soaps.  Then again, for a hotel like this, anything less would be a letdown.The breakfast buffet was decent: waffles and omelets made to order, cereals, fresh fruit, hot tray items like eggs Benedict and bacon, etc.The pool and workout areas are very nice; the pool is much larger than you'd expect for a corporate hotel, though it's not a lap pool nor deep enough (3 ft-4 ft) to allow for any real swimming.  The hot tub was...well, HOT.  The workout room has a range of good equipment: LifeFitness brand machines--treadmills, ellipticals, rowing machine, etc.  There are also containers of water in the fridge and a fruit bowl available.The staff was fine.  Shoutouts to Margie Kay and Derrick for the humor and perks.Service was great; quick check in, very friendly bartender, etc. I've got to knock this place because it is so dated. Def not up to par with other Marriott hotels I stay at. First, let's start with the bathrooms. These seem as if they've never been updated since this place was built. From the floors, to the counters, to the wallpaper in there.. Ugh. They don't use those newer shower curtains that easily snap on and off so they can clean them. Mine had hairs and some other questionable "stuff." Gross... The rest of the room... The carpet must have been replaced and the beds are your typical Marriott beds. However, the TV's seem awfully small for a Marriott. Yes they're flat screens but really small. Oddly, my hallway smelled really bad. If I had to make a guess.. The owner of this property doesn't give Marriott much to work with in terms of capital for remodeling the rooms.Pluses: big rooms, friendly staff. Negatives: NOT kid friendly. Very noisey hallways, ice machine empty, horrible music blasting from "a restaurant across the lake". No free wifi or fridge in the room. Considering it's $$$ to stay this really surprised me.  Meh. I'll stick with Holiday Inn.I am a big fan of Marriott. You know you will be taken care of at any of their locations.  From the time you walk in until you leave, you will be welcome. The beds at this hotel are perfect and its very clean. The location is on the North side. For me it works out great. Lots of nice places to eat right around the corner. Its perfect.
review_content_20: I've stayed at this hotel a couple of times for my company Christmas party.  The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.I've also been to a couple of buisiness conferences here.  The catering is always good!One issue was with vehicle theft.  Several cars were broken in to at one of our Christmas parties.  Never leave anything in plane site and you shouldn't have a problem.I stayed at this hotel last week for a business conference.  When I woke up after the first night I had 5 bug bites on me and found one (alive) in my bed.  I packed and went down to the front desk for a different room.  they placed me on the same floor and that room also had a bug of some kind (small) so I did not unpack.  I promptly when down and checked out of the hotel.  My associate also check his room and his bed had several bugs also.  Hotel staff hurried and changed all the bed linens before they had a supposed exterminator inspect the room.  Hotel management said they found no bugs.  I was under the impression from staff that I would not be charged but I checked today and was charged for the room.  I called the hotel again and they stated that since they did not find the bugs that I would be charged.  After on the same evening the hotel attempted to put another conference attendee into the same room I was in.For the price, this was fantastic.  Great people, awesome service, comfy beds, quiet rooms.  Arrived late after room service was shut down - the desk clerk got me a snack to take up to my room.I'll be staying there every trip to Indy.One of my favorite business hotels. Very comfortable beds, exceptional service. Elevators are awesome. There is always at least one waiting on the lobby floor, with maw open in expectation.  Why don't all elevators work this way?Yeah, the hotel is a little tired stylistically and architecturally but it is very clean and well maintained. Wifi is slow.  But this is clearly a five star hotel when compared with others of like kind and quality.Great place for out of town wedding guests.  The lobby is gorgeous and seems more like something you'd find in Florida than suburban Indiana.  The proximity to the mall helps for anything you forgot at home, or just to kill sometime.The rooms are typical Marriott quality: nice, clean, comfortable but not necessarily memorable.We had a tuxedo get left in a room that caused some drama.  The staff picked it up, thankfully, but lost it inside the "lost & found" closet (go figure) so it took an extra day and a little bit of nervousness before it was returned safely to Mens Wearhouse.The Marriott is a little pricey, so I would recommend offering another less expensive option for guests on a tight budget.  There are plenty nearby.My wife and I stayed here on or first anniversary. While checking in I happened to mention that fact when I asked about any special rooms they might have, with a jacuzzi or something like that. The friendly clerk at the desk said they didn't have anything like that, but he did put us in a room with a balcony.Later that night, at about seven, there was a knock on the door. The gentleman had a tray with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, " compliments of the house". Quite a nice surprise.Our stay was wonderful, and if we stay in Indianapolis again, we'll be staying here!I love this place!  I first stayed here for a conference, and was astonished by how smoothly the staff made the whole conference go.  During intermissions of conference sessions the staff were very accommodating in providing ringing soft bells when it was time for the next session to begin.  The staff also let us know when the lunch selections that we had chosen for the buffet luncheon would not "hold" for the last of the attendees, they upgraded the food choices at no cost.  The staff are truly wonderful!The rooms are quiet, clean, and spacious.  The beds are heavenly soft.  Great location!  Moments from great shops and dining.  Anytime I need to stay in Indy I stay here.I'm gold, so perhaps got special treatment. Very warm reception. Got upgraded. Room too cold. Lounge is very good.I stay in many Marriott's and this is rated in the top 3. Wow great place and the staff is secon to none. I would give an bonus 5 more stars if I could.This hotel should get 6 stars.  I was here in business.  I generally don't sleep well at hotels.  But the beds were out of this world comfortable.  But the best part is the awesome service.  I know they have won an award for best Marriott in 2009 and I can see why.I was down having breakfast and one of the managers asks me how my stay is... point number 1.  Then we just start talking and he asks me what room I am in.   I tell him everything is fine and please don't do anything special for me.  But... I come home from meetings and there on the bed is a tray with an ice bucket filled with 2 beers and a personal note from Brian the manager.  I am so touched that he remembered me and took this extra step.The entire stay was like this, I felt like I was staying in a 5-star resort.  I just can't say enough good things about this hotel and I believe your stay will be great too.My in-laws gave us a gift certificate for a free night at the Marriott.  We stayed there one night during our last trip.  We were upgraded to a slightly larger room.  We had a view of the lake and Saks.  The room itself was nice.  The bed was uber comfortable.  The bathroom was good too (great shower, spacious).  The work-out facilities had much to be desired.  It was pretty bad.We had an enjoyable breakfast.  It was a buffet of typical breakfast foods.  The service was outstanding.  We also had outstanding service the night prior at the bar.I loved staying here. Quiet, peaceful and just pretty. Great shopping nearby and good eateries. We stayed here for MOTOGP this past weekend! Great breakfast buffet and just great bed for a good nights sleep.Friendly accommodating staff, clean rooms and free parking. What else do you need?Nice place, great heated indoor pool, good food, fast room service and nice view of lake.Clean, nice location, affordable, good customer serviceI must say that I was very impressed with the Marriott North at Keystone Crossing.  The hotel is extremely nice and very well maintained.  The staff is so helpful and always had a smile on their face.  I was here for a wedding and it was gorgeous out on the terrace and I would definitely stay here again when I'm in Indianapolis.  And it's very close to Keystone Shopping Center which is a definite bonus in my book!

review_content: I travel a lot for work and spend over 100 nights a year in hotels. I switched this year from Marriott to Hyatt.  While a full-service hotel is always nice, and full service  Hyatts have great fitness centers.  However, I have fallen for Hyatt Places lately based on cost and amenities. This is my fourth time at the Keystone Crossing Hyatt Place.  It is the only one in the country that offers cookie crumbles at night!!!  Lots of great things here - near great shopping, good chain restaurants, one of the best free breakfasts a hotel has to offer, a clean work out room (no weights, but cardio), large comfortable rooms with refrigerators.  I have not noticed the freeway noise that others mention, but most hotels seem to have that problem because of convenient locations.Overall this is a nice hotel and the prices are affordable. Issues I had were specific to me. Ice maker on 4th floor didn't work, spent 3 nights here and not once was my room cleaned. In fact the last night there I went to front desk to ask for more bath towels, I told the staff at front desk that I needed new towels because my room wasn't cleaned again and the staff never apologized or asked why. Breakfast was OK, first day the scrambled eggs were burnt, to the point the color of them were yellow and brown, how do you not notice that?Just stayed there this weekend. Only One elevator worked. Hall carpets dirty. Have stayed there numerous times in last few years. Going down hill. Was going to have meeting there in October taking 40 rooms but now looking elsewhere.All of my hotel stays prior to my check in at this Hyatt Place have been non-work related, however this time, I have been sent to town for job training. I'm used to a certain comfort when returning home to my personal space, after work, but wasn't sure what to expect here. A proper greeting is always among the first ways to make a guest feel welcomed. I felt welcomed within seconds of walking through the doors. Trays stacked with chunks of cookies baked in-house, sat atop the front desk. Smiles and a bit of humor completed my prompt check-in. Yep, I had a feeling my stay here would be a good one. After taking my luggage to my room, I didn't waste any time making my way to the mall, just a short walk across from the hotel. Various restaurants and shops are in walking distance or just a short drive away. It's very easy to get familiar with the general area. From downtown Indianapolis, to the areas of Broad Ripple and the Carmel Arts and Design District, I enjoyed several breweries, sports bars, county parks and the popular Monon Greenway. The staff was very helpful at recommending places to go and things to do. I actually spent time, every evening at  the bar or lobby. The consistent acknowledgement day after day and willingness to engage in conversation made me feel like a welcomed friend, not someone just passing through. Yes. My room was clean and bed comfortable. Yes. Breakfast was good. Overall, I like the hotel. My experience was made above average, because some staff members were able to establish a rapport with me and remain professional. I want to especially acknowledge Brittany, James, Detra, and Jasmine for their excellence in customer service. They are the stars in this review:)My family and I stayed here on Butler University's family weekend. Five of us shared a suite with two queen beds and a pull out sofa for two nights. The room and bathroom was clean and modern. It was a bit crowded for the five of us, with limited bathroom sink space. With us all being girls, we had to resort to other mirrors on the desk and on the closet doors to do our make up. The living area with the pull out coach was nice, but there was a wall separating that from the bedroom area that seemed more of a nuisance than a benefit.The TV was placed right across from that wall, making it hard for everyone in the room to see it at one time. The pull out coach was surprisingly comfortable, as I got a wonderful nights sleep both nights. However, there was some sort of red spot on one of the bed spreads that was kind of concerning. I went down to the lobby around 9 o'clock at night to get some coffee for my mom and I and the service was extremely pleasant. The attendant even went searching for more of my favorite flavor of cream. I wasn't there for check in but my sisters told me that there were fresh baked goods served upon arrival that were delicious. The location was perfect! It was not a far drive from Butler, and conveniently located right behind the Keystone Fashion Mall. It would be the perfect hotel for a shopping getaway. My family and I did not take advantage of the continental breakfast, but considering the baked goods and quality service, I'm sure it was decent.Have had no internet all week. Called and mentioned this to the front desk. My computer notification said that the problem was on the router end. They tried to give some suggestions ...nothing worked. They never did check back with me to see if I was successful in connecting. I can connect everywhere else so I am very confident it is not my computer.Great experience here. Clean room, pleasant staff. Like the couch separate from the beds. Good breakfast. Convenient location.I have stayed here multiple times for business. The staff is always friendly and accommodating no matter what time I check in. The rooms are spacious and clean. You may even find a treat in your room if you're the lucky guest (cookies!) Yup! I'm talking about those cookies they put out at night.. Every morning you will find the newspaper waiting for you in front of your door and the hotel offers free breakfast. And it's not just bagels.I did stay for business purpose and I was very please with the room and the friendly staff. The room I took was huge and very clean. They also offer Starbucks brewed coffee, it doesn't get it better then that. The location is great with all the surrounding stores and top restaurants. I will stay there again.We recently stayed at the Hyatt Place and were blown away. Not only was it very clean and spacious room, the staff was amazing. I had plenty of room to work and relax in my room. I ordered a flatbread for a late dinner that was delicious and we loved the complimentary breakfast and capuchino.It's been a while since I've experienced superb hospitality. Steve Bart is a prime example of what hospitality  should be! He was friendly, informative and made us feel like a VIP guest. He went above and beyond our expectations!   Overall this was one of the best hotel experiences we ever had!Nice place, clean, convenient, cookies in the eveningStayed here for a business trip for 3 nights and definitely enjoyed my stay.  They have a 24/7 menu that is very convenient for late nights and long hours of work. The room has a separate living room/study room which kind of makes your room like a big suite. The bathroom is clean, the water pressure is fine and the bed is comfortable. The only thing I do not like is that it is close to the freeway so you can hear the freeway noise. Next time , I'm going to ask for a room not facing the freeway.  Also like the location because it is very close to keystone fashion mall. Will definitely stay here again.Nice, clean, spacious rooms. All the employees were super nice and helpful. They would even offer coloring books and crayons to occupy our kids. I'd definitely stay there again.Hey it's not bad. I like Hyatt Place hotels but this one... It's right off the freeway and there is nothing they can do about that. It's noisy if you're trying to get some solid sleep. Service great, breakfast good, cookie crumbles they put out at night... AMAZINGIt's just their location and the noise. Not much they can do about it aside from moving the entire hotel. Oh... and when I checked in all of the trash cans were on the table tops (desk, bathroom counter, etc)... That was odd..This is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. They've thought of everything here. Great breakfast great service great lobby bar you name it they got it stay here!!!!I stayed here for a couple of nights while I was in the area for work. It was a good stay. Clean, spacious room, comfy bed, nice free breakfast, good-quality free WiFi. The highlight for me was on the afternoon of my second day. I was walking down the hall to my room when a hotel employee pushing a cart came by in the opposite direction. The cart had a bunch of plates of cookies on it. She offered me some. Taken aback, I declined. When I came back out of the room a minute later she was still in the area and repeated the offer. "You're just trying to get rid of these cookies?" "Yeah, pretty much." Well, okay then! They were good, too.I'd stay here again if I were coming to the area.Off to a bad start with the extremely rude person at the front desk.  Plus, with their stupid wifi you have to re-login every single day.  This is a big pain as far as I'm concerned.   Why not make the login last throughout someone's stay instead of making it a pain for your guests?Hopefully, this will improve, as I'm here for 4 days...I've been to a couple hyatt place, and most of them were pretty good, yet i felt quite disappointed @ this one @ indianapolis.  the staff were okay, 1 of them were quite nice, the other one didn't look at us at all and she was the one serving us.  the room was neat as the other ones.  we stayed for 3 nites, they didn't come clean up our room at all on one of the day, didn't change the towel at all; and one of the day, they didn't have water for a few hours without notifying the guests ahead of time.  Their TV channels are fewer than other hyatt place hotels.  1 plus is they had pretty good cookies at night by the front desk for guests.Nice friendly staff and nice clean decent size rooms with a large flat screen (LCD or Plasma- I do not know). Most hotels offer the same for the price, so nothing unusual or stand out here. The one big negative is the lack of drawer storage. There is one deep drawer by the sink and one for toiletries and that's it. On a  3 day business trip there is no place to put underwear, t-shirts, shorts, socks or put electronics out of sight other than in your baggage. TV channels were not all operational and MNF on ESPN was blurry with horizontal/.vertical lines intermittently. Daily  WiFi log in is an inexcusable inconvenience. There is no need for this kind of stupidity in logging in for WiFi. Probably will not stay here again which is a shame because it is a nice location, close to the mall and some great local and chain dining.Can't complain. It's a great hotel for business travelers, with a nice breakfast in the a.m. A little too close to the highway.
review_content_20: Nice large modern room with a giant TV, free wifi, free breakfast. A little close to the highway but otherwise a great place to stay. Recommended.We stay in Hyatt Places whenever possible, and this one did not disappoint.  Although we were only there one night (and we skipped breakfast), the room was clean and quiet, the bed was comfortable, free wi-fi.  Front desk staff was very friendly.  Good location, as well.Always feel weird when I stay at a hotel in my city, but it was New Year's Eve and we thought we'd make a night of it.  Thing is, we ended up not going out at all!  How boring, right?Well, once we walked in and saw how big the bed, living room area+couch and tv were, we decided to order some pizza and treat ourselves to Nick and Norah's Infinite Playlist on pay-per-view.  I agree that the bathroom is really tiny and could be a problem for a family, but it makes up for it with a vanity outside the bathroom and another mirrored area in the 'office' space so there is plenty of room to get ready...and who needs that much space to use a toilet anyway? I mean, if you're stretching out on the john, you might want to visit the local prompt care for a thorough exam. The tv is enormous, the bed was pretty sweet, but how often do you get a full living room in a hotel for $80/night?The room was clean and fairly modern.  But, the bathroom was miniscule!  Not to mention, the place is being remodeled and the lobby is in a complete mess.  Further, the construction began at 7 a.m. on a SATURDAY!!   I prefer the Marriott which is in the same area...and the price difference is not that great!Nice rooms with BIG flat screen television; The hotel was remodel nicely, but some older parts still show as the doors and wall switches and outlets. All and all I like the place and it cost to restaurants and coffee.Better than anything else at the price. The free internet was good, especially the upload. Your mileage may vary.This hotel is situated directly on a freeway. Unless you're in a room facing the main parking lot, you can expect to hear trucks pass through your room all night.  The breakfasts were very poor, and the service at the front desk not much better.

review_content: Probably the best location among the city to stay. Staff was amazing, room was awesome, and the free beer before the game was ice cold. I was very overwhelmed by how great this hotel was. I will definitely be back this fall to catch a Colts game. Indy you rock!!This Homewood Suites by Hilton is conveniently located in downtown Indy and is within walking distance (in warm weather) to Lucas Oil Stadium, Circle Center Mall and BankersLife Fieldhouse. This hotel is also next door to several bars and Kilroy's - you have to go there for the breadsticks - YUM!We arrived mid afternoon to check in before heading over to Lucas Oil Stadium for a company party.  We were immediately greeted by the valet when we pulled up in front of the hotel.  The valet's were very friendly ans asked if we needed help with our bags. They opened the doors to the hotel and explained that the inside vestibule would be closed and locked after hours and we would need our key to re-enter. The lobby is large and welcoming. I loved the high ceilings all throughout the hotel. There is a business center, billiards lounge and restaurant all located right off lobby. The billiards lounge is a first come/first serve lounge, but it is only open until 11pm...which was a bummer (apparently there is a guest room that backs up to it). However, it would be great if this was open later just to get away from all the chaos on street and in the bars - just a quiet place to come back and chill and shoot some pool. We were quickly greeted by Tahsa at the front desk who checked us in and added my Hilton Honors # to the reservation.  We grabbed our keys then headed to our rooms. The rooms are spacious and designed very well.When you enter the room you walk into a full kitchen and living room/sitting area, then you have a hallway to the bathroom and bedroom.  The decor is very modern and clean. The sofa was a little hard, but other than that it was very nice - but let's face it who is there to sit on a sofa for that long anyway!  We had a 2 queen bed suite. The beds were comfy and had lots of pillows on each bed. The bathroom is pretty large as well. The only two things I noticed about the bathroom was that the shower head was extremely high on the wall - I'm like 5'7" and could barely touch it to move it around and there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom, so when the door was shut it got all steamy from the shower.We had a inside facing room, so our room was very quiet. A co-worker of mine had a room that faced the street and she said it was loud and she could hear the activity from the street most of the night.They offer a free breakfast in the morning (right off the lobby) or there are plenty of local restaurants in the area you can take advantage of. The valet is $27 a day (in and out as many times as you need) but don't forget to tip when you get your car each time.Overall a great hotel and would stay here again in the future.Stayed here one night last weekend for a night away. Great location, close to lots of shopping and restaurants, and really cool interior, especially for the price! Only complaint is that the pool was closed for maintenance and I was looking forward to swimming, but no big deal, especially as it was a short trip anyway. Big rooms with full kitchens and cool exposed brick and wooden beams, tall ceilings. Would definitely stay here again!Great rooms, very nice.  Would be 5 stars but our hot water went out during showers on the 29th.  Hilton Honors made it right though.  Great location.  Go!My SO and I travelled from Nashville to see the Pacers game and booked a room here for the night. We chose the room because it was the perfect location being a 2 minute walk to the Fieldhouse for the game. And it seemed to be in the middle of everything--restaurants, bars, shops, etc. We pulled up in front and immediately the valet comes out and takes care of us. The entire staff was very accommodating and friendly. When we realized we had left our tickets in our car they hustled to run and bring them to us.The room was absolutely gorgeous. I've been in a lot of hotels before. Rooms generally look very generic. Always the same. This room was the exception. The exposed brick and wooden beams were stunning. It was also very roomy--king sized bed and seating area with large bathroom and kitchen areas. I joked that I wished my house looked like this. If we are ever back in Indy (probably will be since the man is such a huge Pacers' fan) we will definitely stay here. You can't beat the location or the price.Great staff!  Every single person I encountered staying there for the last 3 nights was great including front desk staff, valet, happy hour/breakfast folks.  They all went out of their way to give me directions, dropped off fresh towels without asking, refresh the coffee etc.Easy walk to the convention center 2ish blocks and you can take a long cut through the Omni if you want to stay inside for 1 of those blocks.  Otherwise, the room was comfy.  And since I always wonder: HDMI and VGA inputs to the TV (hope that helps the geek in you).One of the best hotels we have stayed at on Indianapolis.  Walking distance to just about everything.  The rooms are HUGE!!  So much character in each room as well - from the original buck walls to the wooden beams.  Each suite has a full refrigerator, stove top, microwave, and sink/garbage disposal.  The beds were quite comfortable and the pull out wasn't too bad, either.  Just a couple of downsides - there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom and the elevators are very slow.  There are actually 2 elevators - one off of the lobby and the other at the back (this one only goes to the 4th floor).    The breakfast was fantastic - scrambled eggs, muffins, yogurt, sausage/biscuits/gravy, juices, coffee, hot tea, waffles (chocolate chip AND plain- nice!!), oatmeal, toast, etc.  nice way to start the day.  All of the parking for the hotel is valet ($27/night).  You send a text when you need your car (there is in & out privileges).  It takes about 5 minutes from the time you text.  This is definitely going to be our "go to" hotel when we visit Indy from now on.See picture for where you don't want a room. The patrons of the Revel make it sound like there's a frat party after 11Pm. Not cool if you are here on corporate travel. Fortunately there are three other members of my group that don't have to put up with the noise.....the bonus is you can hear people wretching in the alley if they imbibed on  too many libations from the Revel. Makes me want to drop a piano, safe, anvil, or other cartoon weapon on them.Beautiful hotel. Horrible customer service. Never received my wake up calls. Was told 5 different things about price of shuttle to airport. Was brushed off when I asked about the smell of gas in the hotel and then lied to about room ready for check in.The management is inconsiderate of life changes, and especially emergencies.  A refund would not be applied regardless of the situation (under 24 hrs).  I would recommend IHG for any future hotel use.  The folks running this place do not care.It was a little bit of a shock to find out that parking was valet only and almost $30 a night, but everyone was really friendly and they got the car very quickly so it was acceptable considering the downtown location. The room was very spacious and clean, albeit a little dark. The bed was very comfortable and it seemed much fancier than the price tag due to the high ceilings and apartment style layout. You cannot hear noises from other rooms, but can hear hallway noise quite clearly.However, I also experienced the mysterious sewage smell so I don't know what the deal is with that. Also received some stained towels but everything else was very clean.I would definitely stay here again because of how comfortable and convenient it is.Stayed here Sunday night January 4 2015 and it was crazy busy. We were four blocks from,Lucas oil stadium and the colts playoffs were today. We arrived early and as hilton diamond they were able to accommodate an early checkin. The room was two queens and had a nice full kitchen living room and two TVs. The view wasn't nice but heck they were able to get us in right away and the room itself was very nice, we were able to park the car with valet and they were swamped. Ricky smiled and we left the car,      We were able to walk to the game which was awesome and ordered kilroys after as we watched the second game in our room, enjoyed the visit, the breakfast was just ok. Used gym which was tiny but edifice to I liked this property overall.In town for a trade show at the convention center.  Good location, nice hotel, with the exception of the front elevator.  That being said, we had a large group with direct bill.  Upon check in, a credit card is used for incidentals as normal.  Instead of a pending charge for incidentals, my credit card was billed for 3 nights room and tax. Plus $40 per day for incidentals.  Then another charge! Thanks to an email from the cc company, I was immediately aware, and contacted the front desk.  Credits appeared to offset the charges.  All seems good.  About 2 hours later another email from the cc company, it was put back on!  I went to the desk and the young lady became very defensive, saying she didn't do it I should call the cc company.  I still don't know what I was supposed to tell them, as the hotel initiated the charges.Next morning(Saturday), the young man at the desk said no manager was in, but the guest services manager would be in later and he gave me her number.  He also told me he would speak to her about the problem.  I left her 3 voicemails, and never received a call.  Sunday am advised same fellow at the front desk, who apologized for the inaction on her part.  So as it stands, I have a nearly $1200 hold on a credit card for charges that are not to even be billed to it!  Our group has many rooms here this week, and usually stay here twice a year.  I am in contact with our planners about future stays in Indy.Beautiful hotel with an awesome location. The prices are fair as well. Booked a room for a night for a stay-cation and was super impressed by the friendliness of the staff and size of the room for the price. We had a full kitchen along with living area in addition to a decent sized bedroom. Everything was very clean and well-stocked. The only downside was the lack of windows/view. At night it seemed like we had absolutely no view because all light is blocked from the interior window and during daylight all you get is a weird view of some industrial courtyard. Pros outweigh the cons but be cautious when expecting a certain view!! Also keep in mind that you need to be 21 to check into this hotelThis was my first time at this hotel and it was fabulous!  When I first pulled up the valet parking staff were speedy and extremely courteous.  They explained the text-to-pick-up process, opened the door for me, and even offered me a bottle of water!  Once inside at the registration desk I immediately felt at home.  The attendant was very friendly and the furniture and ambiance of the hotel was just cozy!  I had a problem with my reservation when I tried to check in because of something on my employers part.  Kristin (at the desk) was so pleasant and patient.  She waited while I talked to my job and even let my husband go ahead and go up to the room since he had his hands full.  She offered me a cookie while we waited and even offered to call my booking agent directly.  It was resolved soon and Kristin never lost her cool demeanor.  When I got to the room I was so happy!  The ceilings were tall, the place was very clean, and the bed/couch was so comfortable.  The kitchenette even had dishes, pots/pans, silverware, and a working fridge :) I immediately wished I was staying more than one night.  I also was happy to find out M-Th they offer FREE buffet dinner!  Later I left to attend a work function and was wished well out the door and greeted BY NAME when I returned.  They also have a restaraunt next door that will deliver to your room! The only complaint I have about this hotel was the free breakfast and coffee.  The breakfast was disappointed and the coffee was cold.  I am giving them a break on it because I did come down at the end of the breakfast time. Although 2 different containers of coffee were very cold and even tasted like they were left over.  The "oatmeal bar" I was excited about consisted of oatmeal packets, water, and a microwave.  I don't eat meat and the eggs also had meat in them so my options were limited.  Because of this I gave them 4/5 stars.Regardless of the breakfast scenario I was very pleased with my stay and recommend it to anyone - especially if you are in need of a suite/kitchenette style room.Impressed! Nice rooms, comfy beds, pillows. Unlike other hotels the sheets and pillows didn't smell like bleach (or washed with strong chemicals). Quite location, close to a lot of businesses, restaurants and 10 mins from airport. Beautiful cafe area in lobby, nice breakfast, free drinks, good coffee and good service.I was in town for a convention and found this hotel a couple of blocks away from the convention center for a reasonable price.  It looks like it used to be an old warehouse as the room that I stayed in had an elevated ceiling as did the lobby.  The staff were all very friendly and accommodating.  When I called to inquire about the distance to the convention center, the person on the phone gave me good descriptive details about the area.  He also helped arrange the booking so I didn't have to do it later online.  When I arrived, the room I was given faced an ally.  I called the front desk and they were able to give me another room facing the sun and the front of the hotel!  Big difference.  The daily free hot breakfast was great the first day, but not so great the next.  On the second day, they served some sort of chicken filet in a biscuit.  It would have been ok, except the biscuit was really hard.  I think it was just a question of it sitting in the heating tray for quite a while.  Not the fault of the staff, but maybe just a fault of the choice of meal items.  The beds are super comfy and rooms are extremely spacious.  I had a king suite.  It has a nice living room area adjacent to the kitchen.  A little hallway toward the back of the room and you'll find the closet and bathroom.  A few steps away and you get to the bedroom.  A nice location, great staff and comfortable room all for the same rate or less than the hotels right next to the convention center.  Worth the extra block walk in my mind.Beautiful hotel, rooms are huge and the bed was very comfortable. The free hot breakfast is great for being free, lots is different options. Well worth your money. The only annoyance was the bar next door. They were extremely loud way into the night, but that's nothing the hotel can control. I would definitely go back.We stay mostly at Hilton Family hotels and with our kids it is typically one of the suite-style hotels like this Homewood in Downtown Indianapolis. We choose these because they give us more space and give us kitchens for milk or small snacks for the kids. The free breakfast is also a nice bonus. Typically I would say that most Homewood locations tend to be four star stays, but this particular location on this particular stay fell short for a few reasons. The first reason was that on the Hilton Honors website it listed parking as free. I probably should have known that in Downtown Indianapolis that was too good to be true, but I did not expect that the only option would be valet parking. With small children and all the requisite junk that goes with kids everywhere, I really dislike valet. I like to be able to go to my car at any time and not have to wait with wiggly little ones for someone to show up with the car. Nor do I like loading and unloading along a very busy street. Because of this, after a long drive from South Bend and two very cranky kids we ended up losing one of our iPods. Every adult assumed another adult had grabbed it and we don't know if it fell out of the car or was stolen, regardless that put a huge damper on our trip, especially when we knew we had a long flight back with no entertainment for the kids. Another issue was the free breakfast was actually pretty disgusting on the one morning we tried it. Not even the make your own waffles were edible. We had had waffles at a Hilton Garden Inn the previous morning that were very good and the batter or something here was off because not even my kids would eat them. We did not even bother with the breakfast on the second morning. Worst of all, our room, while lovely and spacious, on the first night smelled like poop. Because I have two small children we kept sending the older one to the bathroom and checking the younger one's diaper thinking they were having issues, but finally we realized it was either in the carpet outside the bathroom or coming out of the vent. Either way it was very gross. The second night the smell was gone, thankfully.Otherwise, this location was very pretty and convienent to Downtown Indianapolis. On our first night we walked to dinner and the mall and my husband and his family were able to walk to Lucas Oil Stadium for a Colts game. It is also very close to the basketball arena. The location is really ideal, so if you don't think you will need your car you could park it in a nearby garage that does not have in and out privledges for cheaper than the $21 per day the hotel charges. Our room, while kind of dark, was nicely decorated and had two queen beds and a fold out couch in the living room with the bathroom between the two, but no door you could shut to the bedroom. It also had a full size fridge, microwave, sink and stovetop with a small dining table. The lobby and the staff were nice and I was able to use the business center to print out our airline boarding passes. We did not have a chance to use any of the other services at this hotel, however, as we had a pretty packed schedule. I may or may not return to this hotel depending on the rate I got. We have stayed at the Hilton nearby and they have suites that serve our purpose just as well, have self-park and a better breakfast. The only thing Homewood has is more up-to-date decor and a slightly better location.When recently I heard I was going back to Indianapolis for work, I knew exactly where I was staying.  I knew many people who picked properties closer to the convention center, but I figure a 5 minute walk is a) not that bad, b) probably good for me, and c) again not that bad.  A repeat visitor of this location, I have to say, it has changed the way I think about hotels.  When looking into places (say, the new JW Marriott) I had to concede that it followed the bed, tv, bathroom, dresser, maybe a desk model -- and charged heavily for it.  Sure it's new construction and it's awfully tall and closer to the convention center, but still a small basic room.  And I admit many suite hotels tend to lack any charm, worn, or tend to be located in some suburb.  But this Homewood is a old brick building, renovated to house large, comfortable rooms and very good prices.  Exposed brick walls, no real changes to the facade, all that. I don't even spend that much time in hotels, but the extra space (especially on a work trip) to set up a desk,  stretch out on the couch is much appreciated. When I told colleagues just of the square footage of my room, I probably got a few converts.  When I mentioned the free beer, wine and snacks they brought out each and every night, I had some doubters. On each visit to the hotel, I've enjoyed a full kitchen, living room with with a L-shaped couch (with pull out mattress, if that comes up), a dining table, several tvs, a large closet, and desk.  The room has to be the size of a decent sized apartment, well at least in most of the cities I've lived.  Hell, it's probably bigger than some of the apartments I've stayed in.  There is also an indoor pool, do-it-yourself laundry facilities and a fitness room.  The room is small, a treadmill, elliptical, and some weights, but it'll get the job done.  The staff in my experience has been very kind and helpful.  Now I understand that this is the hospitality industry -- if you are not these things you probably don't have a job for long, but the staff here has been genuinely helpful in a way I suspect has much to do with everyone simply being from the midwest.  Case in point, On my first work trip here, a group of us were sitting in the lobby chatting, having missed the happy hour spread (or whatever they refer to it as).  I did not even yet know that was a thing, but an employee of the hotel asked us if we needed anything, and suggested beer.  We said sure, why not and were quite happy when they brought us a six pack of something not terrible to share after work.  That said, as mentioned before, if you get in early enough they do this for free every night in the lobby anyway.  They'll put out wine, beer, cheese, a small salad bar and typically a few hot items -- a nice little something say you don't have time for dinner or more likely, as I did, a opportunity to wind down with a glass of something and a snack.  I found the spaces in lobby and the nearby business center accommodating -there's even a room with a pool table in it off the lobby.  I understand it's not as sexy as saying you stayed at the JW, but I suppose I'll take exposed brick over tacky new - vegas style construction any day and once you get used to the extra space, it's hard to give up.  Seriously, since staying here I have a hard time staying at properties that aren't giving me at least something on the one bedroom suite model, which is a lot harder to pull off in places that aren't Indianapolis.
review_content_20: I've stayed in this hotel every year for GenCon (so a total of 5 days) for the past three years. I've always stayed on the executive level in a suite. They were amazing at first. The year before last they started making life really difficult. Their have horrible room keys that never manage to stay active for more than a day. They kept not giving new me news ones.Last year is what really turned me off. My friends and I got to our suite and it reeked. We found a baggie of pot in the corner. I was livid. The cleaning must have been done very well. When we alerted the manager and he got furious with us. I think he thought we were trying to scam him. He never apologized and said he would handle the situation so we got ready to leave for the day. The absolute best thing about this hotel is the complimentary grocery service. We started writing up our list before we left. We got the basics, water, soda, and the makings for sandwiches. Then we realized we forgot our Jack Daniels at home so we put it down on the list. We've always been told that's ok as long as the person getting it was over 21 (and they were). I believe we have even done it in the past. Right before we left a friend realized he forgot condoms. So on the list it went. We dropped the list off at the front desk. It got approved. We left. The next afternoon we had no groceries. So we went and checked up on when we'd be getting them. Turns out the manger from before flagged the list and just threw it away. He never bothered to tell us. He claimed that we were trying to embarrass him and wrote up a formal compliant.I understand that buying condoms may be embarrassing for some, but it's a hotel. What do you expect? I'm sure that we were not the only ones requesting them. They even sell the over priced single packets in their mini store on the first floor. Why in the world would this get flagged?So later the manager threw a fit about the pot we found. He said it was obvious it was ours. We escalated. The owner of the hotel, I believe it was, came to our room on one of the last days we were there and talked to us. He was so incredibly nice. He apologized a bunch. Asked if there was anything he could do. We asked if there was any kind of comp for dealing with the manager. He said no. We said that was fine. He apologized a bunch more. We left it at that. The manager, on the other hand, gave us issues the whole time.Pretty sure the guy still works there. I will never be staying here again and I'm going to make sure to tell every last friend/GenCon attendee about the issues we had.My son and I took a one night "man trip" to Indianapolis that included staying at Homewood Suites in downtown Indy.  I have stayed here twice before which is why I targeted this hotel when searching.  I've traveled extensively and I have stayed in many, many different hotels.Love this place.  Classy but relaxing, new but retro, suites are perfect, free breakfast is really a breakfast, not just toast and donuts.  Great location and easy parking.  I'll be back.We came here the week after Christmas to do some shopping and attend a Pacers game.  I looked at several hotels downtown, and based on the reviews, chose this hotel for the second half of our trip.  The hotel was clean and very unique.  One of the main reasons for choosing this hotel is the dinner buffet everyone talked about.  Ha.  We planned on that being our dinner.  We ended up going across the street to the Spaghetti Factory.  The buffet was chicken nuggets and a spring mix salad with some carrot sticks.  That is what they consider a full dinner buffet?  I stay frequently at the Drury Inn & Suites, and their happy hour munchies put this dinner to shame!  They have baked potatoes, nachos, hotdogs, salad, chips, chili and all the fixings to make them how you like.  FAR superior to this.  Also - we assumed (of course - I should not have assumed) that we could check out of the hotel and walk over to Bankers Life Fieldhouse for the Pacers game at noon and then walk back and pick up our car after the game.  They told us at check in that we had to have our car out of their parking by 11:00.  Another reason I chose this hotel is that it is the closest to BLF.  We had to leave the hotel and find a place to park far away.  There wasn't anything close - so we just drove around for awhile to kill time.  We had stayed at the Conrad for a few days prior to moving to this hotel, and they let us keep the car in their parking while we shopped at Circle Center after checkout.  For the money, I could have stayed at several other hotels downtown.  After taking away the dinner buffet we had planned on and walking to Bankers Life, there was no reason to pick this hotel out of all the rest.  It isn't connected to Circle Center, so there is nothing to do if you have to get out of the hotel earlier than planned.Beautiful! Very modern, spacious, makes you feel at home.I am a big fan of the Homewood chain, even though most Hiltons have gone to shit.  The Homewood Suites in KC is still one of my favorite hotels.I used to be a Hilton Diamond(highest level), but now all the nice perks are gone.  In the chain, the Garden Inn and Homewood seem to be the most consistent, but again it depends on a location by location basis.This location is perfect if you are planning to see the Colts or Pacers games; both within walking distance.The hotel appears to have been a remodel of a condo/apartment building?The rooms are very nice and the ceiling tall enough to accommodate the tallest NBA player; too bad the beds are not.The suite has a full kitchen setup with a flat screen, but the bedroom has an old tube tv on a dresser.Service both at the front desk and valet was excellent!While overall I would give this place a thumbs up, it did have some shortcomings: - Breakfast was weak, scrambled eggs and a pigs in a blanket on a stick?  Some frozen disgusting combo that they stuck in the oven for 20 min. - Elevator takes about 2 min to go from 4th FL to 1st, with no stops! - On Sat night, street noise was almost unbearable until about midnight. - Parking $24/dayUh oh!!  The updates I have are as follows: #1: Not much of an update but something I forgot to mention previously...The gym is TINY.  Two treadmills, a bike, and an elliptical.  It is also about a bazillion degrees in there and there's no water cooler or water fountain.  The indoor pool is gorgeous though.  #2: Their WiFi was HORRIBLE this time around.  When trying to work from my room, I got booted off every 10 seconds.  It was better in the lobby (it would boot me maybe every 5min) so note to self...Do not stay in room 403 again.  There must be an issue with the signal in there, though they told me at the front desk it was impossible.  #3:When the hotel is full, the wait for the elevator SUCKS.  Like, you could be standing there for 10min waiting for it to come.  #4: The young guy at the front desk during the day is AWESOME.  He not only printed 20 pages of color documents for me (would've cost me $40 a FedEx-Kinkos) but he gave me handfuls of free toothpaste and two razors when I went to buy them in the lobby store. All in all, still a solid option downtown Indy.  I'm starting to lean towards the regular Hilton now, though, because of their enhanced amenities and addition on wireless internet.Nice, clean hotel.  Stayed here during a conference and was in a very reasonably priced suite with a kitchen and living area.  The beds were inordinately comfortable! They have free beer and food from 5-8 on Monday - Thursday. When I was there it was italian fare and stella artois.  Not bad!Definitely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. The room was really large and reasonably clean, with an extra pull out bed in the sofa. TBH, we didn't use the kitchen or the grocery service, but it was nice that they served both a breakfast and dinner. (There were pots/pans available if you go that route.) Every staff member I met was super nice, though not always completely knowledgable (they didn't know about the shuttle service to the airport, for example). I felt really bad for the staff who had to stand outside and open the doors though. If I had to point out any negatives, I suppose the view is not the best (facing an alley), but uh, if you're there for a convention, how many daylight hours are you going to spend in your room anyway? Not a lot of natural light, but the room was reasonably well lit anyway. It may potentially be a bit noisy though -- we could definitely hear the doors closing in the hallway. Conclusion: good price, good hotel.Most comfortable beds ever and really nice small hotel! They even have a pool and room service available from Kilroy's next door.We stayed Friday and Saturday nights. I've never stayed at a Homewood Suites but I really liked it. The room, which wasn't that expensive, was nice and clean and big. No complaints at all. Great experience. The hotel is on a busy street, but I was told (and asked for) a room in the back. We had no noise issues at all if definitely stay again.Nicely done renovation. Huge room and nicely appointed. No view on my side of the building. Quick walk over to the Conseco Fieldhouse. As with any downtown hotel, parking isn't cheap.  Will stay again when I return to Indy.Seriously one of the most beautiful hotels I've stayed in period... They have fantastic rooms with great structural reminants leftover from the warehouse that was the previous use of the building.  The architectural work is amazing and they have done an amazing job remodelling this building into a top hotel in Indy.  The homewood suites is a perfect homebase for a trip to Indy.There is a sitting room and then a bedroom with a mini kitchen to have snacks and food available without having to go out for every meal.  On the weekends they only serve breakfast but it is a good selection at a perfect price (free).  All of the staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean, and the facilities are new and in good shape.  We fit 5 people comfortably into our suite and no one was unhappy.You are litterally a block from circle center, 3 blocks from monument circle, 8 blocks from white river state park and a few minute drive to Mass Ave shopping and dining.This is a great central, inexpensive solution to a weekend in indy.Lovely. The rooms in this hotel are like a beautiful new apartment. The staff, especially those in the kitchen during breakfast, are friendly and efficient. The amenities are plentiful, and the location is fantastic. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is pricey, but that is due to the downtown location.Beautiful rooms with modern decor and above average room additions (full fridge, dishwasher etc) Comfortable beds with huge loft style rooms. Exceptional customer service...However if you are a light sleeper be weary of the fact that you are downtown and right next to a night club open until 3am in the morning. The bass resonates through the rooms if you are so unfortunate to be on the side next to the club. We were there during the Indy GP races and mistook the noise as part of nightly festivities...after three nights of little sleep and a complaint to the night manager we were moved to a better location, still some noise but tolerable.There is no room service but the central location as well as breakfast/light supper provided make up for that.Internet is available in rooms/ wireless only in the lobby.I would be happy to stay there again if I was guaranteed one of the interior rooms to eliminate any sleeping issues due to noise.Liked -- almost everythingDisliked -- noise issueBEAUTIFUL hotel!  Really modern rooms with the highest ceilings i have ever seen!  The room includes a mini kitchen with microwave, rangetop, full size fridge and dishwasher.  This brand of hotels in more designed for the at-length traveler although I only stayed one night.  There is no room service but a breakfast and dinner is served in the lobby.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance as well.  They have snacks (chips, drinks, sundries) at the front desk that you can charge to your room.  Great room for the price too!Brand new facility in a newly restored historic downtown building. This amazing new hotel even includes a pool. Very cool location right across from the Spaghetti Factory and very near the RCA Dome and Conseco Field House.

review_content: Staff is super friendly! The free breakfast in the morning is amazing!! Rooms were very clean and over all hotel is quite, safe and comfy!It was a nice, average hotel. We checked in here because of the 24 hour shuttle service to the airport and it worked perfectly. The beds were not comfortable for us. And the pillows had no body to them. Don't expect service if you forget something. I had a cold and they had no medicine. If you forget anything, you better hope the CVS down the road is open.Stayed here 1 night.  Plenty of parking.  There are several other hotels located within a stones throw.  A Sam's club is behind the hotel.  There are some restaurants and bars done the street.  I am not sure how close to the airport the hotel is but it is about a 15 minute drive to downtown.  Staff was ok.  Room was spacious.  Free WI-FI.  Clean bathroom.  Breakfast was pretty good.  Plenty of seats.  Pool and gym do not open till 830 and are accessed via room card.  A decent place to stay for 1 night.I had to change rooms at 2am due to the yelling and screaming on the floor I was on. I thought since this was a Wyndham hotel it would be a little classier but this must be the place they hand out Section 8 vouchers to people to come and stay while the projects are getting renovated. Horrible experience. I will not be back.Nice place. Room was pretty spacious and clean - but the bathroom could use some updating around the tile/tub area. Looking kind of dirty/worn/questionable.Breakfast was decent. Scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits (some were a bit hard), gravy, yogurt .... etc etc. Just watch the baked goods -- my bagel was moldy.Was only here for one night, so didn't get to take advantage of the pool or anything.Staff was polite & friendly. Good location not far from downtown Indy & the airport. Our room was spacious & clean. Bed was REALLY comfy! Breakfast is complimentary with choices. Would come back!Really bummed out by my stay here. Not what I've expected at other Wingate Hotels. I was extremely let down with the bed. Super cheap pillows and the mattress didn't have much for support. The maid wouldn't change the towels I threw on the bathroom floor either...gross. They kept putting then back up on the rack, and I know this because the towel in question had a noticeable stain on it, and it would wind up back on the rack every day.The breakfast was mediocre as well: hard biscuits, watery eggs, the juice dispenser concentration was waaay off.Live and learn I guess. Wyndham hotels have consistently let me down. I won't return.Everything was great except the driver. They would've had five stars was it not for him. The was clean and very nice, everything you would need to be comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful (except the driver). If you don't have to take a shuttle from the airport this is a great place to stay!Now for Mr. Grumpy driver he can barley speak English which alone I would never pass judgement or even mention except that I could not understand one word he said. When he picked me up I noticed he was not happy weaving in and out of traffic. Dude if u don't like your job find another. This morning I get in the car with my little service dog he basically yell at me to make her sit as far away from him as possible. then he's getting angry at other peoples driving honking, waving his hands. I do not feel this is the way someone driving the public should act. Even the other riders we're surprised at his attitude. I would definitely come back to the hotel as long as I had my own carI really do wish I could've given them five stars because as far as the hotel goes they deserved it.I would give zero stars if I could I was in room 118 and slept the first night fine the first Monday after Valentine's Day, upon my waking I got up out of bed to find that a bed bug was sleeping with me, I had the week paid for and all the hotel offered was to switch rooms what a joke what a friggin jokeI only stayed here for one night, but the hotel was pretty nice and very affordable.  The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly enough, and the price was just right for a one night stay for business (around $45).  The only thing I wish the room had was a refrigerator because it would be nice to have cool drinks in the room without having to hunt for ice (and use the tiny coffee cups provided for my soda).  Overall, a pretty nice hotel though.  I would stay there again if it was just a one night trip, but for more than that I'd be willing to pay more for a few more amenities.First off, I would like to make note that the Manager was very nice. My main problem is with the Shuttle Driver and a minor issue with the sheets and pillows smelling like sweat. We were informed of the free speedway shuttle by management and decided to use the service. During the ride, the driver raised his voice and became very rude. He stated, " I want $10 tip from each of you" I felt this was uncalled for and he proceeded to make comments about us being cheap because we, "only" tipped him $7. Management was informed though it appeared to be brushed off as a miscommunication. This wasn't a miscommunication and was in fact a deliberate act of rudeness and an attempt of fraud.We stayed here after flying in to the airport and needing an overnight place to stay.  I liked this place much better than the more expensive Wyndham that we stayed on our way home.The room was pretty large and the beds were comfortable.  My only problem is that because it was a Saturday night the hotel seemed to have some sports teams (young) staying there.  Their idea of fun is to run up and down the halls screaming at the top of their lungs.  Where are the parents??!!  Their free breakfast was good.  Plenty of choices for everyone.  The free Wi-fi never did work. I would stay here again because of the proximity  to the airport.   And it was very clean.There is something shady going on with that airport shuttle. Lots of excuses were made. The hotel itself is averageOur experience was pretty decent at this hotel. Although I requested a king, the hotel was booked enough that we were given a room with 2 doubles - not a big deal, of course.We were on the first floor, and honestly, that kind of sucked. I had to turn the fan on just to not hear the people smoking outside. There was something going on that had probably 100 motorcycles in the parking lot, which REALLY sucked, but I don't blame the hotel.The TV was a flat screen, which I liked, but we wanted to stay in and watch a movie, and the ordering system didn't work. That would normally be fine because I have an iPad and video hookup, but unfortunately, the Wi-Fi was awful. Our room was on the first floor and I couldn't even get it to stay for a single minute to browse with. I realize it's free, but it's not that hard to have decent Wi-Fi. I've experienced slow Wi-Fi and not been upset, but the fact I couldn't even get on is not ok.The pool was okay, and the free breakfast was fine. Plus the beds were comfortable, so I couldn't complain that much, but it just didn't seem to be that well kept. The room wasn't that clean, with yellowing wallpaper in the bathroom, a food wrapper on the floor, and a dirty mirror, but it wasn't disgusting, just not anything beyond average.I did book through Hotwire's "Hot Rates", where you are not given the name of the hotel before you book, and I saved about $30 a night, which made it a decent deal instead of overpriced. I don't think I would have paid $100 a night happily.I'm not usually a posh traveler. I've slept in hostels all over the world, shared showers, etc. So I'm not writing this review to be whiny... but this hotel SUCKED.My bed was made daily, I got the paper daily, the front desk staff was kind, etc.Here is what I didn't like:Upon arriving from a long flight I needed to use the room's facilities. I sat at the commode and looked to my right and saw a brown smudge on the toilet paper dispenser. An OBVIOUS brown smudge...Now - if this smudge were on the microwave handle, the remote, or something at least 5 ft from the toilet, I could have thought "fudge?".. but NO. This was shit. I don't blame the shitter but the maid could have spotted this from a mile away, used a glove, and cleaned it up! I didn't pay for a hotel room that I had to clean myself! It was so gross. Then later I saw that they offered complimentary tea and coffee in the room. How jazzy! I was stoked for some tea so I poured water in their little hot water dispenser and after it heated up I poured myself a nice cup of boiling hot water. But as I looked into the water I noticed all of these brownish black flakes. I'm not too tall so I hadn't bothered to inspect the water dispenser beforehand.. but I pull it down from it's shelf and notice that there is a ton of muck and dirt in it. GROSS #2! No tea for me.Third - my room was on the second floor and because I was attending a work conference I had to get up early each day and cab downtown. One evening (about 6pm) my room suddenly started to shake. Some crazy loud bass from below was blaring through the ceiling and keeping me on edge. I let it slide for a while because I hate to be a complainer. (I know, I know.. this whole post is a complaint). Anyway - after an hour of this noise I call the front desk and I'm told that the room below me is actually a rental party room and a family was hosting a quinceanera for their daughter. The woman said "they have the room rented until midnight". NO EFFING WAY!! So the call ends when she promises to ask them to at least turn the bass down.Thirty minutes later it's the same loud reggaeton. BOO. So I call back and the woman explains to me that the people don't speak any English. Lucky for me - my job entails that  I speak fluent Spanish. So I go down there myself and ask them to lower the bass. They did. Sort of.Needless to say my nights at this place were quite restless. Between the poop on the fixtures, the dirty appliances, and loud neighbors.. I was glad to leave after just a few days.My boyfriend and I stayed here this past weekend visiting with his family. It's a nice hotel and the bed was really comfortable and with clean sheets. I really enjoyed watching television on the flat screen, but my only pet peeve was the fact that breakfast was rather mediocre in nature using powdered eggs and sausage(don't even bother indicating if it's pork or some other kind of meat especially to those with dietary restrictions). The dining area is situated to the rear of the lobby next to the pool and if it's wintertime you'll get a blast of cold air every few seconds someone comes into the door. Not to mention the excessive noise of some of the guests when they come into the dining area and parents don't seem to have it all together to tell their kids to put only what they're going to eat on their plates instead of them piling it up high and wasting it in the end. They need to have fresh scrambled eggs since they taste good and they should also offer egg whites for those who can't eat regular eggs. Another thing is the constant hiring of Mexican workers who don't speak good English which makes no sense because half of them spent the entire duration of the breakfast run yapping in Spanish and when guests asked for certain things they pretended like they didnt hear them. They need to change the breakfast menu to include things like sausage patties, pancakes, waffles(already made), grits, freshly baked biscuits with plain or sausage gravy instead of placing boxed biscuits inside of a crock pot to steam them. Most people know that buttermilk biscuits are best served straight out of the oven. I was also bothered by the lack of attention paid to the room since the Kleenex box had not been changed since the last party that stayed in the room I had with my boyfriend. The only real plus is that the hotel is situated in a fairly busy strip next to a Sam's Club and a host of other stores up and down Rockville Road. The hotel is only minutes from downtown Indianapolis. The stay was okay, but nothing really to write home about.This place might not be the highest class of hotel but I had a great experience staying here.  Check in was fast and the staff was very friendly.  The bed was one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept in.  The TV was a flat screen but I had some bad reception on a lot of the channels.  Room was quiet and laundry was good.  This place is right next door to a Sam's Club so it's very convenient.  The fridge, microwave and coffee maker was great. I liked it here!Helpful staff , good stay. Will stay againWe had a pretty decent experience at this hotel.  The hotel staff was not as customer-service oriented as I would have liked, but we didn't need their help really.  The room was comfortable.  The breakfast was greeeeat!  It wasn't just continental like most hotels.  They had everything, except hash browns.
