I wouldn't stay here again..for the money we paid, there are lots and lots of other places nearby.Honestly I wish I could give this place 0 stars. The customer service is absolutely HORRIBLE! From the time I booked my room I asked the lady when the cocktail hour was the lady told me it was from 7-9. When I checked into my room around 7 I was told it was already over. The Asian lady behind the desk had a bad attitude. When I got back to my room later on in the night I seen that they over charged my room ( didn't take my $50.00 coupon off) had to go back down stairs to get it corrected. Breakfast in the morning was good but they ran out of plates and silverware had to resort to paper plates. After we checked out my boyfriend looked at his debit transactions the hotel had charged $231.00 to his card. He called the hotel and was on hold for 45 min. He kept getting put on hold and was told the manager was busy checking in guests. We came back to the hotel (we was just around the corner shopping) No guests was at the desk. We asked the manager why we was over charged he then told us it was a $100.00 hold fee for room charges. (So nobody that works at the front desk knows that but him? ) it wasn't stated on the receipt nor told to us when we checked in.He didn't have the best attitude either. The room was great but the hotel staff is horrible.  Next time I visit Indy I will not be staying here.A little tired and maybe needing a little tighter management.  I'm a big Hilton guy, so I've been in them all.  Prefer ES, since you get more room and often times a decent breakfast.  Skip the breakfast here.... or get there earlier.  First, the room showed a bit of wear and the public areas were a bit worn.  Bed was comfy though.  I made it to the FREE breakfast only to find egg pellets (aka scrambled eggs) that were super dry, cold sausage, cold potatoes.  9a and the buffet closed at 930.  The better solution would have been to direct us later folk to the omelette bar for made-to-order eggs and accompaniments.I did get a steal through a company rate, but it doesn't excuse the conditions for the other folks paying full price.Our room at the Embassy Suites was very nice. The plush comfortable bedding was great. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The living room area was nice. There were some rowdy people in the hotel, but it was New Year's Eve. So, I kind of expected that. My only two complaints would be that the jacuzzi by the pool was not warm and we were really looking forward to that and they were understaffed for the manager's reception - huge line.I will never stay in this hotel again. Service was poor. I asked for an extra blanket, after an hour & a half and 2 phone calls I finally went to the front desk. I was told on the first to calls that I needed to wait to have it brought up and I couldn't come down to get one. The "happy hour" was a joke. A few tortilla chips with some salsa/cheese mixture & carrots with Ranch not to mention the ridiculous line to get an adult beverage. The whole hotel needs redone. It is dated and has the most uncomfortable pull out sofa. I didn't expect it to be the most comfortable thing I ever slept on, but I did not expect to be laying on metal springs. I had to put the bed away & just sleep on the sofa which was uncomfortable since the couch is a mini version of a real sofa. Breakfast was a unorganized mess. There was only one cook to order station for a sold out hotel. Finally, if you plan on getting any rest do not stay at this hotel. You hear everything thing from the lobby no matter what floor. It is the loudest hotel I've ever stayed at. Stay somewhere else it isn't worth your money.The staff is super sweet, the rooms are all suites & you can't beat the nightly "Complimentary Manager's Reception" from 5:30pm-7:30pm. All drinks are on the house at that time, just make sure to tip your bartender! Are you a morning person? Then you'll enjoy the complimentary breakfast buffet available every morning starting at 6:30am. The location is absolutely perfect! Right in the heart of downtown Indianapolis within a short walking distance to anything, including an awesome mall with a great movie theater! Love this hotel :o)Great location, decent customer service... Place is old and needs renovation.I was expecting better customer service but it wasn't too bad. It is very dated and at night it's pretty dark and not well lit. We stayed in a suite and I did think it was nice that it had a fridge, microwave, and stove. I usually love embassy suites but this is the most outdated one I have stay at.None too impressed. I have stayed at several Embassy Suites in my day and this one is at the bottom of my list.The location is certainly ideal. Close to everything. That said - I knew space would be limited but the fact that I had to actually stand in the corner of the bathroom just to shut the door - come on!!!!! You had just enough room to turn around and that was it. I'm hardly tall at 5'3" and my knees were pretty close to the bathroom door when I was sitting on the toilet. Unpleasant indeed.My biggest complaint - the temp in the room. Outside was about 35-40 degrees. Inside our hotel room was an easy 75 degrees. We fiddled with the room gauges but that didn't work. We then asked the front desk and their explanation was that the whole hotel was on neutral. (WHAT?!?!?) That meant - it is neither on no off and it was just room temp... They explained that since it was such a mild winter lately that they are just keeping their HVAC system at a stand still. I don't get it!!!!If we go to Indy again - we will most certainly try something else. Our two night stay was almost $500. I think we can find something nicer and probably for a bit cheaper.ps - NO free wi fi. Keep your stinkin' free breakfast and don't charge me $11.95 PER DEVICE for wi fi.I have had a long history of pleasant stays at Embassy Suites, perhaps even over the past 25 years. Unfortunately, this hotel fell short of their usual level of excellence. I was underwhelmed with the quality of the room; while it was spacious, the accommodations felt dated and comparable to hotels that cost half the price. Also, the complimentary breakfast was barely stocked. When I arrived about an hour after the breakfast hours began, nearly all of the hotel pans were scraped clear of food and perhaps only one was refilled within the next 10-20 minutes. I wasn't looking to engorge myself that morning, but scraping tablespoon-sized vestiges of food out of the corners of  hotel pans was not my idea of a good breakfast.I always stay here when I am in Indianapolis because A- Location B- Love The Suites  C- Staff is Always friendly D- I feel safe and secure     Embassy Suites in Indianapolis is the place to stay!The hotel is getting tired. The main entrance is due for an overhaul.Room was ok, lobby clean, but the big perk with Embassy Suites is the Manager's reception.  Makes it worth the extra money -- usually.  Unfortunately, the breakfast was horrible -- cold, tasteless, nasty.  And the lines were huge!  30 minutes!!  The evening reception was equally as bad..  The line was at least 30 minutes long.   Good location, but I'll stay elsewhere next time.I just stayed at this hotel and was not impressed when compared to other Embassy Suites. My room was very hot and even with the window open all night (only opened a few inches), was not able to cool below 76 degrees (temperature outside was in the 30's).The workout facility was very small and all but one treadmill was "out of order".The location was nice, as it is attached to a Mall which has a variety of restaurants, movie theater and stores.The rooms in this hotel are in need of serious updating and the HVAC needs to be changed or updated as well.Even as a diamond member don't expect much from this poorly run, run-down hotel. There's a reason why it's $100 less than other hotels. It is perfect for a college road trip, seriously lacking for the normal business travelerI can't even begin to describe my absolute HORROR of finding bed bugs in my bed at 3 am!  I had never seen one in real life, just recall seeing a special on tv about it.  Of course the staff dealt with it well and immediately upgraded my room. Yes, it was a horrifying experience, but I did not realize how much worse it could get when 7 days later, did all the bug bites show up!  I am talking hundreds of super itchy bites in clusters of 1- 6.  I counted how many there were on my hand alone, can you believe it 50!  All on the uncovered areas of my body by my pjs.  I was only in that room for 3.5 hours, I do not want to even being to imagine how many there actually were.  I saw 5 in the bed.  The management was very sorry about the incident and made some very nice gestures to try and make up for what had happened which accounts for the extra star for service.  Its 2 weeks later, I'm still super itchy, have insominia, paranoidness & nightmares and extreme fear of having brought them home with me.  I could completely go on, but I think you get the picture.I still think the staff here are wonderful.  They go out of their way to help  you.  They are very pleasant and personable.  I do however have a problem with rip off hotels.  I paid $311.00 a night during the cheerleading super nationals.  Again, our group bought a block.  I will never stay here again.  What a rip off.  That does not include WiFi.  You have to pay an additional $14.99 for that.  Maybe I don't understand these mega events things just yet but I do know after talking to some of the other parents that there are cheaper hotels 3 blocks away who don't try to rip you off.  Location, location, location no thank you.  Not when there is a $235.00 difference between 3 blocks.
review_content_40: Service is great but been coming here 3 years and the elevators are always slow, this time they are redoing the service elevator so one of the regular elevators has blankets hanging on the inside to cover the glass and thats the temporary service elevator.Free breakfast is hit or miss, they can't handle crowds though, plates run out, juice machine gets low, food gets low, lines back up, can be a mess.Pool is good usually, this time, pool too cool, hot tub was a pot of boiling water and I felt like meat in the stew and the floor doesn't drain well, always puddles around.But its convienent to all the sites, just needs a little work.This hotel is conveniently located in the center of everything downtown and easy walk to everything.  There are plenty of restaurants in the area and the front office staff is friendly.  Cynthia and Sabrina in the Manager's Reception Happy Hour bar rock! They are so nice to folks and make it a really fun after a long work day.  Having omlette station and breakfast included in the suite price is nice.  Although the temperature of the foods on the self-serve line can be improved as the french toast is often cold.Used to stay in the Conrad across the street and often stay at Hampton Suites with my HHonors in other cities, but when in Indy the Embassy Suites is my preferred because of their staff -- they truly appreciate you for being there and especially Cynthia and Sabrina.  Rooms are well cleaned by housekeeping and you get a small work area and living room with pull out couch for extra guests or just to relax a bit when on the road.  I guess folks can use the outer parts as an interview room when on the road for business, I just feel a bit weird asking a recruit to come up to the room.  Would probably meet them in the lobby instead.  Friends in the area can come over and chill in the living area while you finish getting ready to go out.We stayed here for the Monumental Marathon. What a great location. Right downtown,lots of good restaurants,connected to the downtown mall, and easy in and out from the airport. Very good size room(suite)with the two areas. Clean room, king bed and all the extras you wanted,microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. The staff was very friendly and always asking if you need anything else. The happy hour each day was very nice. The breakfast was outstanding. Even though the hotel was sold out Saturday night, the staff keep replacing the snack for happy hour and did the same Sunday morning for breakfast. This was not just your plan bread and cereal, we a talking full breakfast. Eggs, omelets to order,bacon,sausage, potatoes, pancakes, danish. You name it, they had it. The staff did an unreal job trying to keep replacing the food and cleaning the tables as the people just keep coming. The pool,jacuzzi and workout room where clean and all worked well. Over all  for us, this hotel was a perfect spot for coming to Indianapolis.I thought that this hotel was "A-OK".  It was very convienently located.  Very close to a lot of restaurants & the convention center.  They had a free, acceptable breakfast, and free happy hour everyday.  The rooms were spacious, but the bathroom was super small.  The cable on the TV in the sleeping area kept going in & out and they didn't seem to know how to fix it.  I suppose my favorite part of the hotel was the Off Track Betting bar on the bottom floor.  I didn't win anything.  I never do.  But boy do I have fun trying!Not well designed. No air in winter and no heat in summer. Do not recommend. You have to wait 10+ minutes for an elevator. I love the location and the amenities, but the sheer designed will prevent me from coming back.The plus side, great staff and nice breakfast. I could not enjoy drinks because it was too busy.My husband and I stayed in one of the bi-level penthouse suites during the Indy 500.  We had a balcony with a pretty good view of the city.  I thought the staff was great, very friendly and helpful.  You are in the center of EVERYTHING downtown so its a great place to stay with plenty to do.  If you can't find it in walking distance they're more than happy to get you a cab or town car if needed.  The room was very clean.  The only issue we ran into was the water was kinda wacky. One time there would be no hot water, next time no cold... I don't know if this had something to do with the number of people in the hotel at the time since they were either at or near maximum capacity.  The breakfast was great with an omelet bar.  We didn't get a chance to go to the managers reception so I can't comment on that although other guest said it was good too.I stay here at last 2-3 times a year for work. I used to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn off the Circle, but for the same price, why not get a bigger room/suite? Check in and parking is easy,and the staff is friendly. Not sure what the deal is with other people having problems with elevators, but they seemed to work fine when I have been here. Since I have a Hilton Honor account, they know to put me away from the elevator and on a higher floor. You can't beat the free breakfast, and yes...being connected to the Circle Center Mall makes it really super kick @$$ as far as location.This hotel is in need of a complete over haul. The fact that there are no elevators taking you from the ground level to your room is ridiculous. When you walk in you have to go up a SINGLE stall escalator to then get an elevator up to your room. If you are traveling with kids like we were this creates a nightmare! They also do not have a complimentary parking option. You have to park your own car in the garage. Again, would be nice if you could pull up and let them park your car. Having a 6 mo old and 2 year old and needing to use a stroller, this hotel did NOT allow for that. I would have paid double for the convenience. We nearly had an accident on the escalator while juggling both kids by myself. My husband was parking the car, I had the 6 mo old in her infant car seat and my 2 yr old holding my hand. You can't anything in the single stall escalator. Who ever thought this layout was a good idea needs to reconsider! Don't waste your time if you are traveling with kids!First the good things.  The staff is very nice, and the place is clean, and the two room suite is really a wonderful feature.  But the hotel is noisy.  The interior facing atrium, that's at least 17 stories high is a huge echo chamber, with every door facing onto that atrium.  I could hear conversations from the lobby floor.  In addition, one of the elevators was broken and so it took forever to get a ride up or down.  And the whole building hums from the air conditioners.  Literally hums.  And one more thing - the walls are thin.    I think I'll skip this hotel from now on.

review_content: Stayed at this hotel for a dart tournament i was playing in. I liked the fact that the hotel was attached to the event. Made it very convenient. The room I stayed in was pretty nice, a lot bigger than I expected. Not sure if I was upgraded or just because it was a room at the end of the hall. The room was clean and well kept. Could use a few upgrades but was still nice. Comfortable bed and a large shower. The water pressure in the shower was a little light, but that is common in a hotel. The staff at check in was great. I cant remember a faster check in. The restaurant in side the hotel was great also (will give them their own review).I would have no problem staying again.Very outdated hotel and their service left me wondering if the right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing. The remote for my TV wasn't working and someone showed up at 5:30am in the morning to knock on my door saying he was from maintenance. I never called for maintenance. Price was discounted on Hotels.com but you get what you pay for I guess.This was my first stay at a Wyndham and I have to say, it's truly a mixed review. Parts of my time was very good at this location, and parts were pretty disappointing. I attended a conference here in February (2015) and was able to see the convention spaces, as well as the guest rooms.The beds were very comfortable and clean, the hotel offered free wifi, and the staff was very attentive. The conference space was accommodating and open, and the food we were served was incredible... they had a fajita meal, barbecue, pork and mashed potatoes and all of our was simply outstanding. When I first got into my room I unpacked everything then got ready to take a quick shower. Unfortunately, the shower was broken (completely, only a bath ran) so I had to re-pack all of my things and move to a different space. The staff was helpful and responded quickly to this, but you would think that they would have a better idea of rooms which need to be offline or not, or at least check the basics.The next morning I was awoken at 8am to a super squeaky cart, and the squeakiness continued throughout the weekend. I am not a light sleeper but these carts are incredibly noisy and obnoxious, and should just be fixed. Again, another small thing with an easy remedy.Besides there being no mini-fridge in the room and the water glasses being absurdly dirty at one of the dinners, the rest of my stay was great. This wouldn't be a terrible place to stop in for a night at all, but spending three days here wasn't the greatest, to no fault of the staff. This hotel just needs an investment in basic repairs and updating and it could easily be world-class.We stayed at the Wyndham West for a dance convention this past weekend. I absolutely will not return to this hotel. The attitude of the staff was terrible from the moment I checked in. They acted as though they did not want us at the hotel. We were not made to feel welcome. The restaurant had wonderful food but terrible service. There was only one waitress for the entire place. We waited two hours for orders that were incorrect and incomplete. The website insinuates that there are many things in close proximity, but as a convention attendee there was nothing nearby that I could get to quickly for lunches, and the restaurant was not open in the hotel. I did not have hot water one of the three days we were there. I was charged for a refrigerator that we did not request nor receive. I was also charged for a crib, despite being told upon booking that cribs were complimentary. Our room was at the end of the hallway and the noise at night and in the morning from people passing through was atrocious. We will most definitely return to the convention, but I never again stay at the hotel. This is definitely not a crown in the Wyndham jewels.My fiance and I stayed there for a Titans vs Colts game. We booked the room using Hotwire for a very reasonably price. AFTER booking, I read some of the most recent reviews and I was a bit nervous to stay. When we got there it was exactly opposite of what I expected. The staff was so kind and helpful. We got to our room and it smelled of smoke. I called the desk right away to avoid a fee after we left and they offered to change our room and made note so we didn't get charged. The room was clean and cozy. One of the outlets was a bit unreliable but nothing that deserves less than 5 stars.Oooh.. Yikes. I usually like the Wyndham. This hotel, however is outdated and just not great. Stains on flooring, switched rooms due to my tv not working, no soda machine near ice machine, the overall look of hallways and rooms are just kind of grimy. The staff I encountered, from the van driver to the employees who checked us in, were very pleasant, so this review is not to reflect them. They were great. Unfortunately, a friendly staff isn't enough for a great stay. This hotel needs a makeover, to be a WYNDHAM hotel.Ok. Checked in for one night. We have a seizure alert dog. We informed them of this and they placed us at the far end of the hotel away from civilization. The parking lot was closed so we had to walk and walk and walk to get to our room. When we asked for a room change because of the distance and the fact that the room smelled like smoke and the TV did not work we were told because of our dog that was the designated room for us. Have these people not ever been informed that a service dog can not be discriminated against? He's not a pet he's my life line. They seemed ignorant and poorly trained. Rooms were ok. Nothing special or bad to say about the rooms for the price. Better training and understanding of special needs would have made this a non-event stay. Sad this day and age to have to worry about this. Per the hotel response, yes we were moved only after I demanded it in a crowded lobby. We were moved just down the hallway closer to the exit that went to a parking lot which was blocked and not accessible. While the room was better smelling and the TV worked the location was still well removed from the entrance one had to use because of the closed parking lot. This distance was literally the length of the hotel. As for the staff, one can not help but take offense when told that due to our dog we had to be placed in the location we were placed. Also the young manager telling me it was due to allergies. If the hotel staff were properly trained that comment would not have been made and my service dog would not have been considered in the placement of our room.Overall it's ok. The rooms are "clean-ish". Not barefoot clean, but acceptable. Resturaunt is overpriced, but the lounge is a nice place to hang out, watch the game, and enjoy a beer or two. Even local things on tap. There's a 24 hr cafe so even those early morning departures can get a cup of coffee. And a free airport shuttle that runs every 30 mins and free wifi!Overall, not the best, but comfortable and reasonable.Still a great hotel. Large room and standard sized bathroom.Coffee maker with teas and coffee in room.Cordless phone.Back side had moderate airport noise.Slept well in a comfy bed.Adequate lighting and curtains kept the room very dark after the sun rose.Nice shower pressure, but had to report the water backing up in the tub.My girlfriend made a reservation through Hotwire.com to stay here on a whim during a road trip from North Carolina to Minneapolis. We wanted an inexpensive hotel to rest, take a shower, and get back on the road the next morning.My first impression was positive upon arriving, the hotel was conveniently on the freeway and the lobby looked updated, with a friendly desk person to greet us.We quickly had our room key, and headed that way. Here is where the story turns...I quickly made mention to my partner that the carpet was old, and it looked much different from the lobby, as we headed toward our room.Entering the room, we noticed it looked like someone had slept in the bed, and there was a used soap in the sink. We quickly backed out and went back to the front desk to report this.We were quickly "upgraded" to the 6th floor, and we were on our way.The room was much bigger, but with the same decor, so not much of an upgrade in most respects. The room was clean this time.We ordered room service, which was the only positive part of this experience. The food was typical bar fare, nothing fancy. Waking up, my girlfriend was unable to get any hot water. I tried, with no luck out of both faucets....just semi cold water. I called the front desk to ask what the trick was, and they stated the water was being fixed, and she would call me back in 10 minutes. Apparently the repair person was already there. More than 30 minutes passed, with no call and no hot water, and a road trip schedule to keep, so we stopped at the front desk to complain. We were offered free coffee in the shop located in the lobby. It had a line 20 deep outside of it. Sad to say, we'll not be staying here again under any circumstance.I'm giving 1 star instead of 5, because I'm VERY angry about 1 thing. Here it is: I booked a stay here over July 4th weekend, and I used Hotwire. When I saw I got the Wyndham, I was really happy, because there are some really crappy hotels in Indy. We were booked from Thursday night to Saturday night, have breakfast on Sunday, and leave. Unfortunately, due to unforeseen circumstances, we had to leave Saturday afternoon, leaving Wyndham with an opportunity to re-book it immediately. We left about 3:30, and the line was SUPER long to check in, as the Rolling Stones were playing that night, and the hotel was filling up. I asked for my money back for the night I wasn't going to use (Saturday) and I was told I would receive an updated receipt through Hotwire, showing that I did not stay Saturday night, and that I would be refunded. Well, they lied. My receipt said I stayed my whole trip, and showed I was not refunded for the night I didn't stay. What Wyndham did was sell my room to someone, and kept the money, even though the room was paid for. So if anyone reading this stayed in 334 on Saturday, July 4th, you got taken advantage of, and so did I. I called Wyndham about it and they said they sent Hotwire the correct dates I stayed. This was a lie. It's a shame, and I'm sick to my stomach about it. I even took out the $15.00 insurance policy through Hotwire just in case there were any issues- because I've learned my lesson before... And basically the insurance company said that because I didn't leave due to a death, there was nothing I could do. I'm pissed off, and I'm telling all of you to stay at Wyndham at your own risk. I didn't see bedbugs or burn holes, but I saw shady business, and that is why there is 1 crappy star on this review. NOT COOL. Oh, also, their TV cable system is garbage. But whatever. I've seen managers contact other people about their reviews. If this happens to me, I'll let you all know if they tell me there's nothing they can do about it, which I fully expect... Next year, I'll be staying elsewhere. No matter WHAT CITY I GO TO. (This is also being tweeted. People NEED to know.)Came here for a weekend to see a Colts game. We had to wait 10 mins in the lobby, just to check in, even though I'm pretty sure this place was empty. This might be the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The room reeked of cigarettes, the bed sheets had stains on them and the TV was barely functional, at best. The worst part was the cafe downstairs, we were starving from our plane ride and didn't want to trek downtown just yet. We paid $10 for a turkey sandwich, with soggy bread, completely wilted lettuce and some fake looking cheese. I've never been more terrified to consume a meal in my life.Sheets were clean in a decent sized room with two double beds. Carpet chunks were replaced with new carpet due to some weird red stains throughout the room, shower facet was coming apart and the water was either Scalding hot or cold. The cleaning crew was annoying loud in the am. Probably better hotels for the same price nearby.We had prepaid for the room but the hotel overbooked its rooms and we got bumped to another hotel. When arriving late at night, moving to another hotel was the last thing I wanted to do. Desk clerk was friendly. Lobby looked nice.Stayed here on a random trip to Indy. Not the worse hotel. The beds were super comfortable and everything was clean. Why was room service knocking at my door at 8 am? What do you need at 8 am? Go away!I stayed Friday night through Sunday morning for a local gaming convention. All of the hotel and restaurant staff were friendly and helpful and made for a great stay. They provided lots of great space for games!Our room was clean and comfortable and had a nice bathroom. The beds were quite nice and I slept soundly. The only thing lacking there were chairs, as there was only one office chair in the room. However, we spent most of the weekend out of the room so no big deal.Was here for a business weekend, and I honestly don't get all the bummer reviews - I've stayed in a fair number of convention hotels near airports over the past few years and this was far and away one of the cleanest, friendliest and most efficient. We were a huge and boisterous bunch this past weekend, but the staff were up to the challenge, and went out of the way to get me everything from an extra ice bucket (they don't have fridges and I tend to bring my own food), to coffee in a pinch (the room service number got misdirected to the bar and this poor guy had RUN from the kitchen to get the phone; "Not a problem", he said as he caught his breath, and five minutes later that SAME GUY was at my door. VERY GREAT STAFF!). As I just mentioned, no refrigerators and it is true that the wifi is very touch and go. I also could have done with a premium channel or two (I don't do sports or reality TV, so it was pretty much 'Law and Order' marathons or news, which gets a little old). But then again, I wasn't in my room much - I may have felt differently had I been, but I can't for the life of me wonder why anyone would go to a place ten minutes from the airport for a getaway.Didn't get to the restaurant (as I said, I'm not big on hotel food outside of NYC), but I did spend time with friends in the bar and saw what they were eating, and everyone said the food was great. I did try a piece of their flatbread pizza margherita which, while tasty, was most definitely not flatbread (this is why I bring my own food). The 24-hour cafe, while I didn't partake of it, is a big plus.All in all, it was a comfortable and accommodating stay on a really hectic weekend. Provided you don't expect backflips when you get there (and access to your own wifi), I think you'll have a comfortable experience.I was going to Indy for a trade show. I usually Hotwire my rooms, when I have to stay multiple nights and I was pleased to see my selection came up the Wyndham Indy by the airport. I checked in past midnight and was beat, so I was ready to crash, knowing I had a very early day the next day. I plugged in my phone and laptop next to the wall next to the bed and put my laptop and phone on the floor, as I didn't want to leave it on the bed and have it fall in the middle of the night. When my alarm went off, I got up on the wall side of the bed (not the nightstand side) to grab my phone and unplug my laptop and noticed I stepped on something. I turned on the light and it turns out that I stepped on a slightly moist condom and wrapper. I am a seasoned traveler. Typically when I travel for business, I won't stay below anything that is 3 1/2 stars, mostly due to experiences. Not only was I completely furious, but I was on a strict schedule. I quickly showered, the shower was slow to heat up, after 5 minutes I took a cool shower that eventually warmed up as I was turning off the water. Before I left, I quickly checked my email only to find the "free" internet was so slow that I had to teether my phone to receive a wifi signal. On my way out, I asked to speak to a manager and the only manager available at 7:12 AM in the morning was the housekeeping manager, Tammy. I informed Tammy of the incident and she casually apologized and said she would make sure it was taken care of. At this point I was running late, so I said to Tammy I would follow up with the hotel manager when I returned. I was livid with disgust and their casual approach to the occurrence. On my way to the trade show, I called Hotwire to inform them of the incident and they canceled my reservation and booked another room in another hotel and informed me to gather my things after the trade show. After my day, I checked in with the manager at the hotel and spoke to manager on duty and said I wanted to talk about the incident this morning. After waiting 5 minutes at the front desk, the manager came to the lobby. I asked her if she knew of an incident that happened this morning and she said she did not. I informed her of the incident and I asked to have a incident report to be filled out and something in writing that Wyndham hotels would be responsible if I pursued any medical attention, such as doctor's visits or testing and refund my stay for the evening. She said she could not authorize anything but would be happy to write up the incident report and have me talk with security. I spent the next 20 minutes talking to security and explaining the incident and she said she would ask a member of management to phone me. That was last Wednesday 11/5/14 and it's now Monday 11/10/14 and as of today I have not received a phone call or email. I am horrified at this incident and completely dumbfounded at the lack of response from the staff at this hotel. Do yourself a favor, do not stay here. Posted a picture too. Shame on you Wyndham Hotels.I stayed here for two nights this past weekend with my fiance and also got a second room for my parents. On first impressions this hotel looked pretty nice and we were happy to see that it had a 24 hour cafe open inside of it. However the first impressions would be slightly misleading as we quickly found out. My mom is not one to ride elevators and seeing how we were located on the 4th floor, she had to go find the stairs. To say that they were inconveniently located would be an understatement. There was only one set that went from the first floor to the fourth floor (there were more sets of stairs but they were all to fire exits) and those stairs happened to be on the exact opposite end of the hotel. The hotel was set up in a U shape and so we had to go from one end of the U to the complete other side. So after a bit of walk we made it to the rooms and they looked to be pretty nice. They had your normal large flat screen TV's, a desk, 2 beds and a decent amount of space. The beds themselves were fairly comfortable but man were they small. I think that calling them doubles could be misleading although they were certainly a bit bigger than twins. Once again not a deal breaker for staying here but not ideal. Then the first night that we were there neither my room nor my parents room had any cold water. I don't know how or why that would happen as it doesn't seem logical but we both mentioned it to each other the next morning. My mother also told me that whenever she called the front desk she was told that no one else had complained about that. I don't really find that the correct answer whenever someone is staying at your hotel but I suppose it was ok for them? Finally the last item to happen is that my dad ended up using the telephone to make 3 local calls, 2 of which didn't go through. Cost of that was $1 per call. Awesome right? Personally I didn't look at the phones and I am sure that there was something on them saying as much but charging for local calls even if they didn't go through ended up being the cherry on top for this place. I know that I sound like I am complaining a lot so honestly the place wasn't too bad to stay in. Everything that we encountered seemed to be relatively minor but they all just added up for me.The bottom line for me is that I would probably not be back here again in the future. While the rate I received was pretty good, there were a bit too many inconveniences for my liking and the next time I will find somewhere else.My husband and I were traveling together and this hotel experience was less than desirable. I booked this stay through the Southwest Airlines website since we would need travel/shuttle service to the airport in Indianapolis the next morning. We checked in and went to our room. The exterior and lobby of the hotel was nice however the rooms were very dated and the King room was extremely small. It felt warm in the room so we turned the air down to 70 (it was set at 77) after about an hour it did not feel any cooler so we moved the air down again to 67 and called the front desk. The lady said she would send someone right up. A little over an hour and a half later we still had not seen anyone but we had to be up for an early flight in about 4 1/2 hours so I called down again to the desk and explained that we would "tough it out" due to our early departure. There was no apology, just an "okay, thanks for letting us know." Throughout the night the room reached about 78 degrees. Once we left the room to check out and went to the lobby we realized the air conditioning was out in the entire hotel. It was about 85-90 degrees in the lobby. Upon check out I asked the man at the desk of I needed to do anything since I was leaving my car for a week. He said, "yea, it's $6/day... You'll need to pay." I told him I booked through the Southwest site and was supposed to have had the "park and fly" rate. He said, "well you don't so you need to pay." He was extremely rude and again no apology for the extreme heat in our rooms. I asked him politely if there was anything he could do about the charge since i was under the impression I would not have to pay and our room being nearly 80 degrees and he responded with, "well it's hot down here too!" I about lost my shit! I told him he GETS paid to be there and I PAID to be there! He then went to "get security." I'm not sure why no one was yelling but the security "guard" came out and said it was fine to park "this time" for no charge. I quickly responded, "no worries, due to your lack of decent customer service, I won't be staying here again." Something as simple as an apology and a slight compensation would have prevented this review being so negative.
review_content_20: Old building & carpet, definitely needs to remodel. Small rooms. Smelly hallways. No breakfast/coffee/cookies like any other hotel charging $140/night. Wi-fi is extremely slow. When my room was cleaned I didn't get any amenities re-stocked.Received 2 stars because they have a great gym and the staff is friendly.Had to write an update regarding my daughter's stay at the Wyndham, which I had purchased for her as part of a college graduation present. Though her stay was awful, after writing the initial review, Angela from Wyndham called and asked about the situation and seemed genuinely concerned. She spoke with me and my daughter, and after hearing all that happened, she apologized and offered to refund my money for the stay and then went above and beyond and sent a voucher for a free night's stay at the hotel for a future date of our choosing. We're looking forward to that stay, and I'm confident we won't be offered "the warm suite" this time around. :) I am impressed with Angela's follow-up, and we feel very satisfied with the outcome. Even though my daughter can't get that night back, I feel that Angela did her best to rectify the situation, and for that I'm very grateful. That's just good business, and I'm impressed.Fairly clean room, but older furnishings and hardware (rickety closet doors, lousy toilet) reveal this hotel's age. I reserved a 2-bed room thru Wyndham.com. At check-in, the clerk insisted I had reserved a 1-king bed room. I showed her the confirmation email on my phone, but she said that doesn't mean anything. She stated that the only way to reserve a specific room type is to call the hotel directly. REALLY??!! She did change me to the correct room, so I let it drop. But this could have gone really badly if they didn't have availability of the room I reserved. WiFi never did connect to the internet, even after numerous tries. Called the desk to make sure I was using the correct login. If you need WiFi for business, forget about it at this place. Room did not have a fridge or microwave. Mattress was mediocre at best, and I woke up with a sore back. On the positive side, everything worked in the room - TV, central thermostat, plumbing, etc. I would stay here again if I had to; but next time in Indy, I will look elsewhere.The location was very convenient for us which was a plus for us. They have a very nice lobby and snack bar that is open 24 hours. Those are the positives. The room is not a 3 1/2 star which is what their status is listed on Priceline. The rooms are outdated and the bed was uncomfortable. They were having a huge dog convention when we we went. Our room was fairly close to the lobby and we could hear dogs barking a lot the first night. The following night was a Friday and the dogs were gone but the noise level was a bit much. When they cleaned our room on they didn't leave any coffee, bag for ice, cups, or extra toiletries. Each day I had to go down to retrieve these items. It was an ok stay. Something more along the lines that I would expect from a Motel 6 as far as comfort and service goes.They charge for a refrigerator even if it's for medication. Not sure if that is legal. The internet is SLOW SLOW SLOW so don't expect to get much done work-wise. No jacuzzi and the pool is not enclosed and closed. Not really a 3 and 1/2 star hotel as advertised in my opinion. I feel like this place isn't a good value for the money.Suck!We spent the night here to catch a flight, so the location was worth a star. Upon check in the desk clerk was barely civil to us. We had interrupted something he was working on. Whatever, just give me the room card. This hotel is enormous. There seemed to be very few people there so there wasn't much excitement in the air. The room was okay. The beds were comfortable and it was quiet. I couldn't believe how small the bathrooms were! No way two of us could get ready at the same time. I almost fell over the toilet a few times because it was inches away from the sink and in the way.The free Wi-fi was a joke. I never got it to work no matter how hard I tried. I went downstairs to try to get my boarding passes to print but the computers at the "Business Center" didn't seem to have internet. I tried one last time before we checked out and it actually worked. I was shocked it worked. No free breakfast so we ate at the nearby Waffle House. The two stars are for good location and for comfortable (but soft) beds.On edit: as Grace D. mentioned below I was also surprised the bathroom didn't have a fan (mildew here we come) and the outlets were few and hard to find.I stayed here with my frat brothers during our Centennial Celebration. The check in staff were friendly. Check in is normally at 2:00pm, but they allowed us to check in nearly two hours earlier than normal.There is nothing extraordinary about this hotel. This is not a five star hotel. It was clean enough that you feel comfortable sleeping and bathing here. My biggest gripe was with the curtains. The decorative curtains do not close. On days when we partied hard and came in when the sun was rising, it was difficult to sleep through the day when the room is so bright. Having access to a 24 hour gym is always a plus for me. It comes in handy when you can't sleep and you feel the need to work out.The hotel is not too far from Downtown Indianapolis. If you have access to a car, it is literally 10 minutes away.When we checked in, we told the guy we had just booked on Hotels.com, so it might take a second for his system to recognize us (Hotels price was $40 or so cheaper than the hotel's posted rate). He replied, "I hate people like you"... we're off to a good start!The room was nice, though, and the beds unbelievably comfortable. If we could fit a bed in our car, I would have just bought it from them. But when M tried logging on to the free wi-fi, he was working with slower-than-dial-up speeds. He called the concierge and asked if he was doing something wrong, and they said they were aware of the problem and weren't planning on fixing it. At the speed the internet was going, they really shouldn't advertise having internet access at all. And considering we were both trying to work, this was a huge issue for us.The faux Starbucks in the lobby is open 24 hours, which was convenient around midnight when Mike started getting hungry... especially considering the only other things within walking distance are other hotels. But there is no free breakfast... one of the only hotels we have stayed in this trip that didn't. There is a card in the room to have breakfast delivered to your room from one of the hotel restaurants but it's $$$ so we just ate dry cereal.Find some hospitable employees, fix the wi-fi, and this will be a nice hotel. Until then....Didn't stay at the hotel, but I was attending an Expo here - so I was in most of the hotel, just not the rooms. The bar / restaurant was fun but the reason I gave 3 stars is for the feel of the building. It is very outdated. I feel like the last time they gave this place a makeover was in the 1980's. When trying to do business, I asked where the "Business center" was. Low and behold it was the two computers at the front of the building - WITH NO PRINTER!! I couldn't fax, I couldn't copy, I couldn't do anything but surf the internet. Might as well call it an internet cafe instead. NO, scratch that, because I can print at some cafe's!Nicolino's Italian Restaurant. DO NOT EAT HERE.Possibly the worst Italian food ever. It's like crap Stoffer's frozen food--and then they charge $30 for it. You'll get better food at a truck stop than at Nicolino's Italian Restaurant.I am writing this review on behalf of my dad because I have personally never stayed here but I did speak with the front desk a few times and service was great!! :) According to him, the rooms are really clean and their customer service is phenomenal. He forgot his reading glasses and I had to ship them to him, unfortunately they didn't get there over night (for saturday) so they got their until Monday after he has already checked out. The front desk was kind enough to call him and rushed to the airport in order to give him his seeing glasses. I have never heard of such great service before but this was just awesome. It was very nice of them to actually care about someone's belongings instead of just placing them in the "lost and found" bin. So yes, this place DOES have GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! :)Crappy room. Airport shuttle service was not on it. Waited 45 minutes to get back to me car. Not a very caring staff.No movie channels the wifi does not work. If you don't have a car your very limited to food.I was excited about the Hotel as the reviews were good. Unfortunately, I have to say the walls were thin, you hear ever time the water is turned on up to 2 rooms away. Also, there was supposed to be a reception our first night, never was. We asked after the first night and they said there wouldn't be one the second night either. The free wifi was very iffy and pretty much worth just that.But most notable was our room service, we left our room at 10 am. to see the city, when we got back at 5 pm our room had still been not made up. Shame on Wyndham!A hotel airport, clean and nothing fancy or extraordinaryGreat hotel.....didn't mind that the structure is dated.....large clean rooms.....great staff...great west side location....lobby check-in was under remodeling but temporary check in was fast and efficient....price range was moderate because I received a 40% off regular rate through travelocity....I came here because my ghetto hotel didn't have food until 5pm. I tried the buffet, it was a little pricey and the pasta was good but not great. It was good enough to fill my starving tummy.I came back other times for the 24 hrs starbucks to get little snacks.I had dinner at the bar, it was expensive but so damn good.The people were very nice and friendly. Greeted at all timesInternet didn't work, over charged me on the hotel stay by 100$, van driver was yelling at me for holding him up when the problem was do to the front desk staff over charging me, one restaurant on site, over priced food and tastes like cafeteria food. I've had better service at the DMV.Very nice front desk staff! Room was beautiful and soooo clean. Starbucks cafe' and restaurant located inside hotel.
review_content_40: This is a nice hotel except for the location near the freeway.  I had a room that was facing the road and had trouble sleeping with the cars racing down the road.  I was happy with my room, otherwise.  It was clean and spacious.  The bed was super comfortable and had a down comforter.  The in-room wifi is a little spotty.  I had no problems with the front desk service. The hotel has great amenities like a 24-hr gym, business center, restaurants, and even a computer screen of flight status.The Good:Nice, helpful people at the front deskThe room looked nice and was a good sizeFree internet (but extremely slow - hard to even check email)Good quality coffee and tea (organic) for the in room coffee makerThe Bad:My annoyance with this hotel started as soon as I booked my stay there.  I got a good deal through Priceline, so after I booked I called the hotel to see what my room came with (e.g. if there was a fridge, breakfast, etc.).  First I got through to the reservation line and was transferred to the front desk.  The front desk guy put me on hold and then another woman with a strong accent answered.  I didn't realize till later that I had been transferred to an off-site operator.The lady needed all my info - confirmation #, full name, dates of stay - and even with all of those details she asked, "what location?"  It was then I knew that I had been transferred to someone outside the hotel.  She attempted to answer my questions, putting me on hold twice for long amounts of time.  Finally she told me a few things (no fridge, 2 double beds).  I had more questions but it was so frustrating that I told her I would just wait till I got to the hotel and ask.Then the hard sell began.  Do I want to join some kind of frequent stay club?  And possibly win all sorts of things?  Or sign up for a Wyndham credit card?  This was clearly the purpose of my being transferred to this lady, and it was obviously her job to sell this stuff, not to know about the actual hotels. The next day I arrived at the hotel.  It looked like a big, creepy, old cement box.  Inside was nicer, but it had clearly seen better days.  I think it was updated recently but not everything - old features and fixtures remained in the room.  The carpet had burned spots by the bed.  The shampoo and conditioner were so unappealing that I had no desire to take the extra home with me.  The soap left your skin feeling slimy.  The toilet was dirty when I got there.  The first night was interrupted at 6am by the alarm clock radio going off at high volume (set on talk radio with a man's voice.  I almost had a heart attack).  Then I was woken up in the morning by pounding on the door that sounded like the police.  It was only the maid, and it was 9:30am, but on Illinois time it was only 8:30am and I had been up for awhile after the alarm went off because I couldn't go back to sleep.  The first morning I ordered breakfast from room service (Nicolinos).  They were friendly and accommodating about substitutions.  The food itself was ok, nothing special.  However, the silverware had old egg baked onto it from the dishwasher - every piece of silverware that came with the meal.  That was really gross.  And the coffee was un-drinkable.The overall stay wasn't terrible, but they really sucked at taking care of the details.I've seen faster movement from an arthritic tortoise.  Yes, there was a sudden influx of passengers due to a delayed/diverted United flight.  But the speed - or lack thereof - from the desk staff when it came to getting people checked in was staggering.  You would think they'd take steps to streamline the check-in process for a large group of tired, frustrated passengers, especially considering United Airlines was footing the bill, but that wasn't to be.  I was in line for nearly an hour before I finally got checked in, rubbing salt into the wound already inflicted by United.     As for the room itself, I wasn't impressed; tiny bathroom, and uninspired, dated decor that paled in comparison to the Marriott Fairfield I stayed at for several nights prior.  And for one of Marriott's "low end" places to outshine them should say something.  For the hotel itself I'd have given three stars...basically adequate....but after the check-in debacle, I'd have to knock off a star.  Sorry guys, but you gotta show some sympathy to tired, frustrated passengers.Check-in was hectic. The elevators were very slow (and only one of three seemed to be functioning.) The bathroom seemed to have been recently renovated, but there was no vent fan or lighting above the tub/shower, and it was very cramped. There were no desktop electrical outlets, and the only outlets I could find were hidden behind furniture -- extremely inconvenient. The lounge had about as much atmosphere as a family restaurant populated with grandparents. The only upside was that it was much cheaper than staying in the city.As a hotel, this place is A-ok. The room was quite comfortable.  As for hosting a conference, the facilities was very sub-par.  The decor is outdated, the food was probably the worst I have ever had.  The light was too dark to promote lively meetings.  The distance of the hotel from the city is also a drawback.  The customer service is excellent.Stayed a night earlier this summer to attend an event hosted here. The building was worn and smelly in several public areas, and the bathrooms were tiny with extremely low flow showers. (Water temperature was fine, though.) At least the room itself was in good shape: clean carpeting, plush mattresses, and thick blankets.My stay was on a weekend when air traffic may have been lower than usual; nonetheless, I experienced no noise issues.Service was great. Front desk employees were friendly and efficient in checking us in and out. Housekeeping called our room phone shortly after check-in to make sure everything was all right. (Yes.)While this hotel was not horrible, it is definitely showing its age, and it seems like a poor value given the quality and price of surrounding hotels.I spent a weekend at the Wyndham back in July for an event, and after having a sub-par experience at a Wyndham in Orlando, I was a little wary.This was the best hotel experience I've ever had, hands down.The hotel itself is pretty standard. Nice and clean, nicely-sized restaurant inside, good food (and a really great breakfast buffet), and relaxing bar. Actually, I'd say that the bar was above average. Very nice. The hotel staffers were also total pros when it came to the event itself. Even when the attendees took over the halls during the Saturday night parties, you'd never know that the staff was there. Very cool.The rooms are very nice as well. One of my main issues with the other Wyndham was a pretty unclean bathroom. Not here. Everything was immaculate. There was a slight A/C problem in the room, but the hotel was very prompt to fix it.So, why was this such a great experience? When I arrived in Indianapolis (I drove from Toronto), I had just enough money on me to cover paying for my room. On the following morning, I discovered, to my horror, that my debit card wasn't working in the hotel ATM. When I reported it to the front desk (thinking the ATM wasn't working properly), they were very understanding of my predicament, as not being able to access my money meant that I had no money for the event, food, or being able to afford the gas for the drive home. They pointed me in the direction of a local bank to use their ATM, and off I went. When that didn't work either, it was clear that it was my card. When I arrived back at the hotel, I was freaked.One woman at the front desk went above and beyond to help with the situation. She started making calls to her supervisor to see if I can get back the incidental deposit, and even let me borrow her personal cell phone to make calls to my bank in Canada. Naturally, it took time for the bank to sort out the confusion, and the staffer even went as far as to offer me money out of her pocket for me to buy some lunch while the bank was doing their thing. I declined, but this is something I've never experienced before, not just in terms of customer service, but in generosity from a complete stranger. Anyway, the bank sorted out the mess, and I was able to access my money, and I made a special point to make repeated trips by the front desk to give them more thank you's and smiles. Two months have passed, and I still can't believe what a great stay that was, and it made me sad when I had to leave. I really hope I'll get a chance to return someday, and I really hope there is some sort of karmic reward being handed down to that amazing staffer. I did make a point of talking to her superiors via email when I got home, to inform them of her helpful nature and generosity, so there's that.I highly recommend this hotel if ever you find yourself in Indy.2 of the three elevators in main lobby malfunctioned, down most of the morning. wasn't informed of a major event of the living dead movement. Upon checking in, assured our room was in the different part of the building, away from the concentration of fans. Up until 242 am, noise foul language and commotion in halls. Staff believes that they were not responsible to advise or ask if you are staying for an event which is at their establishment.Awful. That's the only way to describe this hotel. Public areas stink, the bar area is especially rancid. Uncomfortable beds, noises coming from other rooms and a staff which either ignores you or is anyone to help you. Avoid at all costs.I was pretty impressed with this place. After reading the other reviews I was really questioning what we had gotten into. I thought the place was very clean! The decor was up to date and the staff was helpful and friendly. I was extremely sick while there so I was in bed the entire day and night and the bed was AWESOME! The only complaints we had were small like the bath tub didn't hold water well and the phone didn't work well it had a lot of static. But other than those two things I was impressed! I would def stay there again!My company pays for this hotel stay, so I have no choice when in town.The hotel and the staff are very nice and friendly.  The hotel provides you with 2-free bottles of water and a coffee maker in the room, offer free internet access in the rooms, computers in the lobby in case you need to print something, and the beds are very comfortable.  They also have an on-site fitness center.On the other hand...Internet service is slow in the rooms, there is no microwave or refrigerator in the rooms for those frequent travelers who like to bring their own meals.  Hotel restaurant is expensive.  If the weather permits, there are a couple of restaurants within about 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel, but if you want to go into town or to a mall to get out of the hotel, the taxi is about $22 each way.  The hotel shuttle will not drive you because of the distance and because they need to be available to shuttle people to and from the airport.  There is an expressway right outside of the hotel that can be quite noisy (bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper).Also, they offer Starbucks coffee in the lobby (that they brew themselves), but they hold the cups hostage behind the counter and charge $2.00 per cup.If they put you in a room on the other side of the hotel, it is a very long walk to your room.The food is genuine and well thought out. Great selections throughout the menu. My server was great. The manager Glenn came by and was very knowledgeable and friendly. He recommended things for me to take the kids out and do on the area. Renovations are everywhere. I think overall if you want true to character Italian food visit. Also, you pay for what you get. Truly quality.Easy to find! It gets the job done. A spot to stay for the night and a place to shower. The beds are heavenly. Not bad.. Suuuuper comfortable you feel like you're floating. Although it'd be nice to have a mini fridge. Free wifi is awesome too. Speedy network.Every room smells like smoke. The hallways smell like smoke. Honestly this place looks and smells like a 1970's Las Vegas casino hotel. Expected more from a Wyndham.  Way more!Brown water, a clogged sink, and no interest on the part of staff in helping us out of either of these issues.  Room walls are paper-thin so we got a lot of noise from the hall in the bargain.  Our stay was, in short, a nightmare.

review_content: The location is great if you want to explore downtown Indy.  Unique layout, and the rooms were clean plus friendly staff.Summary: Of the four major chains (Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott, and Starwood) this would likely be my LAST choice for a hotel in downtown Indy. It isn't significantly cheaper than the Westin,  Sheraton,  Marriott, or Hyatt -  but it is a lot less quiet, the rooms are a lot more dated, the facilities are smaller, and its location is worse. Only stay here if everything else is booked. Pros: it's location isn't horrible. You have easy access to city circle mall. Free Hampton breakfast. More availability than nearby hotels when everything else is booked. Rooms are clean, albeit dated. Cons: When you walk into a hotel and the front desk offers you free earplugs,  you know it's going to be a long night.  You can hear EVERYTHING in this hotel.  The walls are paper thin, as are the windows.  I swear a garbage bin was dropped at least 10 times outside my window. I heard what sounded like gun shots.  Several sirens. Large groups of drunk businessmen from 10 to midnight.  Loud arguments by homeless people from 12am -  2am. Toilets flushing,  bathtubs emptying. TV's.  Don't expect to sleep past 6:50 either. Once one person in the hotel is up, everyone is up. Internet is SLOW. I had free premium Internet as a diamond honors member and I couldn't even stream the republican debate in SD.Horrible layout. You have to walk through the breakfast area to get to any of the conference rooms or to the hotel gym. Although it's a central location,  it's not as good as most other downtown hotels. The larger hotels are just as cheap and have bridges and tunnels connecting them to everything downtown.  This one was excluded from that great city planning.The pipes are old so the water smells like sulfur. The shower was tiny and had visible mildew around the door. The mix of mildew and sulfur was a lost almost nauseating.I am a huge fan of Hilton, but this location was rough. I believe it was under construction, but there was nothing offered that made this stay comfortable. None of the windows int he rooms opened and there was no ventilation int he bathrooms so the whole place filled with hot steam. The wall paper was coming off of the walls int he hallways. The staff was friendly, but weren't able to offer any assistance.I've stayed at this hotel twice. The first time it was just fine - no real issues. The second time that I stayed here the thingie (no idea what it's called) that you use to switch from the tub to the shower head was almost impossible to pull up. I really had to give it my all... and then it was there, and there was no getting it back down. Plus, the shower head itself was SUPER crappy (nothing was the right stream that I could actually focus it in any one location). So stay away from room 722. Both times, the staff was nice and helpful and the valet parking is nice as well. I also enjoy the location as I can walk all around downtown from here. No need to get my car out and drive anywhere - which I love.Great location!!!!!!!!!!!!! Great City!!!! As with all cities getting a higher floor helps with city noise. Some of the rooms are smaller or odd shaped as this is a historic building that has been renovated. But we enjoyed stay a lot .. the staff was friendly and helpful and our bed was comfortable.  Easy walking distance from shopping and restaurants. The downtown was decorated for the holidays and there was carriage rides for a fee.  Typical free breakfast .. I always love the oatmeal.    Only compliant no fridge in the room.My husband book us a weekend away. Here to watch Wizard of Oz. Visiting from Ohio and I must say we will be back. Perfect location to everything. Service has been great and everyone is very friendly. We have never been to the city before and during check in we were given multiple coupons and suggestions on places to eat and visit. The rooms are very clean and neat. Most of all the beds are fabulous! Thank you Hampton for making our stay enjoyable.I love the staff, complimentary breakfast, location to everything, the historic features of the hotel, and the overall vibe of the city. Having breakfast on the second floor instead of the main lobby gives you a wonderful view of the town and a cozy feel.Stayed November 2014, traveled on businessMy boyfriend and I stayed here this weekend from Chicago for a wedding. They were so nice and helpful with all our questions, we were so impressed with their customer service and hospitality. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows were like little clouds! The only weird thing was that the room kind of smelled like sulfur and eggs and farts and it didn't go away the two nights we were there. Other than that the stay was great, I'd definitely stay there again (just not in a fart smelling room).We stayed for two nights.  The staff was fantastic.  As soon as I walked in the valet spoke to me and set to work helping us with our luggage.  The front desk staff was great.  I had checked in prior to arrival and the room I chose wasn't ready but he quickly found us another.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  The breakfast was good and had the usual hot items you are looking for.  One of the employees came out several times to greet the guests in the breakfast area and brought around muffins for us to take with.  The valet was always quick at retrieving the car.  There are no fridges in the room but we asked for one and they brought one up.  This was a good hotel that was close to everything in downtown Indy.As a frequent business traveler, I depend on the ability to unwind and watch my favorite shows on Netflix or Hulu. However, this hotel has Internet speeds that maybe matches the performance of dial-up.  One star.If you are a tourist, this is probably a decent hotel. The rooms are nice and clean and you get free breakfast.  That is why I give this hotel and additional star.  This hotel can cost over $200 a night though for a standard room.  I do expect a little bit more than basic expectations for the above average price.As a business traveler, I don't plan on staying here again.Fairly decent, low-end hotel in a great location. Unfortunately, the heating system was HORRIBLE. The heating on the "auto" setting reverts to 62 degrees periodically, even though I set it at 75. Additionally, the thermostat was probably off by 10 degrees, so I woke up twice in the middle of the night literally shivering I was so cold. I'd reset to 75, and then an hour or so later wake up cold again. After a night of little sleep, I checked out early and into a different hotel downtown. The Hampton Inn staff were wonderful when I checked out and gave me the room for free (they have a 100% guarantee). As I was telling them the problem, several other guests voiced the same issue, so this was not isolated to just one room. I would avoid this hotel unless the weather outside is nice and you don't need to rely on heating.Ideally situated in the heart of downtown Indianapolis, which made it perfect for me as a first time visitor.  It's within a 2 minute walk of the Bankers Life Fieldhouse (Pacers) & the Lucas Oil Stadium (Colts).  The Hard Rock Cafe is within site & also handles the hotel's room service, but why eat from the Hard Rock Cafe if you're not going to enjoy the scenery?  The staff was friendly, My room was clean, although the room I'd initially booked in advance online was not ready when I had arrived after check-in time.  I chose another one floor above, conscious of the complaints about lower floors & the noise I could imagine would be an issue with it being St. Patrick's Day weekend & with the Pacers playing the Celtics.  Like all Hampton Inns, there's a free breakfast, free WiFi & other perks & more for Hilton Honors members.  They afternoon I arrived, the parking valets were particularly slammed & my car was still sitting where I'd left it in front of the hotel nearly 2 hours later, which seemed strange.  Not something I worried too much about, but they were busy & as someone who has stayed in several Hampton Inns over the years, this was the first that I couldn't just pull into a lot & park on my own for free, so I was curious how that would play out.  When I am back in Indianapolis, I'll be back at this Hampton Inn.  It's got it all - value, service & location.This hotel is horrible. They have an issue with loud music and noise on the southeast side of the building. This has been brought to their attention several times but management has not addressed the issue nor do they forewarn customers. I am writing this at 12:15AM with a full work day ahead of me. This is completely unacceptable and I will be seeking a full refund for the night and a change of room.The hotel was so-so but made up for it in the end.  I stay in Indianapolis a lot and I am a Hilton Honors member so Hampton Inn is usually a go-to choice for me.  They usually have clean rooms, friendly staff, and decent contental breakfast.  This Indy location was definitely clean but that was about as far as it goes.  We arrived about an hour before the designated check-in time.  We waited 10 minutes for someone to talk to us at the valet stand about our car outside.  Once at the front-desk there was  problem with corporate card on file.  The desk assistant was not helpful and slightly rude.  After repeated requests to talk to the manager she finally let out a sigh and tried to call him.  I was just told he was busy and must provide a different form of payment (which I didn't have since it was direct bill to my company).  In addition - she made us feel like we were a huge inconvenience by being there early and told us we had to wait in the lobby for an hour until check-in time.  After some time - I was on the phone doing some work in the lobby.  She loudly yelled out to me that my room was finally ready and looked annoyed that I was on the phone.  I asked her to give me one minute to finish up my conversation and she just kept talking to me and finishing up the paperwork.  In the mean-time I had talked to my travel agency who had left a message for the hotel manager.  I asked the attendant to have the manager check and she just said the manager was a very busy person and may get to it later.  She kept telling me they just need to fax in a form but I was trying to tell her they didn't do that and had to just speak to the manager.  We finally got all check-in and got to the room.  The room as great as always - clean, comfortable, and spacious.  The next morning I expected to find an expected Hampton Inn breakfast but found cold eggs, old coffee, clumpy gravy, and tough biscuits.  Overall - this was NOT a great experience.  HOWEVER - less than 24 hours after I checked out the hotel corporate had emailed me offering some points and apologizing for the stay.  That is what will keep me coming back to the Hilton Brand family.Shower has low pressure and constantly changes temperature.  Gym treadmills don't work or they short out the wall sockets and shut down (true story, mine and another guy's treadmill shut down.  One didn't start up again).Internet is nice and fast though ....3.5 StarsI stayed here one night for an interview at Riley's Children's Hospital. Great central location in downtown Indianpolis within stumbling distance to many restaurants and bars. It's also a 7 minute drive to IU and the medical center. Sometimes chain restaurants/hotels are nice because they are consistent and predictablbe. This Hampton Inn is no exception. A clean room and a comfortable King-sized bed, I couldn't really ask for more. The going rate was $130/night which was covered by my interviewers. Valet parking is $17.00 a night, but there are cheaper alternative parking options available. There are plenty of covered lots and street parking as well. Breakfast is included, which was better than average. A wide vareity of fruits, cereal, sausage, omelettes and of course coffee. I had no issues with noise, but I stayed on a Sunday night.Overall a very comfortable stay in a nice central location. I would recommend staying here strictly based on the location.Horrible experience.  This building is not safe.  I had been on the road traveling for a week & was about to take advantage of the on site laundry facility.  Since there is no laundry detergent for sale in the laundry room (which is stupid) I exited the laundry room (with all my stuff inside except my money & room card) and was planning on running down the one flight of stairs to buy detergent from the lobby store and then running right back up. I entered the stairway from hell and was then locked in the stairway.  There are NO signs outside the stairway advising that the door locks behind you without access for reentry. The stair way is marked as an exit though there is no immediate exit.  After a full on freak-out panic attack I saw a dark, dirty, smelly unlit open room down on the first floor - that I was not about to enter - I finally started running upstairs...guess I thought I would make a rooftop escape.  I then saw a phone on the 4th floor & was able to reach the front desk who advised me the 5th floor is unlocked.  Stupid, stupid, stupid and this absolutely HAS to be a fire hazard.  I was in a complete panic...imagine if there was a fire & someone entered the stairway marked "exit" only to find there is no exit in sight.   I went to the front desk to tell them what happened and to report how unsafe it is & they insisted the stairway is marked that there is no reentry.  This is when I advised them (and anyone else in hearing range) that I was going to report them to codes & the fire dept for an unsafe condition. I went to the stairway again just to see what sort of signage there was - where I confirmed it was not marked.  I guess my tirade & threat of reporting them to codes at the front desk got management wondering - because I saw three employees coming to the stairway to review my complaint. They finally confirmed with me that there is NO sign there marking that there is no reentry.  Right.. Pretty sure I already told you that.  The manager explained the doors were locked apparently to keep people from the bar next door (or off the streets)  from entering the building.  Why couldn't they simply have a card scanner at the door to allow access to the floor for guests. Is it that much of a money saver to them to keep the doors locked?At any rate.  Thoroughly disappointed, disgusted and still a little wigged out about the feeling of being trapped in a stairway.  Not a great feelingThis place was terrific!!! Perfect parking the bike which was just around the corner of the door to the elevator.  We enjoyed the city too.Hotel has updated their entrance, but hallway carpet is dirty and worn.  And if your room is in the southeast side of the building be prepared to hear loud music and people partying until 3:00am - will not be staying again!I've stayed here several times for work (Hilton diamond member ya'll), and everything went swimmingly as far as hampton inns go. Except for this one time when some unmentionables were stolen. And a general manager who kept telling me I was at fault. And promises that were made for compensation that were reneged on. Do yourself a favor and if you need to stay loyal to Hilton for points purposes, stay at the Hilton garden inn two blocks away. As a SWF traveling for work, I wouldn't recommend this location to any other woman.
review_content_20: Did an overnight stay with a friend. The location is great! Every place we wanted to go to was within walking distance. Check in was quick and painless. The room was clean, comfortable, and beautiful. The property itself has a nice vintage theme which I think is chic and classy! The only downside was there is no parking garage, just a lot and valet parking I believe. We had our bikes on our car so I was more worried about the fact our bikes would have gotten stolen. We ended up parking in the parking garage across the street since we felt was going to be safer for our bikes. It was hard to sleep at night because the noise from the outside was extra loud which was surprising to me. Overall, I like Hampton Inn. They met my general needs.We stayed downtown for a function for my wife's work. They paid for the hotel room so I wasn't complaining. It's a nice place to stay downtown. It's within walking distance of most things. The rooms were a nice size for an older building converted to a hotel. The breakfast area on the second floor looked out onto downtown and had plenty of room. The only complaint would be the rooms, like most hotels, were a bit noisy.I have stayed at this Hampton several times. It's the best option for low cost downtown visits and you still get your HHonors points. It's nice being able to walk to the shopping, bars, restaurants, etc. without necessarily having to pay the Conrad prices.The hotel is in a historic building but is otherwise renovated and nothing notable. It's a room that gets the job done.I spent three nights at the Downtown Circle Center Hampton Inn while traveling for business, and was completely satisfied with my stay. My room on the fourth floor was clean, quiet and comfortable, though there was some street noise late Friday night.The hotel is in the process of updating the common areas on the second floor, but the work was minimally disruptive, and the workers were pleasant when I walked through to the fitness center (clean and well-appointed, if small) and the breakfast area. The continental breakfast exceeded my expectations: in addition to the usual breakfast starches, they had oatmeal with toppings, yogurt, fresh fruit, waffles, and hot offerings that changed each day.While a skywalk to the convention center/mall would have been nice, I was pleased with my choice and with the value the Hampton Inn provided.Stayed the weekend for a volleyball tournament.  Very friendly and helpful staff.
