Comfortable rooms and great location near everything in downtown Indy.we try to stay here every year for the Moto Gp race unfortunately we was unable to get a reservation last year so we had to stay at the Columbia Club. This place has the best location we have never had any problems at all with our reservations the staff is friendly and helpful cant wait to spend this year at the Hampton Inn. Thank YouJust an ok location downtown. Staff is not very attentive in my opinion. I probably won't be back with so many other options in the city.Stayed here four days for work. First my reservation was wrong then my bill was made out to the wrong person. When i asked to change it i was told to call the 800 number!?  Called the 800 number and they referred me back to the hotel who then transferred me to the hotel accountant who one week later still never bothered to call me back. There are so many other hotels close by, don't stay here.What a great place to stay! Wonderful breakfast selections, and an even more amazing staff. The location is perfect as well. One of the best places I have stayed in a long while.Convenient location, friendly staff, good "free" breakfast, comfortable bed.  We were able to walk to mini marathon, dining, shopping with no problems.  The valet parking is the only option, which kind of stinks, but it's a downtown hotel, so that is expected.Great location, great staff, clean rooms. I come here every year during the Indy 500 weekend. They've just remodeled their 2nd floor restaurant area...it looks nice. Apparently they are updating their lobby as well. Sure, this isn't a 5 star luxury hotel, but its perfect for your downtown stay. The rooms have an iron and ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, and work desk. The serve complimentary breakfast (your typical continental breakfast - breads such as toast and bagels, cream cheese, peanut butter, eggs, biscuits, gravy, cereal, etc...If you need an in room safe, you can get one through the front desk. And if your a light sleeper, request to be away from the major streets. Definitely give it a try, the staff make you feel right at home.We booked several rooms for our Indy 500 group and were mostly satisfied.The good; Sharon Cosby the group rezee person was way beyond helpful, she is who all customer service people should train under.  Can't say enough about her love and care re; her customers. The gratis breakfasts each morning. Staffed so that everthing is constantly replenished, and clean.The friendly front desk staff, bellman, and valet guys.  The location is awesome, 2 blocks from Monument Circle, 3 blocks from the Slippery Noodle, 1/2 block from 14 West, and within easy walking distance from a ton of other drinkin and eatin spots.The bad; 3 night minimum for Indy 500 weekend (all local hotels do the same).  Jacked up rates; $300+ per night for a tiny room. Hot tip for fellow oldsters; AARP gave a great discount of over $200, AAA was only $100.Other than that it was a good stay, and rather quiet for a downtown location.Water temperature was a big pain in the butt...scorching or freezing.  Two days in a row, I put my do not disturb sign on my door, only to find my room cleaned one day and the cleaner still in my room the other!  If there is one thing you should expect at a hotel, it's having the do not disturb sign respected.  What part of do not disturb do you not get?  ...creepy.  Also, I had to keep reattaching the toilet flusher handle thingy.  Anyways...helpful front desk and valet.  Clean rooms.  Walking distance to shopping and restaurants.We have stayed here three times on previous trips to Indy, both because of a convenient location and the packages that they offer with booking a stay. Valet parking is moderately priced and convenient. Each time we have stayed on different floors and even though one was by the elevator they were all quiet and clean. We have never utilized the free breakfast, but the area looks nice. We have gone down at night for drinks and snacks though. Elevators are quick, staff is great. Will stay again.This hotel is in a vintage building - the elevator lobby on the first floor has an ornate plastered ceiling and vintage "this car up" lights for the elevators.  We had two rooms reserved.  On the north side of the hall, the room with two double beds had a view of Maryland Street and the Hard Rock Cafe.  On the south side of the hall, the room with a king bed had a view of the valet parking lot and the brick wall of the building next door.  The south side room was small, had an odd odor and we couldn't get consistently hot water to take a shower.  The north side room was bigger, had no odor and no problem with the water at all.  We used the free Wi-Fi for directions and information during our stay.  The breakfasts were very nice with a good selection of hot foods, DIY waffles, oatmeal, cold cereals, fruit and juices, breakfast breads and good hot coffee.  Thank you to the lady at the front desk who gave us a map of downtown Indianapolis- it was very helpful!  24/7 coffee in the lobby and the snack shop for when I needed something cold to drink in the late evening.  This is a great location within walking distance of Bankers Life Fieldhouse and Monument Circle, and several interesting restaurants within just a couple of blocks.  Ask for a room with a north view.Had a good stay at this budget-friendly hotel. Free hot breakfast in the morning (with variety - one day had biscuits w/ sausage gravy; another had scrambled eggs with sausage and potatoes) with plenty of service and a great selection of eats.The rooms are a bit on the small side but feature flat screen tvs, free wi-fi, and comfortable beds. The downtown location is close to food, bars, sight-seeing, shopping and the football stadium.Nice hotel, friendly staff and awesome location. However this is the hottest hotel in the summer. The air conditioning in this place is severely lacking - be it hot hallways or uncomfortable rooms.  I have stayed here two years running, and have had the same problem in three separate rooms.  The front desk people and valet staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and they made an effort to have a "technician work on your air cooling problem" alas to no avail.  I just think the rooms are too big for the tiny air unit.  The breakfast is large but not tasty, and the workout room is pretty nice.  All in all, you pay for the great location, but not for lavish comfort.Worst stay. Nothing was working. Air vents were making noises. Hot water was almost non existent. Was forced outside when the fire drill went off and was told to stay outside in the snow without shoes. No hotel member came to tell us what was happening. Finally went inside without being told because everyone else was. When i addressed the situation with the Manager they said we would not have to pay and now we have a bill. Called to get it cleared up and the Manager said he would look into it and get back to me and he never did. Still waiting for that follow up phone call 5 days later..I really wasn't planning on staying here, but my room at the Sheraton had no heat. I checked out of that icebox, and used my Hilton Honors points at the last minute and drove up to the Hampton Inn approximately 2 hours before the Colts game. My room wasn't ready, but the bellman was very polite and offered to hold my luggage. The Front Desk staff were also very courteous and allowed me to "pre-check in" and offered to call my cell when my room was ready.Within maybe 30 minutes, the Front Desk Agent called and informed me that I had the green light to check in. Ironically, I was at the bar down the street, so I tabbed out and rushed into my room only to throw a Colts jersey on, defecate, and chug a beer. In my hurry, I did notice that the room was extremely clean and tidy. It was actually much cleaner than the room at the Sheraton.Upon my drunken return, I was very pleased with the comfy bed. I slept very well. This hotel is not a palace, but it was extremely clean, and the entire staff were very nice.I have no clue what this hotel normally costs, but it's in a great location, and I definitely wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.*Oh, and Valet parking was only $14.00. CHEAP!Just stayed here over the weekend for the MotoGP races. Good rates, clean, large rooms. Only negative thing I had is that the hallways are not airconditioned. Otherwise, their free breakfast was great, and their dining area was large with many tables. Plenty of hot water, cheap parking (for motorcycles anyhow) and friendly staff. When I asked for a rollout sleeper, they waived the $25 fee since I was a Hilton Honors member....I'll be back for sure next year! Free Wifi worked great too!
review_content_40: I travel to Indianapolis once a year for the Gen Con gaming convention.  This was my first time staying at the Hampton Inn.  I can't say that I was happy with the place.  I guess I shouldn't have had high expectations for the Hampton Inn, but it still did not meet my lowered expectations.  The front desk area could be due for a remodel.  The staff however was very nice and had a good attitude.  The hallways looked like I was back in my college dorm.  I'm pretty sure I got a non-smoking room but the room smelled like smoke.This wasn't the worst hotel I've ever stayed in but it was far from one of the better ones.I did check out the fitness center which was pretty well equipped and was a descent size compared to other hotel fitness centers.The only other saving grace was the free, hot breakfast buffet they provided for all the guests every morning.  There was a lot of variety and the service was good.The service was amazing!!!  Can't say a bad thing about this  hotel.  Everything was in walking distance and the staff knew where to recommend!  Beds comfy.  Breakfast was varied and everyone smiled.  If in Indy, it's the must!  Inexpensive rates with a staff that has 5 star attitude!Your average Hampton.  Good location near shopping, Lucas oil Stadium, restaurants.  OK pricing with paid parking.  clean and friendly service.

hotel_name: Sheraton Indianapolis Hotel at Keystone Crossing
review_content: There are enough people from my project team staying here that we've got a decent negotiated rate, which definitely helps how I feel about this Sheraton. But I should also say that this is one of the nicer Starwood properties I've stayed at, when you factor in price, what you're getting, service, etc. Anyone reading my other angry Starwood reviews knows I think they're not worth the price, but this Sheraton seems to buck the trend (again, partially due to that negotiated rate). Key to my enjoyment is the presence of fitted sheets, which is an absolute delight after all those wrinkly sheets at other properties (or even sheets that don't fit - you hear me, Sheraton Seattle?). But in general, the rooms are good size, comfortable, beds are fine. The comforters/sheets in general are nice and heavy, which I like - turn down the temp and snuggle up under the blankets, and I sleep like a baby. On the downside, the bathrooms could use an update, but they work fine - and there is bathroom ventilation! Awesome! The entry and bathroom are pretty dark - the entry is where the closet is, and it's so dark that even with the "entry light" and the bathroom lights on, I can still barely see what I'm digging out of the closet. I don't know if this is just a function of energy saver bulbs or what, but it's happened in a couple rooms so far. WiFi is decently fast, but I'm getting the "premium" speed as a function of either my status or my credit card - the "standard" might not be so good. Not sure.Their club lounge is nice, with a small cold breakfast spread and a couple hot options like oatmeal, plus some hors d'oeuvres in the evenings. All I need for breakfast is some yogurt and a coffee, which this provides nicely, and if you just wanted a snack for dinner, that lounge would probably fit the bill. The downside is that the lounge smells very badly of a smoker's lounge...and it hits you as soon as you get off the elevator. We've mentioned this to the hotel, and I think they recently replace the carpet, but that smell is still there. I'm not really deducting points, just...something to mention.I think I have something like 18 future reservations here for this project. So obviously I was hoping when I started that this would be a "good" Starwood, and so far, it has been. Totally content.I've used the Sheraton for several local meetings and have a great rapport with the staff. There are a number of options for meetings and a staff that goes above to ensure all needs are met. Their catering provides creative menus, bartending staff and fun displays to meet your needs. I most recently had the opportunity to taste a sampling of their menu; BBQ and chicken sliders, Caprese salads in a small Mason Jar, heavenly mac & cheese, chinese noodles with salmon & a springroll, cake pops and a mini dessert in a jar. Everything surpassed my expectations!If you're looking for suggestions to add fun to your meeting, their event planner can assist you with everything from Team Building, Casino fun with Blackjack and Roulette, Wellness with Oxygen bars and massages - just ask for some help. Above and Beyond transportation services is located on site and can assist with group outings around the city or out to a local restaurant. Call Greg Tucker to schedule a tour of their meeting space and rooms for your next event!I really hate giving a 2 star review. Especially for a hotel that has good location and nice beds. The location you know before you booked so it doesn't really count. I prefer staying here over in downtown due to free parking. It's not like you can walk anywhere in Indy anyway. The good quality bed is also a given as its starwood chain and everyone has the heavenly bed. Putting all the good things aside, this hotel is just terrible. 1. Horrible sound proofing. On Saturday morning I was waken up by a family of 2 super young kids. I could hear the whole conversation between the family members starting from 6 am. I have then requested to move room, which they did. Unfortunately the sound didn't get much better. Every time if someone opens and closes their door, the floor shakes. Coming from LA I can easily think earthquake followed me here. 2. No restaurant - the restaurant is almost non existent. They have some tables and you order from the bar. No real server for the restaurant. The tables are dirty and no one cleaned it all night. Dinner is average 30 bucks per entree. The service and quality does not match. 3. Terrible service- they were supposed to switch the room for us. Not only did it not happen, they said we are too busy so why don't you go it yourself (after I gave them a 6 hour window). Super bummed cos I like the location. As an SPG preferred member and I got such service. I am staying elsewhere.I stayed for 5 nights while attending a work function. The hotel is nice in appearance and the hotel staff is nice however, the walls are paper thin. You can hear every word said by your neighbor. The breakfast bar was good and had a decent selection and the waitresses in the am where awesome. The bar / restaurant in the evening is a whole different story. The food is over priced and not very good and the service was HORRIBLE!!! The bar server is also the waitress, she is not friendly and did not seem to care that you where there. Both times we had dinner there we waited 2 hours and had to get up and ask for service, utensils, finish ordering and to be cashed out. I would recommend wasting your time or money at the bar / restaurant... Cheesecake Factory is in the same mall/ area as well as other places. I did like that we received $5 rewards for each night we did not use the maid service. The stay overall was okay but not much more than that.Front desk is nice...when you can find a person. The pods stand empty...and this was a reality upon check-in at 3:30 PM (when I arrived) and reservation "casualy" stepped out from behind the safety wall. And they were consistently absent at 8:30 PM, when I returned to the hotel and again at 6:30 AM, when I tried (to no avail) to find someone to give my laundry. I finally found a person at 7:20 AM.Room is nice...that is a plus. Restaurant prices are beyond high (and I worked in hotels for 15 years). And service is all-in-all suspect. After several nights in this hotel, I was wondering where the value is here. excessively high, 5-star prices for a 3-star hotel, in all honesty. And the third star is earned for location, not product.Wonderful experience, most amazingly comfortable beds.Nice hotel with a modern look. Love that it's connected to a nice mall too. I stayed at the corner on the 9th floor and was happy with the cleanliness and appearance of the room. It even had posters of race cars on the wall, which was fitting. Parking is free at the parking garage, and it has a covered walkway to the hotel. Yes, there is free wifi only at the lobby. Most of the staff are friendly. For $160 a night, it's decent. I'm docking a star because of the visible construction in the lobby, the fact that the hot water doesn't last for more than a minute, and because I was sleeping and woke up abruptly to a loud knock from unannounced room service who came to the wrong room. Other than that, I plan to come back.Edit: I'm back and I really like it. I got a larger room facing the lake on the 9th floor close to my previous room, and it's nice to come back after a long day to see it. Hot water is not an issue in this room, which has a tub instead of just the stand up shower like the other one had. I found out the pool and fitness center are on level 3. Construction is gone, and everything else is just great. Mall access is one of the best things. Quick note though--I can hear my neighbors conversations. Paper walls?Walk-around: youtube.com/watch?v=qiq7...Clean and comfortable, but what stands out the most is the staff is amazing!! We come every other month to get away from our small college town, to shop and to eat. The club lounge has a simple free breakfast, all day coffee/snacks, and eveningHors d'oeuvres (if you're an SPG member or booking a club floor room). There is direct access from inside to the mall and a Starbucks downstairs. Your basic needs are pretty much met. A spa or kids club would be a great addition. But again, it's the staff and location that keep me coming back. My kids got really sick from a PF Chang's nearby and the staff brought towels and kept checking in with me to see if I needed anything. Now THAT'S serviceIn town for one night for business and while I usually stay downtown, this location isn't bad. Great choices nearby for dinner. Did not eat at the hotel, but did grab a ginger ale at the bar. service was "okay" but not impressive. Would I return? I'd consider it.This hotel is actually quite nice, if you can get past the location (on the outskirts of Indy next to a mall.) That said, there are lots of things to like about this hotel including free parking, indoor pool, spacious lobby with lots of seating and power for charging.The mall next door can be seen as a plus since it's got food options and a nice landmark cinema, of course you're no where near any of Indy's attractions, those requiring a drive to get to.Our room was billed as a king "corner" room, though the corner was one window on an angled wall, so the room as more trapezoidal, but it was plenty big with a comfy king bed, desk, flat-screen TV and coffee maker as well as ample drawers and closet space. The bathroom was huge, with a big expanse of counter space, and a huge shower. The best part of the room by far was the shower which had incredibly good water pressure, and an actually functional shower massage (when have you ever seen these work?) as well as a spray wand.The downsides of the room were:- AC just couldn't cool the room down, so it was hot the first night (we think this is a fault with the HVAC system - as the first night it couldn't keep up, but the 2nd night when the hotel was not full, it was fine.)- The fan in the bathroom sounded like a jet engine. Not relaxing!- No fridge in the room.- no free wifi- the hallway and rooms smelled strongly of chlorine (from the pool?)But all in all, the place was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the amenities were all there, which is as much as you can as for in a hotel.Mediocre hotel, bathrooms are dated and lighting is bad. Staff is nice, beds are comfy and overall room is good. However this hotel is located near a Champs bar and often has issues with the noise from the bands at Champs bar. For example, right now it's 11:15pm on a Sunday night and the drums/music from the bar nearby are so loud I can't sleep. I'm on the 10th floor and the staff at the front said that hopefully the band stops soon. They said people complain often and they are sorry, I understand it's not their fault and there's nothing they can do but I have a full work day tomorrow and need sleep. I will find a new hotel for my business trips to Indy. This one was great due to its convenience to upscale shipping and restaurants but there's others nearby that are farther from Champs and hopefully quiet at this time of night.As a long term platinum of Starwoods, I have to say this hotel is Not worthy of the brand. From the time I registered where I was greeted by a grumpy registration hostess, to a room that had flying bugs (yes!) there was really little that is worthy of the Starwoods brand. Sorry folks, but this is not a hotel I would ever stay at again.This is a nice large hotel with parking in the back or in a deck for free. It's located near a mall ( with a walkway) which is nice. My room was clean and check in was okay (just took a while). There was a lot of events going on when I arrived- sports team game, wedding, graduations, some conference, etc. the hotel was quiet where I stayed despite the amount of people in and out. The fitness center was nice with towels, water, and cool towels. My only concerns about that area is ventilation and cleanliness. They have no wipes to wipe down the machines before and/or after use. I'm not sure how often people come to clean it but there were towels left on machines..... I was surprised. That's so unsanitary! The key cards for the elevator are unique. I see the safety of them only allowing you to go to the main floor and the floor where your room is, but people loose their cards and people have guests. You can't go down on the elevator without a card.Even if you are a gold member your not going to get anything special. Otherwise expect your bare basic!!Better than your normal Sheraton location, in fact, it is more comparable to the Westin class of hotels in the Starwood family than the typical Sheraton. Large spacious lobby with 2 story ceiling, small shops adjoining, and escalators to the 2nd floor meeting rooms and walkway to the adjoining upscale mall are what you see when you first enter from the door off the u shaped driveway. Parking garage across the street also has walkway to 2nd floor, making it super nice in bad weather. Rooms were clean, but not overly large. Standard heavenly beds were standardly great. We enjoyed the preferred members evening hors d' oeuvres and drinks as well as the early morning breakfast at same location. If you are a member, it is worth popping in for.Do not sleep on them. If you are looking for a hotel in the Keystone area, this is your place. GREAT service, nice amenties (fitness, free garage self parking, a restaurant and bar, indoor pool and hot tub, conference rooms, large lobby area, room service and computers for guests to use). It is connected to the Keystone office building and the shopping mall. I was working in the building next door so it was a short walk using the corridor on the third floor without going outside. The room was well insulated, the bed was comfy, the sofa was a nice touch and the toiletries were of good quality.Here's another reason this place is great. I booked my reservation through a third party and for some reason, the reservation was not showing in their system. The manager Courtney went out of her way to see that I was checked in as soon as possible. The desk agent (whose name I do not remember) was also a rare find. He seemed to take great pride in his work and I witnessed his interactions with several guests while I waited for my matter to be resolved and I was very impressed. Gold star for Sheraton Keystone.Miserable Experience - Terrible customer service.Brought a team for a soccer showcase because the location is great.Too bad management & front desk staff are appallingly awful.Don't spend your money here unless you enjoy paying forRude & Condescending. Do yourself a favor and stay at JW Marriott.More like 2.5 but it was comfortable. I can't testify to a lot of things about this hotel, cause I spent most of my stay here, in bed with an upset stomach. No free wifi is really quite ridiculous and unforgivable in today's society, hubby had to work (I was sick so he may as well work, right?) so not only do I begrudge PAYING for internet, I get p*ssed when it's painfully slow.My beef, is with the room service, high price already +++ = a $23 turkey club sandwich. Are you freakin kidding me? $23 for a SANDWICH?!?!?!?! omg. I asked for no mayo, so they gave me a bone dry sandwich to boot, not even some butter, I had to guzzle water to make the stupid sandwich go down and my fries were cold. Having to use a card to use the elevator, is a total nightmare, esp when you have guests there who aren't staying in-house and who don't have a key-card. PAIN.Our room was also really loud, like we were staying half a mile away from an airport, was it the elevators making noise? a parking garage? I have no idea, we couldn't figure it out, as such, sleep quality was poor. I'm sure there's better places for the same money in the area, I was so disappointed with the Sheraton, it's got a reputation that it really didn't live up to!BRIDES, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL! Very unorganized and unprofessional people working there. The event coordinating team there will tell you things in person just to change it right before your event. I'm left with out a hotel, a location for my rehearsal dinner and now have to scramble to make things work 6 weeks before the wedding. This is due to Sheraton firer the girl I had been working with and NOT HONORING WHAT she had told US...... At first I had another plan for the Sheraton I was going to do an after party and breakfast there. But then 6 months later from signing the argument, (a year before the wedding) we changed it to a rehearsal dinner..they had no record of the changes! but assured me they would fix this.........The next morning after they said they would "probably just throw in our suit due to the mix up" we got an EMAIL from them, they didn't even have the decency to call! The head of the coordinating team says we are basically OUT OF LUCK! They wouldn't work with us!! And said we could do what our contract stated (which should have been changed 6months prior) or we could redue it but not get what we had asked from months ago. I had 5 meetings with them and this girl promised that everything would be fine and to get back with her a couple months before the wedding to decide our food. SHE LIED! EVERYTHING ISN'T FINE! Huge let down! Please SAVE yourself the tears, and TIME! DONT EVEN CONSIDER THE SHERATON. It looks great BUT has HORRIBLE people working there! Just go downtown! Or use a Marriott! I will NEVER stay in a Sheraton again, they don't VALUE YOU. Absolutely NO customer service!This isn't worth the chance!!! The Sheraton's looks are very deceiving. On the outside it looks great. But on the inside,......a bunch of monkeys could run the place better!I attended a convention here two weeks ago. The facility is beautiful, convenient, and has free garage parking. My friends who stayed there had compliments on their rooms, especially the twelfth floor with free drinks and food.Located in a fantastic shopping mall, there was plenty to do without a car, and plenty of good restaurants within walking distance.
review_content_20: I am so so so disappointed in this hotel. I can't believe this is a four star hotel. I feel like I'm in a motel 6. The hotels don't have working air conditioner. I have the thermostat set at 66 and its 76 degrees in there. Can't sleep at all. The night desk manager is so so so so mean and grumpy. The doors in the are all marked up. We found dirty old pretzels under the bed. I feel gross and dirty and tired in there. I do not recommend this hotel at all. Kind of ruining my vacation because every one is tired and grumpy around me and I'm only sleeping like 2-4 hours a night.I don't really leave too many reviews for hotels. They are a place to close my eyes and wake up several hours later. I don't do conferences, and when on vacation my type of vacation includes spending as little time in my hotel as possible. So in short: I don't value hotels that much beside the obvious; cleanliness, class and comfort. The reason I figured I'd leave one for this Sheraton is because I genuinely enjoyed my short stay (7/27/13) and I will rebook next time we are in town. The hotel is nicely (re) decorated, and has an overall very updated, modern look. I don't know how long ago the run-down pictures were taken here in the photo section, but they do not represent this hotel well at all.The beds (per usual with this chain) are plush and amazing. Soft, thick bedding and a mattress that manages to be firm and impossibly soft made me not want to get up.The shower has good pressure and we never experienced hot water issues. All was fine. The only thing I thought was odd was the lack of places to put shampoo, etc. I guess you can place these on the small raised ledge off of the floor, but eh - I'd rather not. Whiners gonna whine, though (trust me, I will always find something to complain about).This is our "go-to" hotel in Indy.I have been both for business and pleasure and had great experiences each time. We usually stay on the Club Level and the rooms are comfortable, spacious and quiet. The Club Lounge here is A+ for service and offerings. A lot of Club Lounges charge for beer and wine in the evenings but here it is complimentary which we, of course, love. I have to give a shout out to Tamera who works in the Club Lounge in the evening- she is an AMAZING addition to their staff. She goes above and beyond to make sure you feel at home. The front desk staff is helpful and does their best to resolve any issues quickly. The workout room is top-notch, clean as a whistle and even has refrigerated cold towels... fancy! The pool was filled with kids the whole weekend we were there recently so that wasn't ideal, but around 2 on Sunday they had left and we were able to use the pool and hot tub (which fits about 15 people- it's HUGE) kid-free. You really can't beat the location. We traipsed all around the city this past weekend and never felt like we were too far from the hotel. Not to mention that the hotel is located within a 5 minute drive of several great places to eat, as well as a mall to wander around in if you get bored. As for parking, you can park in the garage behind the building for free so no need to worry about daily parking fees!I do agree that they need a little more signage as we had a hard time finding our way to the mall the last time I was there, but overall this is a really great hotel to stay at in Indy.I won't stay there again. Almost $200 after taxes and then they want to charge $10.00 to have Internet in the room. It's only free in the lobby. Nope, they have gotten enough from me. Room is not the cleanest and there is hair on the bed that isn't mine! You can also hear TV's and talking through the walls!I've stayed at many hotels that are as nice or nicer than this for half the money and they offer totally FREE internet!! Screw you Sheraton!!My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night. When we got to our room at around 12:02 a.m., we called to see if we could still get room service, and they said no. I understand it was technically after midnight, but I was quite upset that they wouldn't make a small exception being our wedding night. We were also supposed to receive strawberries and champagne, which were accidentally placed in our friends' room on another floor. Our suite was nice, however I couldn't seem to shake the fact that, on someone's wedding night, some consideration and higher service wasn't provided. Very disappointing for us on what was supposed to be one of the best nights of our lives. I will not be staying here again.Pleasantly surprised by this Sheraton. Pleasant check-in experience and the room was large, clean and comfortable. I paid a little extra for a room on the club level and thought it was well worth it because of the free wi-fi and access to the club lounge (free happy hour and free breakfast). My room was very near the elevators, ice machine, and club lounge so I was a little worried about noise, but it was actually very quiet inside the room.The bed was very comfortable and I got a great night's sleep. The tile in the bathtub looked old, but the rest of the room and bathroom seem to have been recently renovated. I was a little disappointed that the club lounge "happy hour" started about a half hour later than promised, but the appetizers were pretty good (cut veggies, chips & salsa, hot potato puffs) although the white wine was undrinkable. Breakfast was surprisingly good--full hot & cold buffet (eggs, breakfast meats, cereal, yogurt & fresh berries, breakfast breads, etc.).My receipt was emailed directly to me and I could check out via the TV so that part was very easy. I was there for business, but the location is also great for shopping at the adjacent Keystone Crossing mall and walk-able to several good restaurants as well. Overall, a great experience and will definitely stay there again.The good- service was friendly and the location good. The bad- Slow elevators, no hot water, not giving us the room we reserved. Overpriced breakfast buffet. $10 for wi-fi in your room, but free in lobby. Faulty electrical plugs in room. Loudest bedding in the world - everytime someone moved it sounded like they were sleeping on wrapping paper. Squeaky bathroom door. Doorstop for door between rooms didn't work- one falling down, the other not holding door.Other than that, it was ok???I hate to write a poor review. I will give a few pros before I list the reasons why I was so upset with my stay. The beds (if I had a chance to sleep in them) Where extremely comfortable. The location is fantastic and I love being near shopping and so many restaurant options. As a SPG member and a frequent traveler with a company that has 700 employees (many of whom travel to this city frequently) I expected much better service. This was my second time staying in this hotel and this experience was worse then the first. At least the first time I was able to enjoy my bed, however the toilet in the restroom was running when I checked in my first time and it took 8 hours to fix it. The dinning in the hotel is seating outside of the bar and the staff is nonexistent. During my recent stay at the this hotel the fire alarm and emergency warnings went off at 1:15 am. We were told to evacuate the building using the stairs to the fire exits. When I left my room the hall was filled with white clouds and a terrible taste. Many of the people on my floor where panicked as we believed there was a fire. In the stairwells several disabled people had trouble getting down the stairs. I had stayed on the 5th floor and during my decent stopped to check on several people who where having trouble getting down the stairs. Several concerned guests helped these people get out of the building. We did not see one staff member directing or attempting to help anyone. It was a very cold night and we were all standing outside freezing. We noticed several people sitting around in the lobby. One of us went back in to find out why half of us where outside in the cold and the others where staying inside while the fire alarms and emergency evacuation message was still going off and the fire department was inside. I was told by another guest that other guests were saying that there was no fire and they believed someone pulled the fire extinguisher and sprayed it up and down one of the halls. Only one gentleman was at the front desk and he was doing his best to answer questions but he did not know what was going on. I did not see any other staff for at least 20 minutes. During this ordeal not one staff member told us what was going on or if we should be inside or outside. Several guests stayed outside in the cold. After about 40 minutes there was an announcement that guests could return to their rooms unless they were on the 5th floor. 5th floor guests needed to go to the front desk for instructions. Once again, nobody was told what actually had happened or what was being done about it. My fellow guest on the 5th floor where only told that our rooms could not be accessed until they cleared out the halls. We were never told what had happened or why the halls needed to be cleared. In the mean time, it took another 20 - 30 minutes for the elevators to be turned back on or for other guests to be able to get to rooms by stairs past the 3rd floor. In the mean time all of us lucky to be on the 5th floor got to stand in line to be told that we could wait to get to our rooms or switch rooms. A few people took refunds and immediately left. We were still not told what was wrong and when we could get our belongings. A while later we were allowed to go to our floor to check out our rooms. There was still white clouds from the fire extinguishers in the hall. Most of the walls, carpet and doors where covered in white "dust" and it was very difficult to breathe. I had to go back to the lobby right away as I have asthma and could not stay on that floor. When I went back down the 1 employee at the desk was working very hard to accommodate as many people as he could. We were told they still needed to bring the fans up to clear the halls but he did not know when that would be or how long it would take. Several guests complained that they wanted a new room and that they did not want to be billed for this stay. I as well as the crowd around me heard the staff member say that the credit cards where not processed until morning and we would only be charged for incidentals. By 3:30 I was finally in another room to sleep, however I was unable to access my room until the next morning because the fan pushing the smoke out was blocking the hall and I could not breathe anyway. To my surprise, my credit card was charged for the room and I was not given a credit as promised. This hotel needs to work on a better Emergency/disaster plan as well as their communication skills. The staff and guests need to be informed of what has happened and what is being done or what was done to resolve the issue. Many of my colleagues have also had bad experiences here. I am all for second chances but this was my second stay after a not so pleasant first one and this one was worse than the last. I am very displeased with the service here.Located next to the Fashion Mall and just down the road apiece from Castleton Square Mall, so there are lots of shopping and dining options nearby. The guest floors are accessible only via room key for added security, although the area is not unsafe. The lobby/bar area is huge with several big screen TVs. A coffee bar is also located there. The food I had during a conference stay was extremely good for that kind of thing. There is a free parking garage with an enclosed overhead walkway to the hotel. Overall just a great place to stay.I don't usually stay in Starwood properties (I'm Diamond level with Hilton, so I just get more upgrades/amenities/stuff when I stay there), but stayed at this particular one this week for a training course I was taking. I wish Yelp offered the ability to rate with 1/2 stars, because my experience here wasn't quite as bad as "Meh. I've experienced better", but definitely not "A-OK". The lobby and other parts of the ground floor are well kept and attractive. Getting from the front desk to the elevators requires a bit of a road map, though and you may want to pack a sandwich if you're arriving anytime after 4PM and actually expect the check-in process to be swift. When I arrived (~ 5PM Monday), the line at reception was at least 10 people long and, although they had four stations at the counter, only two were opened. I've returned to the hotel both Tuesday and Wednesday and saw the same thing. I'd imagine a short review of some simple data would tell this place to have a couple more people doing check in at these times? There's not many things that are more annoying to a weary business traveler than having to wait in line 15 minutes to check into your hotel.The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, but I fear the room may have been designed by a mental patient on a weekend pass. Given the massive square footage of the place, I was really surprised to have the closet door placed so as to interfere with opening the room door and a big wall right in front of me when I walked into the room, requiring me to snake around it with my bag to get to the "actual room". The Executive Lounge was well setup and appointed (albeit blasting Fox News so loud I thought I'd entered into Michelle Bachmann's head). I was really surprised to be told that, as I Starwood Gold member, I'd still need to upgrade my room to get access to the Lounge...THAT was particularly annoying.My biggest "challenge" while I was at the hotel was that they managed to lose my laundry and it took them about 2 hours to find it and get it to me, all while I'm trying to get ready and out the door for my meetings. I started to get really frustrated after an hour or so when, after being told I'd "hear right back" from them, no one called and I had to reach out to find out what was going on. Thankfully the staff was very nice during the process (as they've been about just about everything) and were clearly concerned about making the situation right.Overall....it would appear there are a lot of hotel choices in this area. You might want to do yourself a favor and consider some of the other options.Ask me on my first stay I would say a 5!!!! But over the course of staying when a problem arises depending on who you speak to it may be handled poorly. Also they will sneak charges in on you that you are entitled to through SPG. One time is an accident a few times is ridiculous. If you don't care about handling of concerns this hotel will be great. And the lady in the club lounge at night is the nicest person ever.First time in Indy and I got to stay at this lovely hotel. The beds were to die for, I never wanted to wake up! The service was excellent as well. I was here for a conference and we couldn't have had a better experience. I will definitely choose this hotel for my future visits and it was conveniently located to tons of restaurants and shopping!Stayed there this past week for a business trip to Indy, and it was an enjoyable experience. I was surprised to see this place rated so poorly.As a Starwood Platinum member, I was placed on a SPG Preferred Guest floor (Floor 10) and in Room 1009. I could tell the room had been recently updated-- The bedding was very new looking, flatscreen TV, tasteful decorations nodding to the Indianapolis 500, and the bathroom was spotless. Why was everything so new and awesome looking? Did someone die in here? I hope not.TV and Desk Area: yelp.com/biz_photos/I2Yt...Wall Decor: yelp.com/biz_photos/I2Yt...Restroom: yelp.com/biz_photos/I2Yt...The hotel hairdryer was broken (yelp.com/biz_photos/I2Yt...) when I arrived, but they were quick to send someone up to replace it. They also threw in some complimentary toothpaste... uhh, thanks? The bathroom also had a complimentary loofah. Maybe only ladies can appreciate it, but it's nice to have (unless you travel with your loofah, which is just weird). yelp.com/biz_photos/I2Yt...Wireless wasn't free which is kind of a drag. Parking, however, was free if you skipped valet and did it yourself (and it's really close to an entrance point/the lobby).Bartender was nice and friendly. As a decent looking woman traveling alone, you are bound to have unexpected "company" join you if you're at a hotel bar looking to kill some time between check-in and dinner. The first night, I saddled up to the bar around 5PM... The bartender and I chatted a little bit, he hooked me up with a drink, and then he noticed a little while later that I was getting intensely hit on by a creepy dude at least 35 years my senior. Maybe my body language was a big enough cue, or the fact that the guy was yelling, "SINCE WHEN DO ENGINEERS HAVE SUCH GREAT RACKS?" (thanks, btw) because the bartender came over and said, "Hey buddy, lay off or I'm going to ask you to leave." NICE. I like you, bartender. Pour me another.The hotel is connected to the mall, which is nice for safety and other reasons (like forgetting to pack a jacket, whoops). Lots of restaurants inside. I wish there was better signage about where the hotel pass-through is if you're coming from INSIDE the mall... I got a little lost trying to get back to the Sheraton because there wasn't really much except for two white double-doors. yelp.com/biz_photos/I2Yt...I posted some pics of this place to hopefully combat the gross ones.This is the best hotel in northern Indianapolis. The hallways just barely smell like wet dog. The air conditioners squeak sometimes. The staff is very nice. The bar hours are short. The people who stay there are old.I booked this hotel last minute through Priceline at a great rate. My wife and I arrived very late on a night in early May - after 1am - due to a long drive from Tennessee on our way home. When checking in, the lobby is amazing. Shiny, new, modern. Good feelings happening. The guy running the front desk, I think his name tag said he was the front desk leader/supervisor to that effect told us he "upgraded" us to a suite. Our suite was located in the 2nd tower, the tower the lobby is not located in. As we were dragging our luggage clear across town to get to the other tower, we noticed the change in decor. Gone was the shiny modern look and in came an average, somewhat dated looking atmosphere. When we got to our room, we could see that it was technically a suite, however, this tower was apparantly not part of the "$17 million renovation" the hotel boasts on its website. This room was tired. Old worn-out 1980's furniture, CRT televisions - heck, even the mini-fridge had fake wood paneling on the front. Now you know you haven't seen that since 1987!Now I will concede that the room was spacious and clean, which says a lot when you are going for the cheap. There was a living room, which included a sofa, some chairs, a desk, and a bar area with bar sink and the mini-fridge. The bed was in a separate bedroom and was comfortable. I was a bit worried the bed was as old as everything else, but it seemed the mattress had to have been replaced at some point. The room was cold so we had to turn on the heat in the bedroom, which smelled for awhile. Maybe it hadn't been used recently.Perhaps they reserve these rooms for people who Priceline a 3.5 star hotel at the last minute for $60 a night. But this really feels like two different hotels - one 3.5 stars and one 2.5 stars. If you find yourself booked in this hotel, whether by choice or by chance, do yourself a favor and turn down the "upgrade" and specifically ask for a remodeled non-upgraded room. Hopefully you'll be luckier than we were.Parking is free in a garage next door, but is is no where near the front desk for checking in and out. Wi-fi in the room is not free, but there are nice computers you can use in the lobby for free.Might have given 3-4 stars if we had a renovated room, but had to deduct for the outdated everything and that they charge for wi-fi.I was here for a furry convention. The staff was friendly and accommodating. However for our event they applied odd stipulations and rules. People in costume for example couldn't be in the lobby unless there was 110 of us doing it or it was 6pm. It was really small and the key for the elevator deal was kind of a annoyance. I think our convention could benefit from a change in location. But otherwise this is a decent hotel if you are visiting family or on vacation not so much for big conventions.I love the fact that this hotel is connected to the mall. If you're new around the area, you have access to the restaurants surrounding and in the middle of a business district. Parking is free and valet is also an option. Being an SPG member, I stayed in one of their club rooms. I was able to get free internet, free hot breakfast and free afternoon cocktail and some light snacks. There's free bottled water, coffee, fruit and granola 24/7 in their club lounge. The rooms are clean and bed is comfortable. The room was tastefully decorated with Indy 500 cars and the flatscreen tv is always convenient for my late night comedy shows. Call the 1800 number for Sheraton directly to get a better rate rather than booking this online. If you have AAA membership, mention that. Ask if your company has a corporate rate so you can even save more.Stayed here 2 weeks ago and it was really great. Would definitely recommend. Love the Wifi in the lobby and the computers. Would be nice to have free wifi in the rooms.So based on our first experience here we were eager to go back so we did... This hotel always has the nicest associates but this time the hotel roon standards were not good...We were in room 1207 yesterday ...when we walked in the room really smelled like chlorine from pool. so we left and came back late in evening..our toilet had black stuff under the rim..pink mold on shower tile with mildew scumon all shower hardware yuk! We actually called downstairs at 1100 pm to have sheets changed in one of the beds because they were soiled including bed skirt and not from us. At about 1 am we realized our air wasn't working correctly but we were too tired to do anything about it...The next day I went down to front desk to talk about this I was given 1,000 extra points on my card for my "incident"... I'm sorry but this room with tax was 180.00 and I really felt ripped off on the Sheraton standard....I was really disappointed and grossed out. That's a shame because it is a beautiful property..I stayed here for only 1 night and so far so good...whats nice about this location is that it's literally connected to a high end mall....Also with in walking distance of the hotel is about 20-30 great restaurants!!! The lobby was nice, Starbucks actually had complimentary hot apple cider for you when you walked in from the cold....The rooms were actually like mini suites with a separate sitting area. Very clean. The beds were just like their sister chain "The Westin"!!! Very comfortable!!!! All and all, I'd definitely stay here again!!!
review_content_40: Truly. Truly this is one of the worst, most run-down, old, dirty and disgusting hotels I've stayed in, in YEARS. Honestly I cannot recall seeing a hotel in this much need of restoration and cleaning and general REPAIRING for as long as I can remember. Normally, we stay at Hyatts or Hilton properties for business trips. A Marriott occasionally. I never would think to ask our travel person to book a Sheraton and, after visiting this property, I will NEVER EVER STAY at a Sheraton. Tomorrow I'm going to shoot video and take pictures- as I feel it would almost be unbelievable if I type up how awful it is. Every single area is shouting out: "I'm an old hotel! I need to be fixed, I need to be painted, I need to be dry-walled, I need new furniture, I need to be ironed, I need a new tub, I need a vent cover...." etc. I keep walking down the halls looking at the worn torn carpet, the beat up dented scratched walls and wondering, was there a tornado here last night? It's that bad. My room is clearly missing some furniture, some vent covers and it feels like they slapped two beds in an office. I honestly feel uncomfortable sleeping in the beds.....I recall years ago when I worked for a startup company we really had to watch our travel expenses. I would book Best Western hotels or sometimes Comfort Suites. I'd consider those hotels to be a 3-star hotel, just for comparison-sake. Literally- any BW or Comfort Suites was 200X better than this hotel. I'm appalled and plan to call corporate on this hotel and send them all the visuals I take. I will post the pictures later- but save yourself, don't stay here!! Seriously.I just stayed at the Sheraton at Keystone at the Crossing the past two nights as part of a new job and relocation process.The lobby was clean and modern and all of my dealings with the counter at check-in time were good -- very friendly and professional. I didn't take advantage of the valet parking and just parked in back of the building.The room itself was OK and the bedding was comfortable. There was a 42" plasma TV which carried NFL Network (a must-have for me now that the season is in full swing). Hot water was always available. Ice and vending machines were right down the hall. The hotel walls were your typical paper thin variety, so expect to hear your neighbors' alarm clocks and whatnot.Wi-FI was available in the room for a fee but was reliable and speedy in my experience. I did not use any of the business center facilities in the lobby.The only complaints I had about my stay here were that my fourth-floor room was apparently located almost directly over some kind of a party/conference room.... on my second night there, there was a good deal of loud yelling and laughing sounds coming from below. Also, I didn't receive additional bath soap on my second day.I ordered room service both nights and the food was very good. On the second night, they screwed up my order by sending it to the wrong room... when I called down after an hour to find out what was going on, they admitted their mistake and redirected the meal to my room free of charge.There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and even more within a short drive.Overall, I recommend the Sheraton Keystone... I realize that hotel chains tend to give their non-frequent guests the crappier rooms in the hotel, so you might want to book something above the fourth floor. Other than that, it's a good place to stay although a little pricy.Another TREMENDOUS experience at this hotel!!!  We stayed off and on last year for around 3 weeks while conducting business in Indianapolis and loved the hotel and the associates that work there so we were very excited to return this year on business and spent a week there in October.  Being Starwood Platinum members we got a jr suite next door to the club lounge on the 12th floor where we got free breakfasts and appetizers and drinks every day!! Tamara, Maryann and James made us feel so welcome in the club lounge and Kiana and the restaurant staff took great care of us as well!! It was like  coming home to see all our dear friends at this great hotel! We also LOVE the connecting covered walkway that connects to the newly remodeled fashion mall next door where we spent a lot of "quality" time in our favorite shops (Nordstroms, The Walking Store, etc).  We hope to be back in January to enjoy this great hotel once more!Not all Sheratons are built equally. This one is one of the better ones.Attached garage is great, rooms are large and comfortable and staff has been great.Menu is longer and more high quality that the average Sheraton, and the club lounge goes further than average with cocktails and breakfast.Great location and I like that it is attached to the mall, however finding your way around can be extremely difficult.  Having more signage would be a huge plus for this hotel.  The staff, however, was extremely friendly.  At the little coffee cafe I ordered soy to go into my coffee, however they do not carry soy.  It just so happened that one of the ladies uses soy for her coffee and had some in the back and she offered some to me.  Being the trusting and non-germaphobe person that I am, I gladly excepted and enjoyed my coffee just how I love it.  Any staff that goes above and beyond like that definitely deserves recognition!Okay.  I'm going to try and keep this simple:For a hotel of this size, nameplate and cost per room this hotel is a complete failure.  Approaching the hotel, it looks pretty modern and nice.  It's next to what seems like a high-end mall for the WASPy suburbanite inside of you but if you don't use the valet, you have to drive around to the back B-level entrance where you get all the charm of a hospital emergency room.  The lobby is pretty nice and the staff were pleasant and helpful.  Like other reviewers they dropped the "remodel is coming" stuff.  I got my key and headed to my room where I noticed that there were several displays with fabric and carpet swatches with renderings of said remodel.  Whootpie-do!  What good does that do me?  Am I supposed to use my imagination and make believe when I get to my room?  Which leads me to the next point...It's very easy to use your imagination when you get into your room because there is no light switch anywhere near the door so you're in complete darkness if you check in after sundown!  Try and picture that earlier rendering because you're going to have to Stevie Wonder your way around the room until you stumble into the bathroom, the only place where I found a switchBed was clean but old.  Springs were hard and creaky.  Hot water took about 5 minutes or more to get going (6:30 AM on a Sunday, maybe I was the first to shower).  TV had all the classic hotel room channels plus the obligatory staticy channels.  I've never understood why every hotel in the US has at least a couple channels with weak signal but I digress.  No free wifi (hard wired internet was also at a cost).  No free coffee that I was aware of.  I peaked at their breakfast menu and when I saw the 8 dollar oatmeal I got my trusty (except for calls) iPhone out and yelped to the stellar Cafe Patachou.  So in short, this is an awesome Motel and a lousy Hotel.  Shop around.if you're thinking of staying here, then think again.  it's in desperate need of remodeling, which i overheard the front desk say to another guest that it was being scheduled in a few months. let's hope so.what i did like: good service from the front desk and meetings staff, and free wifi in the lobby.what i didn't like:i got put into the older tower; opened the door and walked into a room that wreaked of stale cigarettes and 80s furniture. the carpet had stains like someone rubbed red lipstick into it or spilled nail polish. the ethernet worked for an hour and then never again for the rest of my three-day stay. happily, the front desk attendant reversed the charge.  the tub was quite narrow and oddly shaped. i actually took a little tumble in the tub. luckily i was able to grab onto the shower curtain and safety bar to keep from breaking my ankle or cracking my head open.i'd recommend staying at another hotel until this one is remodeled.It had been a few years since I had been here for a conference.  The facility was nice then, but now they have made some renovations for the better. Definitely a good place to hold a conference.New renovation.  It is very clean and modern with free WiFi (lobby only).  WiFi in the room was available for a fee.  Adjacent to a renovated mall and theater with a Starbucks and Apple store.  Also, there is a Maggie Moos less than a mile away.  Plenty of food options.  The rooms were very nice with quality mattresses (firm), linens, and furnishings.  Free parking which is good considering all the downtown places charge $30+/per night.  No hidden fees.  Hotwire rates it at 4-star and I agree.Nice, clean hotel connected to the Fashion Mall....great in the winter.  The people there were super friendly and the beds are extremely comfortable.I really do appreciate hotel chains that have a consistent product - especially when you two hotels in the same area.   Last time I was in town, I stayed downtown at the Sheraton (upgraded to a suite because they were out of King rooms and because I am a loyal customer), and decided this trip to stay out at Keystone Crossing to be slightly closer to work, and avoid the $25 parking fee at the downtown version.1 Star - Hotel is in a great location.  Easy to freeway, 25 mins. to/from the airport, close to some decent chain restaurants, and a mall if you need that kind of distraction.1 Star - Free parkingChecked in at 11 p.m.  All the King rooms were booked...and no upgrade.  Rooms here are nothing like the downtown version.  Small rooms (think NY small), and don't look they have been updated at all in the past 5ish years.  The TV in the room is so old the welcome screen from the Hotel TV menu has been burned into the screen (i.e. when turned off, you can still see it on the screen)...and either not noticed, or no one cares to replace. Next time I'm in town, I'll stay downtown...stick with the consistent one.The rooms are fine, though dated.  I like being able to walk directly into the mall, and it's just a brief foray outside to Patachou, my favorite area spot for breakfast.  My fondness for the hotel is definitely due, in part, to its receptivity to low bids through Priceline.I really like Nancy W's checklist of this hotel.  It's dead-on.  (Though I can't relate to the whole Knob Creek situation)  I was shocked to find that the room didn't have wireless internet and that I actually had to pay for access as well (even a crappy, cheap-ass hotel I stayed at in Ft. Worth at least had wireless available - and it was free).  I wouldn't spend the money on the breakfast buffet.  Not worth the money.  Go to Panera just down the street.Overall, good service, but the property and amenities itself aren't so good.  I won't be running back anytime soon.Well this was the last straw for me with this hotel, if you get the older tower RUN! dirty dirty dirty bring your tent instead! I will now be staying at the Marriott next to it.I visited this weekend from Chicago for a family member's baby shower and didn't have the best experience.  Pros: (agree with some others) close to highway, nice shower with great pressure, nice bar downstairs, many comfortable couches and chairs to sit on it the various lobbies.Cons: The bed (it was the pullout bed in the suite) was really uncomfortable, the operator staff was really rude, extremely noisy hotel.  I called the operator because the front staff (who were very nice) sent us to the wrong room.  The woman on the phone was so rude to me and acted as if I should know where I was going in the hotel (and I know there are at least 3 different elevator banks taking you to different parts of the huge hotel).  Later in the night, we heard music so loud that we couldn't sleep.  I called and unfortunately got the same operator.  She said the music was from Champps across the street (and we were on the 10th floor- it sounded like it was right above us) and she acted as though I should know that!  "Well, of course, the music is coming from Champps and you're on that side of the building."  She had a "What do you want ME to do about it?" attitude which really didn't help the situation.  Her attitude alone will keep me from going back.. probably ever to a Sheraton again.Great location (connected to a high end mall with Saks etc..) and close to a lot of decent restaurants.  I appreciated the great service, especially in the concierges lounge.  Didn't get a chance to try out the gym, but they have a deal with the Ballys next door (which is also connected)All in all I enjoyed my stay.  Definitely try out the bed when you first get there though because the first room I had, had a horrible bed with springs popping out.  This is one of the things I check for as I travel frequently and there is nothing worse than a night without sleep.Okay hotel, but a little run down, peeling wall paper, etc.Stayed for one week post Christmas. Unless you take adjoining rooms as a family, strangers conversations/coughs/clearing throats/fights/dogs barking etc feel as if they are in your bed with you. Only slept two out of seven nights after hotel cleared out after New Years. Connecting doors are very poorly insulated. Staff at hotel is superior...really excellent but Starwood needs to do something about insulating those doors. Have stayed many places with connecting doors and never experienced anything as bad. Poor materials used????The Sheraton Indianapolis Hotel & Suites is located at Keystone at the Crossing next to the Fashion Mall,  a combination of (mostly) upscale stores and higher-end chain restaurants.  It's on 465 N so it's easy and quasi-quick to get to the airport, about 30 minutes away in non-commute times.  For my purposes, the location was perfect, just across a man-made lake (formerly a quarry) from the company I was visiting.As a business traveler, I care about the following:  Cleanliness - not so much.  The rooms and hallways are dingy-ish and the hotel badly needs an overall remodel the main floor public spaces are very well kept;A good bed - check;Excellent hot water - check;Good water pressure - YES with a fantastic shower head - just powerful enough to clear out the remainder of the Knob Creeks I consumed on Tuesday night;Decent bathtub for those post-client therapeutic baths - eh, not so good;Fast Internet - as long as you shell out 9.95 per 24 hours;A work desk - the large table was great, but the chair was HORRID; andRoom service/food - the room service servers were great but the food sucked.The bartender was great, too.All-in-all, the people at this Sheraton provide excellent service, but the property and especially the food are not so good.  Stay at the Marriott (also on the 'lake') if you can.  I think the room prices are comparable and according to one of my co-workers, it's more up-to-date and has a decent restaurant.The hotel is outdated and has turned to nickel and diming guests to make up revenue-charging $20 for a rollaway bed and $5 the gym.  Front desk staff is surly, clearly tired from having to defend their property. There are better options in the area,

review_content: Spacious room, perfect for work trips. It had to be around 800 square feet, with a room with two beds and an additional room attached with a desk and couch and tv. 10 mins walking distance to the JW. Hotel is well melts and clean. I'd definitely return!Breakfast buffet held a variety of cold and hot breakfast items.  Omelet/waffle stand was extremely slow due to only one chef working the station.We also booked the "Hotwire" deal therefore we could have received the less Hilton experience than others have gotten. Mainly, I just want to know why there is no refrigerator in these rooms?! We stayed for three nights, and obviously that is necessary. Also, when our room was cleaned the sheets were not even changed. The outside appearance is nice, but things were not up to Hilton standards that I have experienced before. We were tucked in the back corner room, with a prison cell window. We didn't even ask about breakfast seeing as we didn't even get access to a fridge or microwave.I probably wouldn't be writing this review if I had access to a refrigerator... And maybe free water?I had a really quite wonderful stay at this hotel in June 2015. The front desk staff seemed very busy but my room was nice, large, and had a great view from the 19th floor. I was very busy on my trip so I didn't get the chance to spend that much time in the hotel, but I really appreciated the fruit infused water in the lobby every morning when I walked through.The humidity of Indianapolis meant that the room felt moist on occasion, but the bed was super comfy and the shower was good with adequate pressure. There was lots of counter space which was great as I was sharing a room with two others. I never made it to the pool but it looked nice and was just down the hall. I never had to wait long for the elevator which is always a concern when one is on the 19th floor so that was really great! Checkout went smoothly and staff were able to divide our room payment between us appropriately given how long we each stayed so that was great! I liked how close this hotel was to everything else downtown.Well it's a nice room, very long. No fridge no microwave but there is two tvs, I don't know why either. A little tip don't close the doors to the office to cancel the outside noise the a/c vent is only in the office and you will be on fire by the middle of the night. The bar in the lobby is really good the bartender Eric is great he made the experience. And the food is very well made.The hotel initially looked nice. When we got to our room, throughout our stay, found slow draining shower so you stand in your water, hair on the walls, closet handle missing, hole in our sheets, mascara colored stain on towel, and a terrible evening of next door partying noise until 3am which "security" didn't resolve. The decor was attractive but it doesn't outweigh the lack of maintenance shown throughout.Very nicely appointed room.   Surprisingly quiet for a busy street.   Staff has been very helpful.   Walking distance to great restaurants including St. Elmo's.  Here with a group and enjoy this more than previous hotel!!  Valet and luggage service was seem less and efficient.Pretty good hotel, great service.  Deducting one star because on closer viewing, it is getting a little older. For example, the tub in the bathroom was stained. some nasty grout in the tiles on the tub. A couple of the floor tiles were cracked.  Elevators to the parking garage have seen better days.   And a couple of minor design annoyances.  Such as the bath towels are 6 feet away from the shower (yes, I should remember to grab one before the shower).  And you can't plug in the coffee maker where it is (power light on the coffee maker was not working also).  But all minor points.Lobby is great.  Prof service.  Good flavored water. Free wifi.  Good breakfast options. Good bedding.Great place to stay in downtown Indy. Tons of things in walking distance. Hotel staff are friendly and trustworthy. Tight pool on the top floor. Suites are spacious and plush. Nice work Hilton!The service sucks the hotel is nice the parking sucks the total costumer service is bad .. We ask about surround places the lady is to old .. We have to walk for parking  and no  help w valet... No one  help with the lou lougage. I change me review to 4 stars just because the hotel cares about what I said to my experience ! Is all about getting better and making people happy ! Even if it is just listening ! Thank you I will think about  stay there again just cause there is no parking available and there is no vallet for lougageWe are hhonors members for a reason. It's rare to have anything other than a positive experience at a Hilton. Indy Downtown was a bit of an exception. The suite was spacious but a little run down with some scuffs and paint chips on the walls. The dresser in our room had something sticky on it and the room AC/heater unit's front panel was a bad fit.Staff was with one exception Hilton-quality; the one problem we had was with a concierge at the front desk who was a little snippy with us regarding theater tickets. It was busy, but our question was simple and we got our own fix later.Would we stay again? Yes, it's a fine place in a good location and there wasn't anything wrong, just a few unpleasant surprises that are probably not the norm.Not giving 2 stars because the towels are soft, they provide lots of fluffy pillows and the bed is comfy.. What truly disappointed me about this hotel is the lack of care regarding a request I made.. I always put out the 'do not disturb' sign when staying multiple nights (in this case 3) as I don't need the cleaning crew going through my room.. Hate having strangers clean up and rearrange my stuff without me being present. No sign in my room; requested it before heading to the work conference in the hotel. Reassured by the front desk person, Rose, it was on its way. I requested nicely to not have my room cleaned and thanked her for getting the sign to my room. Well, the sign didn't come and when I got back to my room they had come in and cleaned my room. Furious I called the front desk, expressed my anger and frustration for Rose not taking my request seriously.. Felt my privacy was invaded. Finally a sign was provided.Had a brief rude interaction with a women at the front desk (tues, may26th @ 7:30am so the hotel can possibly know who it was) when I had asked her to please not have my room cleaned (same morning as my call to the front desk; they never provided a sign so followed up with her before my conference started). She made no eye contact and scuffed at me.. Thanks hotel staff person for making me feel like my request wasn't worth your attention. Sorry I'm not important. Finally, it's 11:30pm, Thurs May 28th and a very loud drilling has gone on for the last two hours!I called the front desk and was told to 'deal with it' & 'we have no control over it'. Again, with an attitude. Wasn't going to add that to this review but 2hrs of this drilling noise is ridiculous! You have multiple conferences going on in your hotel, my company alone has 75 people staying at this hotel and you want me to 'deal with it' and had trouble bringing me a 'do not disturb sign' nor ensure my room wasn't cleaned.. I'm also a Hilton Rewards Member.. You are really not making me a happy customer. Shame on the hotel for this behavior.So I booked this room via "Hotwire", so my experience may be different if you were to book them directly or if you are a member of the Hilton Club perks. I couldn't complain about the price that we paid for a 4-star hotel. When my girlfriend and I arrived to the hotel, the atmosphere, the service, and appearance was 4-star for sure. Check in was very easy and multiple elevators which was a nice thing. When we get to the room, we felt that it was a "Hotwire" or bargain-type room because it was tucked away in the corner, and it was hard to explain, but you could tell that the hotel and the company decided if they don't get a lot of room sold, then that room we stayed was designated as the "bargain" room.Well I don't want to make it sound bad, but there were just a few things that made it seem this hotel more of 3-star hotel (more so like a 2.5 star) than a 4-star. Well I haven't stayed at much of Hilton, but I was kind of bummed that they didn't have a refrigerator inside the room. Maybe it is the type of Hilton Hotel, but come one, I can get a refrigerator at a Holiday Inn or Best Western and still paid either the same price or less. There were some certain things that made the room unattractive. The biggest thing we saw was a giant stain on the wall. Didn't know if it was old coffee and maybe that was the trash can was originally located, but it was kind of gross. They had water bottles in the room, but it was like $4 per bottle! I stayed at 4-star hotel in Chicago and they had a giant bottle of water for FREE! But you know I couldn't complain since I used the room only to sleep, but it would've been nice to have at least a refrigerator in the room.My biggest complaint about this place was the noise level. That night, there were some very "loud" people staying that night. I don't know how soundproof the wall is when doors are closed, but these people were very loud and very rude that they were not being considerate of their noise level. They were standing in the hallway to the rooms and even had their doors open, and they were laughing and talking very loud. I am usually a very calm and forgiving person with noise, but this was very rude. When these people decided to move their party inside the room and closed the door, it was relatively quiet, but you can still hear when they screamed and laughed out loud. We eventually had to call the front desk and maybe that did the trick because these people (who were 2 doors down from us, or almost nearly across from us), came out and started the party back in the hallway. So I am not trying to complain to the hotel, but just wanted to warn everyone that if you are a light sleeper, and if you do end up staying at this hotel, and encounter an episode like mine, please call the front desk to request for a room change. That is the only advice I could give. Yeah I know that people want to party and don't want to ruin the vibe of having a good time, but some days people forget about politeness when they are under the influence of alcohol.Overall, the hotel was OK. It's in downtown Indy and it is near by many stores to shop, and restaurants to dine at. Parking is either a self-garage parking or valet parking; both offering in and out privilege, which is a good thing. They have a restaurant (bar and grill they call it), which offers OK food and also, they are adjoined to a McCormick and Shmick? steakhouse.I would not recommend this place if you are booking directly through their website, unless you are one of those members who gets points for staying at the hotel. Once again,  i booked it via "Hotwire" and the money that I paid for the room was a bargain. I just wished it was a better experience. But hey, everyone has opinions and you can either take it or leave it.Thanks for reading my long review and I hope you found it to be funny, helpful, or just plain awful!CheersWe went here for the Redskins Indy game. Everyone was so pleasant, from the valet to the check in crew to the bellhop to the bar staff. It was a great experience. I ended up seeing Doug Williams retired hall of fame QB for the Redskins, also the whole team stayed there lol bonus for me haha! ;) great job as always HiltonI like it here. Stayed overnight a couple times, and also had a three day meeting here. Friendly staff and all that. I'm interested to try the McCormick & Shmicks place that is on the first floor here.The bathroom tub in my room did not drain at all after my shower. I told the gentleman at the front desk about it this morning but it obviously wasn't fixed since it happened again tonight. I expected better quality service and attention to detail from a Hilton property.For $359 plus taxes I would think I would have a clean modern room, free water, stocked frig etc. what we got was a room that was decorated about 20 years ago, closet doors that don't open, dirty grout on bathroom floors. No robes, a sofa that is killing my bad back. Unfortunately this was the only room left in downtown Indy. We picked a bad weekend for a get away.I stayed here this weekend in a booked hotel  that was loaded with wedding guests and most likely some Colts fans (Saturday game) so I am writing this review based on this weekend.We were in 1902 on the top floor near the pool. 2 queen sized beds, no fridge in room.We tried to hit up the hot tub/pool but at almost 11 at night there were a ton of kids in there. Finally they shuffled off and we ran in for 10 min of hot tub time before getting kicked out. We get it they need to clean, at least we got a few min. What I liked-- clean spacious room with a cool view. Nice temperature setting. Lots of pillows and extra pillows and blanket in the closet.What I didn't like- there was an odd rocking/ clicking noise we kept hearing but couldn't figure out where it was coming from.
