We could hear EVERYTHING happening in the hallway. I think we even heard our neighbor drop the soap lol... The walls are thin!Seals on the door are non existent so they are not very soundproof. Um *cough* soo if you are having "relations" don't be too loud about it!At 2:30 am we kept hearing people in the hallway... Screaming. Yes. Screaming...banging doors, hollering and being jerks in general with no consideration of others!! We called the front desk and then it got quiet for a bit but I heard jerks again at 3:00-3:30. I didn't get much sleep. I've stayed here during gen-con with  a friend in the past but honestly the nerds are quieter!Great hotel! Convenient, clean, spacious room. Small convenient store and spa available for massages and other types of beauty services.Walking distant to several locations--restaurants, the mall, convenience store etc.Stayed here the last week of March in a deluxe suite with family.  The pros here are that the room was huge, we could have fit probably ten people in the suite without trouble.  The rooms however are old and dated.  The pullout couch where my kids slept was scary in that it looked worn and in horrible shape.  The carpets are old and stained.  Okay place to stay but its one of those places that I worried me about bed bugs.I have seen many better HIltons.  Stay away from this one.  I am marking wifi as free as I am a gold member but they do charge for it if you are not a gold member.
review_content_20: We snagged a same-day deal on this hotel using the BEST hotel deal app, Hotel Tonight (seriously download it right now, I get crazy deals from this app regularly). For $69 we ended up in the biggest hotel suite I've ever stayed in. The room wasn't what I'd call updated, but in true mid-western fashion it was immaculate. The king size bed was quite comfortable and I wasn't sad about the Peter Thomas Roth skincare products in the bathroom (I read somewhere that those hotel sample size branded products aren't the "real thing" but I prefer to believe they are).The one downside of this experience was our shower drain was very clogged, which is something that really grosses me out even at my own house. We were at the hotel for such a short period of time though, I didn't even bother calling the front desk. The valet and front-desk service were excellent.  On checkout when we called down for our car we did not have to wait at all for it to be brought around.Location-wise, you are literally steps away from the circle, as well as lots of bars and restaurants. Solid!Two words: stay away!As a property, the hotel was so-so. Like others, I've been at better Hiltons. I stayed for a conference in September. I slipped coming out of the shower on the last day and ended up on the floor under the sink. Long story short, I hurt my back and incurred some chiropractic/naprapathic bills from the fall. I suspect the hotel has had problems with this before because they put a sign and a grab bar in the bathroom, and because the staff seemed not surprised by this. Given how hard I fell, I'm probably lucky it isn't worse. They told me falls were common.I didn't hear back from the hotel about my "incident report" until I complained to Hilton's head office. They agreed to forward my bills to their insurance company. My dr sends them in.In late February, I get an email from my dr. She still hasn't been paid, and it's been 5 months.Pet friendly!  They don't charge you and arm and a leg to bring your furry friend, just a one time charge (I think was around $100 for your whole stay).The hotel itself is nice.  While its a bit older than some of the other hotels in Indy now, it is kept up well, and they seem to be working to keep it fresh and clean.  On our last visit there we smelled new carpet on our floor, and the lobby is always clean.  Valet service is fast and efficient!  WAY better than the JW Marriott, they get a huge thumbs down for slow service.  You can call down to get your car brought up from your room, which is hugely convenient (why can't you do that as well JW?)Finally the rooms are really clean, and with status we usually get upgraded to a huge suite that is bigger than our condo.  Status is definitely rewarded here, which is a great perk!  Overall, a nice place to stay, and a little cheaper than the Conrad down the street (and in my opinion a better value, the Conrad only has its amazing bathrooms to outdo this place.)I've stayed here with a group every year at GenCon for several years. The location is perfect. There are several options downstairs for food. McCormick's stopped doing their late night happy hour specials but the breakfast buffet is usually something we do once per year.The staff has always worked with our group. This year, our usual room was booked... on every floor. They converted the CC rooms on 2 floors for us. It was a cool setup but there are a few kinks to work out.The wifi has definitely gotten better than it was in 2012. Last year we could not even stream music over wifi. This year, 480p videos were fine even after the hordes arrived for GenCon.So many better options in downtown Indy.  This is my third downtown Indy hotel in less than a year, I DO NOT recommend staying here; - rooms are very outdated and not clean (my toilet seat was soaking wet when I arrived NASTY).  You can also hear everyone in the hall.  The doors are old and require a hard slam to close.- staff friendly but not helpful; there is a convention in town, I believe it's a cheer leading competition, and hundreds (not exaggerating) of screaming kids came back to their rooms at 11pm screaming and slamming doors.  Ok, not the hotel's fault, but when I called the front desk I was told, "they're all arriving at te same time, they should quiete down shortly".  At least lie to me and say you'll have someone up here right away to handle the situation. - nickle and dime you; rooms do not have fridges, must pay $10/day to get one.  Internet is $13/day.  People gave good reveiws for location; I can see 3 other hotels from the lobby.  Please take my advice and stay elsewhere!Great rooms. Clean and modern for the most part but there are a few signs of wear starting to creep out in some places (like the shower heads). Hilton HHonors Gold will get you free WiFi and other amenities.On the down side I was traveling with a group and in total we used 4 rooms. Two were ready at noon, one at around 3:30, and the last not until around 5:00 or later. It was great to have some of the rooms early but the last one dragged on later than anyone of us expected and also long after the front desk lead us to believe as well.We stayed here because our usual hotel for our Indy trips was booked (some convention or something) and were very pleasantly surprised. It was in the same Hilton points bracket as our other hotel, even though it is more expensive than our usual hotel. They upgraded us to a suite because we were staying on points and we were very impressed. The bed was comfortable, the towels and toiletries were top notch, and the customer service was fantastic. I love the location of this hotel as well. Within a block or two of everything we need to go to. We will stay here again for sure. The only con is the same with all Hilton hotels - no free wifi! And the furnishings are a little outdated, but nothing that takes away from the stay.The name and the lobby are not enough to make this a great hotel. We stayed in a state suite. The bathrooms were updated but that's it. While nice looking, the bathroms had issues. The shower diverter only transferred about 80% of the water to the shower head. The tub filled up quickly and was very slow to drain. They also failed to install vent fans in the bathrooms which was a hassle.The room itself was large, with a wall of windows overlooking the city. There is a large desk in the corner facing away from the windows and not private. There is a large round table with four chairs. The living area also had a couch and two armchairs facing the entertainment center. The furniture was old looking and uncomfortable. There is a nice little wetbar with a refrigerator and coffee maker.The sofa folds out into the single worst possible surface you could imagine sleeping on, outranked even by armchair and floor. Sleeping on a chicken wire hammock would be preferable. They also failed to include extra pillows for this option.The master bedroom has its own bathroom, a nice king bed and closes off from the rest of the room.If you have to entertain and do business, it might meet your needs.Even with the overly expensive price for what you get, they have plenty of upcharges. Internet access for example among others like $22/day for parking and half the breakfast options. The parking garage is open air and you have to walk outside from the hotel to get to it. There was an issue of a misquoted price for the service from the front desk, with the attendant being rude about it. They do offer valet for an upcharge.Basic breakfast is free with voucher, but if you want hot food, and some drinks, it costs extra. You also have to wait for their incredibly slow service to get drinks and wait to check out (even if you get the free voucher).For the price, I was quite disappointed.The location is perfect... I had no idea I would be able to just walk out the door downtown and be able to walk to not only the IUPUI law school building, a shopping mall.. restaurants, and bars all at such a short walk.. My room was a great size.. a large comfy bed.. I spoke spanish with the cleaning lady and got brand new pillows...They were so accommodating.. and I"m an annoying ask for a lot guest.. and they definitely had no problem answering all my questions.. There is no wifi.. which is weird.. and there is no safe / lockbox inside of the room to store your stuff while you're not in there..however you can get a safe deposit box from there free of charge... it's weird though because you have to keep your stuff locked up downstairs in a room behind the front desk.. it's like why travel and bring these things.. that you're going to store far away from your room and have to go through more than I would want to to get it.. that's a problem .The workout area is cool... they have many amenities...   I'd def stay here againI seem to have discovered a trend on my ~ quarterly visits to Indianapolis; really bad service delivered with the kind of pleasant smile that makes it hard to be frustrated...and the Hilton Indianapolis fits right in.  The hotel's downtown location was fabulously convenient for the meetings I had throughout the downtown area during my trip and I was upgraded to an absolutely massive corner suite that was bigger than most of the apartments in which I've lived.  With the amount of traveling that I do, having a constant  like the Hilton Breakfast is always reassuring; not the most wonderful breakfast buffet ever, but it's consistent and always good quality.  However......I tried for literally 15 minutes in a less-than-half-filled restaurant to get someone to bring me my bill.  It took so long that I almost ended up late for my first meeting that day.  The laundry that I sent in before 08:00 was nowhere in my room to be found when I returned from my last meeting at 9:00PM.  A call to the front desk was answered with an assurance my laundry would be sent up "immediately".  I waited 30 minutes and no laundry...a second call to the front desk went into voicemail, as did a third 15 minutes after that.  As I had an 06:00 flight the next morning, for which I had to be up by 04:00, all I wanted to do was get some sleep, but, as it was now 10:00PM and the laundry I needed to wear the next day was still nowhere to be found, I had no choice but to trudge down to the front desk to locate my laundry.  The very nice young woman at the front desk assured me it would be handled right away and that I should just hold tight at the front desk, which I did...for 15 minutes.  Finally, someone emerged from the bowels of the hotel with my laundry and a very pleasant smile and apology for the delay.  The lovely smile and pleasant demeanor didn't change that it was now 10:30 and the process to find the laundry that was supposed to have been delivered to my room four and a half hours before had now cost me an hour and a half of so badly needed sleep.I really don't know if the other downtown hotels offer any better service, but....you might be doing yourself a favor to find out...Multiple stays. Called ahead with a request and the staff took great care of us. Large rooms. Updated but not the tub/shower and they need an update. ATT hotspot wifi or pay $12.95. Don't misread Hotwire free internet to mean in room. Lobby only. Near all attractions. Close to mall which then connects to most downtown attractions indoors or short outdoor jaunts. Close does not mean connected but close. Staff nice. Price is right for our stay. Pet friendly for a fee. And they are pet friendly. You can eat at the hotel restaurant or many places downtown.  Love gyros? Try Ali Babas across the street - eat there (carry out suffers) and have the spicy gyro.WiiiiiiFiiiiiiiii!!!!!!  They finally joined the party.  Don't expect a quick connection or even an adequately amateur paced one but at least it exists.For a Hilton, I've seen better. The staff is friendly enough and the rooms are nice enough. The breakfast buffet is pretty nice, especially since it's free for the Hilton-loyal. The place just is not modern or even updated. Also, beware - the Internet is terrible. They have wi-fi but the signal is weak (and I tried two different computers, two different guest rooms on different floors, and sitting in the lobby). They also don't have access to hard line/Ethernet Internet cable. Their workaround for terrible wi-fi is just to offer a "bridge" which plugs into your Ethernet port but still just pulls in the wi-fi signal. For business travelers - it's painful. Overall, it's not bad, but there are better hotels in Indy at similar price points. If you're a Hilton member, I would actually suggest the HGI over the Hilton. At least they have accessible Internet.I stayed at the Hilton downtown Indy for New Years and a Colts game. Our rate was $119 a night, but we booked well in advance and noticed that the rate went up quite a bit in the couple months before we arrived. We had a king room with lots of space and a nice desk to sit at. I used the Wi-Fi downstairs in the lobby and it worked great for us(and was free). We had a problem at check in when our room wasn't ready, so the front desk offered us free breakfast at the 120 West Market, which has a wonderful buffet. We arrived after 11am when the breakfast buffet was over, so the server said we could pay $4 per person and have the brunch buffet. It was great and def worth us paying a couple bucks. If you can include the 120 W Market in your rate with Hilton, I would def recommend it. This Hilton is about 5 blocks from Lucas Oil stadium and 3 blocks from the Convention Center. Circle Center mall is a couple blocks away with very nice shops. There are great places to eat all over the place. Try St. Elmo's for shrimp cocktail and steaks, it is wonderful! Harry and Izzie's is a couple blocks away and is a great place for lunch or dinner and Peyton Manning is part owner. If you're looking for a bar within walking distance, try the Slippery Noodle. We spent a couple nights there and it's an awesome establishment! We also saw the Indy 500 museum, which is a short 10 minute ride away. We took at cab and it cost about $12 each way. Cabs sit right outside the Hilton, so they are easy to find. The Go Indy Green Line is directly across the street from the Hilton and is a great way to get to and from the airport since there is no shuttle. It costs $7 per person.Overall, Hilton was a nice place to stay at with nothing over the top, but is in a great location surrounded by the best places to eat, shop, and sightsee.Do you seriously have to pay to use the internet? Beautiful lobby and great location. Rooms showing their age and a little wear and tear but overall pretty nice.I went here with my dad for his company business party/awards banquet. I was his plus one and was able to share his room with him on the 10th floor. I'm not sure about the price per room, but what I can tell you from a strict entertainment perspective on the hotel, I was very pleased with service and overall quality. The banquet party was down on one of the lower floors underneath the lobby, which was very big, and held two bars and a kitchen. The bar service was great (an unfortunate two drink tickets per person, but this was the company, not the hotel) and made tasty drinks. The Long Islands were slightly disappointing because they used the mix instead of the actual mix of different alcohols, but that's okay in the long run. The food was good. They served salad, London broil, bread pudding with chocolate on top, a variety of vegetables, different breads, pulled pork, among other items. The meat was a little tough, but other than that, everything tasted great. The servers cleaned up the empty dishes in a timely fashion and did so without getting in the way of the ceremony. Very stealth. Because it was a company function, my parking garage ticket was stamped and did not have to pay for parking. I was very happy about this. The rooms were clean and large and had a great view of the surrounding buildings and the capital building. They have smoking rooms and non-smoking rooms. I experienced both and much rather prefer the non-smoking rooms. Rooms had flatscreen televisions, queen beds, a desk and chair, lamps, coffee makers and a wonderfully clean bathroom. My only complaint is that the drainage on the bathtub was clogged and the water got extremely high (close to overflowing) by the time the shower was done. Checking in and out was incredibly easy and everyone at the Hilton was very kind. If you're looking for a hotel in the downtown area, I would recommend staying at the Hilton.Note: Don't give the hotel the credit when you wake up with mustard stains on your sleeves and knees & you're wearing your shirt as pants... that's just you being awesome. Rare is the opportunity to stay at a hotel in my hometown (hometown as in... where I be livin'), and a wedding reception at a hotel is the prime chance. This hotel is part of a giant corporate complex that's quasi-mall. The self-park underneath the building freaked me out. I really don't understand how they justify cutting it that close with the space between the ceiling & the cars' roof... so I'd be sure to check the car top before you get back in it after the valet brings it to you. The front desk was totally up for a pitying upgrade to a king bedroom, late notice... so really... that's enough for a positive review. It's funny that a view of a government building (the State Capitol) is sought after... I suppose there really is a couple out there toasting their raspberry champagne and saying, "Cheers to our lovely government. I love you, sweetheart." Me on the other hand...I see this as a fine opportunity to moon the Capitol, elevated no less. Service is attentive. Bar is stocked and service is slow with endless seas of conference newbies to stand behind, but once at the bar... you might just meet a man named Mike from Louisville who drops knowledge like the Marlboro Man in The Big Lebowski.Rates? It seems like Hilton owns Indy, and there's no other option... last minute for a wedding reception in the same building, I'll take what they're giving me... but for no other reason. They seemed not to mind a wiley young duo scurrying through their hotel with mustard-y ham & cheese croquets with bottles of beer clanging -- thanks!Note: Anyone else see that our State Capitol is listed as "State Chiropractic Association" on the Google/Yelp Map? Fascinating stuff.Summary: Although there are some bright-spots, ultimately this is a VERY mediocre and tired hotel. Unless you are a low-end/budget traveler, there are much better properties in the vicinity.Location: (4-Star) Ideally situated in downtown, there are better located hotels, but not many. The views afforded by higher level rooms are likely quite good. We were on the 5th floor so ours were just average. Decor/Room: (1-Star) We had a Deluxe King Suite. 1984 called, they want their decorations back. I did enjoy the rusty shower (complete with ringless shower curtain!) that took 10 minutes to drain. Our first room had a bloody Kleenex and pubes on the bathroom floor -- they quickly moved us to another pube/blood-kleenex-free room. One's imagination roams thinking about the various other body fluids that have been sprayed about the rooms. Nice. The coffee maker leaked water and was a pain in the butt, but the coffee they supplied was actually pretty good.Technology: (2-Star) Wired ethernet connections are not obviously available. There is a note that says to call the front desk if you want a wired connection. $10 daily for wireless internet access. Really? Who does that anymore? The flat screen televisions were quite undersized for our room. They may have been fine for a small box, but for a suite, they needed much larger screens. The programming was mostly in HD and pretty good. The HVAC was effective and the digital thermostats were placed appropriately in out suite.Food: (3-Star) Room service was functional, food was just ok, tray pickup took all day and by the evening the hall was littered with dirty dishes from various rooms. Their in-room dining menu is typical Hilton-fare. They have two restaurants on site -- an excellent steak-house and a mediocre diner.Hotel Staff: (3-Star) Front desk check-in, while not friendly was quick and pain-free. Valet parking was uniformly excellent!Spa: (4-Star) My wife received a massage, which she, an experienced spa-gal, deemed pretty good.Location is perfect.  So much within walking distance and we felt safe even in the early am when the streets were bare and we walked to the City Cafe for breakfast. The attached garage was $22 a night, which seems pricey but was comparable to the other overnight garages and had the convenience of being attached to the hotel.We got a King Room and the bed was ultra comfortable, I slept all night which is rare for me in hotels, and the room was clean, had everything we needed to.  The shower had fantastic water pressure (a necessity for those of us with long hair) and used Crabtree & Evelyn products which was a nice and unexpected touch.Those working the front desk were kind, quick and attentive.  One was a little slow at helping us find a restaurant (her mapquest skilz weren't up to par) but she did her best and we got what we were looking for.If we were going to downtown Indy again I would definitely stay here.  It was $119 a night, plus (ugh) $20 in room tax but it was our anniversary so i'm glad we didn't go cheap.Although there are some nice pros including a great location which is walking distance to all of the major downtown attractions amd best restaurants, a beautiful lobby, friendly, efficient service at check in all in a nice big room with a spacious bath and a flat screen on a full swivel stand so that you can watch it from the desk or bed. Some major cons: NO wi-fi, only plug in ethernet cable access at the desk for $9.95/ day, no minibar or fridge, valet parking is expensive at $28/ day. Nice, but needs some technological updates!
review_content_40: I stayed here for the better part of a week for this year's Gen Con. Shared a King Room with a friend - bed was quite comfortable, and the room was surprisingly large when compared to other downtown hotels (Marriott, I'm looking at you). Room had a full sized desk and a sleeper-sofa, along with another chair and coffee table, plus a large dresser and flat screen TV.Bathroom is nice - lots of counter space, but the lack of a fan and the downright tiny trashcan were a bit weird. Also, the only extra we got was a coffee maker - no microwave or fridge, although we could have paid extra to have them in the room, at the rate of $10 each, per night.Other than that, the hotel is within decent range of the convention center - a ten or fifteen minute walk, depending on your pace and luck with stop lights. While I would have preferred a connected hotel (that is, connected to the convention center via hamster tubes), the Hilton was a decent alternative.The hotel was okay. It was a busy weekend during the Brickyard. The big downfall was that when booking with a third party like Priceline, you are at the bottom of the barrel in their eyes. I had called the hotel prior to my stay and requested a 2 bed room and said that I would get one if there was one available. When I went to check in, they said that all they had were king size bed rooms and wasn't ready as I was there earlier than standard check-in time. They said that they were completely booked. I went on their site and sure enough, there were 2 bed rooms priced at $329/night. I pointed it out to them and then they said, "oh, we do have one room left." Just because I did it through a third party, I shouldn't be treated any differently than any other guest. Was very disappointed.Great hotel with great service! I have stayed here 4 maybe 5 times and the hotel is old and the rooms are a little old but the service is great and the location is awesome if you are in town of a convention.The walls are paper thin and the staff is not friendly. While the room was very clean and nice, it would be way better if it was in isolation.The staff is unwilling to resolve problems and I got several eye rolls before I could get two extra keys and a cot in the room.A bit dated. I can only imagine the partying that goes on in these rooms during Indianapolis 500Awesome hotel with great service, very reasonably priced and phenomenal location.  Just down the street from the capital building and the monument on Meridian.  Plenty of good restaurants and nightlife within walking distance.  The area seemed safe, too.  Extremely easy access on and off I-65.  Room was spacious, beds were very comfortable.  Would definitely recommend!

review_content: My dad stays here all the time on business. So much so they even offered him a discount to stay there whenever he's in town. So of course, this is where we stayed on our stop in Indy. It's a pretty nice hotel. They have a nice courtyard in the middle and even have a few grills. My dad says they  (the staff) will grill up food for the guests during the week so he usually eats diner at the hotel. They have a huge Buffett style breakfast. Goes until 10:30am on the weekends. Perfect for sleeping in. There's a nice indoor pool, which we didn't end up having time to use, and a small outdoor basketball court. Our room was nice and even had a small kitchenette with a full size fridge, microwave, stove and dishwasher! Great if you were staying a few days. Being as our room only had one bed and a pull out couch, my sister and I had to share the couch. Pretty awful pull out mattress, but I knew it wouldn't be much. Could feel the springs. Water pressure in the shower sucked. Overall very nice place.Cute little Hotel in Fishers, IN.  I flew in from Seattle for my one day of orientation at a large biotech company and this is where they placed me.  I came in late (almost 10 pm) at night.  The lady at the front desk (Pamela) was friendly and nice.  She also took care to charge my room to my company since I wasn't returning to check out and I didn't have my credit card yet. The room was really quite homey and clean.  It was set up like a studio with a cute kitchenette, 2 desk areas, "living room" area and a bed and bathroom.  Free wi-fi, too.A nice bonus was the free breakfast buffet.  There were a lot of  food options and self serve.  I would stay here again since it's close to my headquarters.Clean hotel. The main problem I have is that we brought our Amazon Fire Tv with us-we always bring it when we travel. This is the first hotel that we have stayed at where the hotel disabled the HDMI port on their tv so guests can't play Xbox, PlayStation, or use Apple TV and Amazon tv boxes. It's very greedy on the part of the hotel that they force you to use their pay per view if you want to rent or your kids are SOL if they want to play video games. We thought maybe something was wrong with the tv so we called the front desk and a worker came to the room that didn't even know what HDMI was. The worker did say that he heard from "Charlie" that none of the things on the back of the tv work anymore since the hotel put a box inside of the back of the tv. My husband called back to the front desk to ask about this and the woman said she would ask and send someone else up. No one ever came up. For this reason alone I won't be back here. We come to Indy for hockey tournaments all the time and we decide what hotels everyone stays at. We'll be looking elsewhere next time.Great hotel! Very spacious. Nice amenities. Great breakfast and they even provided some dinner meals during the week.  Would definitely come back again.Top to bottom, this was a very pleasant stay. The room was immaculate and the free breakfast rivaled many that lodgers pay top dollar for. I liked their towels too. The only strange thing was the fact that the free guest laundry is literally in the same room as the fitness equipment, but this was more than made up for by the deal they have with a close-by gym that was AMAZING. I would stay at this hotel again for sure and recommend it highly to others.This place has all.  Clean, roomy, immaculate refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, electric oven, pull out sofa and comfy bed!  Adult beverages served evenings and a nice breakfast.  I highly recommend this brand and location.Stayed here recently for work and definitely enjoyed it. The room was spacious and clean and the staff took care of every need I had. It's such a $$ saver to have a real fridge and be able to prepare meals in my room. Delicious breakfast here too.I'm a comic and was performing at Morty's Comedy Club June 4-6. I stayed at the Staybridge Suites and really enjoyed it. I used the hot tub to relax. It was great. The rooms are very spacious, nicely designed, and the beds are comfy. It's a great room and has a more spacious design than most hotels rooms. The lobby was nice to sit and read and write notes in preparation for my show. I like the shampoos and soaps. I enjoyed soaking in the tub too!  I recommend this hotel for anyone. I'm a big fan!!I stayed in a suite over the weekend with a group of performers and I was incredibly satisfied.  I stay in hundreds of hotels a year and this hotel was so nice and accommodating that I've been compelled to write my first Yelp review.  The suite we stayed in had two rooms and 3 beds and it felt like we had the privacy of a quiet 3 bedroom house.  I was able to catch up on lost rest and be refreshed with a wonderful shower.  I highly recommend staying here if you are visiting the Indianapolis area.  The staff couldn't have been more helpful.Horrid service throughout due to employee prejudice and condescending attitudes. Waiting patiently in line or politely asking does not work with any employee. On several accounts I have waited for service at the front desk and others were taken care of first despite my earlier presence. After waiting patiently, the cordiality was not present and was instead replaced with a glare and a cold "hello." There was no, "how are you?" or "thank you for waiting." On another occasion, I went over to inform them that there were no kitchen staff present and the receptionist angrily said, "no, someone's always there." I politely informed her that I checked the kitchen and waited a few minutes but did not see anyone to refill the breakfast foods. She continued with her angry persistence so I said I would go back and check again. Luckily someone from the kitchen walked in as I walked in. Similarly, the staff are rude and disrespectful to each other. One staff slipped on a spilt drink that another employee thought was cleaned up. After the fallen employee stood up, she annoyingly said, "next time put down the caution sign" and stomped quickly away in her nonslip shoes. Honestly, whether or not people were present, it could have been said nicely. The same staff will jump in line to refill the food without even a small "excuse me." Along with the horrid customer service, the facilities are always dirty and something is always broken. I approached the front desk nearly weekly with items that were either not functioning properly in my room or throughout the hotel. The maintenance man does fix it up quickly but to have that many repair issues weekly is not safe for anyone. Lastly, the food is disgusting and the gym is small as well as the laundry facility for such a large hotel. I highly recommend staying away from this hotel because it really is worse than a motel.Convenient, nice rooms, free parking, and super hospitable. Would stay here again, and definitely recommend it to a friend!Super comfortable and huge rooms!  Convenient parking, very clean, nice kitchen with awesome coffee!  Great night's sleep!  Would definitely stay here again!I really enjoyed staying here! The room was nice and the staff were very hospitable and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.Would NOT recommend. They screwed up our reservation and I ended up sleeping on a pull out sofa bed.Nice hotel for the price large rooms free food and beer!! Staff is very helpful and $75 bucks a night a real bargain..Stayed a week here as temporary accomodation. So the company paid for it... but if it was out of pocket it would totally be worth it!They have breakfast everyday - make your own waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, oatmeal, toast, juice, coffee the usual. Pretty good and filling. Tues, Wed and Thurs they have Dinner with Beer and Wine - when we stayed there it was hummus and fresh veggies one night with bread cheese meat make your own sandwiches. Wine is good beer is OK (miller light egh)So basically for three days of the week you get breakfast and dinner! Pretty good deal to me.The A/C unit is VERY loud... but housekeeping is good the units are clean and comfortable.This is one of my favorite hotels to stay at and we stay in hotels far more often than in our own home. I work late into the morning. Went to bed at 5:30am and the housekeeper knocked on our door early even though we had a do not disturb sign posted on the door. I sincerely hope that this is just a case of a poorly trained housekeeper and not a directive from management. Housekeeper did not speak English when I tried to question why she knocked. Otherwise.....I love this place. Free food and beer for dinner. The most amazing breakfast buffet of any of the chain hotels in America. They had fresh fruit aplenty, cans of V8 juice, lots of yogurt types including Activia, Breakfast bars, Eggs, Meat, Waffles, and tons of other stuff much of which is never seen at a hotel free buffet. They also have a large pantry with lots of fairly priced, make that low-priced items. Room was a huge suite with bedroom separate from living area. Two big flat screen TV's with lots of channels. Full kitchen. Nice very large desk and nice chair. Fold-out bed. Plenty of well-lit free parking. Lots of food choices nearby. Too bad that housekeeper cost the hotel a 5 star rating. We'll come back though. Hopefully this review is noted by management and the housekeeping staff is retrained so I can sleep next time.A great hotel that's far enough away from Interstate 69 to be quiet. Close the blackout drapes and sleep in!Suites are okay.  Good to have though with kids.  The benefit is that during the week they had a full breakfast that changed slightly each day.  They also have evening reception which is basically a full meal with beer and wine Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday.   The food is marginal, but nice to have to save on some costs.  Friendly staff.  Rooms were fairly clean but dated.  Some wear and tear here.  A/C is loud and turns on/off all the time.  Lock had some issues.  Smoky smell in hallways, Etc...  Small little things but the show the general small amount of wear and tear.We stayed at the  staybridge on our way to kansas and on our way back home because indianapolis was just about in the middle.  Both times were only for 1 night but we enjoyed the place.  Every morning they have complimentary breakfast with fruit, cereal, waffles and other stuff.  Tues - thursday, they have free beer and wine and some snacks and food which was a nice touch.The rooms were ok, not super luxe but comfortable. Free wifi acces is available and if you want to watch a movie, you can rent a dvd from the lobby and watch it on the en suite dvd player.   Both rooms that we were in had a kitchenette with full sized fridge.  There was an exercise room that we contemplated using but then reality set in so that was that.  The hotel is right off of 96th street which has a nice smattering of stores and restaurants nearby and its right off of the interstate so it was easy to find.   Its a nice step up from a budget chain.
review_content_20: I travel to Indy for work alot and call this place my second home.  Apt. style rooms, with full size fridge, dish washer, and free laundry.  Breakfast is included and tasty.  Dinner is also included but varies night to night so I usually walk next door to Cheeseburger in Paradise.  Free wine and beer is also available in the evening!The fitness center isn't much, but the pool is lap friendly.  The staff is always great and the beds are comfy.  There are also a lot of travellers that stay here long term with their dogs!  Family style atmosphere.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown
review_content: Located about a mile off I-65 and a few miles from the heart of downtown Indy, this La Quinta is clean and has small rooms. What made my stay a pleasant one was the super friendly front desk staff.I love how accommodating the front desk guys are. When I first checked in, I was greeted with "Hello and Merry Christmas!" He was genuinely interested in my stay and how my travel was going. Check-in was easy and quick, and the staff was very polite when I had called earlier that day. A different front desk I greeted me in the morning the next day. He complimented me on how cute my dog was, and gave me a bag of fancy dog biscuits from the local dog bakery! I was checking out kind of late, and they were closing up breakfast, but he went and got me an oatmeal pack and a spoon for the road. FIVE STAR SERVICE! I slept comfortably knowing the room was clean- sheets were a bit worn but we're starch white, and the towels were also super white smelling of detergent and bleach! I am a German neat freak, and after doing my walk-in ritual going thru the whole room, the only thing I found was an eyelash in the bathtub! I don't have many negative things to say about this place other than the room would not be big enough to stay multiple nights, and like other reviewers mentioned, the elevator is the size of a small closet lol.Reasonably priced and comfortable, I would def recommend this La Quinta for a solid mid-grade hotel.Stopped in this place on the trip from coast to coast. Location is 5/5 perfect about one block from Indy downtown.  Service is 5/5.  Receptionist, Michael, was a very hospitable guy. Facility: very reasonable.  Breakfast: 4/5.Breakfast lounge: 5/5. Nice, tidy, quiet and comfortable to have a chat.  Price: total with tax: $127 per night for single room double bedsPros:1. Great rate2. Convenient location3. Clean room, towels, sheets4. Comfortable bed5. In room microwave oven and refrigerator6. Parking was adequate but a little bit goofyCons:1. Came across a bunch of shady characters, but it is located in the Downtown area.2. Besides the room, the rest of the hotel was pretty old.Overall: It was adequate for my trip to run the Indianapolis Monumental Marathon. I booked late and this was a pretty great find, but if I had decided earlier, I would've booked somewhere a little bit better and nearer the center of Downtown.Old outdated elevator. Close to Bankers Life Fieldhouse but not the greatest stay. Cold showers.The room was clean (although trash cans did not have trash bags in them) and the location was conveniently located downtown. That's about all I can say good about this place. The hotel front desk staff was uninformed about close by businesses. We asked if he knew where the closest gas station was. His response: "yes." Pause.... Me: "well, are you going to tell me?" Him:" you go out of the hotel right here (hey, I'm on the phone, not standing in front of you. What does "right here" mean?"). I asked him for an address or intersection or name of gas station and he couldn't tell me. Not only that, the front desk accosted my bf in the morning as he went to the lobby bathroom, on his way to the breakfast area by banging on the door as he was inside the bathroom. She wanted to know if he was a guest. Could she not have waited until he came out? That was rude and uncalled for!! Never going back!!!Not the worst, but not very good.  They didn't give me the right room, so I almost had to share a bed.Yes, it's fairly close to downtown.Yes, it's rather cheap.Yes, it's a familiar brand.Yes, they have breakfast.Yes, they have pretty good parking.Yes, you won't die in your sleep or have to ward off legions of bedbugs.  But . . .It's not entirely clean, the hallways look like something out of The Shining, the service wasn't very friendly, and you'll wish you'd spent an extra 50 bucks for places four or five times nicer.The staff was helpful we asked to change the room three times due to the rooms' hygienic issues and also oldness. The hotel was very old and you can understand that by the time you step into an elevator that doesn't even show which floor you're at. However the staff was very helpful. That must have been the only good thing about this hotel. The bathrooms were very old and some of them had rust. You should stay in this hotel if you really need a cheap hotel and if you won't be in town for a long time.The hotel is within walking distance to Indy however boarders a shady part of town. The hotel is very old, the front dest was extremely nice. Don't waste your time on the breakfast. Powder eggs with either cold cheese or plastic cheese, nothing to drink except coffee or hot tea. No milk, juice dispenser "out of order" no water. I would pay the extra money to closer to downtown.This hotel has wonderful service! I left a necklace on the floor, left town and realized what I had done and the front desk worker (Terrance) went in my room after the maid cleaned and found my necklace for me! The hotel has wonderfully pleasant workers every time I've stayed here and you really are getting good quality for the amount paid. Everything's clean, breakfast is nice and the location is very close to downtown! Perfect choice!My dad and I had a great experience here.  We stated for the night, at a decent rate (especially during the Pacers playoff games - which is why we came to Indiana) A lot of reviews are negative about this hotel, so I will first touch on the positives-Clean room-Comfortable bed-Friendly staff-They let us check in early-The manager (Don) was so helpful to the two of us - he helped us print out our BBall game tickets, gave us directions and recommended places for us to eat-So close to Bankers Life FieldhouseCons:-typical cheap hotel breakfast - nothing good-Hallways and elevator need an updateWe were traveling through with two dogs and La Quinta was the place to stay. There were no pet fees, prices reasonable and I was really surprised at how nice the rooms were. Very modern and clean rooms. I did notice some stains on the carpet but it didn't bother me.The beds were very comfortable. Location was fantastic and convenient to downtown. We walked 10 minutes to the restaurants, etc. Overall, I was incredibly pleased.Super friendly & accommodating  concierge staff. I stayed here 4 nights with my doggie and everyone was very nice. Free breakfast and they had a variety of healthy choices :) Very good nightly rate too!Don't stay here. Reasonably priced but you get what you pay for. It's a very old hotel that has been rehabbed. Staff and General Manager are less than friendly.  We had our rate raised a few days before our stay even though we booked on online weeks prior. Hotel had low-lifes and drunks that partied all night and urinated in the halls. The General Manager did nothing to address our complaints. Never will stay again. Only positives of stay were free parking and breakfast but not worth it anyway.BEWARE!!! What a "Thanksgiving" rip off!!! Once we received our credit card statement there was a $250 charge for "cleaning vomit". According to the manager, it was "all over" but they have no pictures, nothing to prove it. It's the first time in my life we had an experience like this (and we have traveled a lot!). We stayed a week there... do you think that is reasonable to think that the morning we left we "vomited all over"?. The staff is as mean as the crumbling structure of this hotel. Rooms are in the small side. The building has been updated to keep the business running but the structure of the hotel is old. Some of the updates are falling and showing these problems. Our room had a funny smell. The toilet leaked and did not stop running. The breakfast area was quite small for the crowd. I definitively don't recommend this hotel to anybody.For just an overnight stay in downtown Indy on a budget this place is fine...if you don't plan on spending any time in your room.Pros1.  Decent location. 1 mile to Circle Center so it's walkable.2.  Nice staff.3.  Free parking.Cons1.  Floors in lobby area were always muddy and wet...recipe for disaster.  I understand there was snow but come on people!2.  The elevators are freaky scary, especially when you get back late at night, half-blasted and your spouse finds the light switch!  Only enough room for two people inside...and a suitcase.3.  The walls are paper thin.  You can hear your neighbors misgivings as well as the drunkards in the hallway at night.4.  The bathrooms are unforgivingly small.  No room for 2.5.  The breakfast in the a.m. is less than impressive with hard as rock, cold biscuits and gravy that looks like its has been cooking in crockpot all night long...and tastes like it has.6.  The couches in the seating area look like someone spoogied all over them.  Get new ones for goodness sake.7.  The outside of the hotel makes the area look a tad shady.  Seriously dated.8.  The room was either too hot with heater on or too cold with it off.  No in between.9.  The sheets were see through from over-use...replace them already!!Having said all that...if you're looking for a bed for 8 hours and close to downtown this is your place!If you find yourself SOL in regards to a hotel room in downtown Indy, La Quinta is certainly not the worst thing to happen to you. The Good:-Super friendly staff-Free breakfast including some fresh fruit, juice, cereal, etc-Modern lobby with decent sized flatscreen due to the remodel-Clean rooms-Nice sized LG flatscreen in said room-Beds were comfy enoughThe Not So Good:-In room bathrooms are sad: Tiny showers with an awkward, half moon curtain and a toilet from 1983, I believe-Beyond shampoo and soap, that's it for toiletries -The location is fairly close to downtown (very walkable) but it sits right on Washington St - a very busy and sometimes loud road-Elevators are incredibly slow. Just take the stairs.If you find yourself thirsty or hungry, vending machines are available on each floor, and that's where you can score your bottled water and other snacky goods. If you're in a bind or on a budget, La Quinta should work out just fine.Terrible... No water, then no hot water. Heater in room would only go on or off so either freezing or a sauna.But great sounds of helicopters all night, next to a helicopter pad....Would never stay with family, I was put up here on business trip.I travel a lot for work and stay at all kinds of hotels.  This had to be among the nastiest I've experienced.  The first room I was given smelled strongly of cat pee.  The doors separating the rooms did very little to block out the, um, sounds (which means I got to hear my neighbors get it on...goody gumdrops...).  The hotel is on a busy downtown street, so there was a lot of traffic noise, too.  The demolition project across the street did not help with the noise factor, either.  The desk person switched my room without any problems, so that's a plus.  The second room was much better.  Not awesome, but better.  Like a totally different hotel.  I'm thinking, why didn't you just give me this room in the first place?  I'll be back to Indy, but I won't be back to La Quinta Downtown.  Yuck.Oh, and the "free wi-fi" never worked.  Sigh...I was heading into downtown Indianapolis for a conference at the Crowne Plaza and wanted to bring along my dog to save on boarding costs.  I was excited to see that a new La Quinta (renovated older hotel) had opened in downtown.  I called to make sure they were open and to ask for the dog policy.Here are the Pros and Cons of this new place (keep in mind they had only been open a few weeks or less at the time of my stay - some kinks were expected)Cons: Check-in took a while - the attendant was a little flustered when 3 separate guests all showed up at the same time; A little further away from the middle of the action; When the doors shut, they slam shut; Next to a helicopter tour place, not too loud but it could have beenPros: Price - Can't beat less than $80 per night in downtown Indy; Pet Friendly - any room and no charge!!!; Parking - free AND covered in the hotel so pretty easy to monitor; Breakfast - Waffles, coffee, cereal, pastries, fruit; Rooms - Very comfortable beds, desk, LCD tv with basic cable, microfridge, great shower pressure, and all the regular amenities; helpful staff; close to the action but far enough removed for a restful eveningI really do recommend this hotel!  I used to be very skeptical of La Quinta but the company has really improved their rooms and amenities.  This hotel is nicely updated and offers an affordable option for downtown Indianapolis.  Easy access to the sports arenas (you could walk and save on parking because it's less than 2 miles away) and other downtown fun!  Plus, you really can't beat free stays for pets!  FREE!  Wow!  Keep it up La Quinta!My friend got 2 rooms through Hotwire at this location.  Her room was perfectly fine while my room had the following problems:Cons:-Furniture:  Ottoman leg was completely broken.  I almost hit my head on the air condition when i sat on it.-Air con:  It was an old system BUT it worked.  Problem was it leaked all over the floor.  I did not feel the carpet wet until the last day when I finally decided to open the curtains.  And when I tried to turn it to heat because it got so cold one time the fire alarm went off within seconds.  -Trash:  I moved the nightstand a little so I could plug in my charger only to find food wrappers under the nightstand.  I didn't bother to look under anything else after that.-Lighting:  Only 2 lamps worked.  The lamp on the desk didn't even have a lightbulb so I could use my laptop.  When I took the lightbulb from the other lamp to use at the desk and tried to turn it on I realized the whole lamp wasn't working.  -Cleanliness:  So much soap scum on the shower curtains.  Regardless of how you get a hotel room you shouldn't have to deal with simple issues like that.  We were told it was remodeled last year for the Superbowl but it seemed like they never did any upkeep.  There were too many issues to call downstairs and complain so I just dealt with it since I was out most of the time.  Pros:-Bed was extremely comfortable-The staff I would run into were extremely nice-Convenient location-Microwave. I rarely see microwaves in hotel rooms.
review_content_20: We were greeted by being told that breakfast gets crazy because the hotel has a lot of guests so there might not be food for us.  We were told of a restaurant where we could purchase breakfast if none was left.  What a great way to introduce us to your hotel.  "Welcome!, good luck getting any complimentary breakfast that we advertised."  The one elevator fits 2 150 lb people...barely.  Don't try to fit yourself, another person, and luggage.  My room had a dripping shower head and I found a half empty bottle of lotion left on the sink counter from the previous guest.  I guess the hotel can't afford a new bottle for each guest.  My colleague told me that he wished he had brought shower sandals to take a shower because his room was so nasty.  The hotel's hot water is luke warm at best and my shower head was not secured tightly so when I turned on the shower, water sprayed all over the bathroom.  I actually had to stand there and try and fix the shower head myself which I finally did, to a degree.  I could spend a paragraph discussing the nastiness of my toilet, but won't go into detail.  The hotel is right next to a helipad so you have helicopters flying at all hours as well as police and fire sirens.  Don't walk around in barefeet.  Don't touch anything without washing your hands.  Bring a sleeping bag to sleep in.  This is only my first night here.  Two more to go...Stayed here a couple weeks ago for a convention in downtown.  Walking up it isn't the most appealing looking building, but it changes when you walk in.  All of the guest service people at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful.  When we first checked in to our room, we noticed it had a STRONG odor of cigarette smoke, which we did not care for, so the desk attendant quickly had us in another room a couple doors down within about five minutes, and it was clean and nice.  The continental breakfast was perfect for us.  The walk to the convention center was about three quarters of a mile away, which wasn't too bad.  It was just cold out so we had to bundle up.  But yeah this hotel is really nice!  The remodel is coming off nicely!  I recommend avoiding the elevator, as it is clearly very old and very slow.  The hotel is only three stories high.  Will stay here again!

review_content: The suite was perfect - living room, kitchen, bedroom all were comfortable and well equipped. Plus the free breakfast buffet was amazing. I'll be back. I wish Staybridge  had locations everywhere I travel!I stayed at this hotel in Carmel, IN at the end of February.  I was up here for a few days for work.  The hotel is situated not too far from the I-465 and U.S. 31 interchange.I arrived around 7 pm Monday evening after getting the rental car from the airport.  Traffic wasn't too bad even at that time.  One of the first things I noticed is that they know how to clear the roads of ice and snow, unlike here at home.  The staff member at the front desk was great and got me a room on the first floor.  At that point, I was exhausted, so I went to the room.  The room was quite nice and spacious.  The suite even has a dishwasher.  There was plenty of room to be able to get clothes stored, etc.  There were two things that were missing though, and is the reason I gave only four stars instead of five.  The first is that the rooms have no in-room safes.  The other reason is because this is one of the few hotels I have been to that doesn't have separate recycling for items such as bottles, glass, etc.I happened to be here during the week, so Tuesday through Thursday night, they had a social hour with food and drinks, including alcohol, all at no charge.  All of the drinks were served by Donna, who is the sales director for the hotel.  She was great to get to know and have fun with over those few days.  The one who handled getting all the food out, etc. was always on point and kept things well stocked (I believe her name was Diane).  With the social hours there, I was also able to meet some others staying here from all over.  It was fun and helped break up the end of the day.If you are in this area for some reason, this is a great hotel to go to.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.It's okay place - middle of nowhere that you could walk to. Must drive to places. If pets don't bother you then this place is good for you. They allows cat and dogs there. The room is cute and cozy. The negative thing about this place is too many people and pets roaming around. Feel like I was at a pet fair. No privacy. Like I said, it's okay - wish no pets allowed but those days, people are starting to travel with their pets. Pool is ok but small. It was crowded.We were in town with several other families for a youth sports event over the course of a long weekend.  This hotel was perfect.  We loaded up on groceries at Costco, and cooked out every night, which saved us all money and time in trying to feed a big group at restaurants every night.  The backyard/patio area was great:  gas grills and grilling tools provided, a beautiful patio with plenty of seating, and a small grassy area for the kids to play.  The kids also hung out in the pool and in the theater room.  The staff was friendly and accommodating, and clearly understood our needs.  Initially, I was worried about the room being too small for our family of four (the only availability when we booked was a room with one queen bed and a pull-out couch), but literally, all we did in there was sleep and shower.  It was perfect, and we'd do it again in a heartbeat.I definitely enjoyed my stay here.  The rooms are spacious and have a kitchen with microwave, sink, full size refrigerator and even utensils and plates.  They also have complementy breakfast in the morning and free beer, wine and food from 5:30-7 or 7:30pm from Tuesday-Thursdays.  Awesome!  The staff was friendly and amenities were clean during my stay.  Easy 5 stars.This place has been great.  Family gathering here from 8 States and Singapore to celebrate an 80th birthday.  Clean, quiet, good breakfast and wonderful staff. Highly recommend.Great place. Very big room. Friendly staff. Great ligation right next to the highway. Would definitely stay again.I had such a fun time at this hotel. I was there for a week long training but they made me feel right at home. The hotel itself is beautiful, clean & up to date. There is a huge pool/hot tub to enjoy, as well as a free breakfast everyday and a light dinner with free beer and wine 3 days a week! My room was serviced and cleaned everyday. I had fresh towels everyday as well. Awesome. Both Drew and Robbie are the sweetest staff members. They were both very helpful and I was able to have a nice conversation with each of them. I had a 10/10 experience and I hope to stay in your hotel again very soon!Stayed there for the first time. Very friendly and competent staff. I watched Drew go outside in a driving rainstorm to cover up the patio equipment; didn't see him complaint or even look sour. Mary hosted the social hour and was also super-friendly. I'll stay there again next time I visit.Our family and friends stayed 4 nights for a wedding. It could not have been a better place for us to gather. They have a beautiful patio and outdoor area for us to all gather and visit. There was even free food and booze for us to enjoy on Thursday night (tues-Thurs is free food and drink nights). My kids loved to watch movies in the theater room and also swimming in the pool. The saleswoman went above and beyond to be sure we were all content. I would recommend this place for everyone, but especially people with kids. Oh AND our room had a full kitchen and two bedrooms two bathrooms. It was worth the upgrade when you have little ones.Off of US-31 and behind a block, it was a little difficult to find at night.  However the hotel was great.  Comfortable bed, newer quality stuff.  Staff was super friendly.  Wifi was decent when I used it.  Definitely will stay here when I come back to the area.A Great Hotel with outstanding people and Clean and very comfortable rooms.  I can not say enought about the staff and how helpful they were.  I was in town due to my dads surgurey at St Vincent and the team here made my stay very enjoyable (considering the circumstances) and did all they could to help out.I love the rooms....as I was in town for a while and the suites with full kitchen made life easier.A great hotel for any needs.....and Thank you to Chris and his team!  I will be back!While visiting the Indianapolis Children's Museum, decided to stay at this hotel based on other reviews. The staff was wonderful and very friendly. Drew was helpful in finding a delicious pizza place that delivers. The hotel had free beer, wine, soda, and dinner T-Th. The food was good and the beer was awesome! The kids were thrilled with the pool and the movie room. Wonderful stay!The Indianapolis Staybridge suites is the new kid on the block on a stretch of US31 that has plenty of big name hotels (Hilton, Marriott, Wyndham, Sheraton, etc....). This beautiful hotel opened in the spring of 2010.I've stayed here twice now and I'm very pleased with the service and the quality of the rooms. Because it's so new, all the furniture is very nice and the beds are amazing! I always have difficulty sleeping when it's not in my own bed but I've always had a good night sleep at the Staybridge.The best part is that they have an amazing courtyard in the back with tables, chairs, fireplaces and BBQs. Every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday the Staybridge hosts the Sundowner reception in the courtyard. This means free food and drinks for guest and a great chance to socialize with fellow travellers. They even BBQ for guests every Wednesday night!This is fast becoming my favourite hotel in Indy.I don't really have much to add to the existing reviews, except to say that the quality of this hotel has not eroded over time.  We chose this hotel for an anniversary weekend, based on yelp reviews, and were not disappointed in the least.   My wife travels a fair amount, and is pretty fussy.  But she said she would go back to this one anytime!In a drive from Houston to Indy, we stayed in three hotels and this was the nicest by a mile.The hotel was spotless and the staff was really nice. Two different rooms were comfortable, spacious and sparkling clean.Two big bonuses, free on-site laundry and the free breakfast buffet make this place a great choice. They have four washers and four dryers for hotel guest use, just bring your own detergent (or buy one-shot packs in the hotel shop for $1).The breakfast buffet was quite delicious, with make-your-own waffles, biscuits & gravy, eggs, sausage, yogurt, fruit, cereal, etc.And they let you bring pets for a small fee.Just a note to say that if you ever have a need to stay in Carmel, especially long term, at a first class hotel, you want this to be the one. The facility is impressive, with many amenities including an indoor pool and hot tub, breakfast included, and lovely decor.  But it's the staff that makes your stay here really special.  There is not another like it...from the top management on down to the service people, everyone is as friendly as can be.  You will feel like you are coming home to family every time you walk in the door.  The best fun is the mid-week social hours where you get to know other guests as well as the staff, with food and drink provided.  We were there due to a house disaster from the first of August till the middle of November...nothing could have been better.  it was truly our home away from home.  XOXO to all at Staybridge Suites!!!I second Scott!.  We have been staying here for two months now. From the staff to the hot breakfast, and happy hour Tues-Thu has made it not only a great hotel but and friendly homey environment.  The staff is knowledge, helpful and accomodating.  They have delivered my mail to the door very timely, copied and faxed paper work for me.This is one of my fav hotels hands downMy family has had the chance to stay at this location a few times already, and each visit has been wonderful. Spacious rooms, accommodating staff and great breakfasts.One of the biggest selling points for us is the theater room... big screen TV, surround sound and about 9 big cushy recliners.  You can't reserve the space, it is a first come first served basis, but we planned an early evening and had no problems. We rented an action flick, ordered a pizza and thoroughly enjoyed this perk!
review_content_20: Okay, it's not The Ritz.  But it *IS* my FAVORITE hotel for business travel!  It is clean, quiet, has excellent amenities, including:- QUIET environment where you can get work done!- Free wireless and wired internet ALL OVER the grounds- A large "theater" (giant TV) and impressive movie collection- Free hot breakfasts each morning- "Sundowner" wine and hor d'oeuvres several nights per week- THE friendliest staff I have EVER seen- Super comfortable beds- Full kitchenettes in each room- Flat screens & DVD players in each room- A huge, indoor pool and hot tub- Super easy parking and access to everything in the Carmel area.The only possible downside (which isn't one to me) is that it isn't very close to a lot of touristy attractions.  I'm always in town for business, though, and this place is a dream.  The price point is amazingly low considering all that they do.  I highly recommend it for business travelers.

review_content: Location: Fantastic for DT Indy. Parking: Valet was quick, friendly and I love that you can text to have your car brought around. Service: Wonderful! When we checked in the girl told us about this cool "sleep number" style amenity on the beds. After inspection, our double beds didn't seem to have it. We asked the front desk and the guy confirmed it's only for the King sized bedrooms. He felt bad that we searched for it, so gave us free breakfast the next day. It was perfect and the buffet was very decent. Rooms: Just fine. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was large. The only complaint is that the temp wouldn't go below 68 and we both like to sleep in the cold. I would definitely come back here for another stay. Solid visit!I was recently here for a 3 day training seminar for which my company rented one of their meeting rooms. I did not stay here overnight, so this review is only about their meeting/event accommodations. First off, the location is right downtown by the circle, so it is a great place to host an event if you want your guests to be in the heart of town. There is a lot to do, lots of places to eat, and it is very easy to walk to all of the conveniences someone staying in the city would want. That being said, the parking came with a price tag. I walked here each day, but if I recall correctly, self-parking was $22/day and valet was $27, and the parking wasn't even attached to the hotel, as the attached parking garage is actually owned by Chase.  I heard good things about the valet system being convenient, in that you just texted them about 20 minutes before you were going to be leaving and they would have your car ready.The room we rented for the seminar was on the second floor, and not an ideal setup. It was U shaped, so there was no way to setup so that everybody in the room could see both the presenter and everybody else in the room. It was set up with about a half dozen round tables with 5 seats around each of them. We were using a projector and screen, and there wasn't a good way to dim the lights over where the screen was. The only windows of the room were grayed out, so it seemed like it was constantly dark and gloomy outside. They had issues with the climate control, which they made sound like was a recurring issue. The first day the room was really hot even though the thermostat was all the way down. We had to prop the doors open to keep cool, but the noise from the conference that was using the foyer area outside of our room kept us from doing that for too long. The final 2 days weren't as bad, so they did something to help. They kept a supply of bottled water and canned soda stocked, and they had both regular and decaf coffee as well as hot water for Lipton packets of black tea in the morning. We had lunches through them each day. The first lunch was great, with variety of sandwich offerings along with a couple different soup choices and some other sides. The second day was some of the worst pizza and breadsticks I have ever had. That is just not something meant to sit in a warming tray for any period of time. The third day we had less people and they just had a meat/cheese platter with bread to assemble sandwiches and an assortment of sides, which got the job done. The staff were all great the whole time. They were very polite and friendly, and made sure we had what we needed. The person who brought our lunch in to set it up in the serving area, and then came clean up afterwards, was always very courteous and did their best to get that job done without distracting us from the presenter. Overall, it worked pretty well and got the job done for what we needed. I don't know that anything stood out above what I would have expected from anywhere else, but while there a few things that would make it better, there were also no major red flags to get me to recommend against the place. If I was in charge of planning something like this, I would probably look around and see what other options existed, but I wouldn't avoid coming back if it turned out looking like the best option.Great location and the room is clean. That's about it. Stay at any other chain hotels and you would expect that. Room has neutrogena amenities so that's also nice.As a gold Hilton member I got free breakfast, but the eggs was super greasy and quality is very average in general. The elevators was super slow. I considered walking up to 12th floor. I am sure only 1 (max 2) out of elevators were working. That key got demagnetized 3 times during my stay. Even if I put it in a different compartment in my handbag, it still gets demagnetized. What a waste of time.  Drinks split everywhere on a Saturday night in the elevator and lobby.Location: great. Right off the Circle.Atmosphere: fantastic. The HGI is housed in a very old hotel building and they've retained a lot of the cool features from years past. Rooms: really nice. High ceilings, spacious and very clean. Being as old as this building is, you can hear others taking showers and whatnot, but it's not a huge deal.Staff: Friendly. We were greeted by everyone who worked there in a nice, welcoming way.Price: excellent. $129 a night.My only beef is that the elevators are small and SO SLOW. We ended up walking down the stairs when we left on a Sunday morning because the three elevators were all being monopolized. The one that did stop on our floor had three people, a couple suitcases and a cooler and was totally full.Also - and this has nothing to do with the HGI, just a warning to anyone reading this - DO NOT park in the nearby Chase Tower garage. When we left, the elevators were both not running and the unmanned exit booth was not taking credit cards (our only way to pay) and the "call box" was not functioning properly either. We and another couple ended up being stranded at the exit bay until I finally got enough of that nonsense and called 911. They patched me through to the security company and we were able to leave after the guard arrived a few minutes later. On one hand, free overnight downtown parking... yay! On the other... hugely inconvenient.My new favorite hotel downtown. First time staying at this location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It is a great location right off of Monument Circle. Not quite as fancy as the Hilton Downtown. But feels more like home and the price is less. Go see Joey the bartender for food or a cold drink. He is awesome.My fiancee and I had a wonderful stay here. We were in town for a Colts game, and this was a great place to stay downtown...right on the Circle! Online check-in was a breeze, and our room key was waiting on us when we arrived. Our room (on the 15th) was clean and warm when we arrived. The bed was large and comfortable. Jeff in the hotel bar was a good dude and took care of us when we came in after dinner for drinks. Breakfast was included in our stay...the buffet options were ok, but the made to order pancakes, omelets, and french toast were awesome! Staff was top notch, polite, and professional-all the way from the valet guys to the check in staff, to room service. We will definitely stay here next time we have a night out in Indy!we stayed here a week ago and the valet broke our car key and put scotch tape on it. we didn't think much of the scotch tape at that time. my husband and I didn't notice until we made next stop and then went to turn the car on and the key popped open. we took photos at that time. with the holidays being around corner, it skipped my mind to call them. finally called and the valet manager asked me to send the photos so i did. i received an email telling me that they couldn't do anything since i didn't report it when i left. I'm really disappointed in this because we always stay at this hotel when we go to Indy. We go there at least once a year, if not twice since my husband's family is there. I will never stay at this hotel again.They are thieves.  Don't stay here unless you want their employees placing fraudulent charges on your credit card and then a long delay in waiting for a refund from their corporate office.  The water in the shower was also cold.  Who wants to take a cold shower on an icy February morning?  I printed off documents in their business center and they were covered in blue streaks.  When I asked for help with this the employee was rude and unhelpful.  Also, I have never stayed at a hotel with elevators this slow.  I must've been waiting around 10 minutes for one around check in and check out.  Between this and the fraud, this hotel is really on the decline.  They charge Hilton prices for sub-Motel 6 quality service.Moist...let me just say that this was the first and ever-present thought that entered my mind upon entering our room.  For the price of the room, I can say that we expected so much more.  Though the uncleanly smell/feel was just the beginning...We requested a cot for the room months ahead of time, yet upon getting to the hotel, there were none available.  Every day of our four day visit we requested a cot, and every day we were told they were given to other rooms.  Their explanation was simply that they gave out cots on a 'random' basis.  Let that sink in, rather than giving it to the guests who ask ahead of time, and check in over the course of the day, they still give them out randomly.  I will give the caveat that there was a nearby convention being held, so they had plenty of guests.  But the state of the room, and the absurdity of their randomized system puts them at the bottom of the hotel experiences I have ever had.I really enjoyed this hotel. As many others have mentioned, the location is great - right in the heart of downtown and practically on the "circle". There are tons of restaurants nearby, a shopping mall and the convention center is just a 5 minute walk.The building looks like it dates from the 20's, so expect high ceilings and lots of nice architectural details. Rooms are good, not great. Mine was decent sized with a Sleep Number bed, comfy chair and a microwave/frig combo unit. The air con seems to blow non-stop so be prepared for that noise - earplugs are probably not the worst idea as there can be some street noise as well.Small details make this an above average property - staffers are young, enthusiastic and very friendly. There is a small convenience market for essentials and a complimentary water/coffee bar in the lobby. My rate included breakfast and free wifi - I had a decent signal which was much appreciated. Also, bathrooms are fairly large, well lit and have ample space for toiletries.It's not a luxury hotel, but the staff and location make it worth a stop.I have such an issue with "regular" hotels.  You literally do not get anything for your money.  But this hotel is a solid three star, the front desk staff is polite, they serve healthy snacks and coffee in the lobby, the room was clean, the bathroom was spacious and overall it was fine for the night downtown.  It was NOT worth $250 bucks but the Big Ten football game was in town and why not charge the OSU and MSU fans an arm and a leg to enjoy their Indy experience, so the prices were very high for the evening all over town.  One thing I wasn't impressed with.  We valeted and our valet didn't warm up our car even though we called ahead - bummer since it was approximately 28 degrees when we checked out of the hotel.  It's a downtown hotel - nothing blowing my mind so just A-OK. I'm hard to please in the world of hotels but I doubt I have any need to stay here again.They are CURRENTLY renovating the elevators which are slow and cumbersome.  It shakes and rattles when you ride on it.  Just a warning, until they are done.The staff here is awesome! The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The location is great too!We didn't stay here, but I just had to stay what an AMAZING STAFF!!  They were amazingly helpful.  My S.O. came in from Illinois the afternoon of June 1.  He spontaneously purchased Pacers tickets from StubHub for Game 6.  Far from home, we walked the Circle to find FedEx in order to print out the tickets.  Unfortunately they were closed.  We walked into the Hilton to see if we could somehow use their Business Center and pay to print a couple tickets.  The gentleman at the concierge desk was so nice and and incredibly helpful.  He led us right next door and allowed us to use the computer, with no demand for compensation and no questions asked.  This really just made our day!  We certainly look forward to our next stay with Hilton, even if it is here in downtown Indy.This hotel is located steps from Monument Circle in downtown Indy. It's a great location, walkable to many attractions in Indy, including the Circle City mall (if you can find a pedestrian entrance!), Monument Circle and it's monument and cool architecture of the surrounding buildings, and the hip Massachusetts Av with bars and restaurants.  There is valet or self parking right next door at $17 a day.There is also a free fitness center and indoor pool in the basement (which we did not use.)The hotel itself is in a handsome old bank building with a spacious lobby with seating and fireplace, a 24-hour free coffee/tea station and a 24-hour small store with sundries, soda and snacks.  There is a restaurant off the lobby, which we didn't visit.The hotel rooms definitely needs an update from it's mid-80s neo-classical style, but that doesn't take away from the good-sized rooms, and functional, if not elegant bathrooms.  The rooms have mini fridges, a small microwave, TV, coffee/tea maker and good closet and drawer space.  Bath products and towels are of a good quality, and abundant, and there is good water pressure.The bed was comfortable enough, though i could not get the advertised dial to make each side harder or softer to work.Staff was pleasant and helpful, and quickly dealt with two very small issues (some trays left in the hall all day (gross); and a malfunctioning key-bard) cheerfully and apologetically.I was impressed overall.I have never witnessed such an attentive staff who seem so interested in a positive guest experience. The rooms are quite lovely and have a throw back elegant feel. The bar and kitchen staff are excellent. Superb crispy salmon delivered by the chef himself. California Club was delivered via room service very promptly and one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten.
