I would like to see a bit more work out equipment in the gym but minor in comparison to the service. Front desk called after room service to make sure everything was satisfactory and very enthused when it was. Keep up the good work!I tried to like this hotel.  I love the fruit water,  the historic building it is in, the location, the view from the rooms and the decor.  But overall this doesn't pull more than a 3.  I have come to expect tea, coffee and hot chocolate in all hilton honors hotels.  This one only had coffee and lipton tea (for any self respecting tea drinker that is very weak).  Although i don't eat cookies, the tray was always empty so i guess even if i did there wouldn't be any and overall i didn't get a feeling people where glad to see me as in other hotels with the exception if very helpful and courteous bellboys-they need lots of creditGreat room and great location!  The hot tub and pool were great!  It is right off of the circle and so convenient to downtown bars!  We stayed here for bachelorette night and it was perfect!Tip: Street parking will save you some money but watch out Mon-Sat mornings and be sure to get to the meter before the maid!I had such a pleasant stay at the Hilton Garden Inn while i was here on a short business trip. The hotel is perfectly situated right next to the Circle--so it's within walking distance to some awesome restaurants. The roads are wide and easy to navigate. If you don't want to park, leave your car with the valet. The staff is friendly and check-in was a breeze. I had a standard room and it was spacious and had all the amenities I could need--comfy bed, nice desk and chair to do work, long mirror on the closet, and properly equipped bathrooms. And the best of all Wi-Fi was complimentary! How many hotels do that nowadays? One nit-picky thing I found was that the shower went hot and cold and back to hot for no reason. Other than that, it was perfect. I'd stay here again for sure!I stayed here for a few days and the room was well appointed.  The front desk staff were very helpful and easy to deal with.  I would stay here again.Went tot he bar there to meet soem friends who were staying the night.   It was good - but the typical hotel bar.  You should walk around and explore the city for good food.   The bartenders will tell you the good spots to go.
review_content_20: The hotel was nice, king suite was a bit small for what we were paying, but the thing that was unsatisfactory was the security guard who was harassing us. He would stare at us every time we went outside to smoke cigarettes. Being in a non smoking room with four smokers, he shouldn't have treated us as suspiciously as he was, especially being that we were paying guests. When we complained to the front desk the next morning, they seemed concerned and apologized, but we didn't receive any follow up that it was actually addressed. Probably would not stay there again, the guard made us feel very unwelcome.Such a cool old building, historic and very cool with old details throughout.  The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful.  The rooms are outdated but not terrible, they are very clean.  There is nothing that stands out really about the rooms, very typical.  Parking is across the street in a parking garage at $25/day which is completely rediculous, I've stayed in bigger cities and haven't even paid that much.  The biggest thing this hotel has going for it is definitely the fact that it sits on monument circle.Nice hotel that doesn't feel like the normal Hilton Garden Inn's that you normally see...It is definitely more like a full service hotel.  The front desk staff is helpful, the rooms are spacious and clean, and there is free wifi throughout the hotel.  The issues I had with the hotel were...1 - No closet, hangers or iron in the room.  2 - The elevators are DEAD slow.  I waited for almost 10 minutes one evening for the elevator to take me downstairs.While I feel other hotels are nice for other reasons, this one was nice in an "upscale" way. It's probably one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at.I am from Louisville, KY, and I booked this trip using a weekend getaway package on an Indy tourism website. The room was about $200 and I received a $100 Simon Mall gift card as part of the package. You can't beat that. FYI: I'd probably stay here again... even if I didn't get the gift card.I love the fact that this hotel was in a historic building. I'm nostalgic about those things. I was impressed with the pool and hot tub area in the basement, which must have been recently remodeled... it looked great! My partner and I enjoyed the pool very much.... we were the only ones in it the whole time... probably 1.5 hours... must have been a slow night. The decor of the whole place was beautiful.The location, Monument Cirlce in downtown Indy, was also great. It was a neat area with some brick streets and great architecture. We were within walking distance of a TJMaxx, Steak'n'Shake, and the Cirlcle Center Mall (a Simon Mall). The Indy zoo was about 6-8 blocks away... we were going to walk it, but it was a rainy day.The check in was decent. I can't really rate the hotel staff because I really didn't need much of their service. All in all... a great place.A good place to stay. In an old historic bank building. Room was clean and the staff attended to our needs. Pool area needed some attention as there were towels all over the place and the hot tub needed some water added, as the jets were sloshing water all over the floor. The breakfast buffet was just ok. This is in the heart of downtown Indy, so the places to eat were limitless.If the Conrad is booked up. And the Hilton Downtown is booked up. And the Omni is booked up. After you're done kicking your own shins for waiting until Friday afternoon. And cussed out whatever shenanigan conference is going on in Indy.Book the Hilton Garden Inn. It'll be fine.Very, very nice hotel in a great location, with a very friendly staff. Everyone we encountered at this hotel was extra nice: the front desk staff gave us recommendations for dinner and the server at breakfast highlighted the must-see animals at the zoo for us. While I was getting ready to go out, the hairdryer shorted. No big deal. Called down to the front desk and they brought up a new one in minutes, AND gave us breakfast coupons. Nice touch! Rooms were clean and comfortable -- the Sleep Number bed was really nice!Another great Hilton Family hotel. What else can I say!!Went to Indianapolis for a Birthday weekend celebration and stayed at the HGI downtown. Excellent location. Its right in the heart of the downtown is you dont need a car for anything if you are staying here. You can get on the walking tour of Indianapolis. (They have a web site, look it up).The downtown eateries are all accessible on foot. The stadium is near by as well. Depending the direction your room is facing, you get good views. The room is clean, comfortable and spacious. The bath room is slightly smaller than average. But very clean. The lobby is pretty nice. Not fancy but nicely done. The hotel is in an historic building. They have valet parking or self park. The parking structure is right across the street. So go for the self park option. It is unlimited in & out anyway. They have a restaurant in the hotel. We did not try it. They did give us 10% off coupon at check in with a nice cold bottle of water. The TV has basic cable and some movie channels. Overall, good place.Typing this as I sit by the toasty warm fire place burning on a cold, crisp night.  I'm enjoying my stay here and think this may be my new hangout when I'm downtown Indy.  It's centrally located in town and I can walk to many restaurants.  The hotel has a full service restaurant and a little convenience store.  Rooms are spacious and nice and workout facilities has  new equipment.  Best part of my stay is I was able to walk across the street and get a fabulous massage at Studio 2000 (recommended by the hotel).  Great stay!whoa.    it's an above average garden inn.- friendly staff- awesome location- awesome beds- good sized, but not huge rooms- amenities: small pool, hot tub, good fitness room, nice biz center, free wifi, free printing.i have two minor complaints- bathroom door is oddly placed right next to the bed.- ac doesn't turn off.  the fan just kept running until I got fed up and turned the whole thing off and then it was warmish when I woke up.overall, I'd stay here again and I'd recommend it.One of the first hotels I stayed at in the city, the Hilton does not fail to live up to the prestige one would expect.  Thankfully, I was not required to examine the bill, so I can't be 100% certain that it was worthwhile, but these upscale hotels in downtowns, mere blocks away from key foot-traffic locations can't be anywhere in the neighborhood of cheap.  That said, I felt the experience was worth it.This location is right next to the Circle, downtown.  This place is full of cute shops, restaurants, one strange biker hangout, and picturesque landmarks are just a staircase away.  In the other direction, a slightly more hefty, but still doable, walk away, are the clubs and liquor-themed restaurants.  But none of this seedy type of traffic would ever pass by the Hilton, it's simply out of their way.  A horse-drawn carriage ride to another location in downtown would be entirely possible.Inside the hotel it's clean, the staff is helpful and prompt.  Nothing special to report either way, which is kind of the experience you want, after all, you don't come to a city to hang out in the hotel, it should be pleasantly neutral.I would not recommend it. Location is great. bartender super friendly but staff needs help. My bed sheet had holes on it. The front desk came to my door and jsut dropped sheets off versus changing them. I went to the front desk for the gym card for the athletic club and they said it was 16 a day when my friend an hour earlier said it was free.Clean, centrally located, great amenities.  The 24-hour pantry (read: extremely tiny limited convenience store) is great and they don't grossly overcharge.  The business center is likewise great - free printing!The restaurant is mediocre, and expensive.  They kept raving about this bread pudding, but it was really very sub-par.  Although the rooms have a microwave and fridge, there didn't seem to be anywhere within walking distance to buy groceries. However, do NOT check out before taking a look at your room charges.  I was charged $22 for valet parking (took a cab there) and for a 25 minute incoming call - they purportedly don't charge for incoming calls.  All was corrected but had I been in any more of a hurry I would never have noticed.a Basic Breakfast Buffet but they will cook to order included, also included is your drink, mine was coffee, they have switched to Starbucks Organic, Bonnie & staff were SO  Friendly, they have fresh soups on the Lunch Buffet, which we can't wait to trywe haven't stayed here yet, but eyeing the Holiday specials!breakfast buffet plus drink $9.95Watch out - BED BUGS!!!Last week, I was in Indianapolis for business and stayed in the Hilton downtown. If I had only known ... the next morning I had 3 red bites on my belly - I googled images and learned that these kind of bites are the typical BED BUG bites, also referred to as breakfast, lunch and dinner. they itch as badly as poison oak and are very painful, too.I've called up the hotel and told them about this instance. The only response was "Thanks for letting us know." No apology, no shocked "oh my god, how terrible", no attempt to keep me as a customer and make me feel better about this horrible Hilton experience. Nothing. Are they used to people calling them up and complaining about bites?Unbelievable ... outrageous!Nice hotel!  Although I only spent 10 hours in the hotel the staff was nice, the room was clean and the breakfast service/food was good.  It is in a great location to get to anything in town.  There are many restaurant choices within walking distance.We had a great experience here! The hotel is great, rooms are clean and allow pets. The rooftop pool area needs some work...I really like this hotel!Great room. Took three calls to get the item i requested in my reservation to my room, and the pool is really depressing .. its in the basement, but this is a buisness hotel with a nice rooms.. i enjoyed my stay .
review_content_40: I stay at this hotel a lot as my employer is located nearby (and I don't live in Indianapolis). The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, large and clean. Very happy every time I stay here. I've had a lot of bad hotel experiences, and this is never one of them. Each room has a mini-fridge. There is a 24 hour pantry next to the front desk. The restaurant is okay. It's great to have it, but there are a lot of other nicer restaurants nearby, so I don't usually eat in the hotel.

review_content: Stopped in just to visit the lounge and have a few glasses of wine. It's a very nice area with comfortable seating nice TVs service was friendly overall decent hotel lounge.I stay near airports quite frequently. This Crowne Plaza is exceptionally close to the airport. You hear planes taking off all night long. The hotel does provide ear plugs. But then, how do you hear your alarm in the morning? The executive lounge was underwhelming. There are about 10 different types of trail mix and green apples for a nightly snack. In the morning there were breakfast bars and apples for breakfast. How about some eggs, potatoes and bacon? We were going to try the breakfast in the common area of the hotel, but a couple told us to go elsewhere as they were walking out... so we did. My coworkers have banned me from picking our hotels after this poor choice.It's an okay hotel. But it's not as great as they advertise.The staff is hit or miss, friendly and rude. They could use more training on how to not be short with their guests about useless things.The lobby is nice. Makes it seem fancy.The rooms are warm. They never really cool off, but they aren't miserably hot either. I wonder how it is during the dead of summer?Rooms are overall pretty nice. Bathrooms are okay. My bathtub leaked everywhere, but I got a surplus of towels.Everyone complains about the planes flying over the hotel. I guess I can see their complaint, but honestly the planes didn't bother me. But then again I'm around airplanes all the time, so maybe I'm just used to it.I'd recommend this hotel if you need a place to stay, but not if you're looking for an amazing stay.I arrived at the airport at 3 a.m. and expected trouble getting the hotel shuttle without some kind of wait.  But I phoned when I landed and Justin was right there and I must say he made the ride fun for a tired passenger.  I applaud him.  The room was good and the staff was fine as well for this very short stay - left at 8:30 the next morning.  Did not try the breakfast.The rooms are always great here. Exceptionally clean and comfortable. As I travel with too many work electronics, they have plenty of plugs. I have been coming here almost annually for a work trip since 2005. The staff is always the same. I like to see the same friendly, helpful people year after year. Breakfast at the buffet is okay. And there is plenty of fresh fruit and bacon. The buffet dinners feeding 200 are middle of the road. Variety is good, quantity is great but quality is so-so. See you next year!This is a very nice place and I am so glad that this was the location for our stay while in Indianapolis this past weekend. The staff were friendly, the facilities were clean and we were never bothered by the cleaning staff when we asked for privacy. That last one is always important to me, I like my privacy. It is rather loud as the hotel is directly under the flight path of the airport, but that was not a big deal and they provide earplugs if you want them. I was disappointed in the food, but the service was remarkable.Noise Noise Noise. The hotel is close to the airport and has a free shuttle. The lobby is clean and the staff is friendly. The rooms are older and if you can block out the noise from the hall and the airplanes it is ok. At least they keep a glass in the bathroom (sooooo many hotels don't). The curtains do a good job of blocking out the light. AC works well but is a bit noisyThe lobby is nice. Depending on which way you come it it could be hard to see the check in. It all smells like pool down starts due to the pool being right there. We were on the 4th floor and it was easy to find our room even though the hotel is quite large. Once in your room we had to go to the bathroom from our long trip. Unfortunately there was pubic hair and pee on the outside of the toilet and a small blood colt stuck on the inside of the toilet. This make me wonder if they clean the rest of the room.They do have free shuttle service to the airport. And everyone I talked to was friendly.My room was clean and pretty quiet but it just never cooled off. I even changed rooms and that room was no better. Its an OK hotel, it seemed a little under staffed. The food was really good....Very clean, quite place and nice staff. I did make a reservation for 2 beds when I arrived I got a king with a sofa pull out. The mattress on the pull out was 3 inches think (no joke). Access to the pool is akward the only way we found that didn't take you through the whole hotel was straight through the front lobby (who wants to do that in your bathing suit?) It is a isolated location but very quick and easy route to downtown. You are extremely close to the airport hence airport in the name. With that said you do hear airplanes through the night. Price was reasonable but we did find it on pricelineHallways very hot. Room AC made the room cooler, but I had it dialed down to 63 and it was nowhere near 63. Closer to 73. Shower/bath floor felt sticky and not clean. The bath may towel was brown in color, the original color was white. The towels weren't much better. Room opened to the interior of the hotel, so if you are worried about aircraft noise (it IS an airport hotel after all) you may want to request one of these rooms. Breakfast buffet wasn't anything special, they did have real scrambled eggs, not the nasty powdered kind and they had fresh blueberries and raspberries which were nice.  Wait staff was adequate, after flagging one down for a coffee refill. Bed linens felt clean. Bed was relatively firm, pillows seemed fluffy at first, but compacted once you put your head on it, similar to a down pillow. Maid seemed nice, she wished me a safe flight as I passed. No other interaction with hotel employees.I'll keep this one short. The hotel was nice but a few issues added to a less-than-perfect stay. Overall, if you need a really nice place with friendly staff to stay near the airport, I would highly recommend this hotel.Complimentary shuttle from the airport, and the place is nice. You can sometimes here airplanes taking off, but the noise is relatively minor.Stayed here when my flight was cancelled. Lovely indoor pool, great rooms, close to the highways.Nice place but the shuttle service is the worst!!! They do not wait for anytime frame at the airport and literally do a drive by and then leave!!! You cannot be 30 seconds late or your going to wait for another half an hour!  You can even call the front desk and they still will not wait and at midnight that is crappy! They will tell you that the shuttle runs at the top and bottom of every hour which is false ... The driver pulled in at 11:23 and at 11:24 we had already left the terminal and on the way back to the hotel! In my opinion we should have set at the airport until 11:30 and the departed!The front desk representatives are always friendly and helpful. Lobby and rooms have always been clean with fresh looking decorations and furniture. Comfortable bed. For being this close to the airport, there is very little noise. This hotel remains a regular stop for us.Lobby is well decorated for Christmas. Very well decorated. Looked like a nice pool. They offer a pantry to buy snacks as well as vending machines. Double the price of most items elsewhere. Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Room was clean and had plenty of space. Beds were a little firm, but that's just me. All white bedding ( a sign to me they wash all the bedding, not leaving the comforter for each guest to leave their germs)Bathroom clean. Odd set up as far as available towel hangers....Restaurant in lobby, didn't go but ranges from $13-$35 a plate. We ordered Jimmy Johns from 3 min away. They really did show up in less than 10 min. And they delivered to the room directly. About 8 plugins in the room.I was Cold all night.Rooms are cold. heat doesn't work.The old shuttle driver is excellent--knowledgeable, helpful...Shuttle comes and goes to the airport every 30 minutes for free.Free wifiIt's a little old and dated but clean. Its super hot in the hallways; ac in the room worked well and kept the room nice and cool. Air traffic was a little noisy....completely forgot to use ear plugs; fortunately I only had to stay one night.  Staff accommodated late check out (2::00 PM).  I did get locked out of the room when I returned after 12 noon - had to ask for key card to be reactivated, which didn't work so front desk had to call maintenance.  Shuttle service to and from airport is a plus!Right by the airport with a complimentary shuttle service. Pretty hotel with a cool layout. Rooms are big and clean, try not to get a room that's right on the final approach path oryou'll be up all night listening to airplanes. Comfy beds and pillows. Work out room has a few treadmills, an elliptical, a bike, and a stairmaster. A few free weights but not much in that department. Indoor pool with an arcade room. Free breakfast buffet in the restaurant which is also a decent place for dinner, pricy though. They also have the VIP lounge on the fifth floor with snacks and goodies. Friendly staff.
review_content_20: This place has a lot of rough edges, staying here for three days, but will list what I've noticed in first 24 hours1.  Dirty un-vacuumed carpets in lobby.  They really need to shampoo the spots out, but I'll settle for a vacuuming.2.  Outlets in sleeping rooms don't work--they rely on lamps with extra outlets and the holes are too loose to hold a plug.  Tip:  if you need to hold a charge, use the bathroom outlet.3.  They provide earplugs as part of the toiletry kit--bad omen, which was realized in middle of night with freight planes taking off/landing all night.4.  Restaurant menus were dirty and grubby--seriously, wipe them clean.  Also, silverware was spotted.  Made me wonder how clean the kitchen was!5.  Baked potato soup special was Velveeta  with a few chunks of potato.  Gross!6.  Bartender was an untrained waitress who made it her mission to disclaim "I don't know how to make drinks, I'm just a server!"  Manager/supervisor came by and laughed it off.7.  Hotel staff does not acknowledge or greet guests.  Please look at me and say hello when I walk by.  I'm spending money in your establishment.8.  Dirty table linens (tablecloths/napkins) in conference rooms.9.  Who serves boiled hamburgers for lunch?Have stay here 2 times and was very pleased each time. You are greeted with a cold drink and a smile every time. The staff is very friendly and they try real hard to please and meets your needs. The facility are roomy but a bit dated like the 1970 treadmills. The pool and arcade are kid safe and friendly. The best part is the most important the great big bed and fluffy pillow and plush bed spread haaaa goodnight zzzz.Great for the price!  Was not expecting it to be so nice.  Only negative was that the bathrooms in the room were quite tiny (only one person can get ready at a time), and would recommend bringing a pair of ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.  Luckily, these weren't an issue for me, but I could see how this would be bothersome.My evening flight was canceled and I was rebooked on an early flight so I opted to stay closer to the airport.  I really liked this hotel.  It was clean and the wifi reliable (fast enough for free).  I loved the firm mattress!  The bedding was clean and comfortable with a bevy of comfy pillows.  The spa quality shampoo, conditioner and lotion were a welcome surprise and the soap smelled fantastic.   Nice enough towels (nothing to gush over but certainly good enough).To the people complaining about airplane noise - you're right next to an airport! What did you expect?  It was not bad at all and I slept well and comfortably.Got a great price here on priceline. The reception staff was competent and efficient. The lobby was set up for a convention and was almost impossible to navigate through. We were directed through a separate door with more direct access to our room. We were disappointed that they had removed the hot tub from the pool area. The moment we got to our room everything else was forgotten. The room was quiet and large. There was a shower with excellent water pressure and a garden tub. The bed was a bit firm but comfortable with a good selection of pillows. We were in the flight path, but once I turned on the fan before bed you really couldn't hear it. We had minimal to no noise from other rooms. Free parking and good free in room wifi made for a really nice stay.Yuck.  Would not stay here again. Staff was friendly enough but rooms need updating. A/c is very loud. Ceilings in hallway seem low. Walls are very thin- can here conversation of people next to me. And can hear lady constantly sneezing. Worst part- hot water in shower did not work!!!!Not cheap either.Seemed to be a very nice hotel. I stayed here on business. The hotel staff seemed courteous, albeit a little cold. Room seemed clean, which is the most important thing to me. I would likely stay here again.There's a lot to like about this place. In comparison to many of the places I've stayed in Indianapolis, it was cleaner, more modern and better kept. The bathroom was spotless, which I think is a big deal to a lot of people. The Wi-Fi stayed connected and was relatively fast, which is another big deal to many business travelers. The bed was comfortable and big, and the couch was a nice touch too.The airplanes are so minor in comparison to some of the complaints that have been leveled. Yes, it's loud, but there aren't enough going over to be a problem. We heard it several times, but never when sleeping. If you are going to be sleeping at 2 in the afternoon - yes, it might be a small issue, but with the AC on, it's not that bad.The bar is a little expensive, but was a nice thing to have. The bartenders were friendly and attentive, which in a small bar can be an issue.The pool was too crowded, and the people really didn't respect our space. Not the hotel's fault, but they could probably stand to expand that. I just wanted to sit in the hot tub and the parents weren't respectful enough to ask their kids not to climb over us and splash us. Plus - a woman brought her baby into it which is a terrible idea, but not the hotel's fault. It appeared to be attendees or the family of attendees of a conference, so it might depend on what is being hosted there.The one major complaint was maybe on our last day. I woke up at 10:00, and at 10:30, right before I left, the housekeepers knocked on the door. When I left, I noticed our "Do Not Disturb" tag had been taken. My girlfriend stayed behind to sleep in a little more and they apparently came back twice before 11:00. The front desk promised to find out what was going on and address it, but still, kind of obnoxious. It felt like they were trying to get us to leave so they could clean the room and leave for the day. I understand, but it wasn't even a late checkout, so talk about annoying.Oof. Bad. It  was just horrible. If you don't mind, I'm just going to list every crappy thing I encountered during my several meals at The Landing at the Crowne Plaza Indianapolis Airport.CRAPPY STUFF:1) The service: They take forever to come over to you and disappear for 15 minutes at a time. No smiles.2) The water: The h20 tasted lie poo20. If you know your water is tainted, offer bottled. 3) Appetizer: I ordered a hummus trio with fresh pita bread. Mmm the pita was warm. Problem was they tasted like pancakes. Warm fluffy flapjacks. I guess that would have been fine I would have had maple syrup hummus. Oh and the hummus was bland and tasteless. 4) Breakfast: The server was subpar and the milk was warm. 5) Cocktails: I ordered an Arnold Palmer-esque drink they call the "co-pilot". It tasted like watered down country time lemonade. Let down. My companion almost choked over their house cabernet. They were gagging and swirling furiously. Avoid The Landing and go across the street to the Radisson's restaurant. It can't be worse.Hotel is not Crowne Plaza quality. I think they may be downgrading to rebadging as a Holiday Inn. The restaurant here is bad. Had the worst Reuben sandwich of my life. Bread was soggy as a sponge. Inedible. Chili and salad were horrible. Overpriced too. Airport hotel choices in Indy are poor. Since they opened the new terminal, none are that close to Indy either. Stay downtown instead. Or better yet, just avoid Indy all together.What a beat up old hotel this is. Decent furniture and a comfortable bed, but the room was incredibly stuffy and the air conditioner was noisy. The unit, in a space next to the closet, had one register, so parts of the room were cold while others were hot.Planes not a big deal.Not a favorite of mine.  Restaurant is horrible and menu is limited.  Room service shuts down early as does the bar and you get to listen to airplanes flying all night.  Rooms are OK.  Beds are pretty comfortable.  Just not a real fan of this hotel.Ok, this is not a bad hotel.  I really liked the lobby and the fountain and the business center.  The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating.  They are 12 minutes from the airport.  People complain about the noise form the airport; guess what, you're 12 minutes from the airport!!!  The room was nice, the WiFi free, and I had no issue or problem while I stayed here.  I presented at the hotel and the room was nice and the staff was helpful in this regard as well.  The only negative was the breakfast.  I had pancakes and they were super dry but I am a trooper.  I would stay here again, no doubt.Eh, nothing special - I did notice that the old train cars were avaliable as rooms & that seemed fun. For the price, I wouldn't choose it again. The normal rooms were small and the bathrooms were tiny. We shared the room with another couple - maybe that was the downfall. 4 people in these rooms caused it to be cramped. With so many options downtown - I'd choose something different next time.Great rate, nice restaurant and polite focused staff.I enjoyed my stay at the Crowne Plaza Hotel.  This was a last minute stay and was done through Hotwire.  I was overall very pleased with the hotel.  The lobby and interior of the hotel were well kept, and the staff were very helpful.  My room was huge, and very clean!  I ordered room service for dinner and the staff again were very nice and quick!  Overall I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would stay again if need be!I was not able to arrive and stay due to inclement weather.  It was very difficult to get a refund from this hotel.  I would definitely not recommend this hotel.Price is right with Millionaire's discount. Has a shuttle which I haven't used yet. I got stuck on 2nd level back-corner mouse maze. Up down and around. Front desk was helpful and courteous. No restaurants in the area to walk to. A rental car is a must, which I don't have. beds were comfy and hotel quiet. Exec lounge lacks amenities. Fitness center is average.Come on. It's not the Ritz Carlton. But it's clean, the staff is nice, and the restaurant is decent enough. It too is not Ruth's Chris, but for a turkey club it's quite good.Stayed here before an early morning flight. Pluses: Very nice lobby and interior. Soft plush towels. Flat screen tv in room. Large desk and free Internet. Starbucks coffee in lobby. Minuses: bed was hard as a rock. I don't do firm and tossed and turned all night. Iron and board were in poor condition.We got our room through priceline day of travel for less than usd50. Overall, pretty good experience.
review_content_40: This hotel sucks. Stayed here for Super Bowl XLVI. Handicap room too small, They put coffee maker next to toilet (gross), no room for roll A way bed, so my son, husband & I had to share king bed. Bathroom not  accessible & the door locked up.  Had to have maintenance up to unlock door.  CP employee claimed he worked at another location & at his location they had keys to unlock the bathroom & any interior doors.  My husband had to eventually unlock the door with tools provided by the CP employee because the CP employee was unable to unlock the door.  Elevator constantly broke down, my son is in a wheelchair, we were on the 5th floor so this was stressful.  Food & buffet in dining room cold & gross, but somehow room service food OK. Both use same kitchen...oh & ice machines were slimy with mold. When we made basic inquiries about hotel services, most of the staff claimed that this branch was not the one they usually worked at, so they didn't know anything. Front desk staff pleasant, MOD Chris, super, bar staff great especially SALLY. However when I found a charge for $472.79 on my credit card even the accounting department, Bryan, could not explain what it was for. General Manager Mark Pogonis was rude & hung up on me during our conversation, & refused to take my calls when I called back. It was not a SUPER STAY. You would think that a city that handles over 100,000+ for INDY 500 for decades could handle less than 70,000 people for a football game. I was wrong.Noisy, not only from the constant line of planes landing, especially midnight-1am, but the maids are VERY loud. Front desk staff that is apathetic and the biggest problem...BED BUGS.   My colleague found one. Front desk wasn't overly concerned.  When my colleague wrote to Radisson, never even received a follow up.  At one time, Radisson was one of the better U.S. hotel chains, not any more.Whoa whoa whoaaaa! I jumped the gun on my good review! Let's take a few steps back. The walls and ceilings are suuuuper de dupppper thin! We could head all hallway traffic and get this. We heard the party upstairs peeing away.i wasn't sure I was hearing someone peeing til the toilet flushed and the toilet seat cover went down. Seriously?!!!! Cmon! Spend some money for some thicker walls none of this paper mache crap! Besides that. The rooms are great. I'm just glad we don't have a young couple upstairs or next door. Damn.. Better knock on wood now.This is not for the hotel itself but for the parking lot and airport shuttle I used when I went out of town a week or two ago.  I paid in advance (about $6 a day with tax) and the value was very good and my car was secure.  The trip to the airport (about 4:30 in the morning Christmas eve) was prompt and cordial, but on the trip back a week later I called the hotel to pick me up at 1:45 am, right as my plane landed and was told  the van would be there in 15 minutes.  It turned out to be 45 minutes; another party on my same flight needed a ride too and those people had to wait as well.  I didn't need to wait an extra half hour when told otherwise, I wanted to get home.  But with a family of five in the same van, I didn't raise a stink with the driver (I just didn't tip when he got my luggage out of the van).  When I travel I usually have other people take me to the airport and if that isn't possible, next time it will be a tough call as to whom to use to park and shuttle me.

review_content: This hotel was absolutely spectacular!  Stayed here for three evenings in a 1 Queen-sized bed bedroom and everything was just amazing.  Of all things, I especially have to call out the bathroom - good lord, the bathroom they had in my hotel room was the type of bathroom you'd want in your house.  It had beautiful heavy duty granite for the sink and an amazing shower with ample space and glass doors instead of the classic kitchy hotel shower liner with rings.  Beautiful modern mirrors and modest decorations were on the walls and it was in every way my dream bathroom.But enough potty talk!  The room itself was spacious, had a pull-out comfy bed-couch combo unit, and had a luxurious soft bed with soft pillows.  On that bed I slept like a log every night.  Usually I find it tough sleeping in another bed that's not my own, but not these past few nights!  I was out like a light and it was just great.  There was also ample closet space, drawer-space, and a great view of downtown - simply wonderful!Finally and arguably most importantly, the concierge desk staff downstairs were extremely helpful.  If I had a question about downtown Indianapolis, they had the answer.  If I needed a taxi, they got it for me.  When the internet wasn't working downstairs, they had it fixed lickety-split.  Really a wonderful team for my entire visit!  If I had to knock this hotel for one thing, $191/night in downtown Indianapolis is just too high.  Although everything was great, I definitely felt a bit of price gouging here for a city in the middle of the country.Straight up, didn't stay, didn't even make a reservation. Didn't need to. Will be in town to run the marathon in November, they have zero rooms if ya stay one night, plenty of rooms if ya stay 2 nights (confused, yea me to). Then they charge $23 a day for you to park in THEIR parking lot. I'll stay elsewhere, ridiculous.Pretty poor for a courtyard. I have stayed here several times on business and the service at check in is always slow. And I mean 15 minutes to find a standing corporate reservation. All the rooms have feather pillows (which I do not like) and no foam pillows are ever available. Rooms are clean and in good repair but seem fairly loud.The wife and I were in town for the weekend and stayed at the Courtyard Indianapolis Downtown.  The hotel was located in the congested Marriott hotel complex consisting of the JW Marriott, Fairfield Inn, SpringHill Suites, and the Courtyard, which have different entrances from the street, but share a common parking garage.  Its location couldn't have been better as the hotel was across the street from White River State Park, the Indiana State Museum, the Eiteljorg Museum, and Victory Field and a short walk to the Convention Center, Lucas Oil Stadium, and downtown restaurants, bars and shopping.  The lobby and rooms were clean and modern with a design aesthetic consistent with the Courtyard brand.  Service from the front desk, housekeeping, and valet was seamless.  Our room was on the 14th floor, faced north, and had a good view of Victory Field and Lucas Oil Stadium.  The bathroom was reasonably spacious and brightly lit.  The shower had good water pressure and hot water was near instantaneous.  The only downside to our stay was the bed.  The wife found the mattress way too stiff and unforgiving.  I thought it was stiff, but not so much so that I didn't feel rested.  However, we both found the pillows to be woefully inadequate and lacking in support.  Each side of the bed had two pillows.  With two pillows stacked, it still felt like our heads were resting directly on the mattress.Location:  5 starsParking:  3 starsStaff/service:  4 stars  Bed/Mattress/Pillows:  2 starsBathroom:  4 starsThe Courtyard Indianapolis Downtown is a nice hotel with an outstanding location.  I would stay there again for the right price compared to other downtown hotel properties.Stayed in room 1004.Room was spacious and clean. Room has a great view of Lucas Oil stadium and the adjacent baseball field. Room service available from TGIFridays that is next door to the property. There is a $23 fee for onsite parking per day, valet parking also available. Gym area is super clean. I would definitely return to this Marriott property.Our hotel room was superb. Clean and cozy. The staff was quick to address a very squeaky bathroom door, but that was our only issue when staying here.  The other guests were very nice and courteous which made the experience that much better. We liked this hotel even more due to being so close to downtown Indy - we walked nearly everywhere on our visit & loved it!Direct across from the beautiful canal walk.This hotel is excellent.Had some friends in town for the 500 weekend, so even though I'm an Indy resident stayed here a night out of convenience and spent a lot of time at the hotel. Was really impressed overall - the building was very clean and had a nice modern feel. The location near White River and the edge of downtown is extremely convenient, and they handled a crowded weekend of visitors very well.While parking is pretty expensive, for weekends especially there are metered spaces downtown within a 10 minute walk or so (on Indiana Ave or Senate for sure, may be other places as well). Considering its the same direction visitors would end up going for a restaurant or entertainment, it's definitely a budget-friendly option since some are free over the weekend and after 6 pm or so on Friday and don't mind walking a little ways.Housekeepers are theives! Beware and keep all you belongings close! My daughter left the iPad in our room, and when we found out we called the front desk and they said they couldn't do anything untill mourning. They never returned our call. When we called back they were rude.  Never going back to a Marriott.In response to courtyards response.It's funny that this is the only response we've had from you company is on a public forum. Seriously!  I have the track your iPad to your location and you still have not done anything about it. So the Marriott is fine with stolen items. Heads up people!This is a great, new-look Courtyard.  The location is terrific.  If you like to run, just go across the street and run through the park over to the zoo, or down by the canal.My room was clean, as was the bathroom.  It's new and well decorated.  I like the food options in the lobby.  Check-in was extremely quick.The only down-side (for me, at least) was the small exercise room that's shared with the conjoined Spring Hill Suites.  Four treadmills, two ellipticals, and ZERO bikes?  Come on, Marriott, give us an exercise bike or two, please.This the same Marriott with the same ugly clumsy furniture, free wifi and $ 150ish / night. That's 3 stars. I stayed at Marriott hotel 170 nights this year. The worst thing is the breakfast... OMG how can you screw up oatmeal. It tastes like you just scratched it off the ceiling throwing in some bitter nuts... Bitter MarriottNice and clean hotel but the parking is outrageous and the charge for the room because of the events in town are ridiculous. I would have rather stayed somewhere else but it was the only room left downtown. Also we were forced to park valet because the garage was full and I felt obligated to tip the drivers. Kind of sucks!A newer looker for Courtyard which is very refreshing and vibrant! It is right across the street from the park so you can hear concerts & depending on your room even see them. We got to check out Daughtry on my visit. You are also right across from the baseball field as well. Call ahead of time to see if you can score some free AAA tickets. The lobby has water & the hotel is connected to the skyway to the convention center. The workout room & pool are small. The internet is horribly slow which is the only downfall I can truly say about this location.Stayed here over night on a whim and to use up some Marriott rewards.  Everything was extremely clean from the lobby, to the halls, to the rooms.  The configuration of all the Marriott hotels hooked together in a complex can be a bit confusing.  We got the hang of it pretty quick but directed several people around just in our short stay.  The pool is small but adequate for my four year old and the other kids that seemed to be having a great time.  Would have been extremely nice to have a Jacuzzi, but no dice.  You can walk all the way to the Circle Center mall inside through the skywalks and the convention center which is really nice when it's 20 degrees outside.  I'm sure in the warmer months the running path outside is awesome.  There is a small gym that you can use.  Overall a GOOD stay.I was very happy with my stay here!! The hotel was brand new, very modern, clean and great ambiance. All the staff I talked to over the phone, at check in and check out were all very nice. The location is fantastic! We walked everywhere (mostly because the hotel charges over $20/day for parking!!). But you can get to tons of great sites by walking so it worked out. The room was the perfect size and we had 3 girls in there for 3 nights! The hotel let my two roommates check in at 6am for no extra charge! Extra points for that. The food downstairs was good, there was a skywalk to the JW where there was a Starbucks....I really have all good things to say about this place. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone!Everything was positive about this hotel ( comfort, cleanliness,location ) . My only complaint would be that people congregate right outside the front door to smoke, so as soon as you walk outside you're hit with it. Happen to have the pleasure of walking right into 4 cigar smokers.Good location near museums, park and river walk. Also close to downtown restaurants and shopping. Very clean and has some nice updates. Got room for super cheap on priceline.Good location downtown attached to the giant marriot complex.  Right next to the baseball field and attached to Lucas Oil stadium.  I got the room on priceline for $50 before taxes during the week.  Friendly staff.Great hotel. We got a room for 48.00 on priceline. Its within walking distance of downtown and right across the street from White River Park!Great, clean, fairly new facility. Room spotless. Bathroom design very good. Great value for the money - walking distance to most downtown Indy points of interest. Friendly staff too!This hotel is one of the better ones I've stayed at over the years. It wasn't anything spectacular, but a good value for the price ($124/night weekday and $149/night on the weekend) and still considered downtown. It is within walking distance of most of Indianapolis' major attractions - zoo, gardens, canal (NCAA Hall of Champions is located here, as well as a paddleboat ride), The Lawn (concerts), Victory Field (baseball), Circle Center (shopping) and tons of restaurants. There are two museums across the street - The Indiana State museum and a western art museum, I believe.The room was clean, the water pressure in the shower was more than adequate, and the bed was pretty comfy. There's a T.G.I. Fridays on site. I don't really care for them, but they have a breakfast buffet from 6:30-10:30 am. It's a bit too pricey for my taste ($7.99), but we had a free breakfast promotion so it hit the spot. They serve eggs, bacon, biscuits and sausage, bagels, toast, Krispy Kreme donuts, cereal, and yogurt. There's also a made to order omelet station. I'd definitely stay here again if I'm ever in Indianapolis. Oh and one other thing to note - the parking is free at this hotel, which is not the case at many of the other hotels!
review_content_20: Excellent location, much cheaper than the attached JW Marriott skyscraper, but I still paid 157 a night via Orbiz (vs way over 200 for the attached Marriott.) If you are going to a convention in this complex, I'd recommend staying there, though my room had the peculiar stench of body odor that hit you when you first walked in. I'm not going to hold this against the hotel since I think it was an anomaly, though the same smell was present in the elevator from the parking garage.Staff was VERY helpful and friendly and I'm guessing that if I'd complained they would have given me another room, but I was too tired upon arrival to deal with it.Room was very clean, shower (no bathtub) was excellent, free wi-fi (you can upgrade to a faster service but the free was fine) and the price was reasonable for how close it was to the convention center, baseball field, and Lucas Oil stadium.I had a nice walk in the White River State Park area that is right across the street, and if you are a runner this spot would be ideal for a city run on a greenway. Staff also allowed me to leave my car in the underground parking garage for a full 12 hours after I checked out at no charge, which was nice.My wifes camera and her friends phone were stolen out of their room while they were here.

review_content: This place was clean and it was a good option to stay at. Our first night Sierra and Kanaan (sorry if I misspelled that!) were pleasant to check-in with. Sierra told us she couldn't find our packages that we were expecting, but one look in the back, and we found them on our own, since the packages obviously had our names on them and were addressed to us, so you might need to be a bit more proactive on this front if you come here and have shipped stuff in advance for business like we did. Sierra also gave us great recommendations on places we could check out for fun in the Indy area and was very helpful on that front! Rudy the chef was super nice and the continental breakfast is wholesome! Although beware: the food in the breakfast area is not labeled in case people have dietary restrictions or allergies- I don't eat pork and the omelette was not labeled so I took one and it had ham, it threw me off for the rest of the day! On my check out, Nicolette was super helpful and helped me get everything I needed settled before I left. She added the missing parking charge to my bill and even ran out in the cold and opened the parking gate for me when it got stuck- thanks Nicolette!The room was large, and clean, I was surprised and happy to see it had a microwave and mini-fridge! Sheets were clean, bed was comfy, room temp was good, the couch was comfortable to sit on, and bathroom was clean (although some type of stains in the toilet bowl that surprised me the first night until I realized that it was probably rust), water pressure in shower was good, and hot tub was great to use downstairs, clean towels and amenities were restocked in my room daily.I did have a negative experience with Christa who was ridiculously unhelpful. The night before I checked out, I realized I forgot to pick up packaging tape that I needed for a box I planned to check in at the airport. I asked her if she had packaging tape. Without even checking in the back, she says "no," and rudely hands me scotch tape from the front counter and says "this is all we have." I looked at her and knew that it couldn't be true since we were in a big hotel, also that she just wasn't helpful and not keen on doing her job of customer service. At that point I didn't even think it was worth asking her to check in the back because she made it clear that she was lazy and probably should not be employed there.However, like I said Nicolette was great, I asked her for tape in the morning and she also wasn't sure if they had any but OFFERED to look in the back, and behold, SHE FOUND TAPE! She helped me wrap my box up and I knew she was committed to her job and to helping people!Overall, this place does the job of staying somewhere clean and friendly when you're away from home and have the misfortune of ending up in Indiana. The staff was kind overall, and just a few instances where I thought there could be improvements. However, don't come here having super high expectation overall. And if you run into Christa, then good luck getting what you need!My girlfriend and I stayed here for a wedding. I booked the hotel well in advance via phone. The booking agent was polite and after everything was finished, told me what it would cost. However, he failed to mention the additional parking costs and the miscellaneous fees that would be assessed to us upon arrival. I have no problem paying these fees and understand they are a normal expense for a hotel. However I would like advanced notice of them. We went into our stay thinking the cost I was told on the phone covered everything, only to be surprised by a bill that was $50 more than communicated to us on the phone. Considering we were traveling out of state and had no choice but to pay these fees, it felt deceptive at best.The factor keeping this place from receiving a one-star is the bed. Hands down the most comfortable hotel bed I've stayed in - even better than some top-tier hotels/resorts. The hotel is clean, the staff was polite. However, the manner in which we were charged completely overshadowed all the pros of this place.While I've yet to stay at this hotel, I walked through the lobby and was surprised at how dark it was in that area of the hotel and also saddened by how busy the breakfast nook was -- it would make more sense to have more space for breakfast when breakfast is complimentary when you stay here, there being so many rooms in this venue! Otherwise it is a pretty affordable hotel.Stay away. I booked a room and was told the cancellation policy was 24 hour notice. I cancelled my reservation well before 24 hours and was then told the policy was 30 days. I was never emailed a confirmation which raised a red flag. The GM is now calling me a liar when I told him his employee mistakenly told me incorrect information.Greetings,There is a lot of upside to this hotel, but first let me hit you with the one thing that annoyed the heck out of me. They charge you $3.00 a night for the room safe. Seriously, is this a normal thing? I've been traveling and in and out of all kinds of hotels and I've never seen a surcharge for the room safe. Maybe some of you are traveling with thousands upon thousands of dollars or maybe some precious rubies you found in the Amazon, but I don't really ever feel like I need these things. I know, I know, but your precious jewelry or Rolex watch. First of all, no one wears watches anymore so stop it. This hotel will charge you and make no mention of the charge upon check in or check out, so, you've been warned. You're welcome.Oh yeah, parking is expensive so just a heads up. It's like 20 bucks a night for a car. There is some, very little, street parking nearby. If you can score one of those spots go for it. Remember, however, street parking carries some risks as well, but I digress...Now, the upside...STAFF - Friendly and helpful. The chamber maids always said hello and good morning to me when I wandered the hallways. Same with the front desk and breakfast bar staff. Speaking of...BREAKFAST - Free and downstairs in the lobby area. Standard continental type breakfast. They have waffles, bagels, muffins, pastries, cereal, juice machine, hard boiled eggs, toast yada yada yada. Staff running the breakfast is great and helpful.ROOMS - Spacious and comfortable. Nice flat screen TVs. Beds are comfortable. AC and Heater are not loud as hell so it doesn't sound like you are sleeping through a hurricane.RATES - I don't know. My company's client that booked us had a deal so I have no idea. It's probably middle of the road and speaking of...LOCATION - A long par 3 away from Lucas Oil Field. Great hotel for Colts games or concerts. They do concerts there? I assume so...Overall, you will be pleased to stay here. I would actually give this place a 3.9. You need to earn that 4th star and make your safes free! Come on!I attended a conference and stayed here for 5 nights. There are definitely pros and cons to this hotel.Pros:1) Right beside Lucas Stadium. If you are attending a game or event, this hotel is perfect.2) Free breakfast (eggs, waffles, sausages, gravy, fruits, yogurt, pastries, coffee)3) Modern, new decor, style4) Swimming pool and hot tub5) Gym (elliptical, treadmills, bikes, resistance equipment)6) Half mile walk to/from Convention Center7) Friendly staff (in general)8) General public areas were kept clean and free of clutterCons:1) My room was not cleaned for 2 days! Although the housekeeping lady apologized, there needs to be a system in place for all guest rooms to be cleaned before guests arrive back from an all day conference! Completely unacceptable for whatever reason!2) Some towels had stains.3) Breakfast items tend to disappear quick and not refilled. So, eat early at 6 am especially if there is a big event.4) Bananas were green one morning.5) Checkout time is at 11 am instead of 12 noon.6) Make sure to check your final bill because there is a chance that you are also billed for "Safe w/ltd Warranty" which I don't even know existed. 7) It can be noisy if there are kids and/or students next to your room.* If you are staying for 1 or 2 nights, you can definitely consider this hotel due to the proximity to Lucas Stadium and price. If you plan to stay beyond 2 nights, choose somewhere else since there are better options out there. However, I still believe in "You get what you pay for!" The hotel is a bargain compared to the Convention Center hotels.Gross. This hotel gave me crabs. I stayed four nights. On the fifth day I was itching. A closer inspection of the bed spread confirmed it: dead crabs. I had to go buy RID shampoo from the pharmacy. Then, when I was done with my shower, the towel I chose had food on it from the previous guest. Gross gross gross.AMAZING STAFF! Large rooms, very comfortable beds. Pool area was very clean, as was the rest of the common areas. Great rates for what you get.  Did I mention the STAFF IS AMAZING?  From the time we checked in,  we were greeted with smiles and laughter. Even the housekeeping staff was friendly. I have definitely found the hotel I will stay at every time I am in Indy.We stayed here for four nights.  Our rooms were clean and the beds were super comfy.  They have an indoor pool and fitness room.  They are currently charging $20/day for parking.  The staff was friendly.  The Wifi was free, but had a terrible signal.  The breakfast served in the morning is fairly decent.  The little cafe is convenient for a quick meal, but don't expect anything extravagant... our burgers were served on toast.  Lucas Oil Stadium is across the street... literally... less than a 5-minute walk to the door.  The 'downtown' area is about 5 blocks away and offers more places to eat.The lobby and room are about what you'd expect from this type of hotel.  Room was fairly large and clean, bed was comfortable.  We had a foldout couch, microwave, and refrigerator.  Parking was very convenient.  Also had free wifi.  Pretty good value for a hotel that's so conveniently located in the middle of everything.The free breakfast was similar to most hotels- eggs, bacon, waffles, yogurt, various breads, cereal, juice, etc.  The breakfast area (which serves as a bar in the evenings) was way too small and very crowded.  They do have an outside seating area for nicer weather.I read some reviews about bad service / attitude at the front desk and was a little nervous about our stay here.  The front desk staff were extremely friendly every time we entered and exited the hotel.  So much so that I wanted to write a review to acknowledge their positive attitudes and the way they represented the hotel.  Hopefully whoever was causing the negative reviews is no longer there.  We weren't going to Lucas Oil Stadium but for those who are the stadium is literally right across the street.  It's also just minutes from most downtown attractions.  Very convenient location.We stayed for 3 nights during the Brickyard 400. The night we checked in(around 12 am) the front  desk clerk put on a hard sell regarding the parking and the lack of safety if we parked it on the street. Well we parked it street side each day we were there and found that all the locals park on the streets too! Saved myself a significant amount in parking fees by not listening to the front desk. That aside we were very happy with the room(a king size bed and pull out) , the breakfast (sausage, eggs and waffles, plus fruits and muffins) and the amenities(decent business area, lounge , bar , indoor pool and weight room). We picked this up by naming our own price on Priceline (100 a night) and turned out to be more than satisfied.This hotel was convenient for attending a convention at the Convention Center: just a 10 minute walk away. The building and accommodations are what I would expect for a Comfort Suites, BUT be warned, you can't count on them honoring a reservation!They had supposedly set aside a certain number of rooms for the convention I am attending.  I made a reservation for one of those rooms three months in advance through the official channels, and confirmed my reservation with my credit card. One week before my meeting the hotel sent me an email confirming my reservation. So I naively  thought I was all set.But when I arrived, I was told they had no room for me. They claimed it wasn't their fault, something about the reservations coming in too fast. The fact is they just didn't actually set the agreed upon number of rooms aside: they overbooked instead. What was more aggravating, was I could see them checking in other travelers after me, while they were explaining to me that there just weren't any more rooms. They didn't even use first-come-first-serve to allocate the rooms they had. They specifically chose to bump some of us with the convention (because of our discounted price?) in favor of other (full price?) reservations!They did get me into another hotel and pay for the first night of my stay there, apparently by agreement with my convention's organizers. But now I am 6 miles away and commuting at the same price I expected to pay for a downtown location.The most basic service a hotel must provide is a room. If you can't count on that, nothing else matters, so I would have given them 0 stars, if I could.I recently stayed two nights at this hotel, everything was fine until I noticed that someone was in my room after I had specifically asked the front desk not to have my room refreshed. Then I was charged $20 each day for parking in the garage next door. I had checked in late in the evening and the front desk assistance Preston asked if I wanted to park in the garage or the lot so I opted for the lot because he said we might have ice overnight. Preston failed to point out that there was a $20 charge for parking. The next morning I specifically asked the front desk if there was a note in the file where I had asked not to have my room cleaned because there was no "do not disturb tag" on my door. There was a note in the file but my room was still entered. Not sure if anything was stolen. even though I in this field the items on the check-in form, I still feel that the charges should have been pointed out so beware. all I received at the front desk was I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I'm sorry doesn't take away the 40 extra dollars I had to pay.If you are going to see a game at Lucas Oil and are looking for a convenient hotel to the stadium, this place is close.  They have a little bar and free breakfast.  The place is clean enough but DO NOT USE the iron.  Additionally, don't plan to get any service from housekeeping or management after hours.  This place does not empower their night crew to take care of anything.  Despite that, the people are friendly.  Don't necessarily expect a bargain because you are staying at a Comfort property.  Look around, because you may be surprised by the prices in much better locations of downtown.Hotel was clean, rooms were spacious. Price was decent. Staff was extremely friendly and the free continental breakfast was one of the better "free" breakfasts I've had a hotel. Would stay again.Our company booked 27 room nights while we were attending a convention. On our fourth night the hotel made a mistake and sold a room out from under us that we had already occupied and paid for.  (There was actually a hilarious side this to story -- putting two strangers in the same room, sharing toothbrushes, charging them both -- but it's too long to tell here.)  Night manager was rude, rude, rude. This was a situation where a little bit of empathy and concern for the customer would have at least made us feel better but no, he was contentious from the beginning.  Instead of apologizing and trying to make it right he tried to turn it around and make it our fault!  The whole city was booked up because of the convention so we had to send one of our people home early -- leaving at ten o'clock at night.  The hotel wasn't even planning to credit us for the room they gave away until we pressed for it. "As as a courtesy" they agreed to credit us. As a courtesy???  Bad experience here.First walking into this hotel, I was taken aback--it looked swanky for a Comfort Suites! I guess I was expecting the kind of decor you'd find at a Comfort Suites in the middle of nowhere. My five cross-country roadtrips have given me a bad kind of bias when it comes to certain hotels.We checked in sort of late--11pm--because we wanted to get dinner and see a show first. The front desk person was very nice and helpful. We got up to our room, went in--and it was the wrong arrangement. Too bad, apparently. Upon returning to the front desk to ask for a different room (AKA, the one we had reserved), the smiling lady at the front desk was now in a foul mood and told us there was not another room available.Seeing as we got a deal on Travelocity, I wasn't too concerned about it--just a little annoyed that we didn't get the room we reserved and were treated rather curtly when we inquired about it. We also decided to sleep in the next morning, and I thought to call down for the check-out time: 11am. It's a good thing I checked. It's one of the earliest check-out times I've heard of, and we had to rush to get out on time.All in all, I doubt we'll be back at this Comfort Suites. The room was clean and the (cramped) bed was comfortable, but the experience was not as enjoyable as I like a hotel stay to be.My fiance and I drove in from Chicago to stay here while we attended a friend's baby shower.  The rooms are spacious, the king sized bed was comfortable, the included breakfast is good, and the location is decent.  It's next door to Lucas Oil stadium and a short drive (not really walking distance) from downtown attractions.  Those are about all the positive things I can say.  Now, the negatives: thin walls, loud and rude guests, centralized and careless management, and much too expensive for what you get.  I could pay $100/night for a downtown Chicago hotel that's much more peaceful.We arrived around 7 pm and our hallway was full of loud, obnoxious people talking in the halls and slamming doors, and the walls are so thin you can hear every single word. I called "guest services" on the hotel phone, and it took me to a hotel chain operator, NOT someone located at the hotel, who looked the hotel up and informed me that every room was booked and she couldn't move or help us.My fiance went to the front desk to speak to management, was given the runaround, and told that they would take care of it.  It was still loud and I doubt management did anything, so I shared an elevator with a woman to go downstairs again to speak with the front desk, and she laughed about how a room reeked like marijuana, and it turned out that she's the manager (who never stopped on our floor).When I explain to her that I'm exhausted, we've made several attempts to get help, and the floor still sounds like a dance club, she tells me that she didn't hear any noise on our floor, and keeps insisting that she didn't hear anything.  The other guy at the desk takes pity on us and suggests moving us to a different floor, which is MUCH quieter, but still the walls are so thin I can hear every sneeze down the hall.If you're 21, want to stay 5 people to a room and get trashed and laugh in the halls, this is the place for you.  For anyone else, you'll be paying $100/night for a sleep-deprived night.I would have given this hotel 5 stars but they charge 12 dollars a day for parking. When I got there after I was quoted 12 dollars a day. The price went up to 14. Total rip off. The rooms are nice and the beds are so comfortable. Parking for hotel guest should always be free. Charge parking for people who are not guests.Stayed at this location for two nights during a training nearby - very convenient to both my training location and downtown.  About a 10 minute walk to downtown restaurants, etc., and literally a stone's throw from the Colts Lucas Field Stadium.The room was very nice and clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful both at the desk and the bar/restaurant.  Breakfast was decent - nothing phenomenal but ample for a quick bite before a day out and about, and I would recommend going out for lunch or dinner unless you're stuck there - the food didn't look terribly appetizing.Free internet on three computers in the lobby, an exercise facility, etc. make for an all around decent place to stay while in downtown Indy.
review_content_20: My daughter and I stayed here for a girl scout trip to see the childrens museum.The hotel was clean (i inspected for bugs), very spacious, rooms were very nicely furnished, shower water was great.It was quiet at night when we were there.The breakfast area is insanely crowded.  They could improve this by adding extra tables and chairs to the living room area of the lobby to accomodate all the guests wanting to eat breakfast.Our girl scout rate was $89.00 per night, we had to pay an additional $10.00 to park in the garage next door.I definately would stay here again !!Clean and smoke free. I did not have any issues. The best part was the customer service. They were so helpful in helping me find information regarding getting to where I needed and they assisted in printing out my plane ticket!!! I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a nice and affordable hotel to stay at.

review_content: Beautiful lobby, room was clean and comfortable.Hotel staff was super !!  I had forgotten my hair spray, the night staff went above and beyond to find me some!!Thank you!!!!The landings restaurant had wonderful food and our breakfast waitress was fantastic.Highly recommend this hotel as it is only minutes from the convention center and hundreds less than those right downtownA group of 6, we stayed in town for the Indy/Saints game.  Last year we stayed at the JW and were disappointed so looked around for something close.  Not only is it close, there's a tunnel and a skyway to the stadium!Anyway, the hotel is a beautiful mix of the past and the modern.  It is a real tribute to the building having once been Union Station and on the National Historic Register. It is truly hard to overstate the charm of this hotel, or its unique qualities.  Being from New Orleans, we do have a sense of history and felt right at home.Anyway, gushing about the building some more... Trains actually travel through the hotel (and you can just hear it a little bit and it's not all the time by any means).Common spaces are comfortable, plush and yet show off the roots of the building as a train station:  structural steel abounds, and there are numerous statues of conductors, footmen, stokers and such throughout the hotel.As well, several of the famous Pullman cars are set up in the hotel (see photos) as rooms.  They're very cool looking but a bit smallish, so we had regular king rooms.  The rooms are well appointed, the decor is nice and there is coffee and so on.  Surprisingly though, there were no room safes.  C'est la vie.The staff are super nice in a way that makes you glad to be there.  Everybody.  No exceptions.Okay, to the restaurant.  We went for breakfast on Saturday morning and it was busy but speedy and the service efficient and friendly.  Had the buffet, which was pretty good when compared to most other hotels. A bit better than most I'd say as far as variety; usually hotel buffets kind of suck.  Not this one.Went back for breakfast on Sunday (game day- noon kickoff) and they were just packed and hammered with guests.  Really they had available seating but were short-staffed and so the bar gang threw in and was working the buffet.Yes, I'm patting myself on the back here, but as a 40+ year foodservice guy, I sort of stood there and helped coordinate the people working the buffet. It's been a while since I've gotten to poke my head through the kitchen door and say things like, "down to a half pan of bacon, and somebody needs to prep some melons too".  The manager was cool with it since I wasn't griping but trying to anticipate runouts.  So it was fun and I spent about 15 minutes doing that.  But props to the crew, they got things back up to snuff by running their butts off and so I sat down and had a nice breakfast with my group.  Everyone, by the way, including the guests, was very upbeat and so it wasn't an unpleasant experience.  This hotel is also near all kinds of cools stuff:  great restaurants, a nice mall, and other stuff.  Most of this is connected by skyway and makes getting around town easy. Definitely going to stay again.I am writing this from the perspective of hosting a meeting at this venue.I plan meetings professionally around the world and when hosting here in Indianapolis, I LOVE working with the Crowne Plaza. Jessica & JJ particularly keep me coming back. The Grand Hall is absolutely beautiful- our CEO even made a comment that it was one of the coolest venues at which we've done one of our large internal meetings.Their in-house Markey's manager is great, the food is great, the value is great- I could go on. Thank you Jessica, JJ, & team!Super cool hotel. You can reserve a train room, extra special. We were given a room initially that had ppl already in it. They moved us to another  room that had a clogged bathtub drain. Gross. They made up and comped the stay. The train arrives from Chicago at midnight. You hear and feel the arrival. It's kinda cool if you are into that sort of thing. We are going back in the spring. And we are taking the train.This is a wonderful hotel! Such a great experience during our vacation.A couple of friends decided to book a room here for our birthdays so we would be within walking distance of the local bars. I think the price of $200 was fair because of the location. The fact that valet was full and we had to pay $49 to park was ridiculous. The guy that checked us in could've been more friendly, maybe he was having a bad day. Room was nice and clean. I wouldn't recommend staying on the first floor, it tends to be a little loud at times, especially when there's a teenage cheer competition going on. I will not be returning to the Crowne Plaza.They get an extra star for having trains for rooms. Hands-down...Super cool. The train driving through the building in the middle of the night was actually really cool, too, we loved it. Otherwise, this would have been a three star review.For a "higher end" hotel, they struggled. We checked in and were given our room key. Walk to the room, enter, and there are guests already in the room!! (WTF?) We go back to the desk and Mr. Clerk is like "no big deal" about it. Never even apologized. (Can you imagine the shock of the people who we barged in on???  Thank God they weren't in an awkward situation!)As for our (second) room:  One trash can? A dangerous coffee maker. Very creaky beds. But, the most unforgivable for me was the shower that did not drain. Ewwwww. Which the maid clearly knew about because the stopper was half in/half out. To be fair, my friend is a platinum guest at this chain, and the manager refunded us the night.I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Downtown Indianapolis a few times for various conferences.  The location, comfort, and cleanliness of this hotel is great! I also love that when it is cold you can walk through indoor paths to get to Circle Centre Mall and other downtown favorites! My only warning to people planning on staying here, it is an active train station.  I  woke up a few times throughout the night as a train would be passing through.  On the other hand, my co-worker who I often travel with was not bothered by the noise.  If you are a light sleeper, you may want to consider staying somewhere else.Was here for a conference. Cool ambience as this is a renovated train station (with trains still going through and causing some rumbles). Good food during conference. Rooms were clean.I'm here for the FDIC show. I'll start with the positive. It's really close to the convention center and connected via skywalk. Also kudos to them for having a ton of outlets available to charge laptops and phones. Ok, done with positive stuff. This place is $300 per night during the FDIC show. Also known as extortion. The wifi is slow and finicky on my mac (sometimes requires restarting, at one point would not work at all), and there are no wired connections. Walls are paper thin, I could hear a pin drop in the next room. That is, assuming that the trains aren't going by and shaking the entire building. The wall switch does nothing, so I walk into a dark room and fumble around for a lamp. The local tap water has a bad taste. The rooms have little natural light, and in many rooms people walking the halls can see right into your room if you don't keep the light blocking curtains closed. Beds are very firm with a thin blanket.  New and clean bedding, but not warm or comfortable.The bar/restaurant area strikes me as dated and overpriced. All I want for breakfast is a cup of coffee and bowl of cereal. And at hotels for less than half of this price, you get it for free. Not here.The rooms appear to be nicely renovated at some point in the last few years, but at this price the overall thin walled construction and poor amenities are unforgivable. (oh look, the building is shaking again due to trains) I'm sure they will do well with their captive convention audience, but I would avoid this place in the future. Other hotels that I have stayed in for this convention offer a better value. -------update-------Manager addressed the concerns that he was able to, I adjusted the rating up a notch. I was probably overly harsh here initially. To be fair, probably every hotel in the area jacks up rates during this show.I have stayed at SO many downtown hotels and somehow completely avoided this place. Not necessarily on purpose however.  Erich and I "hotwired" a hotel last weekend just for fun and we landed here for $79/night.  It was a great deal considering it was a home football weekend and this place is connected to the convention center.  What a cool, unique hotel with the "quiet rumbles" of trains rolling through the station.  It is clear this is a landmark like no other in Indy and the elevators and train station create an ambiance you can't get anywhere else in the city.  I felt a little claustrophobic in our room b/c there is no view of the outside -- our room faced the main lobby and the other set of rooms directly across from us.  They only earn 3 stars b/c the walls are PAPER and I mean, seriously thin.  I could hear everything going on next door, full conversations and at 6 AM, it was soooo loud, I about lost it.  No real relaxation there.  While they can't control their guests and the kids running the halls, a bit of insulation would be nice.  The trains WERE quieter than our neighbors and let's just say - the "quiet rumble" is a bit of an exaggeration.  It was a pretty loud and rambunctious roll through.
