Most places these days hire employees who are passive aggressive and hide thinly veiled contempt at best, this place has some real leadership at some level that won't tolerate modern day bad service attitude. Please take over other industries. Ah hell I just switched to 5 stars after writing the review. I travel 30 plus weeks a year and live in hotels most nights. I'm not a big compulsive reviewer on Yelp, so this is a big deal.We stay at the Drury each year during memorial weekend for the Indy 500. The strategic layout of the building is great for quick floor access so that you don't need to walk too far to your room. The elevators are right in the middle and guess what, all buttons actually work - yes, I will close the door on your face if you don't make up your mind. I wasn't aware until reading some of the other reviews that there are complimentary drinks and other freebies, had I known this I would have exploited the Drury's gratis offer, because I could not get a pop from the machine being short $0.50 :-(. Anyways, the free breakfast in the morning is great and I made sure to not miss out. The rooms are clean and spacious, but only downside is the bright halogen bulb shining into the room at night. I would recommend this place for your stay.This was our first time staying here, and it was an awesome experience. Staff was very friendly and everything was very clean. Free breakfast, free dinner, 3 free alcoholic beverages, free soft drinks and popcorn...who wouldn't want to take advantage of all those perks?! We will be staying here again!I typically stay at hiltons, hyatts or Marriotts.  Free breakfast, drinks and dinner.  What more could you possibly ask for? Rooms were clean.. Workers were fabulous. I will definitely choose drury over any other hotelGreat experience. Clean, modern rooms. Very nice and helpful staff. Pet friendly. Will definitely be back!Big breakfast buffet, free drinks at dinner.Pretty good overall.Stayed at the Drury for a week in between our buy/sell house closings and there wasn't a single issue I could complain about. If I had one nitpick, it is the fact that they are a Pepsi house and I couldn't get my Diet Coke fix while staying there. The positives are numerous: cost effective, excellent staff, great location with easy access to I-69/465 and 82nd Street, free breakfast and snack style happy hour/dinner (nachos, hot dogs, penne pasta), free soft drinks and adult beverages at night, pet friendly and the place was also super clean.My husband and I stayed at this hotel Memorial Day weekend.The location is great! Right off of I 69 and 82nd/Shadeland, which is a popular part of Indy. Yes, the hotel has complimentary appetizers and beverages everyday. While this is a nice feature, I wasn't all that impressed BUT that is just me. There were a lot of people in the dining area, so they obviously enjoyed it. They had hot dogs (which looked pretty questionable), bowls of salad, mac and cheese, chips and salsa, nacho cheese and celery and carrot sticks. The same goes for the complimentary drinks. The same goes for the drinks.... There is also a complimentary breakfast buffet, but I did not utilize it.In regards to food, the thing I did enjoy was the complimentary popcorn and soda. They have it available until 10 in the evening. It was great!The staff were extremely friendly and the check in/check out was quick and efficient.The rooms were very nice except the refrigerator did not work. We had purchased some cold cuts to make sandwiches for our trip the next day to the Indy 500 and was disappointed when I went to put them in the fridge and the fridge wasn't cool. I turned up the dial and waited, but it refused to work. Thankfully we had a cooler and access to ice, so the food didn't spoil.They had a pool (I didn't use it, but it looked really nice) and a nice business center with a couple of computers and printer.I would recommend this hotel!**GREAT STAFF**  (You should ALL get a Star!)A client booked this hotel for us for a 3 night stay.  Upon arrival we were greeted with two of the nicest front desk guys! Loved the uniforms, very neat & professional looking. Was told about the "Happy Hour from 5-7pm each night" & 3 free cocktails!! Loving it already!! And a small buffet at night too.  Not to mention hot breakfast each morning!!  This all was handy as my spouse had meeting each day and left me to find my own food.  Our room was the coolest layout: separate living room area with TV that had a door that closed it off from the bedroom.  This is VERY handy if you have a companion that stays up until 2am working! Bathroom shower came with preloaded shampoo & soap etc...that was nice.  Towels were on the "thin" side but ok. The Second (6/11 @ 10:30am) day I miss breakfast and needed a place to eat. The girl at the desk was so sweet and helpful.  Even asked if I liked it and what I ordered when I came back in! Kudos to her! Third day I ran into somewhat of an "issue" and needed the hotel Managers help.  He listened, understood my issue and was very apologetic and helpful in resolving it.  ALL the staff at this Drury Inn location in Indianapolis,IN went above and beyond to help make my staff enjoyable and even made sure I was compensated for my issue. I would recommend to anyone.Only complaint: While the buffets were nice to have, I was not real impressed with "quality" of food but tolerable.Can anyone pronounce "Drury" confidently? It's such an awkward-sounding word.Anyhoo! This was the first hotel we came to after a night out in Indy, and we both vaguely remembered staying here once before and not hating it, so there's how we made our decision to bunk up at the Drooooreee for the night. When we pulled in to the parking lot, I noticed a woman walking two Malamutes. On our way to the front door, we saw a couple with a Newfoundland. A man standing just inside the lobby had a Doberman next to him. It was then that I remembered this hotel chain is pet-friendly. The whole place looked exactly like the hotel in "Best in Show," which both amused and concerned me for obvious reasons. However, there was absolutely nothing to be concerned about. No noise, no mess, nothing. The dogs (and their owners) were on their best behavior... of course, they were all in town for a show at the fairgrounds, so we're talking about some well-trained pooches here, but still. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. No complaints whatsoever.Breakfast, however, was nothing short of a clusterf**k, with children and adults in various states of dress (pajamas, swimsuits, no shoes, etc), a hockey team of tween boys hell bent on destroying all the bananas on the buffet, sour-faced teenage girls, and the occasional dog all running around the buffet and seating areas. It was, as the kids are saying, cray-cray. All the biscuits were gone and I couldn't even get to the milk dispenser and ended up eating my cereal dry with a side of sausage. Life is hard.Other than that, our stay was great.I usually stay at Marriott properties when I travel, but last night I stayed at Drury Inn and loved it. Rooms were clean. They offered food for dinner and a great breakfast. Exercise room had good treadmills as well. Overall good experience.I ended up at the drury after the hilton across the street overbooked and sent me here with a paper for the front desk. I couldn't be happier with the staff here. The two people at the front desk were very nice, funny, and personable- which I really appreciated after my experience at the Hilton. They were able to book the rest of my stay so I didn't have to go back to the Hilton and hope they had a room for me tomorrow. They also have a free happy hour type event where they gave me drink coupons and he let me know what food they would be serving the next day. Wifi is free here and breakfast is free too. I have stayed at drury before and have always had a good experience. I will be booking drury over hilton from now on.Wonderful staff, especially Brian at the front desk!  Comfortable and clean rooms.  My new favorite hotel chain.  Highly recommended!!!
review_content_20: We stayed here for the first time at the end of last year and again during our wedding. We were originally attracted to this facility as they allow pets at no charge. They also had excellent online reviews. We were impressed by the level of customer service we received and we were offered an additional night for half price. We decided to take them up on the offer. They also have a light dinner and cocktail hour each evening. The dinner isn't of the healthiest variety but it's free, so we'll take it. They also give you three free alcoholic beverages each evening. We don't drink but thought this was a great value. They had a full hot breakfast, as well. Briefly after our arrival, we received a knock on our door. It was children selling candy to help "homeless children". We didn't buy it and went about our business. A few minutes later another knock, the same thing. I called the front desk to let them know about this. It didn't happen again. Other than the soliciting, we were happy with our stay. We decided to use them for our stay during our wedding, as well as, for our guests to stay at. We set up an account with them so guests could book their room under our name. Some of guests were paying for their rooms, we payed for the wedding party's accommodations. They had a lot of confusion over this, especially once we checked in. I received a call from the front desk during my rehearsal dinner asking if we were paying for photographer's room. I told them we were and told them to use our credit card. This was a little annoying because of the timing and the fact we had given them our credit card during check and explained the situation again at that time. They were very apologetic and fixed it. With the exception of this issue, I was pleased with our stay. The hotel gets pretty crowded in the evening on the weekends, particularly downstairs. The elevators are slow during this time. This normally wouldn't be a problem, as I don't mind climbing stairs but nine stories in a wedding dress isn't easy. To sum it up this hotel reminds me a bit of Embassy Suite hotels. The cocktail hour and light dinner, along with the full breakfast seemed very similar to Embassy Suites. The room we stayed at on our wedding night was more reminiscent of the large suites, as well. Although the huge with jacuzzi tub was an added bonus. They also allow pets for no charge. I think if we stay at a Drury Inn again it'll be because pets are allowed for no charge.We had a great experience here. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The cable and wifi worked great. The linens were good, soft towels. We did not get to try dinner b/c of late arrival. The state fair was going on so the pool was full of children. I had an OJ and fountain soda at breakfast time. They had donuts and waffle maker out. The hot food wasn't being served until 7 AM. When it was served, it was like a cattle call!! This is one of the nicer hotels that allows pets w/o a huge service fee!Great breakfast, clean, personable staff, love the popcorn and free movie and Reasonably priced for what you get!! This has become our new second "home"!!!Brian at the front desk is an outstanding young man.  He is truly an asset to not only this location, but also the hotel organization.  The rooms are always clean, and I love that they offer free kickbacks daily (snacks, fountain drinks, and cocktails).  The breakfast is also hot, fresh and delicious.  I feel at home every time I stay.  I find this location to not only be convenient for Indy travelers, but they also allows pets.  Any travel in my future will be at this hotel and others in it's chain.  I have to mention again how wonderful the staff is.  I think that can make all the difference anymore.Our family has traveled to Indianapolis four or five times in the last year.  We have stayed at this property on each occassion because we have been met with a very clean and pleasant environment, friendly and professional staff who had customer service as an obvious goal, and bountiful and delicious food.  The General Manager of this property clearly sets a high goal of providing great value to the guests and the provision of exceptional service.  Thanks for many wonderful stays.  We will see you again soon!We went here as a "getaway" , and were very impressed.  The place was clean, staff is friendly, plus its pet friendly, which helped as we have a dog.  We also chose this place as it had an indoor pool and hot tub.  The food they have for breakfast & dinner is ok but  it saves you money from going out or getting take out if you don't want to. It's not the healthiest, but what other hotels offer ANY food other than breakfast? We did go over a weekend, which had a ton of kids running all over, but the staff spoke to them in a professional manner, and took care of them ruining someone elses stay.  I wouldn't go on a weekend again for a getaway, but would definitely come during the week when its more quiet.  All the rooms were clean, (lobby, dining area, lounge), which makes a big difference.   We would definitely go here again. We liked the popcorn too that they pop every evening.  We really enjoyed our time there.GREAT stay there!!  The bed was the most comfortable I have experienced at any hotel.  Wonderful breakfast with lots of choices, great staff.....just can't say enought. This would be my hotel of choice if staying in Castleton area of Indianapolis again!!!Room was clean and quiet and comfortable. Late afternoon appetizers and breakfast were very good as well.  Pool is small but was good enough for my kids. Staff was very friendly and helpful - I would stay there again.This is the 2nd time I have stayed at a Drury Inn (2 different cities) and I will not stay at one again.  They are new and clean and all good stuff.  The furniture in the rooms has this smell that I cannot stand, it smells like mold.  Maybe I am super sensitive to smells, but I won't stay at one of these hotels again.Well located, clean, and reasonably priced. Plus they allow dogs at for no fee.

review_content: Nice hotel, very beautiful. In the heart of downtown and close to the mall, bars and restaurants. The rooms are very large and spacious and I really loved staying here and felt very comfortable. Well worth it staying here!I recently stayed here for a business trip and loved this hotel. Beautiful lobby with great lighting. Super friendly and courteous front desk staff. Great hotel rooms that offer a nice break from the traditional Marriotts and Hiltons. Right in the heart of downtown Indy and within walking distance to everything. As a runner, it was centrally located by great running paths (e.g., canal system, bridge near the zoo, etc.). I must have looked like a sweaty mess when I ran back, as the front desk offered me bottles of water right away. Overall, really pleased with the excellent customer service. Worth staying at.Very very nice hotel. Stayed here in August for a friends wedding. Great location in the heart of downtown, connected to the 3 story mall, within walking distance of bars, restaurants, museums and the park. Did I mention it was very nice? Diamond dusted portrait art greets you in the lobby with legends like Muhammad Ali. The Capital Grill and a wine tasting bar are inside. Gym is nice, has everything you need - I heard there was a sauna and a spa that I didn't quite have the time or money for...However, had a very nice stay, beds are comfy, view could have been better - looking into the building next door even on the 14th floor but whatevs. The ballroom was real fancy! That is where our friends had their reception. I haven't quite experienced anything like that before. The food and appetizers were delicious, the servers did a synchronized changing of the plates...ya it was like that...Great time, great hotel, worth the price to stay fancy shmancy.Full disclosure: I've never stayed at the Conrad, but based on my experiences, I can tell you it would be fab-u-lous. First off, the decor is jaw-droppingly beautiful. Grand lobby with marble from Verona, Italy? Check. Abstract gold Dale Chihuly inspired glass fixture? Check. A plethora of interesting artwork, ranging from Andy Warhol pop style to Salvador Dali originals? They've got it. They even have a brand new gallery space! While the Conrad is a chain luxury tier hotel in the Hilton family, I appreciate the local touches. Notice the circular patterns in the marble and carpet? That's a nod to the Circle City. The Conrad also works with a local art partner, and you'll spot lots of Robert Indiana (of "LOVE" fame) influences, too!Still not enough artwork for your palette? Then you have to check out the new Collections Suite on the fifth floor. Did I just step into a swanky, private New York City apartment complex for the rich and famous? Sure feels like it! My favorites are the surrealism suite with Dali influences with a cloud mural in the bedroom and the pop suite with Warhol galore. Also, the bathrooms are bright and spacious - I've never seen a bigger and more beautiful shower and tub in my life.Getting hungry? Check out the Capital Grille and Tastings: A Wine Experience, both connected to the hotel. Need some R&R? The sixth floor has an infinity pool and the Evan Todd Salon and Spa. Feel like getting married? They have large ballrooms and banquet halls, and they're connected to the Arts Garden. The Conrad caters wonderfully to both leisure and business travelers. The staff is incredibly kind, whether it's the valet welcoming you to the Conrad, the front desk/concierge assisting you, or the housekeeping staff. The service is on point. It's the little things like when the valet returned my car to me and asked if I needed directions anywhere. If I didn't already live in Indy, the Conrad would be my #1 choice for staying overnight!Fantastic place, well staffed and friendly. I was there at a meeting downtown and stayed 15 minutes away near airport. because I did not want to be in town. Cindy and Roxanne were on duty and extremely service oriented. The restaurant food was good but service excellent.Royalty, that's how I feel every time I come here. Their Weddings and Event staff couldn't be more on point. Been here for a few weddings and I'm blown away again and again by their hospitality and attention to detail. Even the staff at the front desk is always incredibly helpful. Had a groom who couldn't tie a bow tie so the concierge called Jos A Banks and asked if someone could come and tie it for him. So resourceful! We also asked the front desk for any recommendations for restaurants in the area with good dessert. He brought out the most comprehensive book of restaurants (and menus) in the area that I've ever seen. The rooms are always clean. The staff is always friendly. The food is always great. And you will always feel like you are the most important person in the room.We stayed here for a weekend getaway and we found the Conrad to be very clean and inviting.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with anything that we asked of them.  The location was perfect and right in the heart of the city.   We would highly recommend the Conrad to anyone!  Two thumbs up in our book.Hat tip to concierge Lee for going above and beyond in an effortless manner, and all that while she was off the clock. Grateful for her fitness center tour.Beautiful hotel in the very center of the city. The fact of being chosen by such celebrities as the Rolling Stones to stay while on tour- it definitely sais something about the hotel. Glamorous portraits of various rock n roll stars are decorating the lobby.They have SPA and fully equipped fitness center with few cardio machines and weights. Indoor sky blue swimming pool to work out or relax. Pretty good room service menu. Cozy and spacious rooms. Breakfast a la cart downstairs at the Capital Grill restaurant which is located at the hotel building. Valet parking. Walking distance to all Indianapolis sights, restaurant and the mall. One thing that we didn't like that possibly we were bitten by the bed bugs, cause the bites seemed exactly like of the bed bugs. But the manager assured us that they checked the room after we checked out and didn't find any. So... Except for this incident everything else was exceptional:)Been here twice over the last year.  What an excellent location being smack in the middle of downtown indy.  This hotel has a great wine bar / restaurant as well as Capital Grille attached to it.   The hotel is definitely above average with service and cleanliness.   Rooms are up to date with amenities and technology.   Also good looking hotel with keeping the classy look.   I will always choose this hotel when in downtown Indy.This is the best hotel I have stayed at outside of Vegas in the continental United States. I like everything about it, especially the gym and the pool. Usually hotel gyms feel thrown together in a closet, theirs is especially nice, lots of new and modern equipment and completely empty at 5 when I have time to workout before having to be on the clients site. I believe the food is done by the Capital Grill down on the first floor, I will review that separately, but it was very good as well. So far I have only stayed here for a couple weeks this year, but I will make sure to re-review if experience changes. So far it has been been usual upscale hotel experience, everything is very clean, very quite, very pretty. Being down town I have had to depend on hotel staff to help me out more then usual, but they are very responsive and have genuine nice response want and willingness to help. The location is perfect for the traveling consultant like myself. I am able to return in the evening and walk to 100 different restaurants. So far I haven't ate the same thing twice, and have enough places within walking distance it will be quite a while before I have to get the car out of valet at night. I'll be here for another 20 weeks this year, I absolutely love my new home away from home.Fantastic stay, even for just a night.  Room is wonderfully laid out and furnished, down to in room snacks, drinks and spirits.  The entire place was clean and staff was over the top friendly and ready to serve from the valet to the front desk to wait staff during our conference.Conference facilities were top shelf as well.  No complaints, suggestions or ideas on how to improve.  Just keep doing what you're doing!  I'll be back!Very nice hotel in heart of downtown Indy. You can't beat this location just a block off monument circle. You can even walk to circle center mall and see wrap restaurants via Sky bridges and never even have to step outside. This was great since it was ridiculously windy out when I visited the Conrad and surrounding areas this week. The staff are excellent and very helpful. The atmosphere is sophisticated but not overwhelming. The bed was the most comfortable thing I've ever laid down on! If you can afford a nice night it weekend, I'd definitely recommend the Conrad.This is the first time I have ever done an event or stayed at the Conrad, and I can honestly say that nothing could have gone better. The staff is extremely kind and considerate. Had a quick conversation with one lady about an upcoming trip and for the rest of my stay she would ask me if I was excited to go. They are a real class act and well worth the money. The rooms are impeccable and the proximity to everything happening in the city makes it an ideal location to experience what Indy is all about. The hotel itself doesn't have a restaurant or bar but the Capital Grill and Tastings are attached to the lobby.Thanks again to the entire team at the Conrad!AMAZING and probably the best night for our honeymoon in my humble opinion.  We checked in and parked around the corner for $24 vs. $37 valet.  Afterwards, we asked about anything special for our honeymoon.  Well, they started with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries.  Later, we got microwave delivered to our room for heating up some leftover pate chaud from our lunch church reception.  My new wife wanted a massage and got the concierge to do a last minute appointment booking.  Very good and attentive service since it was difficult to secure appointment within a couple of hours.  In addition to these perks, we also got two $10 breakfast vouchers at the Capital Grill (see my review).  The hotel is ideally located next to Tastings and Capital Grill which we tried both- very good/pricey but worth every penny.  That night, I reserved 2 complimentary bikes to tour the canal and river view.  We were told that we had 4-6 hours but ended up using just for 1-2 hours.  I have to give credit to my wife for toughening up with riding bike with me since she hasn't ridden bike for years.  I also got to do some laps in the pool which is absolutely huge (Olympic size) with a huge hot tub.  Each of the chairs had red/green apples and water bottles.  Well, Conrad Indianapolis went above and beyond our expectations so will have to try and get back here again.  The bed was heavenly and the soaker tub was everything we expected with Conrad.  No doubt, this is the place to be when staying in Indy.Where do I begin?When I was planning on moving to Indy, my mom and I came down for the night and stayed at the Conrad. George at the front desk learned about my upcoming move and went above and beyond to accommodate us. He provided us with information about different apartment complexes downtown - and by provided us with - I mean printed off 15 pages of information and delivered it to our room with champagne!My mom and I were so blown away by this hospitality. Then a few weeks later, per one of George's recommendations, I moved to Indianapolis. And every time my mother comes to visit, she stays at the Conrad with exquisite service.Having this special bond with George and the Conrad, when planning my wedding, the Conrad's Vienna Ballroom was the most obvious choice for us to hold the wedding and reception!We have been blessed with everyone we have worked with in planning the wedding. Stephanie Rice is amazing, and George has been there every step of the way as well!My family and I could not be more pleased with the Conrad in every way. Not only are the staff and service excellent but it is such a beautiful hotel in a prime location. Not to mention Dave Matthews stays there every year.I could keep going but I think I've made it clear that this place is amazing!Our 2 night stay was amazing! Not only are the rooms nice but the customer service was outstanding. I will definitely be back next year!Oh Conrard, how I wish I could afford to live in your hotel. The lotion-esq smell, the pillow bed menu, the full size towels -- you're perfect. I appreciate your AM local brew of Hubbard & Cravens in the lobby, friendly staff, and 24-hour room service. We'll be back.Nice place to stay in downtown.  Bit noisy up to 10pm with the guy at the restaurant across the street playing the saxophone, but it is a downtown location, so I guess stuff like that u can't help.  Breakfast is served at capital grill.  If u didn't know it was the comrad, u would think ur staying at the Waldorf.  Great deal for 50k Hilton points and a free upgrade.Classy. Elegant. Expensive. Comfortable. Doesn't get much better - surprised that Indy ever snagged a "Conrad".  Our room had an amazing view of the circle. Everything in the room was high-quality; the bath was spotless, even the glass shower.  But $8 for a tiny first-aid kit? (in the mini-bar)  And $8 for just 2 condoms (also in the mini-bar).  Only down-side were the noisy children next door and their father (?) who was loudly sharing his misery of drinking too much at 3 a.m.  Mom and the kids left him in the room when they went down for breakfast.  Anyhow, checking in/out was a breeze as was the valet $$ervice$$.  We'll be back.
review_content_20: Conrad, you are amazing! If I didn't know any better, I swore I was on vacation. All that was missing from this experience was a cocktail being handed to me as I'd walk in. However, the treatment that I got was so welcoming and helpful. Each staff I'd pass by always had a warm and friendly smile. Aesthetically, the hotel is absolutely gorg!! Grandiose, classic, yet modernly elegant. The rooms rivals that of any other fancy pants, luxurious hotels I've come across. Bathrooms are equipped with huge rain shower heads, oversized tubs, flat screen and a phone right next to the twailet. My room had a spacious work area that I only walked over to, to grab a pen. Otherwise, I had spent most of my time sprawled out on the bed. For me comfy beds are an absolute must, and theirs was just short of snuggling and cuddling me to sleep. I was on cloud 9 the minute my head hit those pillows! Location wise, it was ideal with plenty of nearby restaurants and sight seeing, tourist spots that I took advantage of in between my workshop and group dinners. If I were to ever come back to this city, you can bet, this would be my first and only choice. Granted, only if work ever covers for it again; the rates are quite grandiose themselves!This was for the devourdowntown  deal...The indoor pool was worth a weekend getaway in the big city. Spa area was relaxing and comfortable.  The artwork placed around the entire hotel is incredible.  Reminds me of a New York east coast kinda vibe. No matter how much you make, a small weekend getaway is worth it here.It's the best hotel in Indy hands down! Fantastic service from check in to valet. The Conrad had 2 top notch restaurants attached to have a few cocktails/ wine coupled w great food.The rooms are clean with space.  I love the gym as it has a lot more then the typical hotel gyms. The spa looks nice and if I ever get time I will visit. It's just classy!I am a Conrad fan... See you next time! Oh btw book early it sells out frequently.Where to start... I'm giving 2 stars only because the lobby is nice. Cons:1. We booked online and with our purchase we get a free room upgrade. Come to find out that's based on availability.  So there room rates and deals are vague online.2. The hotel front desk is rude and loud when talking about specifics allowing their voice to carry,  embarrassing us.3. Robe in the room was broken and had a stain. 4. We had two robes but only one set of slippers 3. We asked for a wine carafe sent to the roo, it was chipped and dirty.  The two glasses were dirty as well. 4. Valet is all over the place andb after arrive back from dinner at about 8pm. We had to ask the front desk about getting the car. Valet is required but no one met us? 5. The lamps are old and not all the outlets work correctly. 6. On the last night of a two night stay I go to take a relaxing bath. The drain won't work so I shake it, maybe that will work. The entire drain stop is loose and come right out of the drain...no bath!7. Pool has fee towels,  spa says they provide slippers,  none were there plus it smells like mold in there.  Also the hot tub take 30min to heat up.Pros:1. Location2. Lobby is nice and food is good.For this caliber of hotel you expect more. I'm highly disappointed.  I am a frequent traveler and have found better service and amenities at lower status hotelsThe Conrad parks cars on The Indianapolis Cultural Trail, threatening everyone's safety and really ruining this section of the trail. It's also just disrespectful and rude.I had the opportunity to stay at the Conrad this past weekend for the Big Ten Championship game. Phenomenal property which reminded me a lot of the Conrad in Chicago, which is also excellent. I travel extensively for business, so I've stayed in hotels of all sorts, and this one checks all the boxes. Everything you need is right here. Friendly and attentive staff, clean and modern/luxury rooms, combined with a perfect location make this hotel a winner.From the Conrad I was able to walk to every major restaurant/venue in the city, and it also has the convenience of being attached via Skywalk to a huge mall, as well as a variety of other hotels and restaurants.If you're a business traveler or someone who is coming to Indy for a convention or sporting event, I highly recommend this place. Also, if you can, try to book in advance, as it books up quick given everything it has to offer.It was a pleasure staying here, and I really hope I get to come back this April for the Final Four.Booked a weekend trip to the Conrad and was totally taken back to days of old or better yet current day racism! Valet parked my vehicle from Friday to Sunday to find people around my car every time I left the hotel. The valet charges are a bit exorbitant to have my vehicle on display for the general public to be able to lean on and take selfies! Upon checkout I felt a bit singled out when the valet requested my identification yet did not ask anyone not of color for a single piece of ID! What gives??? I'm a professional black man of color driving a luxury vehicle and dressed appropriately for the occasion. Why single me out for the ID? I'm ok if the policy applies to all patrons.....not just the black ones! I expressed my concerns with the staff and was not offered any apology or explanation! This coupled with the lackluster service from the Capital Grill left a bad taste with me and will surely not earn my business in the future! I'm sure this will fall upon deaf ears as these comments usually do!!! -Unimpressed-Not all that great, for the price.  They were deliberately vague about a web special which supposedly included a breakfast. The front-desk acted like they'd never heard of the website before.  I got charged for the breakfast, because I didn't present a PAPER coupon, which I think room service "cleaned up".Don't even bother trying to get a copy of your room charges (simple request, right?)....you'll just be sent to Natalie's vmail. And Natalie doesn't seem to return many calls.C'mon guys, it's the little things, especially when you're paying $300/night in INDIANAPOLIS.The Conrad is a lovely downtown hotel. With so many options, they do a great job of personalizing the experience from the time you chat with the lead valet to being greeted upon entering the lobby.  There are many offerings within the hotel that are included in the stay - fitness facility, pool, sauna.  There is a full service spa onsite as well.The room was spacious and comfortable but our view left something to be desired.  The bathroom was lovely offering a deep tub AND stand in shower, two sinks and a television. I thought that was a nice touch.  I love hotel rooms with nice bedding and the Conrad really steps it up here with layers of blankets, sheets and pillows.  I truly enjoy the hotel experience in general and this was a nice "staycation" downtown Indy.I'd definitely stay here again!  The location is great - across from the mall and just down the road from the Indians, Pacers and Colts.  I would recommend it for out of towners for an upscale hotel stay.  The Conrad is also a part of the Hilton brand, so definitely give them your HHonors info for point value. :)"If an excellent hotel in Indianapolis is your requirement, look no further than the Conrad."This hotel was so nice that I spent additional time in Indiana. It has a great overall feel, location and service. When I pulled up to valet parking I was greeted by a polite gentleman named "Conrad". I chuckled and gave him a few jabs about joking around, but he insisted he wasn't joking.Bellboy asked if he could take 7 minutes of my time to show me how my room worked and said yes with the distinct impression he was enjoying his job. There were two plasma TV's one in the main room and the bathroom.There was a coffee / drink bar that had everything you would want including a The Timer hour glass which has three separate hourglass timers, which will time 3 minutes, 4 minutes, and 5 minutes. You could simply tell there was a lot of though behind everything in the hotel rooms.Valet service for meetings was 100% reliable, car running and air / heat was on and ready. Meals were so so, they knew I wasn't totally satisfied so the chef made a desert just for me and by colleague "on the house"!Firstly this rating is based on my perception of value for money AND by comparing this Conrad to other Conrads I've recently and regularly stayed at. I really wanted to like this hotel. I'm a Diamond Hilton dude and love this location. I have to say I'm not that impressed, especially compared to other Conrads I've stayed at around the country.  Couldn't get into their attached Capital Grille eatery after 1030pm - they close then apparently - so I guess it's room service. The food at their cap grille is great (did food this am and last night) but their new billing system isn't connected to the Conrad hotel system (WTF?) so that's also strange....especially if you are a hilton surpass card member and you are dining with their eateries for a reason. They want you to pay with your credit card which makes it annoying if you want one bill from your hotel stay.....plus your points ratio. I haven't stayed at the Miami Conrad but have stayed very regularly at the NYC and Chicago Conrads and this place feels not quite up to their standard. Just little things like no water left in the work out room / no cups / no kids for coffee in lobby - or less than quick responses to requests for room service. Disappointing. Will compare to JW Marriott next time I'm in town. Maybe this place is geared to the Big Race and when it's not that time standards fall. Again. Disappointed. When room service did arrive I got a can of beer with no glass (!) no water and no condiments with my burger! Another quick thing is that you can hear doors opening and closing in the rooms adjacent to you..... again not a big deal if that's not something you notice and you have a corner suite but if you just have a regular standard room then it's an issue.All in all I would stay here again but I'd make sure that I made other dining arrangements and that I'd be sure to ask for a corner room. Indy is a cool fun city and you can't beat this hotel's location.My company booked rooms here for a conference.  We had 25+ producers here with plenty of things that could have gone wrong....but nothing did! The staff here is so courteous, willing to help, and on top of things. Anything we needed was at our fingertips in minutes. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Even with March Madness going on around us it was calm and quiet up by the rooms. You need a key card to even take the elevator up to the rooms. I really liked that feature. The rooms really were pitch black, just how I like it. The bed was so comfortable and I had no problem falling right asleep. The food we had catered was delicious and the service was on point. They came around and made sure everyone had everything they wanted. I wish all of our conferences went as flawlessly as this one has.As a frequent traveller for pleasure and business, I have come to expect a great deal from the Hilton brand hotels. Before arriving at the Conrad, I was excited to stay here and see what the hotel had to offer. I was quickly disappointed. I booked a room with a king bed. At check in, I was told there were no more rooms with a king available. Ok, fine. The next morning, while chatting with coworkers who were also staying at Conrad, I come to find out that they checked in after me and were in a room with a king. Hmm.My boyfriend stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and left his car with the valet. When leaving, the valet handed my boyfriend the key - in 2 pieces. My boyfriend asked what had happened to key and the valet just shrugged it off. That night I went to the front desk to speak with a manager about the situation and was greeted with a "tough shit" attitude - as the valet and the hotel are separate companies. So basically I can pay $37 per night for valet, have a key broken, and the hotel won't do anything - not even comp the parking fees. At check out, I was reviewing my bill and realized I had been charged for a suite, instead of the double bed room I was in (even though I booked a king). The hotel is beautiful. The amenities are nice. The location is perfect. The service and management are awful. For this level of hotel, I expect more. I have received better customer service at lower level, less expensive Hilton brand hotels. Why am I paying more to stay at a nicer hotel, only to receive less?Four years ago my husband and I spent our wedding night here, and stayed again last night to celebrate our anniversary.  Each time we haven't been disappointed.  The Conrad is absolutely stunning from the second you walk in, to every hallway and room.  It's the cleanest hotel we've ever frequented.  This trip Dan, who checked us in, offered us a complimentary bottle of wine or champagne for our anniversary.  I told him no thank you as I do not drink wine, to which he inquired about what I do like.  I told him I like beer (I know, classy right?!).  He offered us any kind of beer we wanted, and suggested Sunking!  We love Sunking!  He had four sent up to our room on the house, and gave us $50 to spend on breakfast at the Capital Grille.  Such a nice, unexpected gesture!  It's the little things like this that will keep us Conrad faithfuls for life!  The bathrooms are beautiful, and always leave me wishing I could live there!  Staying here is worth every penny, and then some.  Keep up the awesome work guys!  We'll definitely be back!  And thanks again to Dan for making our stay extra special!This is, hands down, the best hotel in Indianapolis! As a student at Butler University, a lot of my family members come through town to visit. My parents (who are pretty high maintenance when it comes to hotels) absolutely LOVE the Conrad! As soon as you pull up, the friendly valet are at your car to greet you. You're offered a bottle of water and directed to the main lobby, which is absolutely gorgeous. The staff is very professional and friendly, the hotel is clean and smells amazing, and the rooms are quiet and spacious. The bathrooms are extremely luxurious, with a separate bath tub, and the standard size room has a couch and a desk. A lot of times, when my parents visit, I'll hang out with them in their hotel room and take a nap on the couch -super comfy! For those who are into art, Conrad has a variety of Indiana-based artist's works throughout the hotel. Priceless works of art seem to cover almost every wall. This place is upscale, but not intimidatingly so; luxurious, but not overly luxurious. It fits in perfectly with the rest of Indianapolis, providing a home away from home for visitors and locals alike in the heart of the midwest. If you're looking for great food, Conrad has that, too, boasting 2 restaurants on the main floor. It's also located in the center of downtown, a short walking distance from dozens of great restaurants. The hotel connects with the mall and other nearby locations via skywalk, so you don't even have to go outside if you don't want to (this is a pretty nice feature during Polar Vortex season). If all of that isn't enough for you, the best spa in Indy is located on the fifth floor, along with a pool and a fitness center. I saw Justin Timberlake in there one time. Can I move in?After reading many reviews that raved about this place (and yeah! it is a Conrad!) I booked with a good rate and asked for an early check-in as we would be arriving before 3.  So we go in expecting things to be smashing and we got close but no cigar on a few things.The location is good (although you could whip past it if not familiar with the area).  It is great that it is connected to the mall there and you can go back and forth to eat, shop, etc. without ever getting exposed to the elements.  The staff were all very nice (especially the cocktail waitress for the evening drinks - she was fantastic!) and the room was very good.  So what's my beef?Here's the beef! Got there at 2 was told room wasn't ready yet and would be in about 10mins.  Half hour later the room still wasn't ready and to apologize we got some coupons for some drinks and free continental breakfast.  But did they offer to take our bags and store them while we waited or wandered off like most hotels? Nope! We sat in the lobby with our stuff for that half hour until they gave us the keys.The room was great except that the nice soaking tub didn't work, water in water right back out again.  The stopper was busted. And the tv remote was acting a bit wonky too - no biggie on that one. When we had breakfast at the Capital Grill (reviewing that later) that wasn't up to par for them either (and I have eaten at Capital Grills before).  And when we were ready to leave the valet guys brought us the wrong car!I brought this to the attention of the manager and he did apologize and gave us a free one nights stay for the future when (if) we return.  Let's just say that we went in expecting Conrad top shelf across the board and they dropped the ball several times.  Not cool!What a beautiful hotel, marred by an unexpected gap in customer service. We were thrilled to be part of a beautiful wedding over the New Year's holiday, Stephanie with the Conrad excelled at every level. However the valet services, and subsequent discussion with management about said services have left us with a great sense of disappointment with the Conrad in general. As the appointed driver of our wedding party, I was charged with driving our group about Indianapolis for photos, as the Valet service positioned our vehicle, they did so by nosing it to a pylon of the cultural trail.  As the let us out to our vehicle no note of said pylon was mentioned, as we pulled away, the pylon, under the view of the hood of our vehicle caused significant damage. We were dismissed by the valet service when we addressed it, given the circumstances of the occasion, we had obviously no time to stay and further discuss. When I further called Conrad management about the situation, they noted it had happened before and dismissed me cordially with no offer to remedy the situation, and promised a return call to follow up which never came. I generally hate to write a negative review, as I am in the customer service world as well, it greatly pains me to actually. But this was significant damage, that really should have been addressed by the Conrad. I wish further guests a similarly enjoyable stay, and I hope their experience is not marred as well by a further error in judgment.Stayed here the last weekend of March with my wife and kids.  I have to say the facilities are very nice, the lobby is beautiful and impressive.  There is good security in that they require a key to access any floor.  I am a honors gold member and they upgraded me to a one bedroom suite for only 100 more a night (although some hiltons have upgraded me without an additional charge).  Here are the pros and Cons:Pros:Fitness center - great selection of treadmills and ellipticals as well as free weights.  They even had a free weight bench press which is somewhat rare in my opinion.  The fitness center is large and spacious top of the line.Pool - right next to the fitness center.  The hot tub is huge and the area is clean, the pool is beautiful and well maintained.Location - connected to the circle center mall, so if you don't want to go outside you never have to.  Its also close to awesome restaurants like fogo de chao and mesh.Room bathrooms - they are huge and spacious and have today screen TVs in them. I caught my kids sitting in the bathroom watching cartoons...lolCons:Rooms - the rooms are on the smaller side.  My family and I were quite a tight fit even in a one bedroom suite.  I would have rated them a four if this was the only issue...Service - typically a Conrad is known for its service.  Unfortunately this Conrad did not live up to its reputation.  They visibly were not welcoming to my children in fact it seemed as if they did not welcome families in the hotel.  The front desk staff were rude and I would say borderline racist...sorry to say that but I noticed they were much nicer to other guest for no apparent reason.  So either they were prejudiced or didn't like the fact that I had kids or both.Bottom line, great facilities, rooms are a bit on the small side, the lack of welcoming service is what drags this rating down.  I simply won't bring my family back here because of how uncomfortable the service made us feel.My tip upon mobile check-in to the Conrad:I would like to take this whole bed home with me kthanksbye.Really, though. This place is the place to stay if one finds themselves in the Circle City.A super-centralized location. An insanely attentive staff. A gorgeous lobby complete with sparkly black and white prints of famous old-time celebs (think Muhammad Ali and Marilyn and all that). Super nice accommodation insofar as the room itself. Free water everywhere. A relatively nice fitness center. An insanely nice-looking pool and hot tub (though I did not partake.) Amenities in-room that went above and beyond the usual cornucopia of offerings that hotels provide. An adjacent, attached Capital Grille location as well as some sort of super-cute wine cafe deal.Aaaannnddd... a killer comfy bed. Folks, this bed was better than the W's legendary ones. Not kidding. So amaze.Seems as though folks agree that the Conrad's *thee* place to stay while in Indy, and after my first experience here, I'm inclined to agree as well!Stayed here for one night for a training seminar in Indianapolis. I had never been to Indi before, and the ride to the hotel revealed a pretty shabby looking downtown area. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the Conrad Hotel. I had a King room, and it was very comfortable, nice bed, modern furnishings, and a little TV in the bathroom. Unfortunately, this TV was only set up for viewing from the tub, not the throne. I'm not a bath guy. The lobby areas and the banquet rooms were also very nice, and they had a Capital Grille steakhouse right off of the main lobby. I didn't eat at this particular Capital Grille, but I have eaten at another Capital Grille location and it was awesome. If you HAVE to go to Indianapolis, I recommend staying here.
review_content_40: Wonderful hotel and very close to all of the action.  Service was impeccable and the staff went out of their way to treat us well both at the hotel and the attached Capital Grille.   As far as hotel rooms go, this was very nice but on par with a high end Hilton.  They did have a great fitness area with a steam room and sauna in the locker room. Pool and hot tub were nice, quite, and relaxing.   If you are into art, they have a very nice collection adorning the walls around the first and second floors.Treated like a Queen!Went for a very special girls-day all-day spa-day and it was incredible! It was so relaxing and fun to unwind. They served us fruit and little pastries with mimosas (I of course had mine with very little OJ), and we were pampered. The massages were amazing and the mani/pedis were so nice. The staff was calm and helpful and spoke quietly. I loved the indoor heated pool and the luxurious mani/pedi chairs. They made us feel like royalty.I valeted my car on a Wednesday evening at this "five star hotel" only to pick it up Saturday afternoon to have two bent front wheels. Of course I can not tell a wheel is bent on the inside while it is parked at a curbside. I found out once I got up to 50mph on the highway and the front end of my 2013 Honda Accord started shaking VIOLENTLY. I immediately pulled over to make sure I didn't have a flat. No flat. So I go to the nearest tire place, Big O Tires. They squeeze me in at the end of their day (3pm now) and they pull the wheels off of my car. The front two wheels were found to be bent. Nearly flattened on one side on the passenger wheel. I then call to inform them an they say someone will get back to me. I am from Dallas so I am extremely upset that I may not make it home. They balance the wheels for me but advise me that I may not make it home, they will not stay balanced, and that I run the risk of my wheels cracking or splitting on the highway. Luckily I made it home. But it is now 20 days later and they are still denying that they will cover the damages to my wheels. I demand my wheels be replaced. I am not able to drive my car as it is because the shaking is back and completely unsafe. I have to pay for a cab or an uber to get to and from work. Please fix this issue.Per a recommendation from Jon A, as well as the many five star reviews written about this luxury hotel, I booked my room in advance of my trip to Indy, and I couldn't have been more pleased!Here are some of the highlights:*Friendly staff!  The front desk people even welcomed me by name and verified my Hilton Honors number upon arrival.  *Timely valet! My car was ready for me within minutes of calling down from my room each time I needed it.*Awesome location!  The Conrad is centrally located in the heart of downtown and I was able to walk to some nearby hotspots instead of worrying about driving everywhere or paying high prices for the hotel room service / restaurant.  *Comfortable room with many amenities! I especially loved the high-end bath products!You will pay a price to stay here, but if you plan ahead and don't mind prepaying for your room, you may be able to score a discounted rate like I did... and if it's within your budget, or even a bit of a splurge, I am telling you... it's worth it!  I'll definitely be staying at the Conrad again in the future!hands down, the best hotel in Indy.  The decor is a bit traditional, but who really sits on their hotel room couch?  The service here is fantastic, the room service is Capital Grille, and the other bar of choice is Tastings, a wine bar.  I stay here as often as I can because the service is incomparable, the cleanliness impeccable and the people as charming as a Southern Belle.  If the Conrad is in your budget and locale, then there is no other option.  In addition, the central downtown location is perfect.  You can walk to EVERYTHING in about 10 minutes or less.Thinking about blowing your wad at the Conrad? Well aye aye, sailor... it's completely worth it!The lobby is stunning, but not in that ostentatious, over-the-top "I'm a boutique hotel, look at me!" way. And the check-in process took all of 2.5 minutes. For an impatient girl like me, that's priceless.My room. So stately, so sophisticated. There's a small sofa, an upholstered chair, a coffee table, two end tables, a huge desk, a dresser, my king size bed and there's still plenty of room to spare. In the bathroom, we have a sleek and small flat screen TV to further enhance your soak in the GLORIOUS tub should you want to sneak in some Mad Men. The toiletries = designer Italian. I'm smelling like a bed of roses right now... thank you, Conrad!The location is fab (right downtown off the circle) and the bed is magnificent. Actually, the bed warrants its own sentence. I'm sinking in it right now, and this review is becoming less and less of a priority... on that note, I bid you adieu! Too bad you won't sleep as well as me.And that is why you should stay at the Conrad.I stay in a lot of hotels because I occasionally travel for my job. This Conrad is smack in the heart of downtown INDY. As a matter of fact, it's much more in the mix than the new JW Marriott is.They lobby is fantastic and I should mention the room was on par with other Conrads I've stayed at. First Class all the way. However, there was an incident during my stay that should never happen.I checked in around 5pm and was given my key. I went up to my room and everything looked fine until I got over to the minibar. There was a half enjoyed bottle of pinot noir sitting there with the cork half in it. I went down to the front desk and notified them of it. They seemed to not really care or offer to come up and remove it. This is supposed to be the best hotel in Indy!The frustrating part is that you wonder what else they forgot to do in my room...As good as it gets!Are 10 stars an option? A last minute trip took me to Indy and I was fortunate enough to stay at the Conrad. Having seen many of them oversees, I was excited to experience this flagship. From the time I pulled up till I hopped in the car after check out, the hotel was beyond stellar. I was in a suite that had a parlor room and bedroom, on a corner. It shared a view of the city, which at times can get a little loud but the windows were insulated well. The rooms were comfy, TVs throughout, and exceptionally comfy bed. Let's not forget the fresh flowers in the room and the shower product was scented in an elegant way. The shower head was two that extend out. It was like rain shower but in the rain forest, Ah... heaven! The lobby of the hotel was covered in fresh sunflowers, tied to the current art exhibit underway. The wine bar outside, amazing at night. The plates were larger then I anticipated they would be. Last but not least the Capital Grille located inside as well. The staff was always so friendly and attentive. I checked out at 5:30am, the front desk person offerred me a coffee to go or bottled water. Again - Impressed and details! If in Indy, I could not imagine staying at ANY other hotel, nor would I consider it.The best bed in Indianapolis.  If this was my normal home away from home, traveling for work would be so much more enjoyable.  The rooms are immaculate, although the bathrooms are its best feature.  All rooms come with a separate bath and shower, TV included.  The only knock would be the dimly lit rooms and darker colored decor.  Some brighter upholstery and more modern fixtures might bring this hotel into the 21st century.Turn down service is typical of a hotel at this level, but without the nighttime chocolate :(  Check out the pillow options.. you might like it better than the standard ones.  The hotel staff was helpful and knowledgeable about downtown locales.  Room service can bring some things, if asked nicely, from the regular Capital Grille menu.5 stars for a wonderful stay and friendly service, even if it isn't the Rtiz Carlton.As good as it gets...the Conrad Indy. Lots of elec outlets, beauty room and appointments. Am here for auto racing convention with Marshall Engine group. Placement to this hotel courtesy of MillionAir Indy, where our airplane is parked. Great downtown location near lots of activity. Several great food options here in hotel. I will surely return. Thanks folks. Well done.Conrad Hotels, the upscale version of the Hilton chain has only 3 locations in the US; Chicago, Miami and this location in Indianapolis. When an impromptu trip to Indy came up, a friend suggested I try this hotel out. With it's location central to everything that I wanted to see while I was in Indy (the Capital and the war memorial)- it was an easy decision. After a few hiccups with getting a reservation (the on line system said they only had smoking rooms left) I placed a call to the reservation number and was able to get the room I wanted smoke free. From the time I got there and was greeted by the valet, who whispered my name into his ear piece so that that front desk was alerted that I was there- the service at the Conrad was quite good. People were there to help you if you even only looked confused about something,they would jump to your aid. The only downside from a service standpoint was that housekeeping shortchanged my room a bit with only one bar of soap, no glassware and no turn down service even though when I was going out for the night- housekeeping was right next door turning down my neighbors room. I suppose I could have called to have them come back but it didn't seem worth the hassle.The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The king sized bed was comfortable with a down comforter and 500 thread count sheets that felt great to slide into at the end of the night. The work station is large and there are plenty of outlets in the room so that you can plug all of your electronics in to charge. Wi-fi in the room is an additional charge of $12.95 which seemed ridiculous given you are paying around $229 a night for the room. The bathroom is lovely, all marble with a separate shower and tub. The shower has a dual headed spray which was really nice. The Acca Kappa toiletries smell amazing (white moss was the scent) and while the basics are there- they also have a nail file, and a toothbrush in the room, There is even a small flat screen TV in the bathroom so you can catch all of that day's news while you get ready in the morning. There is a restaurant in the hotel (Capital Grill) that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Also there is a wine bar called Tastings that uses the Enomatic wine dispensing system that dispenses a taste or a glass of over 100 wines with a pre paid card. Not sure when my travels will take me back to Indy- but given the great night's sleep I had during this stay- I will definitely stay here again.While many people see The Conrad merely as Indianapolis' only five star hotel, for me, it is much, much more. My adventure in Indy began here. For almost a month it was our home. Work schedule and move in-schedule didn't gel so as we waited for our permanent residence to become available, and made The Conrad our temporary home. This was my first experience of life in The Circle City. The lobby is jaw droppingly beautiful. Top of the line amenities, friendliest staff, a great wine bar (Tastings) and Capital Grill (I will never forget the first time I had their Truffle Fries!!)  A salon and spa on the 6th floor Evan Todd- A pool, whirlpool and fitness center with all the basic cardio and weight machines. And the rooms!! Oh the rooms!! If you are lucky you will get a room that is East facing and just high enough so that you have a view of The Circle.  We were there  just as they were putting Lady Victory back a top Monument Circle, after her "makeover" before the SuperBowl. Also amazing sunset views from that window. Great bathroom with tv, shower and tub. Sheets that feel like they are 2000+ thread count and nightly turn down service. They treat all guests like family and will do anything to make you happy. As far as hotels go nobody does it better.No paper towels!! the baskets are for the towels, i Loved that! I'm easily entertained, discovered they have FREE  art shows in the Alcove & on the 2nd floor ............Truly enjoyed that ,  Lee & her staff could not have been more helpful next show First Friday 9/7I would have given this hotel a 5 star rating if there were not a few issues at hand.The hotel is very nice, the beds are very comfortable, the staff is very accommodating. When we checked in and they brought us up to our room it smelled like smoke and the smoke detector had been tampered with so it was buzzing.  They upgraded us, no charge, to a smoke free room (we choose a non smoking room due to my son's recent asthma attack).  The upgrade was AWESOME.Now the bad part.My mother in law needed an extra key to our room and I was not aware that she went down to get an extra key.  This was completely fine, BUT The front desk gave her the key after she said she was staying with us and had the same last name.They did not ask for ID nor did they call up to the room to confirm this information.  She just simply asked and got a key.I am staying here with my son, had I been staying alone - this is super scary that anyone can get a key to my  room.  The front desk person does not personally know me or my family.  She only knows that my husband's name is on the room.  I get that it is my mother in law and she knows me, had it been someone in passing or sitting next to me at a restaurant that happened to overhear where I was staying, that would have been different.I feel like there should be some type of protocol for safety like you need to check with the registered guest, check the persons ID or at the very least call the room to confirm.  Not all of those things, but at least something to check the validity of the person requesting a room access key.Classy hotel.  Best bed I've slept in away from home.  An Indianapolis mainstay.  Clean, beautiful rooms with attentive staff.This is still the nicest hotel in town. We've stayed here a half dozen times or so and about an equal amount at that other new hotel to the west, and I still like the Conrad for the extra touches they provide. For the record, we are loyal Marriott peeps. I'm talking 175 Marriott nights last year. We don't stay at Hilton properties often, but if we are going to stay at one in Indianapolis, it's going to be the Conrad. The service is exceptional, and the rooms have those extra little touches that are missing from the other hotels in the area. It feels more personal and not so much like a convention/next-guest-up hotel.We stopped by the Conrad this evening after having dinner at the Captial Grille, to inquire about a stay on our wedding night in March. A young man sporting a Britney Spears headset was behind the counter. He told us he was unable to book us a hotel that far out and in fact, he couldn't even get us a rate past today. This is not what I expected in a hotel of this caliber. I hope to encounter someone a bit more competant on the phone, although a tour or some sort of information/interest from the front desk would have been greatly appreciated. I suppose I could just make the reservations online, however, when it comes to my wedding night, I'd like to be able to firm up the details with a person.Absolutely FLIPPIN FANTASTIC choice for your hotel stay in Indy!  Zak & I loved our stay here!  Pulling up in our Red Mustang Convertible - YES WE HAD TO RENT A RED MUSTANG CONVERTIBLE TO FIT IN!  It's the Midwest, dummies!  FORD!  So anyway, pulling up each day and turning our car over to the Valet guys was fun.  We loved how they were always ready to carry in anything we picked up during our day out on the town.  Either the Valet guys or Concierge were always available in the lobby no matter the hour to joke with us, laugh with us, carry our cases of water to the room for us, or let us know where the heck we could get some good wings at 11pm on a Monday night.  It was great! Our room was beautiful!  The bedding was more than cozy and I loved the separate tub - We had more than a few bubble baths with wine in hand during our stay.  The DUAL SHOWER HEADS were just WOW.  Massage and a new attitude for sure!  Heavenly.  The hotel is within walking of the circle and many restaurants.  You will not regret staying here at all. THE best choice.  This IS our choice for every stay while in Indy... Hands down.Wow!  I've stayed in higher rated hotels and not had a bed that was so amazing. The staff and amenities were on par too!  I'd definitely stay here again.
review_content_60: One day when I rule all, I will make my way through city after city and stay in luxurious comfort with courtesans a'plenty, eat rich foods, rub my expanding, hairy belly, and make my staff assure me that I am svelte and gorgeous. Until that day, I will look for good deals in incredible hotels that allow me to daydream. Hoo-whee mama! This place is awesome! First off, the location is fantastic. Centrally located just off that big-ass circle in the middle of downtown Indy lies the Conrad and it sits there gleaming and marbley and full of awesome. The lobby is ornate without being gauche. My shoes appropriately 'click-clacked' on the marble floor and reverberated off the high ceiling, but it wasn't out of place. There was plenty of chatter from people checking in and checking in. It helped that I made my entrance in slow-motion. After being checked in by one of the most helpful and cheery desk staffs, I made my way to my 18th floor room/suite/thingie. It really is too bad that I don't have a legion of courtesans. Yet. Because, this place was made to be 'appreciated.'The king-sized bed was opulent in shape, feel and decor. The carpet was interesting, soft-yet firm to the bare touch. I had plenty of seating options from the fabricked couch to the over-stuffed chair to the leather chair that sat behind my office-sized desk. My nightstands included pullouts that added more space for books and/or water. The butler nook held all sorts of food and drink items that I could want (plus a mirror in which I beheld a sexy beast). A flat-screen TV atop the wooden bureau. An actual hallway between the door and the bathroom took more than a few steps... which is good. Once I made it to the bathroom, I had to sit down. Double-sized vanity sink. Glass rainforest-style shower. Sunken bath tub on the other end of the spacious bathroom. Warmed tile flooring. TV AND phone by the toilet -- which was separated from the sink by a half wall. The combination of wood and marble made for a completely inviting and extremely masculine space which prompted me to do some very masculine things.I wept. I poured a scotch. I called Heidi Fleiss from the toilet phone. I have arrived.All things rad, no con to be had at the Conrad! Staying at the nicest hotel in the city you live in is a strange brew of a luxury. Honestly, one of the finest treats I've ever experienced was: "hey my room's non-refundable and I can't make it town, so you should stay there!" Tally ho!Who doesn't like entering their room to some smooth Rod Stewart and mood lighting? Who doesn't like a gazillion-thread count comforter & sheet set? Crazy attentive staff fetching ice & bar keys. TV in the bathroom. TV audio feed in the bathroom, too. Stellar views of downtown. The valet is pricey though at $33/overnight... watch it. I don't allow TVs & beds to go together in my own home, so a giant a flat screen at the foot of the hotel bed... immediately made me feel like "okay... just this one time." And it was amazing. Funny thing... I wake up the next day & I feel like I'm on vacation entirely... oh, wait, I live here! Go Indy!The nicest hotel I've ever been in? I think so!We attended the Conrad's Easter Brunch, and were deeply disappointed-very dirty heavily stained table cloth from earlier sittings- bland, unimaginative foods- stale/dry/mushy food that's been sitting out for 24 hours probably- And to boot, after charging $50 per adult (which we knew would be the price), they added a $20 "service charge" to our bill. For just two people!! Service was good, and I would probably have left a 15% tip, but adding a mandatory $20 charge (for a buffet)?? This mandatory charge was not mentioned anywhere by the way, not in advertising, not at the entrance, not by the table, nowhere. It just appeared on our check.Having had Easter brunches at hotels all over the country, this was by FAR the worst, and grossly overpriced with a large unadvertised mandatory service charge to boot. I'm happy to pay $50-60 for an Easter brunch, or even more, but not for what the Conrad offered. Deeply disappointing, really put a damper on our Easter Day.not too happy that the WiFi is tied to one device and not just one log in.  The amount of money that we paid is great for one log in if you could use it from any device.  Outside of that, the location is great (a block walk to the convention center) and the space is large enough to have friends over.  Also the price for parking is steep (it's valet only) but it's for the whole day so you can come and go as you please.The Conrad would have gotten five stars if it weren't for all the problems with my reservation. Then when I finally got a room they checked me out the next day and I still had one more night there. After all that was settled, I enjoyed my stay. Actually, I loved my stay. The bed was ohhhhh so comfy. I had a great view of the city from my room. Every staff member with the exception of the front desk guy at check in was pleasant and very accommodating. I loved the over sized towel in the bathroom, the dual shower head and the bath products. Excellent location. The valet was on top of everything, we had our car ready to go whenever we needed it. The food was fantastic. The fitness center is open 24 hours. If you work out on "off" hours, you'll be fine. I had to wait for a treadmill at 6am. However, if you want a cold bottle of water, head up there, you'll find one in the fridge. I just wish my check in experience was a tad better. PS thanks for the toothbrushI simply love this hotel.  Solid company with a boutique feel.  Best Conrad in the country.  Yes......in the heartland and not a major metropolis.  Just wish I could still get the high end coffee in the rooms.Try three things:1. Pillow menu2. Room show polish service3. Lobster eggs BenedictBest hotel in Indy. Beds are huge and very soft. Great restaurant in lobby. Very close to everything in downtown Indy..This has to be the best hotel in Indianapolis.  We arrived to find a beautiful lobby and a Capital Grille next door.  When we checked in we were asked if this was a special occasion, and since it was sorta a belated anniversary trip but really a "omg, we're having a baby in a month and we won't be able to go anywhere again" trip, we answered that it was our anniversary.  The prize was a free breakfast at Capital Grille the following morning.  The room was immaculate, with a nice sitting area, and even a television in the bathroom!  The staff was wonderful, as upon our return from Fogo de Chao (only 2 blocks away), the room was nicely dimmed for the close of our romantic evening.Breakfast was great and we were very sad to leave the Conrad.  This is one of only three Conrads in the US.  We have only one more to go!So, you know how you watch tv and you see someone who has made a hotel their home?  Well the Conrad is definitely that type of hotel.  Located in the heart of downtown the Conrad has an old feel although it was just built about 3 years ago. The staff is great and restaurant attached is wonderful but  what do you think will be the talk of the hotel?THE BATHROOM!!  OMG!! Spa tub..separate shower with dual shower heads...AWESOME!!  I could not imagine waking up in that room everyday because I would never make it on time for anything! I would like to thank you Conrad for an excellent night of sleep and a wonderful bathroom.We spent more for one night at the Conrad than for the other 5 nights on our trip but it was so, so worth it. Valet parking is pricey compared to the other hotels in the area - $33 but the valets are very helpful in getting things from the car if you ask. The room has a huge flat screen television and there is a DVD player you can connect. The king sized bed has luxurious linens and is quite comfortable. There is plenty of room to spread out with a couch and a chair, a coffee table and a large desk. Tastings wine bar is loud and oddly self service. You buy a card and then pour your wine. The Capital Grill is where breakfast is served and we had coupons for free continental breakfast. Each of us had 3 pastries and a large dish of berries. It was plenty of food. The coffee was surprisingly weak. The pool is beautiful.  The spa was closed at our visit.  The staff was wonderful. Lee, our concierge was quite helpful. The Conrad has to be the best hotel in Indy and worth the price.This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The best service, no really, the best. The rooms are outstanding and the location is great if your in town for a convention. If you have the ability to stay here then do it. I think that there are only 4 or 5 Conrad's in the USA.Um hello it is a Conrad... Of coarse it was fantastic on every level & a Capital Grill inside the Conrad that serves breakfast! BOOMCan never go wrong with the Conrad.  Comfy sheets, killer location.  It's perfect.Spectacular service, delicious room service, helpful and courteous staff.Next Gen Con, this is where to be. It's part of the block but no events are held here, so you can get to all parts of the con while in the air conditioned corridors and skywalks.It's clean, comfortable, beautiful, spacious, and quiet. Worth every penny. They'll book your car from the airport at a discounted rate; do that instead of getting a cab. It's close to the same price anyway, and you do NOT want to be in an un-airconditioned vehicle in Indy during Gen Con. Notably, the Jonas Brothers were apparently staying there, and when I and my husband walked out, we had to avoid paparazzi--no, I am not kidding.  Apparently, it's the best place in town, but you wouldn't know that by the prices they're charging. One of the best hotel values ever.This is a great hotel. Nice rooms, great food,  nice views of Monument circle. Quiet, room.The staff is very professional, very nice, on top of things.The location in Downtown Indianapolis is perfect. The hotel is not cheap. but it is worth the pricestayed locally for a downtown wedding at the Conrad. based upon the prices we expected more. we upgraded to 1 br corner suite. Marks on the walls, stains on ceiling above bed, one robe, no slippers. honor bar product was so old the dust and stains on the tops of the cans were a turn off. the topper was finding a previous guest's tennis shoes and opened and uneaten honey bun in the dresser drawer. staff came to retrieve the clothes and food but no mention of it at check out or any other time. room service food was good but the interface with the kitchen was one guy on a cell phone who took orders while delivering our order and a follow up call to room service had bad reception as he was in transit in an elevator. seemed like amateur service for the top of the line Hilton. will try the JW before returning here.Hotel awesomeness at its best. Great Hotel, great service, great restaurant, great bar. 50'' Flat screen in room, flat screen in the bathroom, capital grille and a wine tasting bar all wrapped up in one decent price. Food was great, wine bar was cool and the service was awesome. Traveling to Indy this is the place for you.I attended a pretty large holiday party at the Conrad and it was fantastic.  Great food, the best formal service I've ever seen.  Food delivery was a seamless dance that quickly moved from table to table.  The dinner, drinks, banquet room, etc. were all top notch too.I came home and craved a refreshing green apple. Oh marketing ploys that never work..the green apples everywhere is a brilliant idea! The tao of Conrad ala green apple. Refreshing, elegant, positive, understated and discreetly present. Conrad Brussels was one of my favourite places to stay, ever.  Stunned that we live so close to another Conrad gem.  Since this is a chain within a chain, I feel no issue with saying that the Conrad Chicago doesn't hit the mark like the Conrad Indianapolis or Brussels. The suites were all booked; however, double room is still worth the money without feeling like a cheap space filler. Elegant spacious bathrooms, separate shower and larger soaking tub, soft bedding, tv in main room as well as the WC.  The pool & spa area and the Capital Grille were stunning additions. Quite a few European hotels have the Pool, spa, steam room/sauna with a well appointed locker room, so few places in the US attempt it.  The amenities at this location succeed in adding activities, health and benefit and no doubt have taken your needs into account.  Forgot about the winter bikini line monster and suddenly you realize, they have disposable razors and shaving creme. Are you a never nude?  Help yourself to a robe before your steam room or sauna.  So considerate and well attended. The Capital Grill will get it's own review but make no mistake, it fits and adds to the splendor of the hotel.As novel length as this review has become, let me finish with high praise for the staff.
