I visited the fitness room while I was there and was thrilled about the large size of it as well as the large selection of equipment. There were several treadmills, elliptical machines, and stationary bikes, all of which were facing a large window with a nice view. There were free weights, medicine balls, and weight lifting machines. There was also two areas with large mats for stretching/yoga, a seating area with water, towels, and earplugs, and a large locker room with showers. I peeked in at the inside pool. It was small but the fact that it is inside was a plus due to it being cold during my visit.The rooms were very clean and decorated nicely. Ours had a nice view of city as well. When you turn on the TV, it reads, welcome (whoever's name is on the reservation). My friend who was getting married was staying in the presidential suite on the floor and there was a complimentary cheese and chocolate tray with a bottle of wine delivered shortly after she arrived.Service: The hotel was EXTREMELY busy while we were there. There were several conventions and another wedding being held within the 4 days we were there; however the staff was exceptional! There was always someone around asking if we needed help, or directions or whatever. When we called for something to be brought to our room, it was there in a matter of minutes. We also ordered room service and was told that our food would take 30-45 minutes; however 20 minutes later they were knocking on the door with our food, plus other little things that we had not even asked for. Although pricy, if you have the opportunity to stay here, I highly recommend it!I stayed at the JW Marriott during the Down syndrome convention last month. We had some complications with our company's reservation, and it could have been a disaster.There were some folks that left a night early and the plan was for me and a coworker to take their room so that our company could cancel one room. After a long day at the convention, we got to the front desk at 10pm only to find out that someone forgot to add our names to the room. Obviously, for legal reasons, we couldn't get keys without permission of the cardholder- who was out having a romantic meal with her husband and unreachable. The front desk supervisor, David Munoz, was so wonderful and kind and helpful to us. He offered to take our bags and suggested we wait to hear from our boss at the bar. He even gave us a complimentary drink to enjoy while we waited. The whole mess got sorted out while we were enjoying our wine, we got into our beautiful room and had a wonderfully restful sleep. Once again, this could have been a trip-ruining event. David made us feel at ease and assured us that one way or another it would work out. And it did. He deserves a raise.A beautiful and very busy convention hotel in the heart of Indy.  Great service, ok food, good bar and very clean rooms.This is the first time I've stayed at a Marriott and been disappointed.  We came to Indianapolis to take our 5 and 7 year old to the Children's Museum (which was awesome).  We chose to stay here because it was the closest Marriott and we always choose them if possible.I realized this is a convention facility, but when I think conventions, I guess it typically think of businesses or at least adults.  However, there is a cheerleading convention here right now.My girls were really excited about swimming in the pool.  They are both still learning and hotels and vacations are really their only opportunity.  I assumed the pool would be crowded given the multitude of cheerleaders.  However (a) this was the smallest pool I think I've seen at a hotel and (b) kids are running amok in there and no one cares.The whole time we were there, which was not long, about 15-20 kids ranging in ages from probably 7-13 were running full speed, doing cannonballs, and probably worst of all doing what I guess you would call basket tosses and other types of tosses where they spin/throw the girls around the pool off their shoulders.  Several times they almost landed on my two small children and us.  The rest of the time they landed so close to us it was like a tidal wave to the face.  Then they would run full speed between the hot tub (which is supposed to be off limits to kids) and the pool screaming bloody murder about the temperature change and soaking our stuff in the process.I tried talking to one of the "cheer moms" but she ignored me and encouraged the kids to continue so she could videotape them.This is not the hotel's fault.  Where I fault them is for (a) not giving the parents clear expectations about acceptable behavior (b) not monitoring the pool when they have a convention full of children and (c) not doing anything about it when they saw it with their own eyes.I didn't even bother trying to call the hotel from the pool because an employee was in there at least 3 times and all he did was make sure the cheer people had enough towels and completely ignored their behavior.  I did call when I got back to the room but the lady that took my call seemed pretty disinterested and just said she'd notify security.  At this point our evening is already ruined and because some of the cheer moms were making snotty and hostile comments because we didn't want their children landing on us, I really don't even feel comfortable heading down to the lobby to try to go get dinner.The wife and I were in town for a few days.  When we're in town, we always opt to stay downtown at a Marriott property.  This trip, we decided to stay at the JW Marriott.  I was impressed with its entrance and main lobby, which seemed more Vegas modern than staid, conservative Naptown.  Check in was a snap.  The front desk staff was friendly and professional, with one of the associates walking us to the elevator while describing the property to us.  The elevators required a guest key to access guest room floors (a security feature I liked) and were clean and very quiet.  Actual ascent/descent of the elevators was almost imperceptible.Our room on the 22nd floor was plenty spacious, clean, and modern.  We had a nice view of White River Park to the west.  The bathroom, while not the largest and actually with a single sink and smaller vanity than I expected, had modern fixtures and a large shower with multiple heads.  Most important to me, the mattress and bedding was very comfortable.  The pillows were soft, but quite supportive (unlike the pillows found at its sister hotel, the Courtyard).  I slept well.  The JW Marriott easily has the best bed I've slept in at any Indianapolis hotel.  Sadly, the guest rooms didn't have free wifi, although it was available in the lobby.  Maid service was unseen, but our room was cleaned up daily with fresh towels.  Besides the quality of the bed, the thing that separated the JW Marriott from the competition was its fitness center.  The fitness center was clean, quite large, with the latest in fitness equipment ranging from treadmills with TVs, ellipticals trainers, and stair climbers.  There were also plenty of free weights, weight machines, as well as open space for people to throw down yoga mats (mats not provided).  It was the best hotel fitness center I've seen.The JW Marriott would've been 5 stars in my book had the guest rooms had free wifi.  I haven't stayed at the Conrad or the new Le Meridien (formerly the Canterbury), so I don't have a basis for comparison, but compared to everything else, the JW Marriott is, hands down, the nicest hotel in Indy and will be the wife and my first choice to stay the next time we're in town.Well, my experience here doesn't include a room- but comparing the staff to the Courtyard behind, is like yin and yang- wonderful and helpful people!!!!! Soooo wish I was staying over here !I dont have any house in Indianapolis anymore.. I ll stay in here just couple weeks ... Its so nice ,quiet and clean..***JW Marriott Indianapolis is a new and mostly luxurious hotel--two things that are not that common with the Marriott brand***Like JW Marriott LA LIVE, JW Marriott Indianapolis is both a JW Marriott (obviously) and a new hotel (it was built in 2011).  JW Marriott or new properties (or refreshed properties for that matter) are not that common to the Marriott brand so it is nice to be able to experience both in one hotel stay.  Marriott is a strong brand with consistently great service and a good range of prices, but it is hard for a loyal Marriott member to experience luxury and a hotel that feels new and modern.I think there will be more JW Marriotts in the future (one will launch soon in Austin).  It is a good brand that many are not familiar with.  It does not feature the traditional elegance of a Ritz-Carlton or some of the upscale modern touches of some of the high-end boutique hotels, but it is noticeably more luxurious than Marriott and Renaissance.This JW Marriott has great luxury touches throughout the hotel.  It starts with the exterior.  It has a striking and modern blue exterior that stands apart from the many longstanding buildings in Downtown Indianapolis.  It continues with check-in where the front desk warmly welcomes you into the hotel and goes over the hotel with a good personal touch (great service by Paula).  The lobby is sleek and upscale and so are the elevators.  The rooms have contemporary touches too like floor-to-ceiling windows and glass showers.There are other unique elements of this JW Marriott that sets it apart from the Marriott brand.  This property almost has a Vegas resort-like feel with the many restaurants, the availability of both valet and ample self parking, the nice and roomy fitness center with a great layout, and the different elevators to get to the low floors or the high floors.Like other Marriotts, Renaissance properties and JW Marriotts, this hotel has an Executive Lounge for Marriott Rewards Gold and Platinum members.  This lounge is open 7 days a week for breakfast as well as nightly appetizers and desserts.  The breakfast was good.  Even though the eggs were slightly soupy, they were fluffy and freshly made.  The bacon was crispy even though it lacked the thickness, chewiness and meatiness of really good bacon.  There were many items though to put together a satisfying breakfast though including a wide variety of breads, breakfast pastries and muffins (including good individual jam jars).  Fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal, and good cheese (brie and muenster among traditional offerings) were also available.Nightly appetizers were not as good.  There were beef wellington puff pastry bites (kind of dry and too much unrendered fat, which was unpleasant), dry beef sliders, and surprisingly decent mini grilled cheese sandwiches.  Like other JW Marriotts, this property featured cocktail party-style hors d'oveures including some very basic offerings like macaroni salad and tuna salad.  Cheeses were not as good as what they offered for breakfast.  There were also pita chips with hummus and tortilla chips with salsa.Desserts were okay and more high-end than Marriott and Renaissance Concierge Lounges.  There were cupcakes, chocolate chip bars, pecan tarts, chocolate dipped Rice Krispie treats, kind of fancy chocolate mousse cakes, and even slices of chocolate cake with layers of thick chocolate ganache.Rooms were nice but definitely not as nice as the JW Marriott Denver Cherry Creek.  Still, the rooms had a clean and contemporary look even if the furniture lacked that luxury feel.  The room was comfortable (good A/C unit), but the shower's water pressure was a little low.Room rates are decent here.  Depending on what is going on, you should be able to get a good room rate here on weekdays or weekends.  It might be slightly or even noticeably more expensive than nearby properties, but this hotel probably also offers advantages over other nearby hotels (especially if you are a Marriott Rewards Gold or Platinum member).JW Marriott Indianapolis is a good upscale hotel with great amenities.  It is also right next to White River State Park (where lots of events happen) and within walking distance to Lucas Oil Stadium, which makes it a good option for personal travel in Indianapolis.  It is also the kind of Marriott brand property that I wish was more common throughout the US.Both pay self and valet parking are available.  Self parking is less expensive and easy getting in and out of.Good: The rooms are pretty quiet and very well-maintained.Nice little touches throughout the place. The entire staff was helpful and genuinely friendly. Roasted chicken dinner entree was terrific. Bad: Had dinner in their expectedly expensive Osteria Pronto restaurant. Maybe we caught it on a bad night. 3 of 4 entrees were sub-par: sea bass, lamb chops & beef tenderloin. (The roasted chicken was the tasty exception.) We ended up being jealous of the table next to ours that had pizzas that looked pretty good. We should have sent back 1 bottle of the 2 suggested wines but who does that? Exceptionally slow wifi.I'm a long-time Marriott fan but overall the food should have been much better, especially when you consider the prices. For example, $17 for the not-that-special burger "special" in the sports bar?JW Marriott always lives up to mark and this one was no other. The rooms were good,service was excellent. The only reason why I gave 3 stars and not more is because the concierge lounge lacked options for vegetarians like us. For breakfast as well as snacks. We have been here for 3 days already and leave tomorrow early morning and all 3 days I checked their snacks. There are usually two things on the menu and they both are meat. Sometimes pork and beef,pork and chicken etc.Apart from that our stay was smooth,nothing else to complain about.Very nice hotel that I stayed in last week for a couple nights while in town for work. Here are a few highlights:- best gym I've ever seen in a hotel, hands down, from cardio machines to free weights. Plenty of towels and even some cold damp ones in a fridge. The view is also pretty nice if you're on the elliptical or treadmill.- rooms were spacious, bathrooms were nice and "modern" with the extra 2 shower heads in the wall. The floor to ceiling windows offer an excellent view.- service was great by any staff I encountered from the front desk to the ones in the Executive Lounge.- speaking of the Lounge, it's nice even if alcohol isn't included. Stopped by multiple times throughout the day just for water, sodas and snacks. I went by one evening for the hors d'oeuvres and it was a decent spread.- only bad thing I can speak of is the parking, it's expensive ($31 for self park, $37? for valet). I came in at a time when some event from the Indians stadium across the street was getting out and the way the deck is laid out, all the inbound traffic was deadlocked by ppl trying to pay and leave. I ended up having to circle around the wrong way down to avoid waiting for easily 30 min for things to clear up.They will not allow pizza delivery to the room, so you have to go down to the lobby in pajamas to receive your pizza order.  I complained and nobody really cared.Beautiful, clean rooms; friendly and courteous staff. Lots of lounge space with various setups (some relaxing, some tables, etc)- great space for working or meeting with friends or colleagues. Breakfast buffet was hot, tasty and a reasonable price.Stayed here for MPACT 2015.  I think our entire group received excellent service & the walkway to the Indiana Convention Center was a plus!The staff was so attentive and friendly.  The only down side was how extremely busy the front desks are as they have over 1000 rooms.  The room was clean and the bed comfy.  I wish the wifi was free with the cost of the rooms it was rather expensive so i did without.For about $400 a night, not impressed. There was nothing per se wrong with the hotel, but there was nothing special about either.  We were woke up at 9 am by the maid trying to clean the room. 11 am check out is early for a so-called luxury hotel.  Self parking was difficult as many spots were reserved for valet and the cost of $37 was high. Location is ok, but not ideal. We were told upon check in that there were free drinks on the 31st street.  We got up there and there were no alcoholic free drinks, just soft drinks. Lame. Again, at this price point, free water and Pepsi does not cut it. When I have had upgraded rooms at competing hotels, beer and wine were included during happy hour. The breakfast was weak and, yet again, was consistent with an average, $150 a night hotel, not what one should expect at Marriott's supposed top level hotel.  I would not return.I'm an events manager for a living - the JW Marriott is fantastic! I highly recommend the JW for events. Their facilities are clean, new, lovely. Catering is very good. Service is phenomenal. There is a FedEx office on site to help with all your shipping needs. I just can't say enough how impressed I am with the staff and their high standard to make sure our event went as smooth as possible:Event Facilities: 5/5Event Service: 6/5 - The red coat service went above and beyond. Thank you, thank you!Catering: 4/5Hotel room: 5/5 - Our room overlooked downtown, facing West St, simply beautiful. Rooms are clean, well laid out and full of amenities. I am getting married next year and want to book here for sure!Hotel service: 5/5 - Room service and housekeeping were top notch. All of the hotel staff are super attentive.Valet: 5/5 - Easy to use and very helpful.We stopped here on a roadtrip at 100 am hoping to catch a good nights rest before heading back on the road the next morning. There are certain things you expect from a hotel such as competent service, working facilities, and normal smelling rooms. We checked in and the shower wasn't draining in the first room.  We called 2x and explained that whatever quick fix the person was trying to tell us to do wasnt the problem and we wanted to switch rooms bc we wanted to sleep asap and get an early start. The lady insisted we were just doing something incorrectly and complying w our request continued to waste more time and called an engineer. The engineer upon seeing it immediately understood it was indeed a draining issue as we had tried to explain to the person on the phone and we would need to switch rooms. Our second room had a very odd odor, stains on the carpet and floor, and a barely made bed. At this point we were exhausted so we made the decision to stay here called down let them know about the room and the person on the phone couldve cared less. Horrible customer service. For what its worth the initial guy at the front desk that checked us in was really nice but the management above him and whatever customer service lady spoke to us did not care. I edited the review with one extra star purely for the breakfast buffet. It was pretty good and put us in better spirits after checking out.This place is amazing.  The rooms are super nice and very clean. The fitness center is spot on!  And the food!! OMG!!  Please please please try the brick chicken!!  Thigh and leg in a Mole sauce over potatoes, asparagus, artichoke hearts and roasted red peppers from the BAR???!!!!!! Yes! My new number 1!!!Arranged a meeting room rental here through the hotel for a business meeting. They have no problem hosing you NYC style (Yes Sheraton NY...that means you) for food and beverage even though it's Indy. $600 for coffee and tea for 6 people. This is in addition to the room charge. We should have each had our own personal waiter pouring the sodas. We paid for an internet connect- it was wi-fi. No AV in the room. Would have cost another outrageous amount.  Other than that the room was nice. Staff is helpful and professional. All else- completely absurd.
review_content_40: I have been staying at the JW Marriott since the hotel was built. Over the last couple of years I have probably stayed over 50 nights at this location. I have never had such an non welcoming experience as I have the last 2 nights in concierge lounge. They literally start closing down at 9 while guests are still trying to enjoy the lounge. Food is picked over and not replenished, no coffee or hot water - it had been put away. When a colleague joked that it wasn't like this when Laura ran things. Savanna said "then maybe you should leave." Then Kyle starts passively aggressively giving us a count down on when they were closing and at exactly 10 he shut off all the lights and said "we are closed". We were headed to the exits prior to Kyle kicking us out. So rude! I called him out on it and he was simply indignant. Either these 2 aren't cut out for the service industry or this hotel has jumped the shark.Though top notch service is demanded at a JW, I was thoroughly impressed with the property, service, and staff. I only had two complaints. One was the noise level as there was an outdoor concert until 11pm. The other was the below average bartender at velocity during lunch. Nothing terrible, but lacked enthusiasm and desire to give good service. Obviously the concert wasn't the hotel's fault. The bartender issue wasn't worth dropping the rating a star. Overall, the GM of the hotel seems as though he/she has it together. Thanks to all the staff for a nice stay.This has been a great stay at the JW. I have stayed at several JW's and this with the convention center attached has been nice. From the front desk checking me in to walking me to elevator, room service, and area restaurants, this was a great selection. The Marriott selection in the area is vast. There are other properties in the general area. I would recommend this location and recommend highly.  Enjoy.I travel for business often, and have stayed in this hotel 2 or 3 weeks in the past couple months. I left a glowing review on trip advisor, but since they don't let you post another review on the same place for 3 months and you can't edit your original review, I'll review here. Overall, it's a great place to stay. I have had NO issues during previous stays. This week.... was not the hotel's best week. First off, they had two conferences in town and were operating at max capacity. That means people EVERYWHERE. Even the Concierge Lounge, normally quieter, roomy, and a good place to work was full and rowdy in the mornings and evenings.But the reason that I am writing a second review is because of the housekeeping services. Earlier in the week I was in my room working (because the lounge was full), and someone starts knocking on my door. I yell "No thanks," because whatever it is, I didn't request it, but the person knocks again. I yell "No thanks" louder, but at this point the person inserted their key card and started to open the door. I said "Can I help you?" and at this point the person apologized and closed the door. This was in the evening, so maybe turndown service? The second housekeeping incident happened this morning. I have to get up early every day for work. Friday being my travel day, I can sleep in a little (until 9). At around 8:30 housekeeping is knocking at my door. Again with the yelling saying "No Thanks," again with the knocking anyway. Listen, I can hear everything that goes on in that hallway - don't try to tell me you can't hear me yell "No Thanks." Luckily this time I had the door dead bolted. Yes, "Do Not Disturb" signs would have helped in both of these cases, but in all honesty - who expects to get woken up by housekeeping before 9am!?The four stars I gave this hotel may seem confusing in light of the issues I had above, so I will copy and paste my trip advisor review below for context:(3 weeks ago)I am currently staying at the JW Marriott on a week long business trip, and even though I still have one day left on the trip I wanted to make sure and write this review before I forgot. This hotel embodies excellence. When I walked in the door to check in, an employee walked up to me, greeted me, took my bags and walked me to the concierge desk where he proceeded to check me in. He was possibly the most excited concierge I've ever seen to have me stay at their hotel. He then took my bags and walked me to the elevator. Who does that!?Being a Gold Rewards member, I get free access to the Executive Lounge on the 31st floor. I have nothing at all negative or neutral to say about the lounge: The layout is great, the free food is fantastic, the honor bar is always well stocked, the coffee is fresh. Breakfast is consistently amazing. The king bed and pillows are among the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on in a hotel - you just sink into them. It makes it really hard to get up! I'm not kidding - I usually wake up several times a night at home to use the bathroom or toss and turn, but here I don't wake up at all until my alarm goes off. My wife hates traveling with me because she says I'm never satisfied and always find something to "complain about." In my defense, I tend to notice little things that could be better and comment on them. In no way do these take away from the amazing ness of the hotel, it's just how my brain works. Here are a couple things I've noticed:The water tastes like well water, which was a surprise and a negative at first - but then I noticed the free bottles of water they have set out in the room. I drank both bottles the first night, and room service replaced them the next day along with two more bottles - one on the bathroom sink and one next to the bed. This is great attention to detail. I feel like they are acknowledging the bad tasting water and are actively doing something to mitigate it. There was not a fridge in my room. This **maybe** gets close to being a negative, but everything else is so spectacular that the absence of a fridge just makes me go "huh?" I feel like even budget hotels have a fridge in the room. The first night I ordered a large pizza, thinking that I could just put the leftovers in the fridge (assuming I had a fridge). Turns out I didn't have a fridge. Oh well, small price to pay for such an amazing place to stay! If I could give one suggestion though, it would be to put mini fridges in the rooms. That's literally the only thing that could make this place better. Oh, and I ate dinner at the Italian restaurant in the lobby one night. It was pricey - $60ish for an entree, two glasses of ($7) wine and tip - but it's in the lobby of the JW and I had no complaints about the quality of food or drink.Stayed January 2015, traveled on businessI stayed at the JW Marriott for a traditional foods conference. It's the kind of event that is challenging for any hosting facility, as the organization involved does not simply select menus from the regularly available event menus. Instead, food starts arriving a week or so in advance of the conference (thus requiring appropriate storage be available - ever asked a venue to clear a walk-in for you?) and a chef comes in to direct the kitchen staff in traditional foods preparations methods. There have been issues at past venues for this event; the Indianapolis Marriott did a great job. One of the best I've seen.Now, on to the hotel stuff. I was in a regular room on the 9th floor. My room was pretty close to the elevators and I could hear them whooshing and dinging. It wasn't super-loud, though, and it didn't keep me awake. The room was clean and everything seemed to be in good repair. The linens were above-average for hotel linens (especially the towels, which were both large and soft). The water pressure in the bath was not great; the hot water was hot enough to poach me when I wasn't careful.At first the tub didn't drain particularly well (probably hair in the drain - they never know to fix it if someone doesn't tell them); a maintenance person was sent up promptly to service it. And they left a chocolate-popcorn treat with a "sorry there was a problem" note. That was totally unexpected and unnecessary.The friend I split the room with said the hotel exercise room was one of the better ones she's used. The pool is small but clean and nice. All ice is found in an "ice room" near the elevators on the 2nd floor, which puzzled me at first.The hotel staff is excellent. Every one that I encountered was helpful and friendly. I would happily stay there again.Stayed here during Gencon 2015. At first they changed my 2 Queen room to a King with a cot, then after I got that fixed their housecleaning staff threw away a bag of purchases I had from Gencon worth about $200 and they offered no compensation. In addition I feel like if they would have just searched their recycling, they could have probably found it, but while the staff were very polite the stock answer they kept giving me was that they were "following protocol" instead of telling me what they were actually doing.My wife and I were able to get the JW for Gen Con 2015.  First the good:  it's really swanky.  Great staff all around, parking that was really convenient, and our room was great.  Best views of the city too.  The bad:  no free breakfast or wifi, and everything was expensive.  Like being nickled and dimed, only with tens and twenties.  Pool was small but no big deal.  All in all, we'd stay again because of the convenience and the staff, but we'd have to steel ourselves for the bill.Wonderful property, however the poor customer service during our most recent stay may cause me to book the Westin or Conrad the next time I'm in Indianapolis. I called prior to our arrival and asked if it was possible to have a rollaway in our room when we arrived--as we were getting in at midnight--and was told it was not a problem.  Unfortunately, this did not happen and it took over an hour to have one delivered--then we had to wait another 30+ minutes for a pillow and blanket!  The icing on the cake was when housekeeping knocked at the door at 8 am--repeatedly!  Not a good night.I stayed at the hotel for an event recently and was blown away by the customer service that the staff at the JW provided. The best part - all 1,200 people at the event walked away feeling like they were superstars because of the staff at the hotel, not just me!My room was on the 24th floor overlooking the White River State Park, and it was perfect. It was much bigger than I expected (although the bathroom was a little cramped) and very comfortable. The temperature of the room was a little warm for me. I like to sleep in a freezing cold room, and the lowest I could go on the thermostat was 65, and there was no fan override. Not a huge issue, but I still would have liked it a tad cooler in the room. I know I know, 65 IS cold, but still..Once I got home I realized I left a garment bag in the room. I called the hotel and was directed to the loss prevention department, who sent someone up to the room and pulled my garment bag AND a sweater I forgot. They called me back within 10 minutes and had the items waiting for me when I got back to pick them up. Again, super fast, efficient and friendly service.Stayed here for a conference in March.  They have what's called a Skywalk, so you can walk through an above-ground walkway directly to the Convention Center without having to go outside (in case of bad weather)!  The hotel was pretty upscale, esp for someone like me who usu won't stay anywhere nice due to funds, but work was paying for this!  I didn't try any of the food in the hotel, but there was an Italian restaurant as well as a Sports Bar restaurant.  My room was not huge but it was nicely decorated.  I was able to request both a microwave and small fridge be brought to my room.  The fridge would not fit where it was supposed to, so I had to leave it sticking out and blocking part of the hallway.A negative was that the drain plug to my faucet didn't work - it kept popping up when I wanted to close it.  Also, I stayed there 6 nights and only requested the housekeeper clean for two of those days.   I was not given any new amenities (shampoo, etc) during her second cleaning stint, even tho I had removed them earlier!  I have NEVER had that happen.  I couldn't believe this  hotel was too cheap to give me another set of shampoo/conditioner/soap after paying over $200  night w/ taxes.  In addition, there is no free wifi except in the lobby or second floor.  Otherwise, it was $14.95 for 24 hours.  Sometimes I had trouble logging in, too, and had to do it several times.  I think parking costs an arm and a leg, too, but I cabbed it over.  On Level 2, there's a Starbucks (huge line in the mornings) and several ice machines.  Overall, my stay could have been better but the place was clean and beds were comfortable.Shout out to Nayim for going above and beyond to see that we were taken care of!  (From 8/8/14 - sorry so late with my thanks!)  Awesome stay again!!I find a room online last minute. Good deal. But how'd I know some !!# would get messed up. Called ahead made sure we could check in early. Was assured we could. When we arrived the girl (yes girl) at the counter told me they were booked. I politely told her we had a reservation. She went to the back and returned saying they're getting our room together. She said my card would be charged  $20 for incidentals. Then it'd be refunded if no incidents happened.  Ummm ok. I get to the room exhausted at 4 a.m. look at my bank account and I was charged twice by the hotel for the entire room cost!!! Wtf! I call down and they admit fault and that at least one charge will be refunded. But it'll take some days. Wtf! I took a chance on booking this hotel last minute and this is what I get... wth! I am very unhappy and dissatisfied with the lack professionalism of the staff. Their mistake was costly to me and my family. The rooms ok. Desk staff incompetent. If you don't mind a hassle then by all means. I on the other hand can't stand a hassle especially when I drove 20 hours and all I wanna do is relax and not deal with BS. Won't be staying here again. Will update when issue is addressed.The JW Marriott in downtown Indianapolis is absolutely beautiful with some of the best views of the city. The hotel has anything you could ask for from restaurants to the High Velocity Sports Bar to Starbucks. A few friends and I stayed here for a Bachelorette Party and its location in the city made it easy to walk to and from dinner without having to go outside in the snowy weather we had and is pretty centrally located. Although the room was not quite ready at 3:00PM when we checked and there was no fridge in the room, these were minor things compared to the excellence of this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and made sure to assist their guests with any inquiries. The rooms were beautiful with comfortable beds and large bathrooms. I would definitely recommend this hotel not only for its amazing view of Indy, but for the excellent service they offer to all of their guests.The worst experience I've ever had. A beautiful hotel in a great location.  All ruined by an incompetent and unprofessional staff. I have stayed at Marriott properties all over the world and have never had an experience like this... it's a shame because I had high expectations due to my other JW experiences..Love the JW Marriott Indianapolis.  This hotel is a great place to forget about things for a few days and enjoy the treats here at the hotel.  Some local people might not think to stay downtown but it's so much easier than day trips.The JW has two great places downstairs to get drinks or if you are Marriott Elite you can maybe score access to the Executive Lounge on the 31st floor, with great views of the city and pretty reasonable drink prices with excellent and personal service.The Osteria Pronto restaurant was fantastic (I'll review that later) and you can get adjoining rooms for a larger group (like you saw in Modern Family).  The rooms are large and comfortable, especially the towels and bedding.  Be sure to bring your HDMI cable because you can stream movies from your PC to the TV in the room.Just a couple of other things.  Prices - you cannot find this quality hotel for these prices anywhere.  You can see I travel a lot and Indy is definitely a bargain.  Parking's not cheap but it's almost double in Chicago.Trendy, staff is high quality, restaurants, good choice new ideas, drinks top notch. Rooms are great, they really do need to vacuum under the beds. When sitting in bed working on my laptop I could see a full rug of dust bunnies under the other bed, yes checked my bed and same thing. It had obviously been a long time since the vacuum had been fully under the bed. The room otherwise was clean and had everything one could need.This is an outstanding place to stay when in town! The rooms are large and very clean with great views. The Italian place downstairs is a three-star place to eat, but the Velocity Sports Bar has surprisingly yummy food! Regardless, if you don't want to eat in the hotel there's lots to go out for close.**This review is following an event at the JW - - not an overnight stay.Space: Beautiful! Great views of Victory Field, Lucas Oil Stadium - I'm certain the rooms towering over Downtown have excellent views as well...I'm a sucker for a view. The event I was attending had an estimated 300-400 attendees. We started the evening out with a silent auction in the hallway of the third floor before entering into the ballroom for dinner and dancing. JW's staff was very friendly and kept the room swirling with wine and hors d' oeuvres. I can't speak for the appetizers because the only one I came into contact had salmon (seafood allergy=boo). However it looked appetizing = smoked salmon wrapped around a sprig of asparagus and (cream cheese?). The ballroom area was very sexy - purple/blue lights, a perfect-sized dance floor and intimate round tables centered with a large votive candle tower. I give the atmosphere a strong 4 stars. The service 5. The food: 3. I can only imagine how much was being paid per plate for this meal, so I was a tad surprised that the meal was dry stuffed chicken on-bone, a carrot with a few green beans and sorbet rimmed with chocolate and rainbow sprinkles (interesting choice?). The highlight of the meal would have to be the salad with nuts, bleu cheese and endives. I was still hungry after the meal. I know I have a reputation for putting it down, so I was reassured when my tablemates were also still hungry after dessert.Came here for a Beck's Hybrid conference and the staff was very kind and well versed. We were given the option to use a phone in our conference room in order to meet any needs that we may have had. In several instances they promptly supplied us with the amenities needed. Even something as simple as an extension cord they supplied us with one. Great experience and we will all be back next year.The JW Marriott has a superb location and, as a newer hotel, is very modern. The good: Very nice, modern, clean hotel. Everything's shiny and new, as well it should be since the hotel is only something like 5 years old. The staff - really nice, very helpful, going out of their way to help. Walking guests to the elevator is a bit much perhaps, but great to see that effort.The rooms are large, great views, all of the creature comforts of home. Good TVs, plenty of channels, good beds, nice bathrooms. That's all you need.The bad:None really.The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that I was somehow booked in a hospitality suite - not the full room, just the adjoining suite. But there's no bed, it's a Murphy Bed (folds out of cabinet) which I had to do myself. I get that the hotel's busy sometimes, but at least set up the room for the guest to sleep in the room. Overall, very happy, would definitely stay there again.
review_content_60: I love the JW.  It's me and the hubs "go to" staycation hotel.  I mean, there are plenty of inexpensive options but we really enjoy the ease that JW offers within the city. Soooo easy to grab a cab, park the car, valet is my fave and the elevators are fast.  Rooms and views are consistently clean, comfortable and nice.  There are no bathtubs which bums me out but we love the executive level bar area and perks that come with high level Marriott status.  We always get treats and upgrades, so it makes the entire experience just a little upgraded.  I love nice hotels and this one doesn't disappoint.I've stayed in lots of 5 star hotels all over the country, and yet I can say with no hesitation, the JW Marriott Indianapolis is one of my absolute favorite places to stay because although it's technically listed as a 4 star hotel, it has better service than 99.9% of the 5 stars I've stayed at.Now before youo get the wrong idea, it's not like the service is the only place where this hotel shines.  Let me tell you now that the JW in Indy is a downright beautiful hotel. I mean truly gorgeous.  The decor is as tasteful, upscale and sophisticated as you'll find, contemporary without being too showy, but also not boring and conservative.  And the food....  the Italian restaurant inside has some of the best food my wife and I have ever tested, and the High Velocity sports bar/restaurant is everything a sports enthusiast could ever want.The rooms are beautifully appointed.  If you get a chance, get a two wall of windows suite or corner room with a view.  Looking out over the Indianapolis skyline at Lucas Oil Stadium, Bankers Life Fieldhouse, the canal, The Eiteljorg and the NCAA headquarters is actually quite striking.  Also, the executive lounge is worth it.  Not only is it a beautiful, ultra comfortable area, but the free drinks in the evening and especially the free breakfast is delicious.But again... the service is where The JW Marriott Indianapolis sets itself apart.  I have never experienced a hotel where all the employees from the valet, to the bellhop and everyone in between, are soooo genuinely nice and concerned with giving you the best experience possible.  Wifey and I have been many times and they are consistently amazing.  The last time I stayed there I had (for the very first time) a slightly unsatisfactory experience with one of the women who checked me in at the front desk.  The customer service manager went well beyond what was expected and bent over backwards to make things right for me, even including a free glass of premium wine of my choice every evening I was in the hotel.If you're staying in Indianapolis downtown, make sure you book at the JW Marriott first.  You will NOT be disappointed.  It's total experience blows some of the more expensive hotels around it out of the water.Every time I stay at the JW Marriott Indianapolis it feels like home! Always welcoming from the moment you step foot in the door. High quality service from this luxury brand hotel is top notch. I highly recommend staying here.For a JW Marriott I wasn't that impressed like I am at so many others. The service was phenomenal the room was okay nice view kind of a little walk to the circle downtown. Looked beautiful on the outside but the inside Decour was just okay I would recommend staying here next time you're in IndyDoesn't get much better than this. Vegas style hotel in indy. I think I am going to have to look for more jws when I travel. Incredible rooms, great beds, outstanding 24 hr gym and a great bar/ lobby. Really could not be better. Friendly staff and a beautiful facility. Great restaurant choices within walking distance or in the hotel.Friendly staff. Can't go 5 feet without someone asking how they can help. Breakfast buffet is amazing with the omlet station and waffles station. Nice gym equipment in gym, clean rooms, prompt service and no smoking in any of the building. Gave it 4 stars Because we came back from dinner and were told we HAD to valet our car because the garage is full. How does a hotel garage fill and not have enough room for registered guests? When I said something about it he was quick to ask someone on his radio a question, then said he would valet it at the self park rate.I spent seven days at JW for the International Vet Emergency and Critical Care Society  (IVECCS) conference and just got back today. I had such a great time at the conference and that was directly related the the fantastic service I experienced from each and every individual employee working at the hotel.The five stars were well earned!When we arrived in a group of three with several luggage, they promptly opened an additional counter to aid in the check-in process. At check in they also allowed me the option to select my preference of x-ray key cards inspired by IVECCS. They assisted us with our luggage and showed us where and which elevator to take. The first night, I phoned the front desk to ask for assistance in requesting room service to be delivered shortly after I return to my room after my yoga class the following morning. The whole thing was seamlessly executed.  The delicious hot food was delivered on time, exactly as ordered with a coffee pot that kept the coffee hot to the perfect temperature for hours!The front desk assisted me in locating a yoga studio, the hotel bar and High Velocity were all staffed with friendly and courteous employees. They helped us when my friend fell on the escalator and gave us band-aids. There was so much more I cannot include here in it's completeness. I felt so strongly about the positive experience that I wanted to share it with the hotel. I wrote just a brief note that it was a great experience and each staff I encountered contributed to that. In the note I also included two items that had room for improvement. One was the key card access in the elevators were tedious, and difficult to manage when our hands are full or when the elevator was crowded. The other was that I felt the in room wifi was too expensive and should be included with the room, especially since I am here for a conference. Less than 5 minutes after I dropped off the notes, while I was still in the lobby, my phone rang. It was the JW manager (I don't recall the name), who phoned to thank me for bringing the feedback to the lobby. She also credited the charge to my room for the wifi. It was impressive that they responded so quickly and positively and ensured that I had the most positive experience possible. Now, next year, our conference will be at Gaylord National Resort and Convention Center in DC. I will be looking forward to it!Beautiful hotel, gorgeous lobby. Our room was on the 32nd floor and while not large was adequate. We had a gorgeous view of the white river state park and the zoo. The bathrooms just have a shower, but it's large. The beds comfortable. Their executive lounge was very nice. The ladies who run the happy hour at night are wonderful! I'd have given the JW five stars, if they had treated us,as members of their elite program, better. The hotel was 1/3 empty, yet we were not upgraded to a suite. The elite program is not what it used to be, except at the marriott renaissance properties. Still I would return to the JW as I believe it's the best marriott downtown.Huge. Nice.  One of the nicest hotels I've been in.  Went to a conference here and walked away very impressed with the service and amenities.Hmm...this is puzzling. I guess I'm in line with what Yelp describes as a three-star experience ("A-OK"). We were gifted a one-night stay with a romance package. This was a fun weekend, and even though we live in Indy, a staycation is always a nice way to jazz things up. I guess my feelings are that while it was a perfectly nice hotel, I really just expected more. From bad to good, because I like to end on a positive note:Cons:-No WiFi in the rooms. I've read several responses to other Yelp reviews that indicate that the fee-for-WiFi situation is a Marriott-wide policy. I understand it's a company policy, but I think it's unacceptable. For a few hundred bucks per night, this is non-negotiable. I have stayed in cheaper hotels (or coffee shops) that offer this service. THIS ALONE is enough for me to NEVER recommend this hotel to a friend or family member coming in town. I don't mean to sound so begrudging, but I hope this is loud and clear, JW--I seriously would never suggest this location to anyone because of this issue. I think it's worth figuring something out.-Though we didn't need it for our one night, I thought it was strange that there was no refrigerator in the room. The walkability to restaurants lends itself to visitors having leftovers, and for people who may be staying for a few days (convention guests, etc.), it seems like a fridge would be a must.Meh:-The "romance package" didn't seem very geared toward two people. There was only one robe in the room (which my husband let me have, thanks dear!). Part of the deal was champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, but there were only 4 strawberries. Maybe we're just big eaters?-Part of the romance package was being booked on a "high floor room". We were on floor 23, which was the lowest floor in the "high floor" elevator bank (23-33). I get that it's technically a higher floor, but it didn't really seem to be in the spirit of what was promised (and we weren't visiting on a particularly busy weekend).-I would've expected name-brand toiletries, but not a huge deal.Pros:-Great location, which enabled us to walk to a bar and restaurant during the evening-Very friendly staff who for the most part seemed genuinely happy to be doing their jobs. I saw a family checking in, and there was a staff member with a mini treasure chest offering some cool toys to the kids :)-Cool shower with side jets! Can I get one of these for my house?-Delicious breakfast buffet, which we got as part of our special package. My omelet was really fabulous.-Really nicely decorated, and you can tell that the hotel is still new and fresh even after a few years.-Love to see that JW management is active on Yelp responding to customer reviews (positive and negative). I like businesses that are hip to social media!Overall, the experience was just fine. I doubt I would come back, but that's OK. My bottom line would be that for the price, I would just expect more.Awful -- check in is at 2:30 and we arrive at 4:15. They do not have a room ready for us. Therefore they give us vouchers to Starbucks upstairs. We head up there and it is closed! The bar has a 3 hr wait. Now there was a big turnaround on cleaning as it is a colts game weekend but don't you think they should have planned for this! Frustrated.A good night's sleep - that's why you usually want a hotel room. The JW does not offer that. You also want the room clean, modern, and functional. The JW has some of that.Many reviewers offer 5-star reviews because of the JW's proximity to nearby restaurants or the skybridge to neighboring buildings. Other Indianapolis downtown hotels share these identical amenities, including the other Marriott hotels that reside in the cluster alongside the JW. So I'm going to rate my experience in the hotel room itself, instead of its proximity to Victory Field, Zoo, Eiteljorg Museum, St. Elmo's, stadium, restaurants, etc.1. The thermostat uses a motion detector. I awoke in the middle of the night, wet with sweat, because the air conditioning kept disabling. I had to change beds to be closer to the thermostat to keep it working. Through the discomfort of the heat, changing beds, and wide temperature swings, I didn't sleep well.2. The thermostat does not have a fan "on/off/auto" setting.  I usually turn the thermostat fan to "on" to maintain air circulation (prevents room from feeling stale) and create some white noise. Instead, the JW room air got still and stale between the air conditioning cycling. So I was constantly throwing covers off, only to pull them back up. This compounded  the sleep disturbance.3. Although the glass facade is very fancy, the room was very noisy. The thermal expansion and contraction of the glass facade loudly popped, creaked, cracked, and groaned all night. This compounded  the sleep disturbance. Having a thermostat "fan on" switch would have been useful to create some background white noise to cover the building's creaks and groans.4. Although the curvature of the building creates an architectural interest, the curvature also serves as an acoustical lens. On the 17th floor, I could clearly make out conversations of pedestrians on the street below. This also meant every motorcycle, truck, and car enthusiast sounded like they were in the room with me. This compounded  the sleep disturbance. I slept with earplugs, an honor I usually reserve for many of the Chinese hotels I commonly stay.5. Room service knocked on my door at 8:00AM on SUNDAY MORNING. I was still trying to recoup a little bit of sleep. That was the last straw. This place does NOT offer a comfortable stay. This was the only problem with staff. Why send the staff to wake up hotel guests on weekend mornings?The nearby (connected) Springhill Suites, Courtyard, or Fairfield are imminently more comfortable. I've stayed at all three. Within the gigantic Marriott cluster on Washington Street, the JW is the least comfortable choice.6. Our stay was to celebrate our anniversary. We paid extra for a corner room, but was surprised to have two small beds instead of a single king bed. Due to the thermostat issue (above), I switched beds in the middle of the night. On our anniversary! We slept in separate beds! However, neither one of us really slept well. Not really how we wanted to remember things.7. Internet service costs $14.95/day, whereas it is free elsewhere in the hotel cluster. This is silly to not offer internet service, even for a "full-service" hotel.8. As a "full-service" hotel, it is lacking an in-room refrigerator ... or even a mini-bar.9. There are TONS of staff everywhere, but they can't help with inherent deficiencies of the JW. The problem is not with management, it's just a poorly equipped and bad building.If your goal is status and panache, then the JW is your best choice. There are glamorous German and Italian cars parked on the entry drive. But expect frustrations. If your goal is getting a good night's sleep in Indianapolis downtown, with an exceptionally functional room and equally friendly staff, perhaps choose the Springhill Suites or Courtyard. You can still access the same restaurants and skywalk (to the Convention Center and Circle Center Mall) from anywhere in the Marriott cluster.I'm in town a lot. I enjoy the perks of being platinum elite.  The concierge lounge is awesome,with great service. I brought my family and they treated my boys like royalty in the lounge.   The valet department could use some help. They are way overwhelmed and it takes forever to get your car and one guy who completely hates his job...so I started self parking because the it in the morning can take forever, even if you call ahead. Love the comfy beds, and multiple jets in the shower. Rooms are always clean and the gym is one of the best I've seen in any chain, and I travel a lot! Always stay here when I'm in town, but find its getting more popular, so harder to get a room!  Osteria has an awesome buffet with made to order omelets, and the sports bar has good apps great service. Overall, love this place. I prefer it to any hotel downtown.I love this place.  And I don't hand out five-stars often.First, the location is stelar.  Walk to good restaurants and pubs.  Go running along the canal, museums, and zoo.  (I did and loved it.)It's fresh and well furnished.  Even their standard room made me feel like a bit of a rock-star.  Quite swanky for my business travel.The Elite Lounge (or whatever Marriott calls their Gold-Elite lounge on the 31st floor) is great, with a killer view and some upscale snacks.I'm so terribly disappointed in what I just encountered as my colleague and I attempted to check in with our reservations.  We were told that the hotel has overbooked itself and we're being sent 20 mins back toward the airport.  It's after midnight and we have to be downtown early in the morning which is why we booked the hotel we did.  I travel extensively for work and pleasure and have never encountered anything like this.  They also didn't offer sort of restitution for the horrible inconvenience.  I won't be booking with Marriott for a while.It's a nice place. But a non-smoking hotel should mean non-smoking. I shouldn't have to smell it in the elevator to the parking garage, and then smell it in the parking garage. Service for dinner was adiquate, but take offense when half the table is offered coffee, and the other half isnt. Then we can't get iced tea or refills on our water! I'm not paying $7 for a bottled water or $5 for a can of soda!!. Waiting for elevators is a cluster. For the price, go somewhere elseRooms are okay. You can get a very nice view on fairly any side of the hotel. Food is typical of a hotel, nothing special. High priced as any other hotel. Decent location. The lobby bar is a little small and tight to maneuver and is somewhat slow in service. The main bar has a decent beer selection and mostly a very nice staff, but the service can be a bit slow at times and not due to the number of customers. VERY IMPORTANT............IF YOU ARE THERE FOR AN EVENT OR EVEN A PROVIDER OF AN EVENT OF ANY KIND... BE AWARE THAT THIS PROPERTY IS EXTREMELY HIGH IN THEFT. Apparently, the management does not care to control their staff and does not care if someone that is bringing thousands of dollars to their facility is repeatedly the victim of theft. The last four visits to this property has left my company filling out theft paperwork. After traveling the country extensively, this is the only property where I have had pricey items walk away. It's clear that the Marriott management could care less. Security? Cameras? That's a joke. This place needs a sting operation set up to bring down the thieving scum.Great property and in line with the JW Marriott reputation.This flagship property is connected to the convention center, right next to the minor league ball field, and overlooks the river and NCAA museum. The staff has always taken care of my needs and were great in providing breakfast coupons when I couldn't access the lounge due to early departure times for military duty.The only item that cost the fifth star is that to get to the Friday's in the Courtyard Marriott, you have to walk through a parking garage. I'm sure this was something that came later in the design phase, but it is annoying to have to go down to the basement, walk through the parking structure, and then go up the elevator in the Courtyard Marriott just to eat. But hey, we can't all be perfect, right?Great facility. Horrible service. Overcharged. Had to wait two hours to get in my room after check in time. Room was fairly clean, but overall it was not my favorite experience.Came in town for a business meeting and my boss wanted to stay here. Upscale atmosphere, friendly front desk personnel, I'm thinking this is going to be a nice stay. Upon check in I noticed that parking is $31.00 per day. First sense of outrageous. Get in my room, unpack and start my routine of ironing all of my clothes for the week, but the iron is missing. Call the front desk and they said they would send one right up. 30 minutes later, still no iron so I call back. They apologized and again said they would get one to me, which happened about 10 minutes later. Not a big deal, but worth mentioning. Next I get my computer set up and find that WiFi access is 14.95 per day. Second sense of outrageous.  Especially since the 2 other hotels connected to this one offer free access. (Oh yes, their parking rates are $23.00 per day, which is still high, but all 3 use the same underground parking garage! Couldn't figure that one out)The next morning (and for the rest of the stay) I had to let the hot water run for about 10 minutes before I got any hot water. Third sense of outrageous.  While taking a shower, the tub didn't drain normal so I ended up standing in a few inches of water. Told the front desk as I was leaving about it. The clerk wrote it down,  apologized and asked if I wanted to move rooms. I said that wouldn't be necessary but did ask that they send someone up with some draino or something. Said okay and gave me a Starbucks gift card for the trouble. Thought it might be getting better.Next morning, same issue with the drain but didn't have time to tell the front desk again since I was running a little late. Just hoped that they didn't get a chance to get to it the day before but would that day.Got up this morning to leave and, yep, had to take a shower/bath again.  Was going to tell the front desk about it as I left so that the next person they put in that room wouldn't have to deal with it, but the desk was empty. Yes, it was 5:30, but the desk should be manned 24/7.Bottom line, there are many hotels in the downtown area to choose from. I recommend looking at those before this one. I won't stay here on future trips to Indy. The rooms are good, but not overly so. The amenities are the same as any other hotel. My opinion, not nearly enough bang for the bucks spent.
review_content_80: This is a new hotel (built for the 2012 Super Bowl) and it has all the bells and whistles.  It was easy to find (but did require a legal(?) u-turn to get into the drop off, the staff and service were impeccable, rooms were great (check out the shower and robes!)  the fitness center is top notch, and the restaurant in the place was stellar.  Excellent experience; I look forward to being back.Very nice high end Marriott Hotel.  It is pricey but worth it.  Check out the deals on their website, we got a Labor Day special that included, breakfast, and parking for $199,Both side of the hotel have great views.  If you are a Gold Marriott or higher member, you get additional perks that make it so much better.The only down side was that everyone and their child, stroller, teenager, grandmother with a Gold Card was in the private lounge and it was a bit of circus.The staff was very nice.Came here for a breakfast meeting at Circle City Bar & Grille  (not an overnight stay)Great selection of food, plus a chef doing omelets at the very far end of the dining room.I got some friends a room at the JW for the night as a gift the night of their wedding.  The only request I made of the front desk was that the bride and groom would not have to worry about any expenses.  2 of us separately went down and gave credit cards to the front desk to make sure everything was taken care of.  I got a phone call at 11:30 that night from the bride and groom saying that they were being asked to pay for parking.  Huge fail JW.  When I asked to talk to the manager, all he did was make excuses.  No apologies, no reassurance that they would be well taken care of for the rest of their stay.  If you want a seamless stay, this is not the place.  Huge disappointment.I love the JW Indianapolis.  All the things you would expect from the brand.  The rooms are not cramped because this wasn't rehabbed or retro fitted to be a hotel.  This was built for the Super Bowl and therefore we know that Americans, especially football fans, need a little more room than the rest of us.  Well done.  The gem of this facility is the restaurant that I can't remember the name of.  It's located in the lobby on the right side of the registration area.  The breakfast was EXCELLENT and the service was even better.  I wish I could remember the name of the server.  She was exceptional and made my JW Indy experience a great one.  She deserves to be recognized and I failed at her name.  Putz!  Anyhow, I hope that the service remains impeccable there.  This facility is my go-to for a hotel in downtown Indy.  Terrific.The JW is a great addition to downtown Indy and I enjoy staying here.  Check-in/out is easy, service is excellent.  Always made to feel like a valued guest.  Rooms are clean and comfortable.  I have requested a king bed every time I visit but have always received 2 doubles, not preferred for a solo business traveler.  Parking at $30/night (self park) is outrageous but I keep coming here for the classy facility, fabulous fitness center, and amazing breakfast (made to order waffles and omelettes!)My company party was hosted here and everything was perfect.The food was awesome and there was tons of it: sushi (yummm), potato and pea samosas, popcorn, pretzels with cheese, mini crab cakes, mini corn dogs, and tons more.  Dinner was fantastic even though I was only able to eat a few bites after being stuffed from hor d'oeuvres.  I had beef with asparagus, carrots, fingerling potatoes, and a puree of some kind.The service was wonderful.  Plates were all of a sudden cleared.  Some of the staff had their faces painted to match the circus theme was was really cool.Everyone had a great time.  I'd highly recommend hosting your event here!Pros:-The hotel is in an excellent location. It is within walking distance to many bars, restaurants, and activities.-The hotel is well maintained and is on the newer side. It is only ~3 years old. - The concierge lounge is open every day serving breakfast, h'orderves , and sweetsCons: -The pool is on the small side. The photo makes it look much larger than it actually is.-JW classification- as a person who travels and stays on average 160+ nights a year in a hotel, 120+ in Marriott's in a variation of their different brands, I feel that it would fit better into the Marriott Hotel flagship brand.I stayed here two nights for a corporate meeting (at the onsite conference center). All in all, I had a perfect visit: very friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and an overall high satisfaction will all amenities.The lobby Bar is awesome.  The staff could not be more accommodating, fast and efficient and the food at the bar was great.  Beer selection is from local brew houses and single malts two notches above typical.   Really for a very busy hotel, the staff is always there and ready to help. The place to stay in Indianapolis.Late review, but better late than never. We stayed here Spring of 2012.We were pleasantly surprised to find such a luxurious hotel located in Indianapolis. The exercise facility was hands down the nicest hotel exercise room I've ever been in- free headphones- Who does that? You rock, JW! The rooms were beautiful, clean, and modern. Two downsides - it was Monster Truck Convention weekend in Indy- what a crowd, we could not relax at the pool. Second downside was the restaurants surrounding the JW- mostly chain restaurants, but I've found that to be trend in Indianapolis.Excellent hotel at nice location. It was a bit crowded due to the Indy marathon but the service of the hotel staff did not suffer. The porters were smiling all the time and the reception was quick to help and pleasant. Rooms are nice with great beds.Jw Marriott is unlike any other hotel. The rooms are absolutely beautiful and the staff are out standing. They have meeting space 2 restaurants and a starbucks. High velocita and Osteria Pronto are excellent. There truly is no other place to stay in Indy. The architetture is incredible and it is connects to the convention center by a Sky walk which also will connect you to the mall. It can get you so many places without even going outside!Beautiful hotel. Great location. Friendly staff from the moment you walk into the lobby.  Had a room on the 19th floor great city view. Impressed with housekeeping I would leave my room early morning and I would stop back before noon and the room was already cleaned. The High Velocity sports bar off the lobby is great . Especially the bartenders Max, Sarah and Katy!! Food was also great. Would definitely stay at another JW anytime !My husband and I stayed for one night which included the romance package. The room was beautiful and well decorated. The view from our room was breath taking. We stayed on the 24th floor! Wow! Everyone was very friendly! The breakfast buffet at the restaurant was to die for! I would return just for that! As soon as I called room service and let them know I was ready for my champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, they were at my door. Under 5 minutes. The only negative I have is they seem a bit over staffed. There were a lot of employees just standing around.I came to visit friends and family in Indianapolis. JW Marriott opened right when I was moving away from Indy, so I decided to stay. Little did I know I had booked my trip during a major college sports event. When I arrived at the hotel it was late and everyone was attentive. The staff was lovely and very friendly through most of my four night stay. However, the swarm of families and children at the hotel made this feel more like a Holiday Inn than a JW Marriott. And the staff - again, very friendly (except one seemingly grumpy young woman who made me a cappuccino in the beautiful lobby bar) - seemed overwhelmed. I hate when I walk into a hotel and there are tons of people and tons of luggage being "held" in the lobby, and that's what this place was for the majority of the weekend.liked:-awesome shower-nice views (I had a corner room on the 27th view that overlooked the river, nice sunset) -lovely staff-two bar options and lots of seating (and types of seating, couches, booths, stools, etc)-free bottled water in your room-delicious chicken fingers from the sports bar, ha!dislikes:-no mini bar. Big hotel, I get that the capacity for a mini bar isn't high, but, I like the convenience. -no spa (I had to go to the Conrad)-I had an appointment and called to have my car pulled around. The valets pulled my car around, and I sat in my car for 5-7 minutes waiting because they lost my keys. !?!?!-too many TV's. I've never been in a building with so many TV's. -cleaning services were just "OK" I'd often find things unattended that I would expect cleaned. I even tip, and was surprised by this. I was not provided complimentary water on my last night stay. -I also had to request a robe. I had accidentally left mine on the floor my first night, and they must have collected it with my towels, but I had to request a robe, it was never replenished. -having to pay for internet in your room. this is the 21st century, let's fix that. or, at least give club members free internet. -a staff member told me that they were giving discounts to people for the sports event, so everyone and their mother was staying here. It felt more like a Holiday Inn Holidome than a high end hotel. I figure though, that if I came any other time, and not during an unexpected sporting event, I probably would have felt the type of experience I expect out of the higher end Marriott label. I was told by a staff member that this was the largest of all the JW's until the Dubai location was built - and that makes sense, it's a massive place. Sadly I did not take advantage of the pool or work out area, the swarm of children made it particularly unappealing. But, I'm a single woman traveler who likes her peace and quiet, and generally finds it at luxury hotels like this. So, note to self: next time I visit Indy look at the city event schedule and book accordingly.Stayed here for a conference. Very nice hotel and the staff is friendly and always helpful. The gym is very nice for a hotel but can get crowded during peak times. I was disappointed in the pool because it is small. Location is nice, close to tons of restaurants and bars.The service at this place is great. When we checked in, the attendant was nice but he was talking so fast that we just said yes and nodded. We kept on looking at each other to see if one of us had understood the question, but none of us did.We got to the room and it was nicely furnished. It's very modern and classy. We tried to order room service in the morning, but they said it was a 45 minute wait and we couldn't wait that long. I like that they have interactive maps. It's very helpful and useful. The meeting rooms are and the bathrooms are lovely. I think everything is tastefully designed without being too barren but not too homey. We had our conference dinner in the grand ballroom and I have to say, that was the best beef I've ever had at a hotel. The salad was not impressive. A negative is that they charge for wifi, unless you're in the lobby. I'm sorry, but even some of the cheapest motels offer free wifi. But my overall experience is a good one.I stayed here for a convention a few weeks ago.  I don't even think I left the area besides going to the stadium.  Everything about this hotel was top notch.The staff was incredibly nice and attentive.  Almost to the point where you think you're staying in a FIVE STAR HOTEL.  Oh, wait....There are two restaurants, and several in the area within walking distance, plus a lounge where you can just chill.Awesome views and even better staff!!!!!The hotel didn't allow me to do a late check-out, in fact the housekeeping knocked on my door at 9am on my last day because she thought the room was vacant.  Not her fault.  There were a few of us staying in the room, and each of us checked out at a different hour.  I was the last guest.  (But they could get a new program that let's them know if someone is in the room, eh?  Especially since the A/C kept shutting off if we didn't move.)What really irritated me was she went in my room when I stepped out to smoke a cigarette and moved my suitcase from the bed to the floor.  There was a DND sign on the door.  I mean come on.  That alone, plus the fact that I couldn't do an hour late check-out should knock it down to 3 or 4, but I'm being nice.I was very busy during my convention, and luckily during my last morning I was able to enjoy the pool, gym, and hot tub.  Why didn't I do it during my whole stay...it was nice.  Nice views from the entire spa area.So since I couldn't get a late check-out, I was informed I could store my luggage at the front desk (and get a bag ticket...very nice).  The house keeping was very pushy to get us out, and I'm not sure if she thought I had left, but she went back in my room.  If someone ever came in my room if I was naked I would have knocked them out.---make sure you have the DO NO DOT DISTURB SIGN ON.  Other than that, bam....I'd go back!Drank at High Velocity after being dropped off the Brew Bus Tour.  Good food and drinks.

review_content: My husband was there for a trade show and I was along for the ride. I really wanted to stay somewhere with a suit but I don't know, we got a good deal on this place through the show so we picked Hyatt. We loved it. From the moment I stepped out of my car at the valet I had all the help I needed. My husband arrived first and the kids and I drove there. They grabbed all my luggage and even my kids and let them ride on the cart! We had a 2 bed room, the room was clean and beds were comfortable. Yes, this place is expensive meaning valet and no free breakfast and what not, but what do you expect? I loved that their's a Starbucks in the building :) and the employee's there were so amazing, they gave my kids free cake pops and cookies and even an apple! I mean you can't beat that kind of service. There's plenty of restaurants around but there's a Subway in the building as well if you want something really quick and cheap. I love that everything is within walking distance from here. My husband didn't even go outside for 3 days because he got there from the airport and walked to the convention center and to Lucas Stadium all through the skyway. There's even a mall attracted :) and everything else you need is with in a few blocks. I love the central location of this place. highly recommended and awesome service. Thank you HyattLocation, location, location means $, $, and $. Parking is $30-36. No free breakfast like other Hyatts. DO NOT PARK to check in for more than 10min, or you'll be socked with the $30 parking charge. The room is good, and it was clean, modern, and tasteful. The staff seem used to complaints from pikers like me, oops, I mean people that are plainly shocked at their prices. But this is located only blocks from the convention center, Lucas Stadium, and other "attractants" to downtown Indy. If you're easily shocked and wondered if you were on Michigan St in Chicago suddenly, then try another place. I was burning frequent stayer points, so I parked down the street for $12 overnight, and went somewhere else to eat breakfast. I'm sure they didn't care.I have stayed here overnight on two separate occasions and thoroughly enjoyed each stay.  The hotel is situated on the corner of Washington and Capitol which allows views of the Capitol building and the IRT. It is also walking distance to just about everything downtown. Circle Centre, St. Elmo's, Soldiers and Sailors monument... all within blocks of the Hyatt. Oh and don't forget that The Eagle's Nest is on the top floor of the Hyatt!Our room was clean and well appointed. It feels a bit more swanky than the price tag suggests. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are spacious and the rooms are quiet. There are even nightlights located under the bedside tables that are motion activated for when you groggily stumble to the bathroom in the middle of the night! It's the little things right?!?The interactions I had with the staff were limited to check-in, check-out and the valet service. Everyone was polite and professional. Valet was a bit pricey ($34 overnight) but it was nice to not have to worry about finding parking. This is a great hotel for the price and you can't beat the location!The Hyatt is centrally located in downtown Indy and easily accessible to many of the restaurants in walking distance. The check in process is fairly quick and staff is friendly. There is a starbucks and subway located within the lobby of the hotel. I've stayed at the Hyatt on a few different occasions due to work trips. This is not my preferred hotel in the Indy area as I find the rooms to be dusty, the bathroom floors are sometimes sticky, and AC can be loud at times. Indy hotels book up very fast because there is some kind of convention every week. So if you know you're coming, book as far in advance as possible.For some reason even though they have 5 elevator banks they seem to take awhile so make sure to give yourself a little extra time or be patient for them. Room service is fairly quick. Every time I have ordered room service it will be delivered in about 20 minutes and they give you a call to notify you that your order is on its way. I do like how the Hyatt does have a healthy menu option for those that want to try and eat well while on the road. A decent size gym with variety of cardio and weight options. They also provide towels and has a water station to refill water bottles if you would like. If you order an UberX from the Hyatt sometimes they get confused as to which entrance to pick you up at but I've had luck telling them to entrance where valet pick up and drop of is. The valet staff is very friendly. Always greeting hello and goodbye and offering to help with bags even if I'm dropped off by uber versus driving a rental.We came to Indy for the Colts vs Texans game on Sunday. I read a lot of negative reviews on Yelp for this hotel, but decided to book it since that's where my friend and her husband were staying. Our room was small, but clean. Although everything looked a bit old, especially the carpet. Saturday we were able to check in early and there were no issues. Sunday we had NO hot water. We told the front desk and she said the whole hotel was out of hot water, but they were working on it. That's unacceptable for the amount of money we paid. We told her we'd like some type of compensation and she gave each of us 8,000 points on our Hyatt Gold cards. I appreciate that, but it took several attempts to get her to do anything. She just kept saying it would be fixed soon. Well, we had to get breakfast before the game so waiting around for the hot water to be restored was not an option.
