Bye, bye Hyatt - please take a few lessons from Marriott!!Awesome, fun, and romantic. I've been there on two separate occasions with my wife and was never disappointed. I was also just there for a conference, and was surprised by the caliber of the open breakfast buffet. Also, kudos to the lobby bar for having Upland Dragonfly IPA on tap. I tip my hat to you, sir.I am sorry to say this but WARNING: DO NOT STAY here! Dirty hotel & unprofessional management & staff.  Faucets in rooms creak so you wake up when your next door neighbor takes a shower. NO windows!  I travel a lot but will NEVER try a Hyatt again!Was here on business need that was cool temperature wise and no noise. Room rate was good Arrived late, did not want room service and need a quick bite and a beer. The Level One bar was still open .The service was good and the bar tender made a few suggestions for food that hit the spot.Awesome place. We were on the 11th floor, and we had great views of the city. Valet parking super expensive.priceline this stuff baby. for 1/5 the list cost of the room, i had a great stay. room was clean (save note below...), gave me a high floor, valet parking was steep-ish at 28 (get your car out before 2pm next day, with in/out priv's) but on par with any metropolitan city center hotel that's not one of the big 5, fitness center was nice and airy and looked out on the street, atrium that was connected with the office space next door was an interesting touch.bed was comfortable, very close to tons of things downtown including dozens of restaurants and places to explore. i requested nonsmoking and they said there's only a total of 6 (or 8?) smoking rooms anyway (for you smokers out there).there was one major cleanliness issue though. a.k.a. don't shower with the bathroom door open, such that it fogs up the window in the bedroom, showing the stigmata of an uncleaned, previously-used-for-sex window (read: hand prints in the top corners, long hair/head-prints being rubbed side to side in the middle, and roundish spread of unfogged area towards the bottom = gross, but i wasn't rubbing myself on any windows so i just stayed away from that area)overall pretty good deal. those small charges rack up - but it's better than staying way out of town at a crappy motel for a similar base cost. i'm okay paying a (very small) premium for some nicer amenities.Don't stay here if you want to sleep. The renovations going on are "24 hour", and they do mean it. I'm writing this at 5am after a sleepless night. Constant construction noise consisting of both massive street noise (I'm on the 10th floor!) and noise from above and both sides of my room has gone on without interruption since 2:45am.  Three calls to the front desk produced no results, and in the 3rd call the person tried to tell me that there could't be noise, according to the contractor.  I politely invited them up to the room to listen, but no takers.  This has turned me off all Hyatts, anywhere, permanently.The location of this hotel is great - central to all shopping and downtown highlights. The lobby is really nice and open - the atrium design lets a lot of light in so it's not your typical endless hallways. Front desk staff was more than helpful (and never missed a wake up call!) and housekeeping was fast and thorough.Room service and food quality leaves a lot to be desired. Everything is drenched in butter. Overall, a very comfortable room and I would stay here again while in Indy.

review_content: I am writing this from the perspective of planning events & booking groups.My colleague and I often book incoming training groups and host events and we absolutely love to work with the Omni. Diondra & Cristy particularly keep us coming back. They are reliable, responsive, and absolutely delightful. Our guests consistently enjoy their stay and the Select Guest program (fresh coffee delivered to your room and free wifi on the first stay?!) is unmatched.Thank you Diondra & Cristy. We appreciate you!I recently visited Indianapolis on business and stayed at the Omni. It was my first stay and overall, I would say it's okay but not the best hotel. Maybe I wouldn't be so critical if they didn't say they were a "luxury" hotel. I got an executive king room and to be honest, I'm really glad I didn't get a regular room. It was pretty tiny even for the larger executive room. Most chain hotels have larger rooms. It might not be such a big deal but there is no lighting. It's like a dark cave. There was a lamp on the nightstand and a lamp on the desk, that's it. Also, most importantly, my cellphone had bad service in my room. I have Verizon and I could receive and make calls but they were a jumbled mess, we couldn't understand one another. I could text so it was alright but if you are planning to do business, think again. The staff was less than friendly. The lady who checked me in was barely pleasant. When I checked out, I needed to retrieve my car from the valet. Now it wasn't even 8 am yet and there were only two other guests in the lobby. There was no one at the valet stand and so I had to trek back in to the front desk where the staff member seemed less than pleased to have to call valet herself. It took them over 15 minutes to bring me my car and they had let it idle for quite some time because it was warm. I don't care if my car is warm, just bring it to me. Would I stay again? Maybe. It was really quiet, the price was decent, and the location was good.Wow. WOw. WOW! I've been to hotels around the world and the Omni Severin is officially my favorite. My company has offices in Indianapolis and as a reward for even us Indy locals, rooms at Omni. I was able to check in at 9a for my night stay and was upgraded by the desk agent Angelica. The suite was 2 floors including a gorgeous view and spiral staircase - I wish I could have stayed longer! The bed was sublime, valet was easy, and everyone was very friendly and eager to help with anything we needed.Bravo to the Omni - my new local staycation spot!I had an extended stay while in Indy for job training and I was very pleased with this hotel.  The staff was very friendly, my room was spacious, and the bed was comfortable.  You can't beat the location.  It is in the center of town.  You can enter the mall without leaving the hotel.  Its also steps away from a multitude of restaurants, and stadiums if you want to catch a game.  The Omni is a real treasure.  I hope that my company makes accommodations for me to stay here when Im in Indy again.Clean and open. Just stopped in for the first floor amenities which were great. Staff were very friendly.My wife and I have stayed at this hotel several times. We go for the plaza suites with a balcony. Small but nice rooms. The restaurant, 1913 is way overpriced for the food quality and preparation. Food is not bad but just ok. The Severin Bar (single bar next to reception desk) is creepy. We had a drink while waiting for our room to be available upon check in. The bartender just stood there staring at us the entire time. Overall it's a nice hotel but the service and management are absolutely horrible!Our last stay was for two nights. We got zero sleep both nights because of some kids partying in the next room all night. And I mean all night! They were completely drunk and obnoxious. Had a stereo set up on the balcony and blasted it well into the early am hours. Techno at 3am anyone? No thanks. Several guests in surrounding rooms complained and security was up there at least half a dozen times the first night. They would quiet down for about 15 minutes then start up again each time.By the second night, hotel management didn't even bother with them. I tried to speak with a manager in the morning to ask for a refund or at least partial refund, comped parking, free coffee...Anything.There was no manager working that weekend. This was October 11, 2015.I have since tried multiple times to contact a manager by phone and email. Still nothing. I recently received an email from the assistant desk manager, who offered $25 off a standard room for one night. Not even enough to make up for parking there ($38/day.)This is her:Angelina SalwakAssistant Front Office ManagerI wrote back and called but again, no response.I used to like this hotel and would have stayed again if they would have attempted to make amends. But they obviously do not care about loyal repeat customers and management, if there is any, makes that lack of interest in guests very obvious. I'll will stay elsewhere when in Indy, which is quite often. But hey! I know where to stay if I want to have an obnoxious party and disturb all of the other guests without any consequences!My stay at the Omni Severin was absolutely amazing! I was in town for a seminar that was taking place at the hotel, so I was able to fully enjoy all of the hotel's services, including the meeting rooms and catering.The hotel is conveniently located right in the heart of downtown Indianapolis. There is a sky bridge that attaches to hotel to the Circle Center mall with lots of shopping and dining options. Even outside of the mall, there are MANY varied dining options available. It is located directly across from the Indianapolis Union Station (and only blocks away from the Indiana Statehouse, Monument Circle, the Lucas Oil Stadium and the Bankers Life Fieldhouse) and was actually built to service the passengers on the trains. The historic building has a lot of charm and still has the original chandelier and post box. I really enjoyed these little details and the historic nature of the hotel.Within the lobby of the building there is access to the 1913 Restaurant, Severin Bar, Wine Thief, and Starbucks. This made it an even more convenient location to stay at!The guest rooms are quite spacious and incredibly comfortable. The staff provides nothing but superb customer service, across the board. From my room on the 12th floor I was provided with a beautiful view of downtown Indianapolis.I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and I would definitely encourage everyone to consider the hotel for business or pleasure in the downtown Indianapolis area (I saw a few weddings being planned and what a grey location to have one)! In fact, I am now very eager to try other Omni hotels during my travels because my experience here was so wonderful!Thank-you, Omni, for another fantastic stay in your hotel this past weekend.   When our friends are in town, we almost always recommend Omni for their stay.  We usually get a room, too.  Convenient location, reasonable prices and great customer service has made us loyal patrons.  This weekend was no different.  With 6 rooms between us, we were all pleased with the quality and comfort Omni provides.  We will continue to recommend and stay ourselves!I thought the hotel was nice, to be honest I was expecting a bit more. I felt the room was a tad bit dark. The size was nice, but the bathroom was a bit underwhelming and the water was slow to drain when taking a shower. The staff was very nice and courteous and seemed to care about your stay. The only other thing that I noticed in the room was the patchwork on the drywall was bulging  through the wallpaper, not to the point of making a complaint, but just lack of attention to detail during renovation. The only odd thing was returning from dinner and arriving at the hotel and the doorman never greeted me and my wife or opened the cab door, something I would have expected. I like the convenience to the parking garage and the proximity to the mall and other venues.Ok... I travel quite a bit and have stayed in a lot of quality hotels. I live in Indianapolis, but had a one night staycation downtown at the Omni.First things first, I'm not familiar with parking options in this area. It was a little confusing, I think you may have to valet park, which is fine, but just putting that out there. It's like 38 dollars for overnight parking. The valet service is great and friendly.The lobby has a bar and restaraunt, I didn't eat there, but it looks nice. The service at the front desk was good. OK so I got to my room and this is where I start deducting points. 300 dollars for a room in Indianapolis is fairly pricey. I expect to get what I paid for. For starters, this was not the room I booked. Online it showed a larger balcony with chairs, which I know is available because I saw real pictures on tripadvisor. I had also selected two full or queen beds, I can't remember which they were. My room had a little ledge of a balcony, no chairs, one king bed. I could have requested a change of rooms, but who ever wants to deal with that?.. nothing irritates me more than taking the time to pick specific things that get overlooked. Like why even ask if you're just going to give me whatever room works for you?The room itself left a lot to be desired. I'm sure most in Indianapolis probably do, however, it was super dark and dungeon-y. The glasses and ice bucket are awkwardly kept in some TV cabinet. The carpet was nice, the bed was clean and comfortable. The couch and chair were stained and worn. The bathroom was small and very hospital-esque. We had a good view of the old union station and Lucas oil stadium, wish we'd had more of a city view. All in all, it was alright... I guess that's all you csn expect here. Just seemed a little overpriced.I was hesitant to stay after reading some rather scathing reviews, but the Omni was amazing! FIVE STARS FOR STAFF, friendly and very helpful!! Valet was a little behind this morning but it was snowing and 8 am so that's expected. Bed linens, pillows, and towels were all up to par, this is something I'm rather nit picky about. Bathroom was small but it's a historic hotel that's 103 yr old so no big deal. We got a great deal on Hotwire for $150 and valet was an extra $38. All in all, I'd stay here again and would recommend to anyone!I meant to post an update a while ago, but forgot! Oops!The manager at Omni contacted me immediately and apologized for the woman's behavior at the front desk and let me know how embarrassed he was that an employee would speak that way to a guest. He offered us another night in a suite to make up for it, complimentary, and though we had to move away to Dallas for our jobs shortly after, we were not able to try it out, but I was so appreciative of the kind gesture. It was nice to know that that sort of behavior is incredibly uncommon and unacceptable and I am confident that my next stay with Omni will be enjoyable. Thank you Omni!I must say I expected a LOT more from both the price and the hotel chain. Other than the fact it is right downtown, this hotel is basic and not worth the money. Never in my life have I paid so much and received so little. Our room was tiny, barely fit a double bed (which was suppose to be a king, when asked about it, I was told there were no other rooms in the hotel). I have never seen a bathroom that was so small. It was the perfect size for a hobbit.I don't think I will ever stay here again. Not worth the money, I mean over 200 dollars a night in INDIANAPOLIS! I'd have more room if I'd stayed in my car...of course, parking was ridiculously expensive...so it won't have been much cheaper.Absolutely lovely lobby in which to sit and chat. Not only that but the lobby wifi is good and strong as well! A friend stayed in this hotel and she had no known complaints about her stay either. The restroom in the lobby was also rather well maintained. And the door person was great at letting us know when the rain let up and helping us gain our bearings such that I could get back to my hotel. Looked like a nice hotel at which to stay.I would like to Thank the Management and 1913 staff for a Great night on 02-10-2016, My Birthday were yesterday came in feeling real down any you guys made my night....Thanks.         Thanks Tyler and JonathanBeautiful lobby and very helpful valet, However valet is $38, ouch!. Staff is super nice. Everything looks a little worn out and rooms are A little cramped. Lighting is not the best, especially if you need to use the bathroom at nighttime. More likely relative to the age of the building and it's restoration the water out of the pipes is extremely musty kind of taste like a peat bog. If you don't like your water taste like single malt scotch you can always buy the seven dollar bottle of water they have by the TV.   The bathtub is extremely shallow, more like a shower stall. Be careful when you flush the toilet and be sure to stand back because it flushes so vigorously is slings water across the bathroom floor; kind of gross.The bed linens were very nice however the mattress itself is likely over 10 years old it was very creaky and would fold in the center. Nice blackout shades over the windows.Location is pretty sweet too in the bar downstairs pours the cocktails kind of heavy if you know what I mean.The rooms here are pretty small.  I was only one person and I made it work for me, but I did feel a bit cramped.  Especially in the bathroom.  I went to make some tea in the coffee pot in the room and was pretty disappointed when I noticed how dirty it was. I went down to the lobby hoping the Starbucks attached to the hotel was still open, but no luck.  I was told that the bar could make me a cup, which they did.  However it cost me $5 for a cup of hot water and a tea bag.  So much for the complimentary in room tea and coffee.I absolutely love this hotel. It is beautiful and close to everything that you want to do downtown. The employees are the nicest group of people I have encountered in such a long time. Each time I return, they make me feel so special. They go out of their way to make you happy. I believe that the person or persons do the hiring has a unique gift of knowing who to hire and who not to. It didn't matter who I encountered while there, that certain employee always had a smile on their face and was always willing to go out of their way to help. While on the elevator I had the privilege to meet the maintenance man. He even went out of his way to help me with my luggage in my room. Then when I realized that I wanted to change rooms, he helped me to my new room. Even when I book through a 3rd party, they still give me free internet in my room. I can't think of anything that they could change that would make my stay more comfortable. Thanks Omni for making my stay always so wonderful.My fiance and I decided to spend an extra night in Indy to celebrate his birthday and chose Omni to spend the evening. From the moment we walked in the door the staff at this hotel were kind and welcoming. This has been by far the best experience I have ever had at a hotel, the staff went above and beyond and we appreciate the positive experienceIts pretty classy. Breakfast was  the diamond in the rough for me--it really set me right from the start. Very professional staff all the way around. The pool was a little small, but we were not there to swim...the water was perfect temp though and that plus the pool cleanliness made up for the lack of its size. I would stay here again with my family. Go for the package deal with this!
review_content_20: Bartender, Jack was incredibly rude and inconsiderate. We sat down and waited for 5 minutes before even being acknowledged. There was a group of men who he talked to the entire time we were there which wasn't long because we were so disgusted. Paid $12 each for mimosas and got service as if we were at McDonalds. Never got a thank you or anything. We talk to the concierge about it and he, Andrew, was incredibly nice and apologetic.Had a 2 week stay and was treated with true hospitality and professionalism . Tony B. Helped me find all the good music spots and was over the top customer service , Melvin knew my omelet without asking every day . April was a great limo driver and got me to my regular morning stop ahead of time all the time . Lucy C. Was also very helpful at letting  me know what bands were playing where and had good recommendations for food and fun ! I will be staying here next visit to Indianapolis for sure. I only named the people I remembered that helped me DAILY, everyone I encountered was very nice as well. Most definitely the place to stay when vMy parents always stay at the Omni when they are in town visiting and it is a lovely hotel.  The customer service is outstanding, the location is convenient, and the rooms are very nice.  The suites facing south have awesome views of Lucas Oil Stadium and balconies.  The Omni is also attached through above ground tunnel access to circle center mall which is convenient.  The Severin bar in the lobby is great and the Starbucks in the lobby is convenient too.This place is amazing! The service and location is unbeatable. My fiance booked us a room here for my 30th birthday and when we arrived they gave us a free upgrade to one of the loft style suites on the 12th floor. They also threw in a hand written birthday card, some local beer, and their BBQ popcorn (which was amazing). We were able to grab dinner at St. Elmo's and then walk over to catch the Pacers game with ease. Overall, we were both blown away by how nice the staff was and how clean the room was. We will definitely be coming back!Hotel was a big disappointment.   Drove over almost two hundred miles for my 65th birthday. Booked three rooms.  When we arrived at 3 they told us only one room was ready.  My daughter with her two year and husband were told their room would not be ready until after 5. My other son and daughter were told their suite would also not be ready.  Only after my son complained did they scramble to find him a suite.   To make a long story short, my daughter with the toddler didn't get into her suite with her husband until after 8pm.  In fairness to the hotel they comped us with breakfast and parking.  They were suppose to take something off one of the rooms...just got my card charges, doesn't appear to be discounted.   There are many other hotels in the area....I would avoid this one.They ruined my 65 th birthday.....I was also told that a bottle of champagne or some other item would be in my room as a token for my birthday.   Nothing ever came.Great, clean, classy accommodations. Our room was a bit on the small side. Annoyed that parking is so expensive, but that's downtown life. Front desk clerk was a total snob and not at all warm and friendly and welcoming like you would expect for the price paid. Received better service/welcomes at Holiday Inn Express. Otherwise, decent hotel.We decided to stay at the Omni because of its downtown location and it being close to Lucas Oil. Having booked the room in January, we were pretty disappointed that they didn't have a room ready for us when we arrived, the staff saying it'd be about an hour until one was ready.We were understanding, and had just decided to wait in the lobby until one became available - even though we knew that would probably make us late for our event.The concierge, Lucy, came over and talked to us while we waited. She was incredibly nice, and went way above and beyond for something that we really weren't too upset over in the first place. She took our bags and held them for us so that we could go to our event and called us when our room was ready. When we returned later in the evening to check in, Lucy was there, and gave us a personalized letter apologizing for the inconvenience. She also included a voucher worth $50 to use in the Severin Bar. We were blown away by the kindness.Despite the fact that there were four separate events going on downtown, on top of it being St. Patrick's Day weekend, the staff were on top of everything and the front desk remembered us as we checked out and got our car from valet.We will definitely be staying here again for Supercross next year! Thanks again!Date: 8/30/2015Time:11:30amI frequent this place when I travel to INDY and I have to say that although the service inside is GREAT! Valet was a complete mess during checkout. I walked out and no one approached us but they were all at the booth standing around. I walk over to them and ask for the number of my car and the guy says "Do you have your ticket?" I said "OH no, I left it in the room but have my check out receipt." One of the three guys said "You can't just walk up and ask for a number without a number or ID". I replied, well you hadn't ask for my ID but here it is. Another guy gets my car keys and then asked if I checked out. I replied, yes here is the receipt. He hands the keys to me and didn't even offer to bring the car around. I told him I'll take it from here and I got my things and left.Staff may need to watch a video on being a little more nicer. Better yet, mock the team from yesterday during my check in around 2pm. Excellent service ALL DAY! Total difference this morning.Did not meet expectations of quality of service.Taking a weekend jaunt to Indianapolis and as members of the National Trust for Historic Preservation, my friend and I decided to stay in a hotel affiliated with the Historic Hotels of America. Unfortunately, the "historic" part of the hotel was restricted the entire time of the stay due to a private party. Also, the Sky Walk / Pedestrian Walkway that connect various hotels in downtown Indianapolis as well as to the shopping areas/restaurants were restricted by guards due to another private function. No hotel guests on this weekend (March 28, 2015) were allowed to access the walkway. This made me want to check out immediately and go somewhere else. For an amenity that the hotel markets, yet it is not accessible to guests? In addition to these segregation practices, the elevators were remarkably slow. There was usually a 10-15 minute wait for them. It became highly frustrating. And in turn, it caused large amounts of folks (especially unsupervised children) to use the stairwell which my room backed up to. I got little sleep because of the loud banging of the use of the metal stairs. Additionally, guests were extremely loud and security was lax or not enforced during "quiet hours" so guests could rest. Also, very few amenities exist. You'll need to pay $15 a day for WiFi access in your room and $25 for business office use (computer/printing, etc). The breakfast buffet, at $20 per person was not up to standard either. There were little hot foods and it was in short supply often running out yet no deduction was made to the bill. Overall, I would not return to this hotel and their affiliation with the National Trust and Historic Hotels of America should be reexamined.I actually really liked this hotel. Very convenient to lots of restaurants and sporting venues, rooms were clean clean clean and there were plenty of outlets for electronics. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, room service food was also quite good! The beds were comfortable and the room amenities were more than adequate. I would definitely stay here again without complaint.I stayed here this past week for a conference that was around the corner at the Indiana Convention Center.  The location is fantastic, and a close walk to almost everything: the Pacers, Colts, and Indians are all across the street or around the corner.  Lots of restaurants and fun areas all right there.  The skywalk connects the Omni to the Circle Centre Mall.  I thought everyone I dealt with was very professional, polite, and accommodating.  My room was clean and comfortable.  I got room service twice and it was prompt and delicious.  I joined the Select Guest club, mostly for the free wi-fi.  When I got my bill, they had charged me for it.  When I pointed this out to the front desk, they immediately corrected it and removed the wi-fi charge.I am not picking on Omni here because all major chains do this, but I still can't believe that wi-fi isn't automatically included.  I mean, McDonald's, school and public libraries, airports all have complimentary Wi-fi.  I still find it odd that most high-end chains charge customers $9.95 or more a day to use it.  It took a minute to join the Select Guest club, so it was no big deal.  But I must admit that it was pretty slow most of the time, and I often lost the connection and had to reboot.Just a couple of beefs - albeit minor. They advertised the fitness facilities as being 24 hours.  I went down to do laps in the pool around 10:30 one night, and there was a woman down there cleaning and said that it closed at 10.  I don't know if the website just meant the gym itself is open 24 hours, but I thought it odd that the pool would be closed but not the gym when it's all right there in the same area/room.  Second, the air conditioning in the room was really noisy.All in all, it was a great stay and I enjoyed my week there.  The original lobby, with the original crystal chandelier and marble staircase from 1913 when the Severin opened, is beautiful.Great location in downtown.  Clean throughout hotel and in the rooms.  Bathroom shower water pressure wasn't good probably could be fixed with a new shower head.  We requested a crib in room and it wasn't there.  They did bring it after but almost wish they didn't. I would hope they replace them soon.  A small pack and play would work better.  It is to deep I couldn't even put baby down without falling almost in it.  My husband had to put him in it.  Staff offer to bring a refrigerator but never did.  We made do with the cooler.  I would go back if other places were booked or if this was much cheaper than others.The hotel is nice enough, but it is nothing fantastic. Most staff was friendly, a couple were unnecessarily stuffy with an invisible stick up their bum.The room was...we'll say "cozy". Breakfast at the restaurant was mediocre.There is one thing that really annoyed me about this place, though...they need to keep working ice machines on each floor. It's on of those things that is a necessity in a hotel with no vending machines or easy access to refreshments.My husband and I tied the knot last month and are not originally from Indianapolis. All of our families and friends had to fly in so we wanted to pick a hotel block that would be convenient to the heart of downtown and still have some culture to it. Plus our venue was downtown so we wanted easy access. (The Mavris.. amazing!)Boy did we pick the right place! The Omni was unbelievably accommodating and super friendly. We were able to tour the rooms our guests would be staying in ahead of time and the discount was leaps and bounds better than any of their competitors. My parents, also from out of state, stayed in the presidential suite the whole weekend and it made a perfect place for our guests to gather. The large space made the wedding weekend feel a little bit closer to home. One hiccup included a fire alarm and we were all mainly on the 12th floor... trekking down all those flights holding all my wedding gear just hours before the rehearsal was a little stressful but they were so apologetic and included extra treats in our rooms once we returned!We did not stay there on our wedding night... for obvious reasons... but our wedding was on a Friday so we wanted to come back to the action on Firday before we left on Sunday for the Honeymoon. The Omni comped a honeymoon suit for us! It was unbelievable.100 years old and they keep getting better :)Great looking hotel with nice staff.  End of compliments. As you will notice, I seldom yelp.  So you know it's either great or horrible when I chime in with a comment.  This is the most uncomfortable bed in which I have ever had the displeasure of (not) sleeping.  My back is killing me.  In fact, the small of my back is on fire it hurts so bad.  My wife and I are moving to town and have been looking for apartments all day.  You have all done this, it sucks and is exhausting.  Can't stay alseep.  That's how goddamned horrible this bed is.  To all of the people complaining about the price: stay at the airport you cheap-assed clowns.  At 140 a night this is one of the cheapest places in downtown.  That and the staff are the only reason I didn't give it just one star.   This is going to sound crazy: I'd stay here again and bring an inflatable mattress.  It's a really inexpensive, cleanish (B+), nice hotel in the middle of downtown.  Maybe that's the insane sleeplessness talking, but it's true  (for now at least).  This place still might be worth the trade-off for you (money for comfort). Trying to roll over and sleep again...Wonderful service, beautiful rooms and great location if u want to walk downtown or if u r going to see a concert (it is very close to Lucas oil stadium). It is a bit pricey but u get what u pay for!This has got to be one of THE most LUXURIOUS OMNI Hotel that I have stayed at East of California. It has special memories for me for many good reasons! :p I was here for a week of shows.The hotel staff here were just outstanding. The doorman, the reservation check in agents, the elevator attendant - phenomenal service. Every space, every angle in this hotel, everywhere I wondered off, the experienced I received were "spectacular - spectacular!"  That's from "Moulin Rouge" btw! :pHere's the treat though, the Omni Severin is connected to the Circle Centre Mall and it is only a via skywalk to the Indiana Convention Center. Also, it is centrally located in the heart of the downtown Wholesale District, and it is only one half block from the famous St. Elmo Steak House, and two blocks from Lucas Oil Stadium and Bankers Life Fieldhouse.---This Omni has a 24 hour Starbucks service (hooray for the coffee achievers like me). I took advantaged of many late night cappuccinos.  Awesome!!Their lobby was gorgeous. Pendant lights hung from up above. The view of their crystal chandeliers with a cinematic ambiance "Gone With The Wind" staircase," breathtaking!I did managed to see their indoor heated pool and jacuzzi - but never got a chance to use the services as they were packed with families so I decided to join my friends at the Severine Wine Bar instead after dinner which was absolutely first in its class. There, we had toasts after toasts, sharing stories after stories how our show went, and a few eye opening exchanges of "rumors and gossips!" Shhhh......For breakfast, we did take advantaged of their "1913 Restaurant" more for convenience (buffet style), but I recommend that you venture out to downtown for dinners. One I recommend is the St. Elmo Steak House. A must experience before leaving Indianapolis.As far as their rooms - amazing.  Most of us were lucky and got early bookings for their King Severin Suites(huge space) with beautiful privacy french doors that lead into a luscious and heavenly private bedroom with flat screen TV, and spa bathroom with all first class complimentary accessories. I was told all rooms comes standard with plush robes and slippers.  Ours were replaced daily; and an evening mint chocolates were delivered nightly with an orchid and a lovely note on our bed. How thoughtful! I had to remind myself that I wasn't in California - and that I was in fact in Indianapolis of all places! Who would've thought!PS - don't forget to sign up during your initial registration for their "Select Guest loyalty program;" there is no charge and this will give you FREE access to WiFi in your room.  Well worth the savings.Wow - this is my 100 YELP Reviews for my list "The Yelp 100 Challenge" for 2013.Staff is super friendly and even wore colts jerseys for the game. Old historic hotel from 1913 which has aged semi-well but is probably due for a major overhaul at some point soon. The a/c is noisy and the air stayed pretty humid and didn't get very cold despite putting it on the lowest setting, the plumbing is funky (flushing the toilet is pretty violent and almost pulls the plumbing out of the wall) and the dents/dings under the newish wallpaper bear evidence to several remodels. The bed was also interesting with some kind of pillow top that made you feel like you might fall off if you were close to the edge. The linens are high quality though and definitely make you feel bundled up and secure under them.The accessible rooms are REALLY accessible which is fabulous if you require that. However, typically when I stay in an accessible room it is dually appointed. I.e. Hooks are in both high and low places, the closet bar and shelf are both high and low (allowing for hanging long dresses/pants) etc. This one just has everything low. It's not the end of the world, but just a little inconvenient when hanging dress clothes or towels (Eco-friendly) where I had to you the assist bars as towel racks. Anyway all in all they try very hard to keep this historic beauty up and running like a classic car. The hotel is well-loved.I absolutely loved this hotel!! We stayed on the top floor in one of the city view suites. The hotel lobby was swanky and the beds were extremely comfortable. I would strongly suggest staying here!!The room was ok.  Everything seemed a little worn out.  However, this is not why I am giving this hotel a two.  We were traveling and chose this hotel in big part because it is a "pet friendly" hotel.  We have two dogs one is boxer who is on the small side only 50 lbs and a miniature dachshund.  Both are extremely friendly and well behaved.  When we got there we found out their limit is 25 lbs for dogs.  The lady told me it is because dogs over 25 lbs are vicious!  I must have looked at her like she was crazy when she then asked me if my boxer was vicious!  I told her of course not then said she would have to meet my boxer before she would honor our reservation.  Of course when we brought in my "vicious" boxer she did nothing but wag her tale and shower her with kisses.  She begrudgingly agreed to let us stay.  But reiterated for my husbands benefit that they usually don't allow dogs over 25 lbs because they are vicious!  It took everything for me to bite my tongue as it was late and we had been on the road all day and I just wanted to sleep.  She then added in if my dogs caused any disturbance we could incur additional charges.  This was not feeling so pet friendly to me.  We travel very often with our dogs and have never encountered anything like this at any other hotel.  And how insanely uneducated to label any dog vicious just because of their size or their breed.  I think the meanest dog I have ever met was a tiny chihuahua.  So my suggestion is if you have dogs don't come to this hotel.  I know I never will.  And as far as the room it wasn't worth the price.  We have previously stayed at the Alexander in Indianapolis and they were extremely pet friendly they even give your dogs little goody bags.
review_content_40: The smallest things make such a difference! Omni has a turn down service in the evenings. I heard the "turn down assistant" knocking on doors as I left my room. I jokingly said "I want two dark chocolate squares with raspberry filling" as I walked away. We joked about how they used to do chocolates, etc. Nice enough that she (Brenda) was super nice and engaging, but she one up'd that. I was working in my room and a knock on the door "turn down service", I said it's all done. "no sir, one more thing" - Brenda had gone to get me a dark chocolate milkshake with the hotel's blessing!!! Awesome service and kudos to Omni for letting an employee make a guest day better!ScottWent here for Mother's Day Brunch. It's arguably one of the best places that serve very extensive themed brunch. Definitely worth the hefty price tag. They offer valet parking which is convenient and an on-site Starbucks.Home for Christmas, the girlfriend and I stayed at the Omni Severin Hotel. The Omni Severin is ideally located in Downtown Indy a short walk from plenty of restaurants, bars, Victory Field, and Lucas Oil Stadium. Given the time of year and the fact that the Colts were on the road on the Sunday we arrived in town, the hotel was pretty much empty...not the Overlook Hotel from The Shining empty...but empty nonetheless. It's not the newest hotel in Indy, but it had lots of good qualities. Pros: LocationPolite, professional hotel staff (front desk, housekeeping, etc.)Clean, fairly spacious standard roomComfortable bedNo motion sensors for items in/on the mini-barHowever, there was one thing that really detracted from our stay...the Omni's use of a holiday pine scent pumped into the main lobby and other common areas on the first floor. While pleasant smelling, it was a bit overpowering and the only thing I could isolate as a possible cause behind my fits of sneezing and other allergy symptoms I experienced during our stay. I've been in plenty of other hotels and casinos that have pumped in various scents into its air ventilation system without issue, so this was a first. Thankfully, like most people that stay in a hotel, we were only in the room a small fraction of the time we were in town. Nevertheless, the Omni was a decent hotel and likely doesn't use the pine scent year round. 3.5 stars.Clean. We wanted a king sized bed but they gave us two double beds. We are two slim people and we were scrunched. why would they even have a double bed? Not very comfy. We could hear all the noise outside...motorcycles, cars...and we were 10 stories up. Shower is nice. They cleaned the room very well each night and gave us turn down service.Beautiful, clean hotel conveniently located in downtown Indy. Easy walking distance to a great variety of restaurants, shops, and attractions. All staff from front desk to housekeeping to valet were friendly and helpful. Valet was prompt as well. Pool is small, but our son loved it. Rooms were clean and well-maintained. We would absolutely return next time we're in town.I have stayed in many hotels in my business travels and this is definitely one of the best! The hotel itself is immaculate. Classy decor. Impeccable service and a staff that bends over backwards for you. Very professional. Front desk personnel were friendly and quick to help me out with directions and suggestions of the area. Found me a room even though I had arrived a bit earlier than check in time.My room is wonderful. Clean and well maintained. Super comfy bed, large flat screen TV, safe, mini bar, great AC, terrific bathroom and toiletries, and even a basket of snacks to purchase. The tempation to rip open that $3 can of Pringles and $3 bag of M&M's is killing me!Nice clean pool and fitness room with a mix of cardio machines, weights, and resistance equipment. Not a lot but enough to get in a decent workout. Beautiful ballrooms on site for meetings and events. Coffee shop, lobby bar, restaurant, and even a martini cigar bar on the premises.The hotel is located perfectly and is convenient to everything - the Circle Centre Mall, restaurants and bars, the convention center, Lucas Oil Field, and more. The hotels in the area including the Omni are also connected to the mall by enclosed walkways. You never really need to walk outside too much which is great since it has been rainy Even by the elevators in the main lobby they have two urns of water - one with cucumber slices and tthe other with lemons and limes in it - with cups for anyone who wants a drink.I really think I could live in this place!-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------PS - be sure to join their Select Guest rewards club before you check in as it's free. You receive complimentary in-room wifi, pressing service, shoe shine, morning beverage delivery, and bottled water on day of arrival.While I feel that I have traveled far and, somewhat, wide, I had never been to Indianapolis.So, planning three nights for a place to stay by the convention center, I did a little research, including Yelp, at settled on this hotel.From the time I got there, the staff was very friendly and helpful with good referrals. The room was large enough and clean as was well attended to. I never ate in the restaurants but I did appreciate having a nice hotel bar and a Starbucks downstairs. The location was one block from the convention center, an indoor walk to the mall and near other downtown venues. It would have been nice to have a little gift store for postcards and a candy bar, but that wouldn't deter me from staying here again.We stayed at the Omni in Indianapolis on a Colts game day. The service at the front desk looked miserable without smiles. The room was nice, with few amenities for being such an expensive place to stay. The worst part of our stay was the valet. It was about $7 more expensive than other hotel garages and it took nearly an hour to retrieve our car. No one friendly or helpful at all when dealing with this issue. The weather was cold and rainy and they had us all waiting on the curb. I would not recommend the Omni to anyone. Stay at the Sheraton or anywhere else for better value and service.We just finished up a three day stay at the Omni Severin and I was overall very pleased with the accommodations and staff. Everyone from the valet parking to the front desk to the engineers, bellhops, concierge, and housekeeping staff went out of their way to make us feel taken care of and at home. All of our requests were met with prompt and speedy replies and everyone tried their best to make us feel welcomed. I would especially like to thank employees Danielle Travis and William Perry for their excellent service. Being an Omni select guest member also gave us additional perks of free wifi, free pressing of shirts, shoe shines, and coffee each morning from Starbucks. The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars is because we had to pay $32 a day for valet parking. I know this is par for the course, but I still think that it's ridiculous to charge guests this much for parking.Stayed here for work. Wonderful staff!! Was having a rough day, when I got to the check in desk the staff noticed my day sucked and bought me a beer. Rooms are comfy, hotel is clean and in a great location. The bar tenders have great recommendations on eats and drinks.The Omni is in the ideal location for anyone visiting downtown Indy, especially conference-goers. Within 3 blocks there are more restaurants than any other town I've visited, except for mega cities. But Indy is much easier to get around in. The Cultural Trail is awesome, too. This hotel had a broken elevator, but otherwise, it was perfect.Great hotel, staff and location... Park and walk to everything!! If you haven't been you need to check it outWine Thief is a must visit bar. They have the most authentic Manhattan ever made. Located in the Omni Hotel Lobby, the Wine Thief offers true vintage cocktails, only fitting for a place that titles it's restaurant "1913" commemorating the year the building was built. After traveling to many locations and "vintage" themed bars (from Denver to Chicago to Baltimore) I will say this is the most authentic cocktail menu I have seen. Ask for Will. He is truly an asset to Omni. The bar was closed, but Will offered to make one more drink as I stepped up to the bar. The Manhattan he made was truly the most authentic I had ever tasted, well balanced with whisky and citrus. It was made with all natural ingredients, no corners cut, no store-bought mixes. As I was finishing the drink there was more and more taste to the drink, unlike many cocktails that water down and warm up as they are finished. He took time while cleaning up the bar to engage me in conversation about his passion for wine and mixology. Apparently he had purchased a cocktail book published in 1927 with the original recipes for the prohibition style cocktails. He took the time to go above and beyond making simple drinks you can purchase at any other bar. He did his job so well, I almost forgot this was a service and I had to pay for the cocktail. He was incredibly genuine, a simple pleasure just to make his acquaintance. Before taking off for the night he made sure to shake every patron's hand and personally thank them for stopping by. I can't wait to see what he does after receiving his sommelier certification.We attended a friend's wedding this weekend and took advantage of their group rate to make it into a little staycation. We were bowled over by the level of service and professionalism that exuded from every employee we encountered, from bell hop, to wait staff, to the front desk. They anticipated our needs before we even realized they were needs, and answered our questions before we even asked them. Prior to arrival, we made a special request to get an extra refrigerator for our room and sure enough it was there, plugged in, and cold when we checked in. If you are considering a wedding here, please know that they are absolute professionals and your guests will be blown away by the white glove service. This place is absolute class and I will be recommending this hotel to my out of town visitors from now on.Had a really solid stay here for three nights while in town for a bachelor party. The location is great for walking distance to food, sights, the two local stadiums, and to access all of downtown. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and were very professional when one of our party members was a little lost in the hotel. The room itself was very clean, comfortable beds, good TV, only thing less than impressive was the bathroom, which was adequate but not as high quality as everything else there.They have a $100 weekend stay deal going on I believe the rest of the year, and for that price it's a place I would definitely recommend.Very average hotel experience. Lovely lobby and friendly staff, but room was really underwhelming.There's nothing that would absolutely make me want to stay away, but there also wasn't much to make me feel I have to stay here again.My husband & I stayed here for a romantic weekend. The location was wonderful - within walking distance of many attractions.Our room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, great water pressure (though the bathroom was one of the smallest I've ever seen) and it had a very nice gym.Our one sour note was a very loud drunk party next door to us on our second night. Security took care of the problem and the next day the front office supervisor very graciously adjusted our bill. Shanda was extremely nice about it - especially as it wasn't the hotel fault. We have already made reservations to stay there again during the marathon.One final note the brunch was amazing!! They locally source a lot of their produce and jams and it showed. Everything was fresh and delicious.Checked in early for a wedding. Happily waited while have lunch, we were assured they would prepare our room. A couple hours pass, they've clearly forgotten about us. We remind them, still patient, but that we need to prepare for a rehearsal dinner. They assured us we would get our room within the next 30 minutes. Another hour plus passes, still no room. In total, we waited four hours to get into a room. When i addressed my complaint with the 'manager' he was quick to remind me that 'check in wasn't technically until 3pm"... At this point it was 3:45 and we were just then getting our room, so, I'm not sure I follow this logic. He was rude, unprofessional, unapologetic, he blamed their error on me somehow. Amazing. Seriously, who does that? I've stayed in nice hotels from New York to Italy, and motel 6's in between. Never have I been treated like this. On top of all this, they didn't even bring up all of our luggage and we had to call down to have it brought up hours later. The room was loud, small, inadequate. I will never stay at an Omni hotel ever againHotels.com rates this a 4 Star but I'd give it 3. The Cons:Stained room carpet.Black grime on the bathroom tiles.Super weak shower/bath water flow.Poor quality towels.Severin Bar TV's too loud and not really an authentic classic cocktail barThe Pros:Great bartender at the Wine ThiefLocal, natural food and beer at the Severin BarLocationIn ranking order with best first, I would place Hyatt, Renaissance, Westin, Doubletree, Radisson, Hilton, Crowne Plaza, Marriott, OMNI then Holiday Inn, Marriott Courtyard, Sheraton, Best Western, Ramada Inn, Days Inn, Motel 6, then Travelodge.A nice, clean room with friendly staff and that's it. I don't stay in fancy hotels and after this, I will stick to the Holiday Inns of the world. Why do expensive hotels charge extra for internet and do not offer a free breakfast for guests? I honestly think it's outrageous you have to pay for internet in your hotel room that already costs $120 a night.The same goes for breakfast! For guests who are staying the night at the hotel, at least offer something small, bagels and muffins. Oh yeah, parking was an extra $40 bucks! The room was nice, the service was nice but overall just not worth the price tag.
review_content_60: Some friends and I stayed here after a long day of shopping and thought we could use some TLC the adventure starts when you pull up to the hotel and your vehicle is parked by one of the handsome and helpful vallet's. You then walk into the front lobby and are greeted by helpful staff and towers of fresh cucumber water while you check in!! The rooms were nice but small based on the price your paying. The downside however is the fact you have to wait 20 minutes or so for the vallet to finally bring your car around. I'll definitely stay here again!This review is in regards to the hotel and hospitality staff.  I have not actually stayed at the Omni but my sister and I decided to bring our grandmother here to have dinner in their 1913 restaurant for her 100th birthday since the Omni was also celebrating their 100th birthday.  My sister contacted the restaurant to make a dinner reservation and see if we could bring in balloons and possibly a cake, and was fortunate enough to speak with Stanton Jacobs, the Director of Sales and Marketing.  Stanton arranged what ended up being an unforgettable 100th Birthday dinner for our grandmother and family.  He asked for some ideas about the foods that Grandma would like and also asked for some pictures of her when she was younger.  We had no idea what was in store for us.  When we arrived, Stanton, plus the Omni GM and hotel staff were there to greet us at the door.  We also surprised Grandma by having our dad (her son) and his wife there.  The welcome to the hotel was the first of many tears from Grandma.  Then Stanton told us that he was going to give us a short tour of the hotel...he walked us around to the Ballroom/reception area where he presented us with a private table under the original, 1913 chandelier with our own private piano player.  The table was set with framed photos of Grandma and her husband.  Cry #2.  The table was beautifully set...pink (Grandma's favorite color) with more forks than most of my family had ever seen.  The wait staff all warmly introduced themselves and then the chef came out to talk with us.  He had prepared a special "Ethel Lindsey's 100th Birthday Dinner" menu and we were each presented with the leather bound menu signed by Chef Vinny (to keep).  The menu included grandma's favorite foods - deviled eggs, mustard greens, filet mignon, sugar cream pie, etc....all done gourmet style and served in courses (thus the numerous forks!).  They served us champagne and wine and catered to our every need.  Then, after all the courses had been served, they wheeled out a special 2-tier birthday cake.  Grandma said repeatedly that she had never had a nicer/fancier dinner in her life.  She felt like a queen.  Stanton has also arranged for the Mayor to be there but unfortunately he was called away last minute...but the mayor still sent over an official Congratulatory document for presentation.  They didn't rush us and allowed us to enjoy ourselves and the evening at our leisure.  The entire staff made Grandma feel like a queen...including Carla, our waitress.  We were there on May 10th which is Mother's Day in Mexico and also her day off...but she said when she heard about Grandma, she wanted to come in and be a part of the celebration.  To top all of this off, they took care of the entire bill.Grandma Lindsey was glowing that whole evening...I haven't seen her that happy in a long time.  Stanton and the Omni staff made Grandma feel as special and she really is...and we can't thank him enough.  We had no idea that they were going to do all of this for us and couldn't have imagined it on our own.  I would definitely use the Omni for any event I was scheduling in Indianapolis.  Bravo to Stanton and his team!!This place was absolutely beautiful.  I love staying in nice hotels when I travel though I rarely get to afford such a luxury.  My husband treated me to a nice anniversary weekend so it was nice to stay in a hotel so close to everything going on around town.I was a bit surprised they didn't offer a free breakfast or free internet.  If you are paying so much for a hotel room, you'd think there would be some sort of incentive.  It didn't really matter to us because we didn't need internet and we slept past breakfast time anyway, but I found it odd and felt the need to put that in my review.  We stayed in our room two nights but never had maid service the whole time.  Perhaps the maid came by at the exact time when our "Private" sign was on the door knob and just never came back by at the right time, but I would have really liked it if someone would have emptied our garbage cans, haha.  I can't fault anyone for this though because I'm sure it was simply a matter of bad timing.  Overall we had a great experience here.  I felt like the staff tried very hard to accommodate their guests, which is exactly what you want when you travel.  Given the amount of people in town for the FFA convention and Halloween, we weren't overwhelmed by hoards of people while inside the hotel.We stayed just one night for a wedding in downtown Indy. The hotel was nice. The room seemed kind of small overall with a sitting chair placed awkwardly between the bed and window. The bathroom was a good size though. One thing we found weird was the toilet was like an industrial toilet found at businesses with the flusher behind the lid if you were sitting down.Anywho, the hotel location is convenient to plenty of places to eat and enjoy including the mall and Lucas Oil Stadium. It was a 4 star based on the reasonable wedding group rate we paid.For the better part of last week, the Omni was my home away from home while in Indy. And not just me- I'm a high school debate coach and had 6 teenage boys with me, there to compete at Nationals. In fact, the whole hotel was taken over by debate (God bless the saintly patience of the staff and other patrons), but it was still a fabulous experience.The location of the Omni is wonderful! It's convenient to everything, but tucked away in a nice little quiet corner. I LOVED the old Union Station across the street- watching it light up in the sunset really was spectacularly beautiful. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful, from the valet, to the concierge, to the front desk staff, everyone was wonderful. The room was lovely, VERY well appointed and comfortable.I feel like this is a terrible review, because I have nothing but praise to sing. . . but seriously! Stay at the Omni! It was great.We loved the hotel and the staff was amazing. Parking was a pain but the location was fantastic. We will stay here anytime we visit Indy.Very nice hotel.. I have been there twice and they always work to make your stay a pleasant one.. Make sure you become a member so you can get all the perks available... On the down side they don't have a parking lot however they have valet service.I can not say enough nice things about the Omni. As a local my wife and I have stayed there on a few occasions.This time we decided to do the whole thing and try as much of what they had to offer as possible.First, its location is perfect if you want to see a lot of downtown. As a bonus you do not even have to go OUTSIDE for a lot of it. The connection to Circle Center Mall makes shopping and getting to other areas in bad weather a snap.We used it to go see a movie at the mall and to do some window shopping. But its only a short walk to the Convention center and a host of other places downtown.The staff is GREAT, from the moment you arrive they greet you and want to make sure you are taken care of. We arrived very early on a Friday morning because I had a 9 AM meeting. The front desk made sure to get my wife into a room a soon as possible. The rooms are nice and vary in size. This time we got a smaller king room with a small bathroom, but we do not care as long as the bed is comfortable and the Omni has some of the best beds we have ever slept in, We had breakfast at the restaurant on Saturday morning and although it was a little pricey, ($40 for two) it was delicious and served with a smile. Later that night after dinner we returned to the Hotel to avoid the St. Patrick craziness and had a few drinks in the Severin Bar. The staff was great and treated us like old friends. They even let my wife try some new drinks they were making. The manager even stopped and spoke with us to make sure we were being well taken care of. All in all a great experience as are others have been. There are only a couple of things to keep in mind. 1. The elevators can run FAST when its quiet and VERY SLOW when they are busy. But DO NOT try the stairs as they do not go into the lobby !!2. This is a PET FRIENDLY hotel. But you would never notice until you see a cute dog in the lobby. 3. Valet parking is pricey, ask about where to park nearby like the Mall parking garages.4. Sign up for the Select Guest Program. You will not regret it !! Its FREE and if nothing else it gets you WiFi at no cost.5. There are NO MICROWAVES in the rooms. But there are way to may places to eat on the cheap nearby . Note we actually watched a couple carry a full size microwave OUT of the hotel ?!!6. Do not forget to tip, these folks work hard for you !I did not stay here, I came here for an event in the ballroom.  Although I did not pay for the event, I was an attendee here are my thoughts:1.  The food portions were very small and the food itself was not the best I have ever had.2.  The room was beautiful3.  The set up was amazing.  As well as the flow and layout of the event.  What I would mention is that the host should put up signage to direct people to the bar at the beginning of the event.  We did not know where our event was, we did not know that a full bar and appetizers were being served on the second floor of the ballroom until someone told us.  It was a little scattered and disorganized.  We had the chicken and the portion size and quality was mediocre at best.Overall I would really examine the food options before blindly booking your event here.Stayed here for a week for a work conference.  The staff was absolutely amazing!  They went above and beyond the call of duty.  Special shout out to Amanda (Meeting coordinator?) and "Big" Joe in Party/Events.  Joe and other staff members helped us carry many random, HEAVY, and awkward pieces of equipment up the stairs for our meeting.  I also think Omni has one of the best Rewards accounts.Bar/Restaurant - Surprisingly good food.  Had a burger and club sandwich.  Staff was great on both occasionsHotel - Facilities were great - nice looking, well maintained not once did I find anything not working properly during my week stay.  It's an old building, but it did not feel old to me.Room - Great!  Clean. Comfy robes. Great pillows and comfy bed.  nice furniture in the rooms.  Catering for our meetings was decent (I'm very picky)  Service was great!Not my best experience at the Omni but still better than most. I know it was game day but 2 hours to get my car from valet parking!?!This hotel in no way lives up to the expectations I have of the Omni chain, and will actually make me think twice before seeking out the chain again. I stayed here for two nights for work about 2 weeks ago. It had the look and feel of a cheesier chain like Embassy Suites, but that was the least of my concern when I found upon checking into my room that there was a pile of dirty, used towels behind the door in the bathroom. I can understand hotel housekeeping missing an errant hair every now and then, but a pile of dirty towels is unacceptable. The management moved me to another room, but as I didn't get in until late this just felt like an arduous, obnoxious process. The second room was fine. That's as far as I will go. The furniture is old and heavy, and while this is going to sound more snobby than I intend it, there was a boxy tube TV in the room. Yes, it functioned just fine, but you don't expect that at a luxury hotel chain. The internet is also expensive which is annoying when you're already paying more to stay at what you think is a nice hotel. Finally, the restaurant was decent but by no means memorable. The one highlight was the little cafe where it was easy to get breakfast to go, and I also got a great sandwich for dinner later.This is, by far, the WORST Omni I have ever stayed in! It's been 5 years since I've stayed at this particular Omni, and I don't believe they've updated, or cleaned the guest rooms since then either. Yuck!I was in town for the Colts game, and this was the ONLY hotel that had availability. Actually, I was told that the room we booked was the last King, non-smoking available. Who knows? Upon check-in, we changed clothes in our mini room, that would even be inferior in size to a pair of midgets---oh, sorry, "little people." Then, I washed my face in our tiny, dirty bathroom. I guess they were short of staff in the housekeeping department this past week.Now that wifey & I were so amused by the filthy accommodations, what was our next course of action? Take a guess! Yep, you're right; we went straight to the bar! The Omni has two bars---one is a filthy lobby bar with an ignorant, dumbass female bartender that doesn't even look as though she's 21. The sign that is posted IN the Omni, clearly states, " 16 ounce Miller Lite $3." I asked for one. Dumb bartender {look of confusion} claimed that there was no sign that stated this? I offered to walk her over and point it out to her, but I didn't have the patience. I opted for the $5 Miller Lite bottle. Chug-a-lug, and I was outta there! When checking out the following morning, we gave the Valet a 20 minute notice to get our vehicle. When we walked into the insanely crowded lobby (Colts fans galore) and to the Valet counter, we were informed that it would be another 20 minutes, as there were clearly at least 12-15 car keys in front of our's. Another 45 minutes later, our car arrives. I have NEVER had to wait over an hour to get my car out of Valet! NO EXCUSE! On game days, the Omni needs to be fully staffed! Thankfully, we were able to make it to the game on time.2 STARS: 1 star for the convenient location + 1 star for the low rate$First off let's get the good out of the way: The Omni's location is a plus if you have any business downtown and is only a few short blocks from the Lucas Oil Dome.Now to the negatives:  This particular Omni is a joke. Be aware of the outrageous hidden fees they will charge. $27/night for valet parking, $25/night for a roll away bed, $13/night for internet and the worst charge ever...$25 receiving fee for packages sent to the hotel.  I travel as part of a professional racing team, and we usually stay at a Courtyard or Residence Inn, but our trip to Indy brought us to the Omni.  When you walk in you feel like royalty with how the lobby looks. That quickly goes away when you see how small and outdated the rooms are. The bathrooms are nice with the tiled marble, but very small.  The beds are comfortable, though.I wouldn't recommend this Omni unless it is your last resort. For the price you would expect way more than a glorified Ramada.Great service!  My reservation was accidentally canceled but they got me in then overbooked!  Wonderfully friendly staff. Four stars as the room is nice but not great. I'd definitely come back though.We stayed for one night and were very disappointed in the room and incidentals. The room air conditioning could not get the temperature under about 73 degrees, so sleeping was a problem. The TV remote worked only sporadically. Unlike just about any other hotel of any level, Internet WiFi was not included with the room. These days, for a hotel which presumes to accommodate business travelers, WiFi should be considered as integral a part of the room as towels, but they charge $10 per night. Amazing, especially when the reliability and speed of what is offered is very low end, not sufficient for efficient work tasks. We ordered room service, which was not too bad, but certainly below par. Don't expect to get your car from valet parking in under 20 to 30 minutes, even without a heavy load of requesters. Very disappointing, we won't be back, and we suggest looking and better options readily available in the area. If this hotel was once acceptable, things haver certainly taken a turn for the worse.The location is good to the mall and the downtown restaurants but the interior decor needs updating. I've stayed here 2-3 times over the last 2 years (employer hotel preference not mine) and each time it has been something else. On my most recent visit the shower / tub where in bad shape. I guess I expect more out of a hotel than continuously have problems or not the cleanest of rooms.Location is ideal for all thats happening in dwntwn Indy- the colts, pacers, shopping, dining, clubbing but the hotel leaves less then desired feeling even if the rooms are big. There is a cold feeling and the decor is ok. Not the grand feeling one is used to from the omni chainUpon sitting down to write this review, I originally planned on giving it 4 stars.  On the surface, everything at the Omni was great.  The room was pretty clean, we were able to check in right away, and the price was fairly decent, as we had a group rate for a wedding.  Then I remembered, our toilet was broken for 2 out of the 3 days we were there, and we had to use the toilet in the lobby.  We waited 20 minutes to have the car valet parked.  The bar in the lobby was less than inviting and was fairly expensive.  If you happen to be in Indy, you could probably do better.I met my family in Indy for a quick weekend last month.  My mom found the Omni on hotwire.  After reading the bad reviews, I considered staying somewhere else on my own.  I'm a huge fan of staying in hotels, and, well...whatever.  But my mom woulda been all pissed off at me for being a snob, so I sucked it up and stayed with them.  The hotel was beautiful!   And very clean, they are in the middle of renovating, so maybe the previous reviews were dated?  The hotel was great, very clean and we had a big bathtub.  There were fees for everything, like parking, but you expect that at all of the upscale hotels.  Nothing is free.  And my sister and I went to the bar across the street and washed up, drug addicted, 80's one hit wonder Henry Lee Summer was performing.  But that's a story for another time.
review_content_80: Omni, We need to talk. You swept me off my feet with your great location and reputation. I was so excited to have my friends and family meet you at the wedding reception. I know that an average sized wedding can be a little intimidating but I really don't feel how you acted was fair. I mean, the rooms were booked months in advance with a 3pm check in, and when we got there at 5pm they were still dirty. Your "buddy" at the front desk wasn't very helpful either. Granted he did finally offer a drink coupon for the inconvenience of waiting an extra 45 minutes for our room to be cleaned, but they way you talked up the staff, I just expected more. I can overlook my room not being ready, but when you messed up the room of the parents of the bride, my parents, my cousins and my friends from Chicago, I started to have second thoughts about us. Maybe we moved too fast.Were you upset because I chose to valet the car? I told you I am no good with directions and I do not regret paying to park because they couldn't tell us how to get to the back lot. Pointing at a building and saying "thatta way" doesn't count. No. It doesn't. And it most certainly is not a reason to give people faulty key cards so they can't get into their rooms. Listen, I am trying to be fair. I know there were things out of your control. I know you had no idea that there would be a million cheerleaders in town that weekend wreaking havoc on the elevators. Or that you would not have hot water on any floor above three for a good few hours... Take care of yourself Omni. I just don't think it's going to work. I've met someone who knows how to treat a girl. His name is Conrad.Great hotel. Reliable wireless internet, very spacious room, very good lighting. I spent five nights here for a convention and was very impressed. I'd definitely stay here again.The people I was working for reserved this hotel for Indy and made it sound to be one of the top places to stay in INDY. Perhaps that's why I was disappointed?The rooms were small to standard size. I felt crowded between my boyfriend and our stuff. Could of used a lil more room. The pillow cases and blankets looked but did not smell clean. YIKES. Bathroom was a bit small for my taste with a tiny tub. Bummed because the long days at the track required baths to help my feet recover from being in heels all day.Room service charges were a lil much. Automatic 20% gratuity charge applied if you take the $4.00 bag of m&ms.The tv was an average old school tv with poor quality. I literally couldn't read some of the titles of the movies selections to rent-fortunately the movie/show quality was better.I'm happy it was quiet-last years stay was a nightmare because of noise. It was comfortable but nothing special. They try their best but sorry champagne in the lobby isn't gonna do anything to change the room which is the most important part.My stay at the Omni was death by a thousand cuts. Stressed out staff, rooms not ready at 5pm, dirty laundry in the halls way past 5pm, small rooms, key cards not working, valet staff not helpful in directing us to self-parking (be forewarned, if you from out of town and don't know where to go for parking - valet parking is $25 a day)... I think you're getting the picture. On the plus side... beds were comfy and the location is downtown. Never again, Omni.Recently attended a wedding here...5 stars for the wedding set up, the wedding, the atmosphere, the valet parking1 star for the bartender "bill" who carded me (which I left my id in my valet parked car) and was a complete asshole... let me start by saying, I hate children who under age drink, you are waste to society.. I am 24 years old and look older than that thanks to smoking and drinking. YOU don't have to be a prick about. I am in the industry, I understand carding people, no problem... no id no alcohol I was completely fine with that. I was not fine with him being a complete jerk, I made a joke about my mom was with me and I am sure she would vouch for me, he proceeded to let me know that he would take away my parties alcohol if that were to happen... ok buddy. But get this, he serves both of my YOUNGER sisters without carding them?So the bartender next to him was not carded, I got in his line, ordered a glass of wine and was served. x2. There you go Bill.Planning a conference trip is always an exercise in anxiety for me, knowing how much money I'm going to need to spend on conference registration, sub-par food, ridiculous hotel prices, and outrageous airfares. Since I was going to be chilling in downtown Indianapolis by myself, the conference $130-160 hotel rates were pretty steep. I decided to try Priceline.com just for the heckuvit. Cha-ching! Four nights at the Omni Severin, one of the conference hotels, for $87/night!Upon arrival at the airport, I took the "Indy Go" (cute name) Green Line shuttle, which provides express service to downtown hotels for $7. The Omni was the shuttle's first stop. Prepared to get stuck in an $87 second-story closet over the boiler room/kitchen/bar, or next to a construction site, I was happily surprised to be placed on the 8th floor, in a room with a bit of a view, room to walk around, and a cozy king-size bed. A good friend stayed in the same hotel, had to pay the regular rates, and wasn't so lucky, getting a queen size bed in a much smaller room. If you find this piece of info helpful for upcoming reservations, #855 was the bigger room, and #422 was the smaller one.The bathroom was immaculately clean, and my only peeve was leaky faucets, forcing me to relocate all my toiletries to keep them dry. I did report the faucet problem, so hopefully someone will fix them. I did not use the room service, but the typical $10 bagel and juice, among other expensive breakfast options, were advertised on the nightstand. Skip that, give yourself extra time in the morning, and walk 15 minutes to Cafe Patachou on, I think, Capitol and Washington. There was a tempting tray of goodies on the desk, but $3.50 for a Clif Nectar bar kept me away. Glad I stuffed some Trader Joe's dried fruit & nuts in my bag before I left home. If you're looking for snack food, there's a CVS drugstore at 105 E. Ohio, about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. A coffee pot, along with caffeinated and decaf Wolfgang Puck coffee are in the room. A nice touch were the paper cups with lids, so I could take my beverage with me on my way out. Weekday copies of USA Today newspaper were also waiting outside my door every morning.The Omni also provides wi-fi service. Upon trying to go online, the default splash page provides three choices for access, one of which includes a $9.95 per day charge, and the other two read as if you need to pay for a membership to get the wi-fi. I called "Blake" at the front desk, and the good man told me if I selected the second option on the page, I wouldn't have to pay. I did select the second option, didn't pay, and wasn't billed. Staff were very friendly, and always had answers to my questions.Check-out was a breeze, and the Indy-Go Green Line airport shuttle stop was located across the street, past the valet service.I have stayed in other Omni's and by far this is the best. As an Elite member of the rewards club you expect certain thing to go without a which at this chain of hotels and the Omni Severin exceeds the standard. Their staff is some of the best most attention to detail personnel I have ever been help by. Especially Carly who went above and beyond her work duties to ensure that all guest were well accommodated. If I am ever back in Indy I will defiantly be staying here again. My coworkers where just as impressed with the hotel despite the fact that they aren't even members of the rewards club. They will also be staying in Omni's in the future.They made it all easy - circle drive, the baggage handlers, the concierge, valets - even with our then four-month-old baby, we moved about with total ease. The room was large and our older one had plenty of room to play on the floor and run around. Great wi-fi service. Nice pool. And best of all, water pressure in the shower that beat us senseless.It's in an area with a lot of conference activity, so plenty of restaurants, shopping and entertainment a short walk away.Stayed here for 4 nights on a recent business trip. The location is right downtown, close to restaurants, the convention center, the new Colts stadium, the Capital building and more. Limo ride (shared) from the airport ran about $13 plus tip and took about 10-15 minutes.The room I stayed in was a nice size and very clean. King bed, work desk with lamp, tv (older tube type, not flat screen), chair with ottoman. The bathroom was nice sized and my faucet leaked on the cold water side whether on or off.
