I must have been in a basketball player's room because the tub was sunk about 6 inches in the floor and the shower head was on an extension rod and was about 6 inches above my head at 6-ft 1-in.I didn't eat at the restaurant, Hot Tuna. I did have a couple of drinks at the bar next to Hot Tuna and had breakfast daily at the 40 West coffee bar. Beware - it's pretty busy at 40 West with the breakfast rush between 8 and 9 AM.Our rate was $99/night.I stayed at this hotel for two nights 3/28-3/30 and had a great time. The linens were clean and the staff was friendly. I had meetings at the Hyatt down the street and didn't even have to walk outside to get there because of the indoor walk way system of downtown Indy. It's in a great location where there is quite a bit of nightlife and the bartenders at the hotel are really friendly and professional. I would stay at this establishment again. They are going through some renovations but I didn't feel as though it hindered my sleep at all. The work seemed to be done during the business day when you're most likely working.This hotel is in a great location and attached to the Circle Center Mall and all the other hotels and convention center downtown (I was here for a conference).Rooms are large and the bed is super cozy. If you join their member network, you receive complimentary hot beverages in the morning and free wireless internet, along with other rewards. Staff was friendly and accomodating and the hotel is in good shape, and very clean.My big issue was the food - it just was so sub-par. Room service should be a treat... not something that gives you indigestion.Despite my mixed feelings I do not believe I would stay here again.I had the pleasure of staying for about a week at the Omni, it just so happened that the NCAA finals were in town that week which made for a very cool experience. From the onset the management and staff at the Omni made sure my stay was fantastic. I received a nice welcome note from the manager as well as some snacks and aqua upon check in. The staff were attentive in every respect for the entire stay. The lobby offered a nice relaxing place to catch a game, cocktail and snack. There is a martini bar across from the lobby bar as well, wish I had found that gem earlier as it offers a quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle of the lobby. The rooms were well appointed, although my 19" tv was a bit outdated and far from the bed, good thing I've got 20/20 ;-) Great place, GREAT location near lots of bars, restaurants and shopping.The Omni Severin in the heart of downtown Indy has a great location, friendly and helpful staff and is my home away from home when visiting Indy. I enjoy getting out and walking around the center of this beautiful city and can do so easily from here. The rooms are clean and functional. The lobby is open, friendly, and functional. I'll be back the next time I'm up there for business or pleasureI had my out of town guests and wedding party stay here. My husband and I even reserved a room for our wedding night before we left for our honeymoon. They gave me a great rate for guests to reserve a room. They had a block of rooms set aside for people to reserve by a particular date. On my wedding day they held ours and our wedding parties luggage until we checked in after the wedding. As we arrived that night they all checked us in without a problem. However, I had a little prank pulled on me. Still not sure who set this up but they played along with it. When I got to our room, I saw it was a basic room. I was really sad and called downstairs to ask what happened. They said they gave away our room on accident but would clean one up quickly because someone checked out early. So I sat in this room for 15 mins, still confused as to what happened. I get a knock at the door and it was the women who checked us all in. She said, come on let me take you to your real room. When we arrived to the room it said presidential suite. She then said congratulations and enjoy your stay. I went into the room to find the entire wedding party in our room to continue with an after party. I screamed to see how awesome that room was AND to have my friends sharing that moment with me. Later I was informed they put me in the regular room to keep me occupied until my party got to the room to surprise me. The Omni upgraded us to the presidential suite from the suite we reserved because it was our wedding night. We all had great views from the balcony and enjoyed having a few drinks until I kicked everyone out. :o) lol. Fabulous hotel, friendly staff and great location downtown.I stayed here on a weekly basis for over 6 months. The staff was wonderful and made every effort to make it feel like my home away from home. You can't ask for better service.Gorgeous hotel. Connected to the mall so it's one of the more expensive hotels which wasn't a problem for me. My back is killing me right now though. The mattress felt hard as a rock. I didn't sleep well at all and when I lifted the sheets to look it looked cheap and old. I thought hotels were suppose to constantly update their mattresses. I complained when I first checked in and nothing was done. No one even knew what brand the mattress was. I complained as I checked out this morning too and the gentleman at the front desk said he would send up housekeeping to check it out. What can housekeeping do?! As much as I would like to make this hotel my go to hotel when I visit Indy, I'll pass and unless you like horrible mattresses you should too!!!!My wife and I just returned from a New Year's Eve French Kiss package stay at the Omni Severin and it is safe to say they have the friendliest staff of any hotel we have ever visited. Although attentiveness is often the norm with this caliber of hotel, the Omni Severin was a standout for the overall sincerity of its staff. From management to front desk personnel to wait staff to the valet team, their genuine interest in feedback and the proactive way they sought it out made us feel truly welcome and valued. My wife and I felt so engaged and were given such special consideration, particularly by Massey, the Food and Beverage Manager that we can't wait to come back even if just for the good will that their evident standard of true service inspired.Of course the rooms were clean and comfortable in the four star tradition in terms of decor and crisp, white sheets on a king sized bed and all the toiletries in a sizeable bathroom. And my wife certainly appreciated the walk-in closet complete with robes for two, but the Severin proved to offer a lot more than simply an ideal, pristine space to sleep. When my wife and I arrived for New Year's Eve dinner in the gorgeously ornate Severin Lobby and Ballroom, we felt even more pampered than we could have anticipated after check in. Worthy of particular notice is the chef, Anthony Armstrong, for his delicious French cuisine that was spotlighted at our NYE celebration. There was a warm sense of community among all the patrons as the emceed event included a short speech by Anthony regarding his sojourn among the French countryside and palate which we all savored heartily in both liquid and solid form. My favorites were the brie pastries with jam, though the entire meal was a formidable treat. Although we all got a small bottle of champagne with the meal, one miniscule suggestion would be to have included at least one complimentary glass of red or white wine with the dinner as it was French themed in the package. We'd of course have been willing to have paid more if added to the package total up front so we wouldn't have to worry about additional transactions later, but this was such a comparatively minor issue compared to the overall experience which was nothing short of spectacular.Before and after the meal, we enjoyed music and an open bar in the ballroom which was an elegant, gorgeous venue for the traditional New Year's Eve countdown. Although the ambiance was thankfully a far cry from the cramped and noisy club and DJ scene we had already grown tired of, the Severin did add some trendy twists with a melange of Franco-American movies on widescreen accompanied by a musical guitar/bongo duo playing classic rock fare in offbeat lounge renditions. Occasionally, I'd hear the first half of a soulful acoustic ballad only to realize later we were listening to none other than Jimi Hendrix's All Along the Watchtower so the hotel entertainment staff deserves kudos for some courageous yet original choices that probably would have struck fear in the hearts of less dynamic hotels.So we counted down to the New Year with more complimentary champagne, more music, good company, party favors, even a garter belt lottery for a free trip to Vegas and by the time 2009 was in its early stages we were ready to head back to our comfy room. The next morning, also included, was a buffet breakfast in the Hot Tuna restaurant. I suppose the Severin could have settled for a standard buffet or continental breakfast with the package, but the spread was replete with fresh fruit, unimaginably light and sweet pastries, bagels, cereal, cheeses, cold cuts, and all the hot breakfast items including personalized omelets which you must absolutely try with the spiced, ground sausage if you are so prone. After being more than sated in the belly, the checkout was so fast and effortless with the pleasant last impressions rivaled only by the first, we started asking ourselves why in the heck we were leaving anyway. Well, we'll be back soon. They've got our email address for the next event. Hmmm, maybe Valentine's Day?Great location since it's connected to the mall with a LOT of shopping plus it's right down the street from 2 clubs (like 0.1 miles walking distance). Can't get better than that. The rooms are clean and the customer service desk is helpful. They will make it right if it is not right and even comped my room twice. There is also a bar downstairs, but I have never bothered to drink there since I go to Tiki Bob's or Have a nice day cafe instead. They have valet parking which can be a good thing or bad thing depending on your point of view. The fee for valet is about $20 a day though. Parking is a bish to find otherwise. The only downside is that the building is older and no lcd tv's.What a beautiful place. Great service, comfortable room and beds. And....I got it through Priceline. My best deal yet.

review_content: The Westin Indianapolis is especially convenient and literally connected via a bridge to the Indianapolis Convention Center. The hotel is also convenient to the rest of downtown, so, if you are a convention-goer like I was, the Westin is a pricy, but worthy option. There isn't a hotel shuttle to/from the airport; however, when I called they recommended an inexpensive shared shuttle service that worked out ok. Once I arrived at the hotel check-in was a snap. In the lobby is plenty of space to meet, hangout or use a computer.My room was outstanding. It was the large wrap-around Directors Suite on the upper floor at the end of the hall with 3 huge windows offering a beautiful view of the city and Lucas Oil Stadium. Two TVs made it perfect for watching basketball on one screen and football on the other while the lounge area really made it easy to relax. The amenities in the bathroom were just ok. The king-size bed was fine, too.Without hesitation, I'd choose the Westin Indianapolis again when attending a show or conference thanks to its convenient and connection to the Convention Center and downtown Indy.Pros: Great location! Next to Convention Center, walking distance to Lucas Oil Stadium (you can actually walk to it using the Convention Center skywalk and go through the convention center without ever going outside to get to the stadium), next to Capital building, walking distance to the Civil War memorial, and not too far from Bankers Life fieldhouse (where the Pacers play).Cons: Musty & stale smelling room, windows can't be opened to let in fresh air, missing mirror in restroom, broken faucet handle. Sounded like there was a washing machine being run right above our room... THE ENTIRE NIGHT. So didn't get much sleep at all.Overall price we paid via HotelTonight was super cheap and location was really good. I think if we were shacked up in a better room my experience would have been a solid 4 star here for sure. Til next time!Summary: Location, Location, Location. This is a great hotel. It needs a few updates as the rooms are starting to feel a little bit worn out.  This isn't a huge concern yet, but within the next 12 - 24 months I predict it will start to show. This means that you can stay at a few other hotels in the city and have much newer rooms.Pros: Very comfortable and quiet.  Great location, you literally have a bridge connecting you to the convention center. Usually pretty good rates. Very large property. 24h access to executive lounge. Cons: Parking is EXPENSIVE. I'm talking $30+ a night. Rooms could use a moderate refresh, starting to feel a little old.Upscale, very nice place to stay, a lil expensive, but you get what you pay for. Valet parking is nice to use. Downtown and near everything, just a short walk away. Comfy beds, lots of pillows, good friendly service. All around nice place to stay when away from home.I was booked at the Westin for a trade show held here in Indy. Luckily for me, the trade show was literally a skywalk across from the hotel. But that's not a reason to give it 4.5 stars. As for anyone who reviews a hotel, there are 3 things that I'm sure everyone looks for that need to be on point: cleanliness, customer service/staff and their accommodability. That's why I'm giving it 4.5 stars.Cleanliness: 4 stars.Staff/Customer Service: 5 stars.Accomodability: 5 stars.The staff there is extremely welcoming and warm. They know how to treat their guests and always seem on their toes for service. My flight landed at 11 am and I was at the hotel by 12 pm. Although the check in wasn't until 3 pm, the front desk was kind enough to let me check in early without extra cost and gave me a $20 gift card to their Starbucks located inside the hotel. I had a wonderful experience and would totally recommend this hotel.Great because we got an awesome deal! Breakfast wasn't included but that was ok. Price seems to really fluctuate.Gym is huge! Pool area nice. A huge children's church function was going on here so that wasn't great. Kids swarmed the gym which I don't think is appropriate as well as the elevators. I waited for 3 cycles of elevators but all were full w/ kids so I took 11 flights of stairs instead!I treated my husband to a 24 hour trip to Indy for his birthday. I decided to stay at the Westin because of the positive reviews and reputation. We were pleased with our stay. When we checked in we only had to wait about 5 minutes. We parked in a garage adjacent to the hotel that cost $30/day. Once we got to our room we were pleased! Our room was on the 15th (top) floor so the views were beautiful and it was quiet. Our room was a king room although we both are convinced the bed size was only a queen. It was comfy though! Our room also had a couch, chair and ottomans along with a desk. Very spacious. The only thing that kept them from getting 5 stars was the communication. I booked the room through Visit Indy website because the price was better. I had to pre pay but that was fine. When I called their number one day prior to confirm I couldn't get in touch with the actual location but spoke with someone at a call center. He was nice and all but just couldn't answer all my questions. All and all we had a great visit. The hotel is in a great location and close to walk everywhere downtown. We would definitely return in the future!Stayed here for two nights last month. The hotel itself is very nice and modern, typical of any Westin. I arrived late at night and had no problem checking in immediately, which was a plus. However, during the early morning hours the water was completely shut off. I didn't raise the issue with management on the first night, but when it was still off on the second night I called the front desk to complain. The person I spoke with didn't seem surprised by the problem and offered the following solution: to switch rooms. It was about 2:30am. Obviously we didn't go this route. The following day I spoke with the front desk manager and she comped our 2 nights, which I felt was the right thing to do. We return home, and I see on my credit card statement that we were charged for 2 nights with the valet at $44 a night. We only used the valet one night. So I called to have this charge reversed, which they did promptly. Overall, without these issues, I would give this Westin 5 stars. However the problems we did experience made our stay less than stellar.I stayed Jan 2nd 2016. The staff was nice, check-in was a breeze. The room was clean. Nothing great about it. The bathroom was small but I liked the shower heads. The Westin is connected to almost everything worth doing in Downtown Indy by a walk way. Bring your walking shoes. The only "thing" I had was the parking!!! It was expensive for parking at a Hotel in Indy, $30 self park or $44 for valet. The walk with your clothes from the parking garage (self parking) to the room was weird for me.  We decided to stay only because it was for 1 night,  parking is $20ish for the Event we attended, we were with-in walking distance and I found a great deal for the room. So overall it was a very Nice stay. If I found the same great deal again, I'd stay again.We stayed here this past weekend for a bachelorette party. I'll say upfront, I hate downtown. Parking can be a nightmare, especially at hotels. We did miss the entrance which was a bit confusing and had to drive around the block. I had hubby drop me off, because, umm $30 for parking? No.The hotel is very nice however. The rooms were clean and newer, no nasty stuff going on. The bathroom had a cool rainfall shower head and the beds were super comfy. It's within walking distance of pretty much everything, which is really convenient. When we traipsed in past midnight with the wasted bride, the front desk staff didn't bat an eye thank god. I will say $250 a night is pretty steep though. We had a nice view in our room, but it wasn't a suite or anything crazy. A decent hotel experience, I'm just glad I didn't have to foot the bill!We booked a block here for our wedding Sept 2015. Everything went well- we had to ask our account/sales rep to increase the number of rooms a few times because guests couldn't book. The hotel staff is nice and the room was clean. My biggest problem was parking. $42/day to valet park in Indiana! Worst part was I wasn't aware it was so much for our guests until the week before the wedding. When I expressed how disappointed I was that I wasn't made aware before we reserved almost 40 rooms with them I was directed to their director of sales and marketing, Angie, who said that its "on our website" then told me, after I found that the Marriott (less than a mile away) could offer the same price for rooms and only $25/day for parking that she'd "be happy to cancel my block as their was no contractual obligation". Please tell more clearly that you don't want my business. I asked if vouchers were an option and I was told to call the garage. Terrible customer service and waste of time and frustration the week before my wedding. They didn't comp anything for all the frustration either. If it wasn't the week before I would have switched. Don't block rooms here unless you want your guests to pay an arm and a leg.Very comfortable beds, very clean rooms.The staff was very friendly and helpful.There's a Starbucks on level 1.The fitness center is nice, but the pool is small.The room itself was fine, nothing to really write about. What I struggle with is that this is a major convention destination hotel and the friggin Starbucks closes at 5pm?!?! WTF? Hundreds of people to give potential business and you close at 5? Moving on to the lack of a real bar. Shulas, the steakhouse on the 2nd floor, is their bar. A whopping 7 seats at the bar & the rest are all tables. How about opening a real BAR on the 1st floor where everyone is currently hanging out doing NOTHING. THINK REVENUE people! Convention folks like to spend $$$ and you act like you don't want their money! Huge empty lobby waiting for a bar to pour some booze, make it happen and watch the $$$ "pour" in.I stayed in the hotel Friday night and will be checking out Monday morning. The hotel's location is perfect. The hotel connects to the Skywalk, which connects to the convention center, mall, Lucas oil stadium, Marriott and Hyatt. The room was clean, but did have a strange odor. The hotel has a Starbucks, a gift shop and is connected to Shula's. Overall it was a great stay.I've stayed at this hotel five times over the past two years for business.  The Westin is one of my favorite hotel chains. The front desk staff are always pleasant and very efficient. I've always been pleased with the rooms I've stayed in.Comparing the Westin to other downtown hotels, it is a few blocks further from area restaurants, but it's still so close it's not a big deal. The only dining options are a Starbucks in the lobby and a Shula's. For breakfast, if you don't want Starbucks, the Shula's is fairly expensive ($17) and I have never been impressed with their buffet. I've also been to the bar and to Shula's in the evening, and while I love the Westin, given the prices at Shula's I recommend dining elsewhere. For breakfast, Cafe Patachou is just down the block and they have amazing coffee and breakfast. For dinner, there are so many great restaurants nearby or a quick cab ride away. Keep in mind that at Shula's the price you pay is just for the steak an doesn't include any sides. However, if you are traveling for business and get to expense all of your meals, it is convenient to eat there.The Westin is located in a great location, close to wherever you need to go in downtown Indy, very awesome for a girl who prefers walking everywhere like myself.The staff is fairly accommodating here (however if you need directions to a local place you are better off using your smartphone). Concierge is very friendly, they had to hold my bags for me because unfortunately there was no late checkout option. This, by the way, was very inconvenient for conference goers because checkout was at noon and the conference was not over until 2. Better planning for this is in order.The beds are comfortable, conference areas are large which was nice. This is a good place for an event or if you are visiting Indianapolis.From the moment we arrived, greeted by beautiful architecture i knew we'd chosen the right location. I forgot his name, but the gentleman who checked us in at the front desk was extremely courteous and helpful, not only with the hotel matters but also with directions to get around the city. He was an excellent example of how all hotel staff should treat a guest. Also, the gentleman who brought the room service we had ordered to us was very friendly and polite. I appreciated his warm personality. Our server at the Shula Steakhouse was helpful and efficient. We were in a rush to make it to our movie, yet the service was fast and we made it on time. The location of the hotel was phenomenal as we could walk to every restaurant and entertainment venture. We had an incredible stay and I cannot wait for the opportunity to stay here once again.So far a mirror was missing, there were towels for only 1 person, and the safe was left locked. We usually have good experiences at Westin hotels so we're hoping things go uphill. They seem to be responding to the problems promptly.You know what to expect when you stay at the Westin. I stayed here for a couple months for business and was pretty much always satisfied. The beds truly are heavenly as at any Westin. Super comfy. Once you lay down you'll be asleep almost instantly. The gym is good, there were always enough treadmills and ellipticals. There are a couple of weights and machines. The structure for dips and pullups is somehwat stupidly placed so there's no way to do pullups due to the height of machine and being just below the fire extinguisher (hurt my head on it).The downsides are the pillows which are totally flat and there's nothing to them. Honestly, I sometimes just slept on the bed with no pillows.A lot of people think the overhead rainfall shower is nice, but I'm not  such a fan. There's never enough water pressure and I just don't feel I get as good a shower as with conventional shower heads.The breakfast options are also somewhat minimal. The Sheraton has a much better breakfast spread for SPG members.Nevertheless, I'll be staying at the Westin when I'm back in Indy for work.I came here for the weekend for the Brickyard 400. Extremely convenient location. I was a 15 minute drive to the track and a 15 minute drive to the airport. Walking distance (two blocks) to the downtown area - mall, restaurants, bars and more. In terms of location, you can't get any better. I had a great stay as well. My room was clean and the AC worked fine. However, I did request for extra bottles of water to be left in my room and they took my tip and left me one extra bottle...nothing that couldn't be resolved by me asking the front desk. Everyone was super accommodating, the rooms were extremely clean and all in all I had a great experience. Would definitely stay here again.
review_content_20: I was impressed with the hotel when I first arrived & the security of the elevators. At first glance, the room was exceptionally clean & plush pillows, comforts, etc. I saw one thing that made me question everything...the free Disani water bottle. It must've been there from the previous customers because the seal was broken & it was half empty/full, but had the tag still around the cap. The one that tells u it's complementary. After that, I didn't want to touch anything. Good thing I wasn't a drunken mess...yet. I probably would have gulped it down & been the beginning of a zombie apocalypse.Other than that, I liked the location & it's attached to the convention center, that's attached to the mall & other hotels. It's only $10 to get to & from the airport using the GOShuttle.A huge king suite overlooking the Capital right in the middle of Naptown.  We wavered a bit on the hotels in Indy and went with the Westin.  No regrets at all.  We'd gladly stay here again if we were back in the area.  SPG club for afternoon snacks and brekkie and coffee.  Big gym and pool.  Remodeled hotel where we had a big corner suite.  Room included a huge lounge area with pullout couch and a great view.  The only modern touch they were missing was an radio where you could hook up your ipod and rock out, though they did have a few dedicated cell phone charging docks in the room.  Smack in the middle of town where we easily walked to the restaurants, bars and Lucas Oil Stadium to see Chelsea FC beat up on Inter.  Go you Blues!Great location. Disapointing customer service. Our room was 81 degrees because the air conditioning was broke. They tried to fix it 3 times when it couldn't be fixed they only offered Starbucks coupons.  Also our water was not working for like 2 hours very annoying to try to get ready with no running water. I will never recommend this hotel and will not stay here again. I get it things happen but for someone to take control of the situation is lazy costumer service.I've stayed at this Westin four or five times, and I like it. 1) It's clean and the staff is friendly. 2) the on-site steakhouse is a little overpriced for what it is, but there's some good food options within walking distance. 3) pretty good price for a centrally located Westin although 4) the valet parking cost is BS for Indianapolis. 5) the corner rooms have totally baller views of the Indiana state house, if you can get the upgrade.This is not the best Westin in the US or anything, but if you're in Indianapolis this is your best option by far. (Although there's a new Le Meridien opening later this year, and so that opinion is subject to revision.)Great location; great beds, great pool/fitness area, expensive parking and expensive wifi/wired.  This Westin is centrally located and within a couple of blocks to the mall, canal and restaurants.  If you know your way around the connected walkways, you probably do not even have to go out into the elements to reach any of the spots.  The beds are as they say: heavenly!!!  Our room was quite plain and average sized.  The pool, hot tub and fitness area are the best I have seen in many hotels.  The gym equipment is up to date and plentiful.  They also provide towels and water.  The pool and hot tub are clean and not overly chlorinated like they can be at some other hotels. The parking was expensive:  $35 to valet; $28 to self park.  Luckily the garage is directly underneath the hotel so we self parked with ease.  And yes, they charge for wire as well as wifi, except in the common areas.  We would return here if we found a great rate.Typical Westin.  That's not a bad thing, I will say that their parking garage situation is akin to highway robbery.  It's cheaper to park in Manhattan.  Rooms were nice, and the Shula's steakhouse looks quite appealing as well.  Overall, not a bad place to stay and the Hotwire rate was too good to pass up.The Indianapolis Westin is a great option for business people and tourists alike. They've recently redone all of the guest rooms, so most of the pictures you'll see for this business are actually outdated. All new carpet, wall paper, doors, locks, furniture, etc. The hotel has a modern feel, but the furnishings aren't so modern that it'll be outdated in a year. Of course, the beds are to die for, the rainfall shower heads are nice, and it's an overall nice place to stay. Then there's the fact that it's close to downtown and is connected via skywalks to the convention center and Circle Center mall. Many hotels are, so this isn't unique to the Westin, but is an added perk if you are deciding between here and the newer JW Marriott. I haven't been in a JW room, so I can't compare, but with the Westin renovation, I'm sure the room quality is close to equivalent. If you can handle the pricey rooms, this is definitely a great place to stay.I stayed here one night on a work trip, and all I can say is this place is not worth the money. It is in a great location, but there are plenty of other nicer hotels within a stone's throw. First, the room itself was pretty nice, but there were subtle problems throughout. This was not limited to a poorly draining bathroom sink, poor water pressure in the shower, and insufficient (meaning not ONE) plug-ins at the desk (where one would assume a computer, phone, etc. would need to be powered).Second, customer service was lacking. When I called down to find out where the gym was located (since the in-room guide failed to mention it) no one answered on multiple attempts to reach the front desk. Luckily the location was listed in the surprisingly slow elevators.Finally, the pricing of in-room dining was astronomical. I am fully aware that room service never comes on the cheap, but my dinner was over $60 (a salad and salmon entree), and breakfast hit $40 (for a typical two egg, toast, hashbrown deal). You can get higher quality just down the street at the Marriott, and their prices are more reasonable.Stayed here this past weekend during my visit to Indianapolis for the Colts vs Broncos game.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  I was able to check into my hotel room three hours earlier than the check in time. The lobby is nice and so were the rooms - honestly I didn't pay too much attention to detail because I was only there for one night.  So, I didn't check out any of the hotel amenities either.  What I absolutely loved about this hotel was the location!!! Right in the middle of downtown and about a block away from Lucas Oil Stadium.  It was perfect. I was able to walk everywhere I wanted. The airport shuttle drops off and picks up right across the hotel. (GoExpress Shuttle $10 each way)I wouldn't mind staying here again during my next visit to Indy for a football game!Stayed here for two nights.  First, the good - extremely convenient location to convention center.  No need to go outside, there's a walkway to the convention center.  The hotel is very nice and there's a top notch Shula's steakhouse on site.  I was on the 13th floor, and had a nice view.  Convenient proximity to several great restaurants.  Wonderful staff.  Complimentary Dasani water in my room.  This room had the best damn shower head I've ever used in any hotel room anywhere.  Now, the bad.  For $230 a night, I expected complimentary WiFi or at least wired internet.  Nope.  They charge for local calls!  Seriously?  It's a nice hotel.  They shouldn't nickel and dime people for stuff like that.  My room had both a mini bar and a mini fridge.  Neither worked.  The air conditioner cycled on and off every 30 seconds. Although there was complimentary shampoo, conditioner and body wash in the bathroom, it was not replenished the second night.  The bathroom is a tad small for a hotel room this nice/pricey.  I'd give it 5 stars, but they need to fix the maintenance issues with the room.  Even with the minor issues, I'd stay here again.It is really annoying when regular maintenance items are not taken care of/monitored the ac is not cooling properly and refrigerator is broken. The room was a lemon at every turn.The hotel was very inviting, centrally located, very clean and the hotel employees were all helpful and friendly. I was SO impressed with the service they provide for workout clothes/sneakers! If you forget them, or don't want to pack them, they will provide you with workout clothes and a pair of sneakers for use. I have never seen that offered before. The room was clean and inviting and the bed was incredibly comfortable. So much so, that my husband and I will probably end up purchasing one. The linens were perfect weight and I liked the bathrobe! My only very slight complaint was that there was only 1 robe. It would have been nice to have 2, but certainly not a deal breaker. I would recommend this hotel to any family member or friend staying in Indianapolis. We really enjoyed every moment of our stay!Great location, central to the mall, stores and restaurants downtown, the canal walk and Lucas Oil. The place is lovely. One of the more comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel (and certainly best pillows).Valet parking is more expensive that I expected, but they also totally washed my windshield before returning my car to me (so many bug guts...).The gift shop/necessities store had things I needed but had forgotten.There is a Starbucks on the first floor. And Shula's Steakshouse on the second floor provided good drinks and a nice breakfast buffet.I was baffled by a sign on the mirror in the bathroom advertising their service for, I guess, basically "renting" work out clothing and shoes. That's kind of cool....and kind of strange?My parents are Starwood Preferred members. In previous years for DCI finals, my dad and I stayed at the Sheraton. It isn't much further away, but I like the Westin much more.Nice room, comfy bed.  It would have been 4 stars, but they put us in a room next to the elevator on the 5th floor..  So all night long we could hear the elevator running- which made it impossible to sleep the first night- even with our white noise machine on. :( free breakfast was nice.This hotel if a winner. The staff is very nice and helpful. The location is wonderful and it has a covered pedestrian walkway to the convention center, which is convenient. I had a minor problem with the TV in my room. The engineer who came up was polite and knowledgable. Not only did he explain what was happening with the TV, he set my clock radio which had been blinking since I checked in. AND, because of the inconvenience, he sent me a handwritten note with a $40 room service credit plus $10 to spend at Starbucks in the lobby. Very generous and first class customer service.The room is large and the bed is super comfy. They leave a free bottle of water every day.I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.I don't know what is/was wrong with this place but the rooms are at issue. Including our janky toilet that you had to wiggle the handle to get it to stop from making that draining sound all night. Don't worry the story gets better...as in better for you to laugh at (our experience) because it starts off Creepy and it's not even Halloween. Service ok. The food service was above parLayout Functional but exiting from the elevator to go to your room or find a banquet/meeting room can be confusing like heck. Key card needed for all rooms above 3rd floor. Pictures posted for your viewing pleasure... muah :*Will write more later.I had a great experience at the Westin Indianapolis while attending the NTEA show.  First of all - great view with the corner room facing south and east. Second - the mgmt turned what could have been a downer into an overwhelming positive!  We had stopped by a winery on the way to Indianapolis and bought a couple wine glasses that looked much like the hotels (except ours had the winery name on them).  Housekeeping took one by mistake and it vanished into the depths of the unknown.  When the staff was unable to find the glass, they apparently drove to the winery and bought two more glasses AND a bottle of wine, placed the. On a silver platter with a very nice hand-written note from the mgmt.  Wow.  I didn't know that kind of attention to detail was available anymore!   Thanks Westin!I worked for a performance company during this past weekends NFL Scouting Combine, where our headquarters was located in this wonderful hotel. The staff was very friendly and highly accommodating. Regularly came by to make sure everything was okay and if we needed anything. Based on their hospitality alone, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to do a conference in downtown Indianapolis. It's connection to the Convention Center makes it very convenient, and there are plenty opportunities for dinning and entertainment within a 3 minute walk from the hotel.We couldn't be happier with this hotel!  The staff are very friendly and any request we have is handled very quickly.  The beds are very comfy and after an evening swim in the beautiful pool we both slept like rocks.  We also enjoyed the newly renovated bathrooms!  Very close to everything downtown.  Love it!Great customer service, spacious rooms, in room dining was reasonably priced except for the high gratuity that is automatically included. I asked for a wake up call and received 2 automated calls plus a personal call to make sure I was awake. Love the linens!
review_content_40: The night I checked in I actually had to have the concierge desk gentleman go find an employee after several minutes waiting at the front desk.  The reservation was a day off after I called to confirm the date prior as the actual check in night. Three nights in a row, my room thermostat has been broken. 78 degrees with humidity.  I have called several times and management has sent engineering to "fix it". Actually, they finally sent them the second day and after the second time I called back more than 30 minutes after the first call to figure out the hold up.  Engineering replaced a ridiculously dirty filter absolutely covered in dust and not locked or secured in any way. I had found the filter the day before, asked about it, and was blown off.   For a moment, cooler air blew for maybe an hour. After that the night was spent at 78 degrees with insane humidity. By night three they actually moved my room after I complained for a third time.  This was done without a single offer of a discount or other amenity typically offered when a hotel does not respond to a guest complaint after the first or even the second day.  The only positive was the gentleman from the concierge desk that was willing to go the extra mile for me in finding someone to check me in AND in changing my room.  I don't ever complain or write reviews on yelp, but this experience demanded it. I understand a mix up, but to ignore someone with thermostat issues for more than an acceptable time frame without changing the temp or arranging another option? Inexcusable.A very clean, business friendly hotel! I stayed at the Westin for a few days for the FDIC Fire Conference and man, did they treat us well! Hotel was conveniently located (and attached) to the Indianapolis Convention Center.  A cool overpass on the second floor brought you right to it. Beds were so comfy and rooms very spacious.  The bathroom could have been bigger and I wish it came with a fan, but oh well.. The shower head was strange and didn't have great pressure, but that isn't really important.  What's important is that the hotel was clean, friendly, and convenient.  I was able to print my boarding passes in the lobby, so that was a nice plus.  It was also nice that they accommodated a late checkout for me at no extra charge.  The indoor pool and hot tub/fitness area were also very nice! Elevator was very fast and kinda made me dizzy, but maybe that's just me. Overall a nice experience and I will be sure to return the next time I'm in Indy.I felt a little bit like Beyonce when the nice front desk manager awarded me a free upgrade to a suite...so on my way to the elevators at The Westin I was pop & lockin' to Upgrade U in my head. Too much info? Maybe. Maybe not. I bet you would pop and lock to the room I entered into. That being said, the suites at this Westin are sweet - incredibly spacious with a full front room, complete with a flat screen LG TV, couch, chair, desk, etc. The bedroom was euqally as nice with the famed heavenly bed, nice view of Lucas Oil Stadium and another desk and LG TV. More than enough space for me and adequate layout to get plenty of work done...or veg out and watch TV on either of the screens.The bathroom leaves a lot to be desired, though. While I dig the dual shower heads, the tub was quite small, the water lever finicky and the toilet ran for quite some time after each use. Not a huge deal, but a few things to nitpick over. One other item worth noting about the suite - limited outlets! There were few, if any, near the desks, and no accessible outlets near the nightstands. But, lo and behold, there's one by the couch in the sitting. Well, riddle me that.Other items of note:Room Service: The staff is super friendly and efficient...and they let me order off the kids' menu every time. Why pay $10+ for a Caesar salad from the main menu when the kids' version costs just $4?! As always, prepare yourself for a steep 22% delivery/gratuity. Gym: Decently sized with a fair number of cardio machines and free weights. The pool is connected to it, too. Parking: Is $32 per day. Seems pretty pricey...! WiFi: "Nominal" daily fee of $9.95 per day in your room. Again, seems a little pricey, but I had a wireless card, so I didn't experience it firsthand.Starbucks: In the lobby! Talk about convenient. And this particular Starbucks is staffed by some of the sweetest, most friendly baristas I've ever encountered. Extras: For each day you choose not to have your room cleaned/serviced, you earn a $5 food voucher to a participating restaurant within the hotel. And that includes the above Starbucks! Just put the "green" tag on your door.I stayed here while attending a work related conference.  It was great because they were connected via skywalk to the convention center, Circle Center mall and other hotels.  I absolutely LOVED this aspect of the hotel since I had my 18 month old with me as well as my husband.  If it got too cold, we were able to walk over to dinner or the mall via skywalk. The service at the hotel was awesome.  Everyone was so helpful.  They also have a Starbucks in the hotel lobby which in my opinion closed a little too early since I like to grab my ice teas during all hours of the day.  They also have a FedEx facility which was so helpful when I had to ship a few personal items back home.  Would definitely stay at this hotel again if I'm in the area for a conference.I was very happy with my stay at the Westin.  I was travelling with my dog and they were very accomodating for him.  The hotel floor we were on was very quiet and had a great view overlooking the government buildings.  There is a nicely manicured lawn area in front of it and the Simon building that was nice to walk around as well.I stayed here this last fall and it was very nice.  I enjoyed the flavored water they offered you as soon as you walked in the entrance. The service at the front desk was quick and the staff were very knowledgeable on the restaurants/attractions in the downtown area.  They could give us very clear instructions to the mall.My only complaint about the hotel was that the toilet kept running.  I called the front desk and was told they were not sure when a staff person could come to address the issue.  I went to the gift shop and looked around and when I came back the issue was resolved.I would stay at this hotel again!By far the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in. The room was immaculately cleaned & the service was amazing! The concierge was extremely helpful when we asked questions as well.  I would say the only flaw was the inability to go up the stairs. There is no key pad in the stairwell to let u on your floor. So if you go up the stairs you can't get to your room.My hubby and I decided very last minute yesterday that we wanted to make it a night out downtown to visit Super Bowl Village and take in 14 West for our upcoming anniversary. Scored the Westin for $80 on hotwire same day. Very good deal considering this is where the NFL is headquartered for the 10 days of Super Bowl.  Fun!  It was all decked out with NFL decor, photos and memorabilia.  The staff was well-prepared, polite and welcoming.  The valets are a bit backed up and I can see them running out of space, but overall, a good experience.Our room has been noticeably updated.  They cannot change the size unfortunately but the flat screens are obviously new and they have purchased nice modern IKEA lamps to warm up the room.   This definitely worth the $80 and we had a nice view of downtown, walking distance to the Village and Convention Center, Monument Circle and the mall.  Overall, a great location for all the events and we were very happy with our room and the staff.  I would not spend $250 or anything b/c there are MUCH nicer hotels overall but for $80 - definitely a great option.There are still some last minute deals to be had; although I'm sure as the big game approaches, it may be a bit harder to get a Hotwire deal like that!Either way, I think it's noticeable that the Westin has made significant improvements recently which I'm always happy to see - especially with the likes of JW Marriott and Conrad less than a block in either direction!  It's about time they stepped up their game.  I'd stay here again for that price for sure.This hotel is way nice!I paid a little bit more during a special event but it was very much worth it.I love the fact that the pool is on the 3rd floorDISCLOSURE: I made money modelling for the Westin brand's launch of "heavenly bed, who is he sleeping with campaign"The hotel is a nice feng shui to it. I am asian and automatically an expert in all things asio right?! Seriously, the energy of the place is nice. The second floor 5 star restaurant is great. Guys like Mark Cuban pay to eat there even though he is comped at other placesThis place is definitely not my first choice. They call their beds "heavenly" but I don't agree. They are very uncomfortable and the pillows are terrible. The bathroom was small and the mirror was cracked. Definitely could use some updates,  especially the 1980s mirrors on the walls. Parking is outrageously expensive.  Will not stay here next time. Oh, and $5 for a bag of m&ms in the mini bar fridge,  are you serious?Located in the heart of downtown Indy, the Westin is a nice hotel option. Clean rooms, nice amenities and a friendly staff make this a good selection for those not looking to break the bank. Walking distance from Lucas Oil Stadium and Bankers Life Fieldhouse as well as the Red Garter and Chick-fil-a.Well not even sure where to start after reading some of the negative comments. I travel all off with being a businessman and professional fashion photographer. The reservations were not made by me and the Westin was not my first choice. However that has changed.Mr Dale McCarthy GM at the Westin, you have assembled one amazing team. From the valet parking staff all the way to the front desk. I honestly do not have a negative comment to share. Yes you have to pay for parking, same in any big city. I seen that was a gripe of a few people, but not much can be done with that. Try staying in NYC It's 5 times as much. I'm sitting in the lounge and felt I needed to write this and express my experience. I travel at least 2-3 times per month. I'm hoping to get more time back to visit Indy and this is where I'll stay. Westin has made me a believer! O'yah Dave in the lounge was a excellent  bar tender and very helpful.The girlfriend and I were in town for a family function and the Colts game.  We stayed at the Westin Indianapolis based on its prime location and walking distance to Lucas Oil Stadium.  Having stayed at other Westin properties, I had reasonable expectations for our stay.  Check-in was a breeze.  The front desk staff was friendly and very welcoming.  The Westin Indianapolis has some nice features, a decent fitness center, a small pool and Jacuzzi, a Shula's Steakhouse, Starbucks, and best of all, walking distance to Lucas Oil Stadium all under cover which was a real plus since it was a very rainy Sunday before the Colts-Steelers game.  However, all is not rosy with the Westin Indianapolis as it's showing a lot of wear and tear.  The hallway on our floor was poorly lit and dingy looking with worn, stained carpeting, and painted walls with lots of scuffmarks.  Our room, a standard room, had a comfortable bed but the comforter had a terrible, moldy odor, which thankfully was changed out by housekeeping.  The bathroom was cramped and poorly lit.  The shower had an over designed two head system which was pretty ineffective but for wasting water.  In the end, the Westin Indianapolis is certainly not a "no-tell motel" with rooms by the hour.  It just needs a refresh.  Call it a 2.25-star stay, rounded down to 2-stars.This was my first time at the Westin. I paid at higher amount than I usually would thinking I would get better service. How disappointing. I had to sign up up into one of there program in order to get free internet. Which meant that I could only use one device to while in my room (I have three, laptop, tablet and phone). The few times I watched TV the program flickered to a point that I couldn't even watch a program. They wanted you to conserve and only provided one bottle of water. Staff was nice but not friendly. It doesn't take much to say hello when you see a customer. The prices for simple things like a water bottle was very high and again staff was not friendly. I would think for the amount of money I spent service would be better.Great hotel for business travel. It is conveniently located next to the convention center (easy covered skywalk has you there in just a couple minutes), there is also a Fedex/Kinkos and Starbucks in the building (phew). They have a nice gym and an indoor pool area.  The staff is great especially Sarah and the front desk who went above and beyond to help us get a few more nights at the hotel during a busy week and clean up our complicated reservations.One night stay on the club level.Check-in: Decent staff. Nothing too alarming or too pleasant that's worth mentioning.Room: I had a corner room. It was smaller than expected. Nothing special- you still have to pay for internet even on the club level. The view isn't anything spectacular and the room didn't have any special amenities.Club lounge in the evening: There were a few cans of soda in the refrigerator, coffee, tea, and water. I had gotten to the lounge at around 8 PM and the food they had out was almost gone. I think it was chips and spinach dip. It was very clean and well-kept. I wish it had some beer or wine in there...Club lounge in the morning: Breakfast was delightful and the male staff member in charge of the lounge was very friendly and nice. He is probably the reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 3. I was expcecting some muffins and cereal.. I was surprised when I saw hot breakfast with waffles, eggs, bacon and the works.This was the worst hotel experience I can remember. If I could give them zero stars, I would. 1. The contents in the mini bar had been opened before I arrived.2. The refrigerated part of the minibar did not work (not normally a problem, but this time,  I was in the middle of a juice fast and I needed to store some juices which went bad). 3. When I checked in, I opted for the "no service, and get $5 towards dinner" program. The front desk assured me they had it noted, and it would be respected. The next day, all the linens had been replaced, and no $5 was ever produced.4. On Monday, I dropped my laundry for same-day service, as I had an important meeting the next day. I was 15 minutes before the published cutoff time. That night, only after I called, they told me the laundry had not gone out after all. Only after lots of arguing did they agree to wash the clothes in an on-site washer-dryer (no ironing, it turned out).5. The next morning, when I went to pick up the laundry (they didn't deliver it), they only gave me half of it. When I pointed this out, they said the had lost the rest.So, now, here I sit, without any underwear, in a wrinkled shirt.I highly recommend not using this hotel.I stayed here for one night & it was an ok hotel at best. Nothing fancy....nothing exciting. For the price I was expecting more really. The beds were semi comfortable but not great, smaller rooms. The shower head was nice, but it leaked & you could never get full pressure because of it. The water never really got hot either. There was mold in the shower as well. & a big wad of hair in the floor behind the toilet. There are definitely nicer hotels for WAY better prices. & the view was awful. I will not be staying here again for sure. If you want a great hotel....try the Crown Plaza just a few blocks away!!Didn't like much about this location.Sharing the cost of a room here with others helps the bite in the wallet.  I don't mind spending a pretty penny on a place if it's worth it, which The Westin was not worth it for me.  On a side note, the best money I have ever spent on accommodations has been The Gaylord Opryland Resort in Nashville.The lobby at this Westin was nice and the front desk staff was friendly, courteous and cooperative except the younger gal in concierge was pretty much useless and unhelpful.  She was clearly just eye candy for the older business gentleman making their way in and obviously not the brightest tool in the shed.My roomie got sick and I was looking for the nearest drug store, and this woman sent me on an adventure to a pharmacy that ended up being closed!  On my return back to the hotel, I expressed my dissatisfaction and she acted like she couldn't understand why they would be closed because she thought all drug stores were 24 hours..grr.  Which by the way, is one thing that sucks about this town is that almost everything is either closed or closes early....I was here Sun-Wed if someone can provide a rational explanation for this observation.The rooms were ok and decent I suppose but a bit dated in terms of decor, plumbing/fixtures, furniture, and paint.The view was ok, I always like big windows for maximum natural lighting.  From my window  could see down toward the hotel's entrance and the water had a murky brown possibly dark peach glow at best.  It had rained my first day so I'm not sure if the water was dirty or was intentionally supposed to look like that.The gym was adequate for my short stay and I did not use the pool.My sheets weren't exactly clean..I will post a photo of what a pillow looked like, somewhat blood stained in a corner...luckily, I only needed one pillow.
review_content_60: My wife and I stayed here while in town to see a Colts game and a Pacers game. You cannot beat this location. Our room overlooked the State Capitol and the hotel is connected to the Convention Center, a mall and Lucas Oil Field by skywalks. Considering it was cold out this was a huge plus. It also has great access to many restaurants and bars that are easily within walking distance. As for the room, the bed was amazing. Definitely will stay here next time I'm in Indianapolis.I LOVE THE WESTINIt always smells like a poolside in the lobby, the beds are ludicrously comfortable, Shula's Steakhouse has a pretty good breakfast buffet for a somewhat reasonable price (compared tot he room service menu -_-).I come here yearly for Gen Con and we have received nothing but the best in hospitality and care. I have no worries leaving my stuff in the room. The hotel is connected by skyway to what seems like damn near the rest of the city: You virtually never have to walk outside in downtown Indy, as everything is connected by tunnel or skyway. It's really quite ingenious and fun to travel as a workout.The workout area in this hotel is also nice with complementary towels and headphones. The pool is nice for laps. Just...everything here is great. I can't like this place enough, especially with the history I have with it from a few years ago...when a water main broke in the main lobby banquet rooms and I was the only one around to report it!!! Great times lolI've stayed at the Westin several times for work travel (and while I was in the process of moving to Indy), and I've enjoyed every stay. The first time I walked through the lobby, i was a little freaked out by how friendly everyone was.  I was greeted cheerily by what seemed like every Westin employee who was working that day.  I've since learned that this friendliness thing is a bit of a Hoosier trait... but it was certainly striking during my first couple of stays. The rooms are nice, although nothing too spectacular. The beds are the typical Heavenly Bed, and they really are great.  The bathrooms were a little grim:  clean, definitely, but pretty worn. Everything was perfectly serviceable, though.  And the views are generally pretty nice, which is always a plus.  The No-Name bar, while pricey, was a great place to catch a drink and a late-night snack.  And the bartenders were really attentive.  In fact, they were very protective when they noticed a guy who had been creepily staring at me from down the bar.  I was oblivious, and was about to leave a couple of minutes after the creeper.  The bartenders stopped me  and had me wait while one of them checked to ensure that the creepy guy wasn't lurking by the elevators.  It definitely added to my overall impression that the hotel is staffed by genuinely nice people.You can't beat a Westin. They are consistent and I LOVE that Heavenly Bed.  Everyone at this hotel was very friendly and the service is always good.  The concierge lounge is very nice and they are very accommodating.  It is a great place to hang for breakfast or an evening cocktail before going to dinner.  The front desk is responsive and the hotel is nice and clean.  I am a slave to Hilton so I can't say I would stay here again, but if you want a nice hotel in Indy and don't have loyalty commitments elsewhere, you should definitely look at the Westin.  It is convenient walking to anything downtown. Great hotel and I have nothing bad to say about it.  Join the Starwood Rewards program and you can get free wi-fi!Very unhappy about service. Confirmed a King bed, showed up at 7pm and they only had doubles. Booked this specifically to spend this night with my wife in Indy, and this was just an unacceptable policy. I would have booked a different hotel, if they would have said unavailable online. No recourse, no one could do anything. I guess they don't think this is important. I do.After a lot of traveling I can say this hotel is one of the BEST I have stayed in.  The Suites are Spectacular and any shower that has not one but two shower heads is A-Ok in my book.  The staff is friendly and courteous, the hotel is beautiful and right next door to the Indianapolis capitol building which is a site in and of itself. It's also connected to a magnificent four story Mall. The only critique that I have is that the elevators require  a room key to access your floor at all hours of the day. Now I know most hotels have this but most of them also don't start requiring this until at least 11:00pm  so that can be a pain if you have a hand full of luggage and food to get your card out just to get the elevator to move. If you ever come to Indianapolis I highly recommend staying at the WestinI want to be kind here for 3 reasons:1. Someone else paid for our stay2. It is a nice hotel3. The staff are extremely nice and helpful.My main complaint? It is so dang frustrating to try to find this place - and it is my second time here! I literally drove in circles for 30 minutes and my GPS kept telling me: "You have reachedy your destination" ....and I hadn't! A call to their 800 number was fruitless; they were of no help. Finally I called 411 (a very desperate measure for a man!) and got the hotel phone number (the 800 number was all that I had) and they must deal with this problem a lot. If you press "#5" you are given a recorded message telling you to enter a different address into your GPS and a nearby landmark. You people seriously need to fix this - I wasn't the only one that had this problem in our group!Again, a nice place to stay. I'll leave it at that.Great rooms and suites. The service at the front desk is always very helpful. The people at Starbucks here work their asses off fast to help everyone.The gym is small, but the pool area is great. The pool is nice and big, you can do laps , swim, or just relax.Prices are typical of downtown anywhere...but its close to the convention center, the football field, mall...nice location.They ruined their view of Indy with the office building built in their front yard.For the price I paid via priceline, I can't really complain ($126 total w/ taxes for 2 nights).  However, had I not been able to find street parking for free, I'd have been annoyed, even at that low price.Check-in at 10pm was 10 people deep, with only one person working the counter.  Annoyingly, all of us in line got to see 3 other employees peek out from the back room to survey the line length, but apparently 10 separate parties needing to check in was not long enough to warrant a break ending.The hotel's location is GREAT.  However, the main drawback here is the INSANE amount of noise.  I can usually sleep fairly well with moderate noise but the doors and walls do NOTHING to keep the noise out.  Certainly a lot of the blame goes to the rude and disrespectful patrons sharing the Westin that night, but the staff or security should have done something as we were awake both nights from 2-5am on as people apparently stumbled back from the bars.I loved this place! It was gorgeous and clean and everything looked updated and perfect. This is exactly how you want a hotel room to be when you book it. And we completely lucked out and snagged it for $90 on Hotwire! The room was great and I will without a doubt stay here the next time I wind up in Indy. My only complaint is the guy that came to our room at 9am on Sunday saying 'mini bar attendant, mini bar attendant' -Seriously? Waking me up on Sunday? Get the *%$# out of here, I went out last night!Not a bad hotel, great downtown location, but the brown-speckled  probable fecal matter on the toilet when I checked in was kind of a turn off. Plus, wi-fi isn't free. Come on now!So this is a Westin thus the standards are high. For the most part it upholds the standards of a 5 star hotel. amenities are top notch. Decor is modern and very well designed. It has great restaurants although extremely pricey and all other amenities are superb. The rooms are wonderful although the ceilings could be an inch higher I felt a bit claustrophobic vertically. The beds are extremely comfortable. So this is a Westin and as that, everything is extremely expensive, parking expensive, internet not free etc... But this is expected. What is not expected however, is the rude staff for the price you are paying. The front desk crew is dismissive at best lacking the fundamental social skills but that is not even the problem its the bell hop and valet dudes outside. As soon as they understood that we are not paying for parking all bet were off and they turned a cold shoulder to us. My sister actually had to tell one of the to load the trunk with our luggage. This is simply unacceptable behavior for a Westin. The young kid helping us out in the evening was nice though, although he was confused why we came from California to such a dump as Indianapolis. If you are to charge as much as Westin does, make sure you make me feel like I'm getting my moneys worth.It is a great location for any conventions. Love walking downstairs to Starbucks. My biggest problem is probably the room / hallway carpets so gross. I think somebody much have tracked gum throughout our room and hallway. If you walk in our room it is sticky......Stayed here about 3 weeks a month for the past year. Honestly, the Westin is the best lodging deal going on in Indy. This coming from someone who tried Homewood Suites, the Sheraton and random other places before wising up to the Westin. On a per diem, this is the way to go. Yes I am sure the Conrad is nice but my company wasn't about to spring for such luxury on their dime. The Westin has the best staff (Travis and Soraya in particular) and the best gym I have seen at any hotel in Indy. There is also a Starbucks onsite...nothing I'd ever be excited about except in Indy, Starbucks is really the best thing going on in terms of caffeine injections. Skip the onsite steakhouse (Shula's) as it's all about grease though if you must, go there for dinner and order shrimp cocktail with a side of steamed broccoli. Their free hotel buffet breakfast is a greasy joke but for just a few dollars more, you can go right next door to Patachou (yum). So all in all, I'd wholeheartedly suggest the Westin. A great deal in Indy!PS - Got stuck at the Westin during the Indy ice storm of 2011. They gave my colleagues and I a boardroom to work in for three straight days and found some office supplies for us. Amazing customer service, worth 4 stars alone!Didn't pay attention to the fact that this was a category 3 property even though it has the Westin name.  With SPG gold status, was upgraded to a suite but my stay was still disappointing.First off, the towels don't appear "fresh".  They're in major need of some bleach and seem really dingy.  The property needs some major upgrades.   There was rust on the bathroom door frame, the shower heads had some major calcium / rust deposits.  During my stay, they were undergoing renovations in the lobby but there was never any indication of is until I arrived.  The elevators were severely backed up and had to wait 10 mins to go up to the room after the conference.Property is probably prepping for the superbowl.Limited food options, the gym is upgraded with new equipment but still a small facility.I'm going to go with a 3 star on this one, I'm a little torn on it because the location, a Starbucks in the lobby and Shula's on site make this Westin a nice place to stay.Questionable: Front desk service, on two different stays I could have had better service.Insanely busy, yet everyone was so nice and welcoming. The manager was genuinely kind and chatty as we waited in line for check-in; the valets were on top of things and efficient. And yes, the beds were every bit as great as I had heard.The only down side was the price of wifi. Good thing I had a mifi with me and saved that cost. Otherwise, a really great experience!I've stayed at this Westin a few of times.  It definitely does not seem as big as it is and the convention people aren't as noticeable as you would think they would be.  It might help that the hotel lobby is in one area and the meeting/convention space is at the end of the building.  Our rooms have always been good quality with the Westin Heavenly beds. The location is also great as most of downtown is walkable from the hotel.Not so impressed sadly.  There was a Colts game getting ready to start while we checked in so the city and lobby were busy.  We got to our first room and stayed a mere 10 minutes when it became obvious that we were so close to the elevator that we were going to hear every Colts fan-happy or sad. I called down and they couldn't have been nicer about switching us to a room on the same floor but farther away from the elevator.  The new room appeared great until we ordered room service.  We had a caprese sandwich and a chicken sandwich, which had some very odd grill marks that were blue???  Then we got into bed-the sheets were clean but there were really weird streaks/stains on them.  It's a Heavenly bed so there are a couple of sheets in the layers and they all had it.  Burning from the steam irons??  They weren't dirty so we went to sleep frustrated and cleared out in the AM.  I should have complained, but just wanted to go and didn't want to sound like a "princess".  Won't stay here again.  Bad vibe!The hotel was clean and close to everything downtown.  The price is high if you don't have a discount but eveything in downtown Indy is priced high.  The parking stunned me at $32 a night if I wanted "in and out" access to it.  Keep in mind that street parking is free on Sunday if you are in the area on a weekend.  For a fancy hotel I thought they missed a few things.  For one, there is no fan in the bathroom which could have been helpful when people are taking showers back to back.  The second, there was no refrigerator in the room.  We had leftovers our first night and had gotten a case of water to last the week so we wouldn't have to buy it every day.  Would have liked to have that service available.  Third, you get charged for the internet or to use the business center in the hotel for printing/faxing needs.  Of course, these are only problems if you plan on using them frequently.  At least they offered one hour of internet access free every day before charging.  The king sized room was very accommodating and roomy for 2 people.  Did not get the chance to check out the pool or fitness center so read the other reviews for that info.  All in all I would stay here again but now I know what to expect.
review_content_80: I stay at the Westin about once a year for work.  It is among the better "conference" hotels I have stayed at.  The staff is friendly and helpful and must have a low turnover rate as I recognize the same concierge, bellhop, and room service attendant every year.The room is spacious but minimal - beware the weight sensory mini bar (and the surprise knock on the door that comes at 8am to replace the gummi bears you must have swiped some time after returning from the bars at 2am).  No spectacular views, but the king size dream bed is as comfortable as can be and the heavenly dual shower is a nice taste of luxury.  Usually I bring my power industrial strength hair dryer with me on trips, even if I know the hotel will have a hair dryer in the room. When I pack for a stay at the Westin, I leave my hair dryer at home.  The hair dryer in the room is a "real" one, with normal strength and settings - not one of those weak tiny wall ones that take about six hours to dry your hair.  Room service is adequate but expensive - however the staff could not be more pleasant, quietly bringing in the meal if you are on a business call and not wanting the party on the other end of the phone to know that you are in the midst of having room service delivered, or, bless their hearts, offering to bring even more water and fresh coffee in the early morning after a little too much wine at St. Elmo's. (They also come to quickly and quietly dispose of your tray before your boss can figure out you ordered room service so you don't have to push your tray three doors down in front of someone else's door.)This is a wonderful downtown Indy location, within walking distance to local hot spots such as Ruth Chris, St. Elmo's, the Ram, Lucas Oil Stadium, the Chick-Fil-A in the mall, and hey even Hooters.  I have not eaten dinner at this particular Shula's, just appetizers and drinks at the bar, but it is a nice hotel bar scene.Although I have yet to run into Peyton Manning, I do enjoy my stay at the Westin each year.Just OK. I would expect more from a Westin even if it's just in Indianapolis. The accommodations were fine, but the level of service was not always up to par. Irregular help opening doors, getting taxis, assistance with forgotten toiletries, etc. Most other Westins I've stayed at have super fresh air, but it seemed stale here.i would like to personally call out Becky from Service Express and Thomas from front services.  They are both representative of 5* service!  Becky helped me schedule a much-needed in-room massage upon my arrival and Thomas got me to and from an out of the way destination safely through a contact of his.  I am in the hospitality industry and am very grateful for outstanding service![ Visited in November, 2010 ]I stayed here as part of a a convention going on next door at the Indiana Convention Center. This Westin certainly is convenient to that location (as well as other downtown Indy locations), but I've certainly experienced better Westin locations. The room (as spacious as  it was) could use a good update, and the lighting in the bathroom updated. Cleaning staff is also skimpy on soaps and other amenities. The hotel bar is within Shula's restaurant. It's decent, even if a bit too "midwestern".All in all, I preferred the Hilton two blocks away.p.s. Don't park here. Park in one of the city lots (there's one on Capitol) and save a few bucks.I won't stay here again unless my clients insist on meeting at their office.  I think this is the worst Westin I've ever stayed at- and I've stayed at plenty.First of all, why are there only two but usually one person at the front desk? It's a huge hotel! Why don't they have more people?!  Also, why does the phone ring and ring and ring and then you get to a recording that tells you to hold and then rings and rings and rings again. I'm inside the damn building!  How can you not pick up the phone when your guests called!But the worst part? Some girl who apparently wasn't "feeling" well, THREW UP all over my floor.  The stench was disgusting.  What did the hotel staff do?  They wiped it up.  Sure enough, the next morning, I could barely even walk out of my room.  I complained and complained and they finally did some sort of carpet steaming. But trust me, they're gonna have to replace that carpet.3 stars for the hotel , would have been a 4 stars had it not been my negative experience with parking.Yup, give us a little more info please.  Misleading information about the parking rate had me - I had to pay TWICE people I parked by myself. THey have no system to check that you have paid and have left and rentering the hotel.  You had to choose valet parking to get multiple entrances and exits. Gosh darn it, then TELL me then. Give me clear expectations and do not post misleading signs on the darn parking structure.yeah yeah yeah- hotel was great. My visit in Indy was really nice. I loveeee the people. Super nice!!!!!!!!!!!!! great service!!!!!! easy check in and check out!!!!!!!!!!But the city owns the darn parking service, and it sucks!!!!!!!!! big time!!!!!!ok i said it.The good:+ The bed. I slept like a rock both nights I was there.+ The rates - if you go on Hotwire. We scored our room for $75/night.+ Starbucks in the lobby. I can't say enough about how convenient and wonderful this was. I live 25 miles from the closest Starbucks, so this was a dream come true for me.+ The staff. They were all very nice without being overbearing.+ The proximity to everything else.The bad:- The walls are extremely thin. We were not all that close to the elevator, but you could hear it dinging its arrival every time it came to our floor. On Saturday night, our very excited, very drunk neighbors were continuing their evening's revelry in their rooms and we could hear pretty much everything.- The "weight-activated" mini fridge. First off, you couldn't put anything of your own in the fridge, and if you even so much as moved one of the items, the refrigerator recorded the weight change and you were charged. This would have been all fine and good if they hadn't put a price tag of THREE DOLLARS on the candy bars and EIGHT FREAKING BUCKS FOR A TIN OF SMOKED ALMONDS. At least the front desk guy warned us about picking up the items when we checked in.- $9.95 a day for wireless Internet service? Ridiculous.- The parking garage is somewhat confusing.Barring the negatives (which weren't really a huge deal), I was very impressed with the Westin and would stay there again.Nice hotel, but good luck finding it with a GPS! You can't get to it using the South Capitol address. You have to enter from Washington St, and being unfamiliar with that part of Indy we had to have them talk us in by phone as we circled the block. Got upgraded to a small suite, which is certainly roomy. Dog friendly, with grass right outside the front door. The staff was friendly and efficient. Only stayed one night, but would recommend this as a good business hotel. Only drawback was you only get an hour of free wifi.I was in the process of moving to Indianapolis so me and a friend got a hotel here while I was looking for a place to live. We got the room, 2 phones in the room and neither worked, which sucked cause we wanted a fridge (which you had to call for) we asked for one at 2:00PM and after calling 3 times throughout the day we finally got one at 12:30AM, too damn late, now that is what you call service! This place is pretty damn ghetto, you got to use your effing keycard to get ice, or take a shit in the lobby, ridiculous. I have stayed here and the Marriott downtown, for reals the Marriott is 10X better and is like $10 more a night. Go with them, seriously. Parking here is also ridiculous, if you park then want to go out to the suburbs to get a bite to eat it will cost you $20 more dollars = ridiculous, save yourself the bullshit and stay at the Marriott, I will never stay here again.The room & location are fine but if  you need Internet forget it. They offer enhanced for about $10 a day but good luck getting it to work. You get an hour of the slow speed for free but it's really  slow. Basically if u need Internet you may want to choose a different hotel otherwise it's not bad.I stayed here for 3 nights and it was OK.  Wasn't the best hotel experience and it certainly wasn't the worst.  I was disappointed when we checked in and got to our room though.  They had given us a room with two doubles and not one king (like my reservation confirmation said).  I called down and the front desk manager said that they were extremely busy and he would call me back.  Guess what he never called back....I wasn't surprised.  So my wife and I just dealt with it.  They need to really work on their customer service and follow through.
